Love the location of this hotel. I wish they would update it though. The hotel itself is very old and run down but the location is good. The breakfast buffet is pretty decent. It is very convenient to just walk down and you are in the middle of Waikiki. Lots of shopping and restaurants near by.

Check in could of had more hospitality knowing I was a local. Rooms were okay, the bathroom was renovated and the city view that I had asked for was the view of the parking structure. Last night of my stay, service at the “Splash Bar” was poorly. I wanted to have dinner, watch entertainment and have only a few drinks. I got all three, but that was it from the waitress “Lei”. I walked over to the bar to ask for my check, and she was than abruptly shouting “I got her don’t worry about it”. Than walked away after handing me my check. If it wasn’t for Shana apologizing for her coworker, things could’ve been worse. Other than that I had a staycation and was able to relax. Enjoyed breakfast at Duke’s and had a beautiful view from my table.

Hotels on or near Waikiki Beach occupy kind of a funny status. Many of them are old and lack the amenities/polish of newer hotels, but they charge insanely high prices due to their location. The SPK is an old hotel, and if you go to most major cities, you wouldn't consider it a "4 star" hotel relative to other 4-star hotels. But for hotels on Waikiki Beach, the SPK is pretty comparable to everything else out there, and it costs WAY less than most of its competition.So here are the details from my early January 2019 trip - rooms are pretty old and small. No real way around it. The swimming pool is tiny compared to the pool at the nearby Sheraton Waikiki. Unlike some other hotels, it's not directly on the beach but you have to cross the street and go half a block to reach the sand. But, everything is reasonably clean and neat. The hotel buffet is pretty good and less expensive compared to other hotels in the area. The location is fantastic - there are lots of great restaurants and stores in the immediate vicinity. The hotel lobby is also pretty spacious, so there's a lot of room for little kids to run around and amuse themselves while their tired parents sip on a tropical drink.For Marriot/SPG elite members, know that there's no club on the property. Platinum members will get breakfast buffet vouchers for 2 people each day, which saves you $60 on food. Not a bad deal.

We had our first visit to Hawai'i and spent it on Oahu where a lot of the action is and we stayed with Sheraton PK for the duration. It was a good hotel for this trip as we were on excursions and we could come and go with ease from this central but not too crowded hotel. The guest rooms, lobbies and pool were clean and service was good. The food and drinks were very good and the buffet was excellent but we found it a bit too pricey for all of our meals. We had vouchers for other hotel buffets which were not nearly as nice and were very busy so obviously price made the difference. The Splash Bar was lovely as well but had no Happy Hour Specials which would help increase traffic for the numerous guests traveling in and out of the hotel on a daily basis.

My wife and I returned to the Princess Kaiulani after a wonderful stay last year and the hotel is as good as before. We like the design of the lobby with its openness, views to the pool, Splash Bar and the various sitting areas for guests who want to hang out. The check in experience has not improved. It takes longer than most hotels to check in, but that is the only complaint we had. We liked our room with a city view. The bed was comfortable and the bath, while small, was adequate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff learned our tea requirements and kept us stocked up.

We have stayed at the PK in the same room (422) thirty plus times. We have always requested to Alex the Reservations Manager for our room 422 be available for us. This last visit was terrible, Alex was no longer working at the PK, I think, not sure, but think Marriott have taken it over. The lifts were filthy, you couldn't read some of the floor numbers to select. Staff not very helpful, we had two men knocking on our door, dressed in the Hotels uniform, I answered and said we would be going out soon, thinking they were the hotel cleaners, they look in and saw my husband and said they would come back later. I reported this to the Hotel reception and all they said was " they didn't know who they could be, and sorry we cannot help you". So much for Hotel security. I think the poor PK is in need of a huge renovation. It sadly has had it's day - so many things that are so dated - location fantastic though. We will definitely NOT be staying here next year.

Great Place To Stay!Short walk to the Waikiki beach !The hotel has beach chairs at no extra charge!It has a very nice pool area!Very close to all shops & restaurants.Great Location!My husband & I Love It !! We would stay again!

Great staff - good service and close to beach, shops (International Market 5 mins) and to lots of good Restaurants.If you need to relax and not leave the Hotel, the pool is great, and you can book one of several small private 'cabanas', to blob at the pool out with a little more shade / privacy. Restaurants and room service is also very good.

Beautiful room looking towards the ocean. Hotel has been renovated. The staff were fantastic and as I was badly injured they provide me with a room on arrival.While this hotel is not on the beach it is very close and is in the center of the Waikiki strip.

The Hotel is located across the street from the beach but it’s right in the middle of all the great shopping places.  As a Marriott Platinum member I felt they should have held a suite for me but they never give you up grades on a holiday week. The rooms are small and older the bathroom is really small and very old. The pool is small and not a great place to hang out. Gym was ok very big but no one was managing the gym so it wasn’t that clean. They also had no water and I called a few times to ask what was going on and they never brought up any water. Also kids in the gym without parents. The pool bar was not that great and the bar tenders seemed to be in a bad mood most of the time. They never really looked up to take my order or say hi I’ll be with you soon. One time they gave me a broken glass to drink out of and I know that happens but they way they treated me after was very weird. I wasn’t going to say anything as is didn’t cut my lips but the fact that I felt Uncomfortable afterwards from the bar man was the weird part. The waitresses are all very nice and very friendly they came over to help me when didn’t sit at the bar. In fact they went out of the way to help me and be very nice to me. The hotel front desk was happy and friendly and she wanted to help me more but seemed to be holding back for some reason. The trip and reservations desk was good and helpful. They say as an Platinum elite member yeah hey a free camera go pro for the day but they never had any you need to Reserve way in advance and even then might not get one. They should hold a few for VIP people or just not offer it as a bonus.

We loved this hotel! The location is perfect, the room had a view of the ocean, city and mountains, the price was good....but the best thing was their staff! We spent a lot of time at Splash Bar and absolutely loved all of the bartenders such as Eric and Shanna. The servers seemed great as well and the people running the brunch buffet were warm and accommodating. The lady that cleaned our room was so sweet. Front desk and security helped us out with a challenging situation in a very kind manner. Splash bar has a fantastic cocktail menu and the food is on point. They have so many activities to choose from as well that we didn’t get to try and music by the pool at night. The only thing I was disappointed in was not being able to use the pool after dark, but there may be a good reason they close it. I guess if the fanciest room possible is your goal this wouldn’t be the place for you....but if you are looking for a friendly, fun, clean and convenient resort that doesn’t break the bank, Sheraton Princess Kailani is a fantastic choice!

I have often stayed at the Princess Kaiulani after discovering it in the 90's. I love the location which is directly across from the best beach in Waikiki IMO! If you are lucky enough to get a high ocean view room the view is beautiful! I love the the Hawaiian music and old style feel of the hotel. Wonderful stay!

First I'm not an admirer of Waikiki, very crowded and very commercial, plus lots of homeless visitors from other planets!The check in process is none existent, as I couldn't anyone to assist with our baggage, nor even a baggage cart for doing it myself, nor an attendant at the drive-up for advice/assistance! The room was satisfactory, though the bed was disappointing and the pillows very poor. The best part of the entire stay was the room cleaning, which does not saying much for the rest of the facility! Also, don't bother with the fitness room! I'm not sure where they got the treadmills, but even if free, they got robbed! Glad to be leaving tomorrow!

My wife and I stayed here for four nights. It is in a great location close to everything. Very short walk to all of the restaurants, stores, bars and beach. There's an ABC store right across the street where we bought beer, water and snacks for the room. Very convenient. Our room was very clean but very old. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful!

There were 6 of us staying at the Kaiulani for 10 days and I have to say from when we stepped inside the hotel the service was excellent. We were even given the keys to our rooms early and the room presentation was fantastic. Great views, clean rooms and the beds were so comfortable. We were always greeted by the service staff with a smile and they did such a great job of maintaing the rooms, always coffee and water available, fresh towels and toiletries. The service and professionalism of this hotel was outstanding. I used the gym a few times and all equipment worked and whenever we had a question, it would be sorted there and then. Well Done to all staff at the Kaiulani. Thanks for making our holiday a great experience.

The hotel is located in very stategic location, rigjt in the middle of Waikiki area, just walk to the beach, near shopping & food complex. The ambience of the hotel also perfect all staff friendly and very helpful.

We stayed for 5 nights/6 days as a family in Dec2018, experience was above averageBOOKING: Booked about 45 days prior, during the strike, resort fee was waived and the price was around $250 with breakfast for a ocean view room with two double beds. We didn't know it at the time but this was a great deal in the Waikiki area. Kids get breakfast for free, 2 bottles of water and a fruit everyday are complimentary with the resort fee which was waived.CHECKIN: Very pleasant, Jason thank you! Gave us a great room with no neighbors on the 22nd floor in the Tower. Fumbled with waiving the resort fee but got the job done with some young manager. Sent a person to help with the luggage, who delivered all our 9 bags to the room! Kids were given a candy necklace which they enjoyedROOM: 22nd floor with a view of waikiki beach, the pool and the road, good but not as good as the Moana or the other Sheraton. Big enough to fit a family of four, central AC works good. Glass sliding door allows some road noise, need some ear putty for a good sleep. We had no immediate neighbors and could not hear any noise from within the hotel!! TV had netflix (that was all we needed), WiFi was fast. The fridge was standard beverage cooler, small but fit a couple wine bottles, food and some milk.RESTROOM/BATHROOM: There was a leak in the tub which was not fixed, no fans and the floor was not very clean. The person that has remodeled the bathroom has done a very poor job. BREAKFAST: Pretty good. Scrambled eggs, omlette station, potates, meats, Asian options and regular bread and other baked goodies. Coffee served at your table. There were a bunch of birds picking up leftovers and another bunch of rude employees chatting at the front and doing nothing. You had to present two coupons for two adults if you booked the room with breakfast, else you pay $30 per adultKIDS: Couldn't eat breakfast without the coupoun or use the pool without adults. The staff is also quite grumpy with children, this hotel is not a good option if you have high energy kids. ROOM SERVICE AND PERKS: Very good, you get extra blankets, hair products, curling irons etc. We also got the gopro camera for free but make sure you have an SD card (we used our phone SD card) else it costs $30 to buy an SD card. You get free beach towels and chairsPARKING: $35 a day which has to be paid upon checkin and spots are always available, if you are in the tower, park higher and you can access the elevator from the 4th floor. There are no elevators in the parking lot. You do have to keep your payment receipt for parking else you get charged $50 and this receipt has to be presented each time you leave, irritating but understandable. Parkling lot access is through a very small road, so it works if you have a subcompact or a small car. LAUNDRY: $5 to was $5 to dry 45 minutes, $3 for detergent. Very expensive but does a decent job. No laundry bags provided. MICROWAVE: $10 per day to rent, but we were not chargedCONCLUSION: This is a very good option if you are staying in Waikiki. Great value if you can escape the resort fee and get a breakfast option. Behind the scenes, management is working hard to improve your experience

Just old. Elevator to rooms to pool everything. Especially for this size of the hotel, pool is just super small. Like 10 kids is too much. Location is great. Center of Waikiki and 3 min walk to the beach. Last time we stayed at Marriott and it’s such a bid difference. Staff are all very nice tho.

I stayed at this property for one night and was completely unimpressed. The location is great, the pool is nice. The hotel is very dated and worn. In need of major renovation. Not worth the price. My rooms blackout curtains had holes in them. Makes for a nice light show.... The room was extremely dated. Looked straight out of the 80's/90's. I am a Marriott Platinum Premier member, and would not recommend this hotel.

I brought my son with me this time for a holiday .. what a pity the hotel management didn't give advance warning of the noisy strike... the noise never let up til after 10pm each night, we had to take care of our own issue of coffee, tea, toilet paper etc in the first couple of days which was just bundled beside the elevator .. the staff who were brought in to assist tried their best with what they had to work with .. once again was good to catch up with Gregg (even though he looked a little tired lol) .. I'm arriving again for another stay on the 7th Jan, with my partner this time, to show her the sights .. here's hoping it's a bit quieter this time

awesome breakfast buffet for those that want to eat alot before starting a very long day. food can be hard to come by in waikiki if you are on the move and traveling with luggage. I suggest starting here. its expensive $26 but worth it. you can eat a dukes across the street for half the price but only get a little. not too crowded and very good selection. I go everytime i am there
user_name:
Bill S
Island of Hawaii, Hawaii

review_body: This was our 3rd year staying here and I’ll be back again next year. The location is perfect close to everything you need. The room do need a bit of TLC but the beds are so comfortable - we get the Pool view and it’s stunning. The breakfast buffet is so good and have a great variety. A special shout-out to Ziggy at the front desk Justin at the pool and especially Uncle Nathan who was in charge of the daily activities Mahalo for the amazing energy and friendly service.

We have 1yr old twins, the hotel refused to provide 2 baby cribs. Apparently it’s against their policy, insane. Their alternative was one cot, and a single bed with bed rails. NO way, my children climb up anything, as all toddlers do. A bed rail was not a safe option for us. So we had to cosleep with one of our twins our entire stay!! While the other got to sleep in a cot! Then there was the pool... for the first few days we would take the babies for a swim, not a problem. We would but them in their safety floats to ensure they were ok. A few days into our stay the pool attendants approached us and said we are no longer allowed to use the infant safe floats for the children as it’s a new policy. No exceptions.My husband and I approached management about it, and were told there is nothing they could do and that they have the policy in place so the floats don’t effect other guests in the pool. Too bad for the safety of any children who cannot independently swim. Dont stay here if your a family, seriously not family friendly or safe. And they don’t care about it either. Offering completely breakfast is insulting.

As a frequent traveler with about 200 nights in hotels a year, today I have to say that the Sheraton hotels are not at the height of his reputation, confirmed after my stay Osaka and my experience at Waikiki.Today, at 10 am, I did my check-in and as expected the room wasn't ready, it´s OK, it´s early. I decided to start to work in a comfortable area, the computer area, but one computer was not working, the other was super slow and the best is that the printer did not work. After two hours ask again for the room and even was not ready, I decided to go to eat and asked for umbrella because was raining, but it turns out that the hotel has not umbrellas, rare, but acceptable. After my frustration one member of the staff, Bobby, gave me a room, my room should have beach view, reason why i paid more, but please look the views in the photo that I attach. Not only that when I arrive the room doesn't have slippers and Leonora another member of the staff gave me one... all this within 4 hours at the hotel, waiting what else will happen in the next few days.

The hotel is n a good location. it is old but clean. The resort charge that applies to all hotels in Honolulu is a complete rip-off but unavoidable. The service here is good. The room amenities are lousy, no comb, not even a toothbrush. That is embarrassing to the brand specially considering the resort charge, which includes a bottle of water!!!! The resort tax covers WI FI so it is NOT REALLY FREE.

Hotel has clean rooms and really good location. Just one minute from the beach, next to a shopping street, plenty of bars and restaurants. Stayed there during the strike in Nov 2018 and they handled it well, saw that other hotels in Honolulu could not cope with it that well.

My mum and I stayed at this hotel recently during the strike.The hotel was nice and staff very helpful. As the strikers where Picketing outside the hotel, you could not really sit by the pool and relax.Our room where not cleaned unless we asked for it to be done. One of the days we had a pile of towels on the floor and our rubbish bin was so full you could not fit another thing in it.I would probably not stay here again as I feel the people who work there (the strikers) ruined my holiday so I wouldn’t want my money going to their wages. I’m all for peoples rights but felt they purposely would bang harder if they saw you come out of the hotel.We left 4 days early to go home because of the strike,

We have had 8 nights at the Sheraton PK. Rooms were average with thin walls that meant hearing noises from next door rooms and the floor above and the protests were extremely loud day and night, we have 2 young children that found it hard to get to sleep due to the noise of the drums and megaphones. At one stage the lifts were not working and we had to use the service lifts. Upon checking out we were stung with paying a resort fee which we were not informed of when checking in, nor were we made aware of the inclusions that come with the resort fee such as mifi rental, GoPro etc. If we had of known we were paying for these inclusions upon checking in we would have made use of them. Very disappointed to be required to pay so much money for the resort fee and not be told what that fee is for.

Our group spent a week at the hotel. It was an average to good stay. Beds were comfortable and our room was small but clean. Others in our party had problems with their rooms. Management handled quickly, but given the current situation with the strike, it wasn’t a super great experience. Several in our group were visiting Hawaii for the first time and had saved a long time to make the trip. Marching and chanting in protest, we understand. Using bullhorns, drums and other noisemakers was over the line. They were allowed to use the loud items from 8-10 everyday. You couldn’t enjoy the pool, open areas of the hotel or nearby restaurants, or even our rooms because of the noise. Whatever the disagreement with the management is, fine, but don’t mess up others vacation because you’re mad. If the news report was correct, the hourly rate they are protesting is more than I make.

Omg you will love this hotel close to everything and of course awesome beds and pillows as always expected in a Sheraton hotel....Only thing I don’t agree with is the resort fees they are a con we feel!!!!

We stayed 6 nights at this hotel and we booked this accommodation months ago and no one made our travel agent or us aware of the staff strike that was on. The noise level was horrendous (banging drums, yelling and screaming from 6.30am to 10.30/11.00 am at night) so much so we had to leave our accommodation through out the day to escape the noise level from our hotel and the Westin Surfrider next door. There was no restaurant available for breakfast or dinner, no staff to take your bags to your room and our room was cleaned twice for the whole time. They ruined my trip to Hawaii and I will not return and as for the big names that own these hotels surely they would be worried about their guests stay especially for the amount of money we paid to stay at this hotel, if I had of known about this I would have rathered stay a street back and avoided the commotion. Avoid this hotel !!!!!!!!!

We checked into this hotel for a week whilst the labour strike was on. I will get that out of the way first then I can actually review the properly on its merits.So most of the food venues were closed, housekeeping was intermittant and a lot of the usual services were not in operation. This I could deal with, everything was avaliable such as amenities, towels, but you just had to get them yourself. The tough part was the noise of the protestors. My anger is not at the hotel for this, rather the union and the local police. The started as early as 5.50am banging pots and pans and chanting and it went on until 10pm at night. The hotel compensated with no resorts fees and a few other things thrown in. All of the staff we dealt with were pleasant and tried their best. I found Melanie to be very pleasant even though she was there everyday listining to the compliants! But the noise was really hard to get past. You couldnt sit on your balcony and relax because the noise was just too much. The police just stood by and watched the protestors be rude to people, chanting that they will not stop the noise until they get their contracts. This is uterly disrespectful to all people that have saved to go on holidays, celebrate milestones and have downtime. Their beef is with the hotel, yet they contiue to affect the whole of the Waikiki area and all of those people that dont deserve their holidays to be affected. All I can say is they are not doing themseleves any favours by being rude, noisy and generally disrepectful to the public. Now I can comment on the hotel....The hotel has a bit of a 70's Hawaiian feel, could do withsome upgrades but overall its got a good vibe too it. We stayed in an Oceanview Room, these do have a great view over Waikiki. The rooms itself is a little small but acceptable. The bathrrom is a bit crowded also and didnt have any sheleves to store your toiletries on. The room was a little dusty, not sure if this was from the labour strike or just that it needs a little bit of love. The double beds were a bit saggy and small. Pillows were flat and lifeless!We ate at the breakfast buffet and I am sure there were some diferences from the stike but overall the tables were cleared regulary, the food selection was good, the line up for omletes was a long. For a American hotel breakfast it was good. I did find the platic plates and cultery a bit odd but I am hoping thats because of the labour strike.The pool area was really quaint, pool isnt large but I never found it over crowdered. The sun lounges were comfy and you also never had to look too hard for one. They played Hawiian music around the pool which was really nice, maybe a little louder than usual to drown out the protesters! The guys that manned the pool area were really nice. They had beach chairs, water, icy poles, sunscreen and were always helpful when you asked for something.The rating that I have given is largely to the location. This is a great spot to be able to walk to the beach, shops and great resturants. The pricing on this hotel is pretty good compared to a lot of the ther beachfront properties that charge for location. On this stay I didnt need to pay the resort fee but if I had of it really brings down the value of the property. The resort fees are really a waste, what you get is not worth what you pay and I really feel the hotel would have a lot more people happy with the property if this charge wasnt added.The beach chairs can be bought at the ABC store, no childrens gift was given at checkin, the only things that really have a value are the bottles of water (once again can be cheaply bought at ABC) and the wireless interest (which was never even offered).Based on location, price and generally being a pleasant hotel I would stay here again....lets hope with no protestors though!

I am so angry with Sheraton kailulaini. After spending 10days listening to protesting from all angles of the hotel and restless sleep, no housekeeping, I kindly requested to have my room charges and resort fee waived upon check out. That wish was said to be granted to which I was thankful and said so to the front desk. Upon returning home and checking my statement I have had just under $500 taken from my account by the hotel...so they didn’t waive my charges at all and lied to me. I have emailed the hotel several times to no response! I am utterly disgraced by the management of the situation and the complete disregard for any people that stay with them and give them a lot of money!

The hotel was ok, but our stay was diminished but the constant noise from the staff that were on strike. yelling and banging drums from 8 am to 10 pm. We were on the 8th floor with the windows closed and trying to sleep after a long flight. We could still hear the noise.It would have been good if the hotel could have sent us an email to advise there would be reduced service before we arrived. No housekeeping services and the restaurant was closed. No reduction in the accommodation charge however, which seems very unfair...

We stayed for one night on 28/10/2019 following a 7 night cruise on the beautiful Pride Of America. This was meant to be one last relaxing night in beautiful Hawaii. Having spent time in this hotel 12 months ago it seemed the obvious choice. We worked hard for months to pay for this and did deserve to relax but no it was a nightmare with the protesting staff. Why do the government allow this public disturbance? We could not sit by the pool or on our balcony the noise was relentless. An offer of partial or total refund would be appreciated?? We are still upset with the people protesting. Hotel management were obviously doing their best

I was going to call it a dog, but that is disrespectful of “Man’s Best Friend!” This hotel has been ridden hard and it shows it. I typically stay at the Waikiki Courtyard when I come to Oahu for business but could not get in. So I decided to stay in the Marriott family. Big mistake. This hotel is just old and worn. There is not enough lipstick to put on this pig. Sorry. It is just in need of some serious investment and updating. Carpet is disgusting, air condition doesn’t work and is noisy. I have only been here an hour and I don’t see my impression getting better. Oh, and I won’t even go into the strike that greeted me upon arrival. Been nice to have been notified by the hotel given my Marriott status (Platinum For Life and Ambassador).

We stayed at the Sheraton PK for 6 nights, and upon arrival we were completely informed at the front desk about the workers strike. I asked if we would be compensated for having to do our own housekeeping and the lady at the desk said absolutely! We ended up getting our resort fees and parking fees waved, which saved us about $600...so yea, you bet I will take out my own trash and call for towels to save $600!! My only complaint was that we booked thru a travel agent and they requested us to have a room upgrade as it was my husband and I's anniversary and at first they put us in a room on the 8th floor. The room was an older one that had not been updated, there were several stains on the sheets and I just felt like the room was dirty. I was rather disappointed especially since those were the only sheets we would have for our whole stay. I decided to go to the front desk and tell them about the room and ask if they had any other rooms available. I was very happy that they upgraded us to a full ocean view room on the 27th floor that had been updated and was nicer. However, when come back we will probably elect to stay in a different hotel just because I feel the quality of this one was not worth the price we paid. It has nothing to do with the worker strike as you could tell the hotel was doing the best they could to compensate and honestly the noise didn't bother us at all.

We knew there would be some noise but underestimated how bad it would be. It starts at 6h30 and ends at 10h30 allowing one to at least have a good nights sleep.. The hotel is doing it's best to cope with the situation and I was quite happy to assist. I did however draw the line at not having house keeping for our stay. The staff at the front desk were great but did not seem to empathize with the problem and it was only when I complained to the general Manager that they offered some compensation. They upgraded our room and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. They cancelled the resort fees and allowed us to have a late book out. This was worth putting up with the noise as we were flying out late at night. If the hotel offered this up front, it would make people less angry. The porters were wonderful and seemed to take the most care of us. On the plus side, as much bottled water and toiletries were available on a help yourself basis and the quality of the breakfast, despite the plastic utensils, was very good. I did not mind the birds at all. This hotel is more suited to very young people who are more likely to be out and about all day.

my wife and I have just returned from our 10 day stay at Sheraton PK, where we were greeted on arrival by chanting protestors saying don't book in, we should have listened, the experience is our Waikiki nightmare the chanting and drum beating continued unabated for the whole time we were there, glad to get away from it, we come home to find my credit card has been debited in error with a charge of $200aust cant find a direct email address to voice my concerns.

Most of the hotel staff were temporary hires but they were doing their jobs very hard under the guidance of managers.Since there is no housekeeping, we had to take amenity and bottled water in front of the elevator on each floor.Getting bath towels and hand towels were battle. As we had no choice, we decided to borrow a beach towel for the swimming pool, and they gave me enough saying "Use a lot."We had housekeeping only once but he did not take the chips that I put on the bedside. I handed him a little later,he seemed to be shy. he was not yet used to it.From the morning of each day until midnight strike participants make an abnormal soundThey were continuing to shout at the microphone saying "Do not check in" "Check out quickly" to the guestsWhen I found a longtime acquaintance among in them, I was shockedKnowing various circumstances it became impossible to blame strikes unilaterally.At the time of checkout We negotiated about the fee of the room charge with a man at the front desk. I do not know whether he is a manager, but I appreciated him.As I returned home, I was confused. Because the charge for the seventh night was charged separated 2days and 5days. Currently we confirmed by email with the hotel's credit manager.Anyway we love this hotel.We have been staying in PK like every year for more than 30 years.It is a very favorite hotel. We will continue to use PK.I hope the strike will be resolved as soon as possible.

Stayed for 4 days in September. We had a room overlooking the pool - The location is central but the walls are appear thin and the noise from the band and the street entertainment (or market) is inescapable.We wanted a table for 7 at breakfast and were advised a surcharge of 10% (i think) was required for table in excess of 6. If you want a quiet stay this is NOT for you

I frequently holiday in Waikiki and always stay at the PK, this year I paid in full for 2 rooms through my SPG membership prior to arrival. I had family members also coming to stay here on there 1st trip to Waikiki as I always rave about this hotel, I arrived 4 days earlier than my family to striking staff protesting at the hotel & at check in was advised that our rooms will not be serviced and collect towels, toilet paper etc from the bottom floor but we won’t charge you the daily resort fee. When my family arrived I felt so bad for them and embarrassed I wish we booked another hotel chain, throughout our 2 week stay we were yelled at constantly entering and leaving the hotel and on one occasion called a scab. My sister in-law who booked separate to my booking was given a 4 day half price and was told I would also but on check out they only credit 1 room not 2 and front desk couldn’t care less, I am still waiting for them to email my checkout invoice also they still have locked $1600 pending on my credit card. Never will return to the PK all those protesting staff should loose there jobs, the temp service staff you hired couldn’t do enough to assist helpless guests.

I think i could have really found this hotel charming jn a way that Waikiki itself seems to conjure up images of a 70s Brady Bunch kind of vibe. Its central and convenient but thats where the charm ended this visit.The workers strike made it almost unbearable with intrusive and brain splitting noise generated by the worst percussion mess you could imagine... and in stereo as the strikers were on two sites within metres of each other. 15 hours a day and don't kid yourself..... they never take a break.Being in your room in the day was simply jntolerable and enough to raise tears of rage and frustration after a 10 hour flight from sydney.No restaurant beyond breakfast, no housekeeping, barely enough staff. What exactly was i paying for?TV remote didnt work and the toilet flooded just to add insult to injury.At least they were good enough to waive the resort fee, my breakfasts and my bar tab.Be especially warned if you have children, are on the "trip of a lifetime" or wanting pampered romance - you in particular will be bitterly disappointed.

Their employees are on strike making noise constantly. AC in the hotel isn't working properly. I am going to dispute all charges on my Amex bill. The strike has been going on for weeks and they didn't think that they should warn their future guests. The staff while nice doesn't care. The place is falling apart at the seams. I've seen welfare hotels that had better service and a better guest experience. Out of the kindness of their hearts they're not charging a resort fee. Isn't that wonderful? Will never stay at another Sheraton. Tried to contact the manager but he never answers his phone. He's too busy hiding from irate guests and employees. Worst place ever!

We arrived on the 21.10.18 for 8 nights. Family holiday for my birthday. Unfortunate timing as the domestic staff were on strike: No room service, no bar or restaurant service etc. due to this we were informed that we will receive a credit on the resort fee. Being SPG Members and were not informed about the strike prior to our arrival. The chants from the striking members outside the hotel commenced at about 7:00am and did not stop until 11:00pm, which of course could be heard on all floors. Fortunately, we did not spend much time in our rooms. My children did ask for another room for myself & husband & we were fortunate enough to be assigned a room on the 29th floor from the 4th floor. For the Staff (temps etc.) that did work, we found were friendly, helpful & accommodating (except for one person at the reception desk who was quite rude when my son in law requested the room to be cleaned after he discovered a cockroach on the bed sheets). Overall the hotel/staff did the best they could considering the situation. The hotel looks tired & dated (c1970) and needs a major update/refurbishment. Having said that the hotel served its purpose and we had a wonderful time in Waikiki. Aloha!

Arrived late Friday night Striking staff outside and one person on reception Was never informed that all domestic staff on strike No room service so had to do all cleaning etc ourselves No bar or restaurant service due to strike Hotel rooms need major updating Hotel was clean thouStaff who were working were friendly and helpful The only thing open was the pool Striking staff ranted from 7am until late into the night Mostly finishing around 10.30ish each evening Not impressed with strike leaders allowing this as hotel will suffer laterHotel did waver resort fees due to strike Overall hotel did its best with staff available but does need investment in updating rooms

Where to start?? Hmmmm .1) workers on strike so no housekeeping, pool, bar, food and limited workers for anything else... 2) huge water pipe broke above our room at 4am. Ceiling flooded, walls and carper dripping. Eventually got some help from security and we packed the kids and all our stuff and drudged to another room far away in an older building.3) I figured .. flooded out of my room, no service..maybe I'll get an upgrade...haha not a chance, new room older and more disgusting than the first.4) Sheraton tops it off by charging me the resort fees even though we received nothing .... not even a note of apology from management. About as bad an experience as this seasoned traveler has ever had. Stay far away.

My family stayed here for 5 nights. Everything is ok. The only thing I concern about is the staff left our door open after house keeping. Since they were under staff strike, there wasn’t housekeeping regularly everyday. And there are many temporary staffs. The hotel is a little bit mess but still functional. We ask for room refreshing on the 3rd morning (10/24) and then we went out. When we back on 12:30pm, our room door is literally opened and no staff inside or near our room. Luckily we didn’t lose anything. We talked to the hotel, there were security and house keeping crew coming and said sorry. Just a reminder that if you stay here and ask for house keeping, put all your value things inside the safer. Or your room might be opened and welcome everyone to go inside.And for Sheraton, as a worldwide famous hotel brand, this is unacceptable.

We were greeted to the chants of " GO HOME". After arriving from a flight from Sydney, this really did make us feel unwelcome at The Sheraton Princess Kauilani Hotel. Our travel agent had advised us there were ongoing strikes at this chain of Hotel, and there were no services, but we decided to check in. We had booked a pool view room, but were told these rooms did not have a balcony! As we had requested a room with balcony, we were allocated a room in the "tower". Poor choice- our room overlooked a concrete wall from the adjoining International Marketplace, and the constant loud noice from the air conditioning units and exhaust fans on the roof, were worse than the chants from the protestors! At least the protestors ceased at about 10pm, but the noise of the loud air conditioners went on 24/7. After 2 nights, we asked to be moved to a quieter room. We requested a tower room, overlooking the pool, but were told there weren't any available as the hotel was " fully booked". I find this hard to believe as we have since met other tourists who refused to stay here and moved to another hotel. We have ended up in a pool room, directly in the firing line of the protesters!!! We were told we would receive breakfast vouchers, and they would be delivered to our room, and placed under the door. We are now on our 6th night of our 8 night stay, and still no breakfast vouchers! We make our own bed, take out the trash, clean the room etc. so much for a relaxing stay at The Princess Kaiulani, and a hard earned holiday. Perhaps a partial refund for lack of services would be in order?

This is the most disgusting 3 star hotel I have ever seen. I have no idea how this place got a 3.9 rating on Google. For starters, there was no maid service because they are on strike. They start yelling and banging on pots and pans outside the hotel at 6am and don’t stop until after 10pm. We could hear them with all doors closed on the 7th floor at all hours of the day. We had to get all of our own toiletries, which were sitting outside the elevator. On top of no maid service, which should have been prorated from the cost of our room, the room was straight up gross. The pictures should speak for themselves. They should be ashamed of themselves for charging what they charge for this quality of service. Some sort of a refund should have been given to guests for this disgusting hotel. Also, no lei at check in.

Considering there was strike action by staff it’s still a great hotel to stay at for a reasonable price.Just across Kalākaua Avenue from the beach you can’t beat the location and close to all the great bars, restaurants and shopping.WiFi is very good and the Tower partial ocean view room was high up and quiet.Promoted as a renovated room I’d classify it as refreshed but the sweet sleeper bed is its best feature.Pleasant and helpful staff working under trying conditions, thank you Sandra at reception and all the guys at the bell desk you all shined bright every day of my stay.I recommend Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for travellers wanting to save a buck but still get a comfortable stay while in Waikiki.

The aforementioned strike in previous poor reviews is one of the major reasons for the 1 star rating. OK they cannot control this. The incessant chanting and loud hailing and banging of drums from dawn well into the night is horrendous.The non service and no cleaning and no restaurant is terrible. I have paid a lot of money well well in advance to take this trip of a lifetime and is is very much turning into a farce.The room was dirty with so much dust behind the tv unit i actually wrote my name in it.Collect your own towels and no form of room service or restaurant means you litterlly pay for me a small fortune for a bed to sleep in.A very small courtesy would have been to contact all incoming guests of what to expect. But no. Money is the prime goal and they think that may put off customers. But i for one would have preferred a heads up. I cannot get a refund so am stuck here ( for another 3 days) but would have preferred to know rather than being all happy and excited and then let down.I have never left a negative review before an am genuinely disappointed to do so but I cannot let this go. No offer of anything other than an apology for the noise.I am sat here writing this listening to it as its not just this hotel but you cannot escape the noise and i am on the 14th floor

Most of the Hotel staff are on strike. The amount of noise was very loud and rang through the whole property and down the streets. The front desk staff was awesome. The check in went very smooth. Then we ventured to the elevators. The elevators were very dirty (puke on the wall) and made an awful sound when in operation. Then we got off the elevator to find the walls leading to our room to be very dirty with black marks and scraps on the walls.Then we opened the door to the room and noticed 3 bodily stains on the comforter of one of the beds.

Had a pool view room which also overlooked Waikiki Beach. The hotel staff were very attentive at most times. The rooms are a little dated , but very clean and the bed was comfy. We would stay again as it is close to public transport.

We were at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani October 17-22. Although the strike going on outside the hotel was disappointing, the hotel desk staff definitely made up for it. Everyone we encountered at the desk was super helpful and had a great attitude considering they have been working for 8, 9, 10 days straight, 20hrs a day and listening to all the complaints. Reese at the front desk was especially helpful and went out of his way to change our room for us.

The employees are protesting their wages, they make $23 per hour and they want $33 for cleaning hotel rooms. There are no housekeeping services, room service, restaurants, bars, etc. They have a towel exchange in the lobby. They hotel is only giving a 15% discount. The protesters are shouting and playing drums outside the hotel all day until midnight. You can’t sleep or rest. If you are planning a trip to any Sheraton or Westin hotel this month, you should cancel. The hotels is doing very little to accommodate guests for the inconvenience.

When we visit Honolulu for a quick long weekend trip and are watching the $$$'s we will stay in the he "PK" or Princess Kaiulani. We are lifetime platinum elite status with Starwood and they always give us an upgraded room overlooking the ocean. (The rate was $159/night when adjacent hotels on Kalakaua Avenue were running $359/night) This time we were given a high floor and newly remodeled/renovated room overlooking the ocean. They have lots of outlets in the room so you can plug in your phones and computers. In addition, they gave us a complimentary buffet breakfast every morning. There is a nice pool and at night they have Hawaiian entertainment next to the pool. if you want to go to the beach they have Tommy Bahama beach chairs that they give out at the towel shack. It is first come/first serve. You can walk to everything - great restaurants, the beach, shopping it is all right there! It is a short walk (30 minutes) to the Gold Coast area which is a quieter beach area with a nice snorkeling beach.

Except for the strikers which spoilt our holiday a little we thought that the hotel was in a good location and we had a nice room overlooking the pool. Maybe next time there won't be strikers making so much noise to spoil people's enjoyment

The hotel is situated in the heart of Waikiki Beach. It contains a great bar and restaurant. We arrived early in the day and realised we couldn't book in until 3pm but were told at reception to come back at noon 'if the room was ready'. It was not and we kept checking being told the room wasn't ready. At exactly 3pm we were given the keys only to realise it wasn't the room we had booked they had placed us in the high rise with no view. So left bags in room, went back down and were told 'oh we upgraded you' i advised them i had specifically chosen the lower floors with a pool view. She said she would correct it but then asked for my ID for the correct room. I said you didn't ask me for ID when I got the first key? After the delay we didn't reach our room until 3.45pm and we felt the man at reception who kept telling us the room wasn't ready was being childish even at one stage tapping his watch and saying 'come back in 11 minutes' when it was 2.49pm. It was a shame we had this experience because we did enjoy our stay there. The only other thing which was a little concerning was the public access to the pool area from the side street which was a security issue if you had left anything on the pool chairs whilst swimming.

As a Platinum elite member I have been to many Sheratons in the past. This place is not worthy of the Sheraton name. The striking employees are irritating but not necessarily anything they can do with the strike. They could be more understanding with the patrons and give a severe discount. Very disappointed. The place is very dated and dirty.

I have loved this hotel in the past but the Employees are striking right now and management does not really care about the guests. We paid in advance so we got no refunds. We could not leave and go somewhere else which I would have preferred. Not only is the noise, megaphone screaming, drum beating, and insults to the guests occurring from 5 AM till 10:30 PM an irritant, but there are no services. We literally have to pick up our towels, and other items needed in our room, downstairs in the lobby. We have to take our trash and our linens down the hall and deposit them in separate bins. We are doing all the work that support staff would do with no compensation from management. We paid the price for a nice room with services, with a nice bar and a nice restaurant all on site. However none of that is available and there is no compensation for it other than us doing the work ourselves. I will never stay at another Sheraton hotel because they do not really care about their customers.

Stayed there for 2 nights before heading up to the North Shore. It's big and it's busy, but they have great rooms, we had an Ocean view, comfy beds and a good balcony. They provided chairs and towels so you can walk 3 mins to the beach itself and enjoy. The staff were helpful. Breakfast was busy, but a good selection of food. This place really hit the spot for our short stay and I'd recommend on that basis.

We stayed here in January 2018 and had such a great experience that I decided to return here to celebrate my BIG milestone b'day!Upon arriving at the hotel, we were 'greeted' by many protestors chanting outside hotel. This loud noise continued the entire 6 nights we stayed here. Not really what you want to hear when you're trying to relax on the holiday you've planned all year for! We could hear them from our room and pool, from early morning until late at night.We also had no one to clean our room, we had to empty the trash ourselves, help ourselves to our own clean towels from the lobby, as well as shampoo, soap etc. Not really something I expected to be doing whilst on a hard earned holiday.During our stay, we had no pool side service, the bar there was closed. We had also booked a package including breakfast, which again, we did not receive. The convenience of having breakfast at a hotel is a major drawcard for us.The hotel seemed well prepared for the disruptions, having flown people in from all over USA to help out. What was most disappointing was that no guests were pre-warned of this. They told us their negotiations take place every 3 years!What's also disappointing was the way 'compensation' was handled. They told us the 'resort fee' would be waived! Really? Given there was no service, geez, I'd expect that! Secondly, because we booked hotel through a third party, no refund of breakfast was offered. We did receive one nights' free accommodation.I would still recommend staying at this hotel - it's a great location and usually great service. Perhaps in about 3 years time, I'd phone ahead to make sure there aren't any more negotiations taking place with their staff. For me, it has left a very bleek birthday experience - and that's a shame, as we are the people keeping the protesting staff in a job!

After reading the reviews here, we made sure to book a newly renovated room, which was pretty nice with a very comfortable bed. This hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of waikiki,across the street from the beach, and reasonably priced. Our check-in was quick and convenient but we were a little disappointed that we had to ask if there were any upgraded rooms available even though we have elite status. We were celebrating a birthday so it was really nice that they had a dessert surprise for us when we came back in the evening.... thank you! We stayed there before the strike so please consider the status of the strike when you book.

Didn't stay at the resort but when to their all inclusive buffet for a birthday and anniversary dinner. Live hawaiian music with dancers topped of the nice relaxing evening. The seafood was on point and cocktails were well made.

Location, Cleanliness, Views (Ocean view room level 22), Pool, Buffet, Reception, did I mention Location. It was the most relaxing and convenient place we could have asked for. A Mahalo nui loa to the hotel and Hawaii overall

We are regulars at the Princess Kaillani, it is a great place to stay. Room rates are reasonable, for Waikiki. The have a great dining room that serves a buffet for breakfast and dinner. They offer shows on property. It is right across the street from the beach. The staff are amazing, sorry they were on strike this weekend but management is doing the very best. Check in was not a problem we walked right up, Justin greeted us and was amazing as always. Because of the strike there is no maid service, not a problem if you need towels or any other items for your room management set up a place near the elevator to get what you need, The only impact we saw was the restaurant and splash bar were closed, No worries there are plenty of place all over. Oh the chanting from the people on strike goes on all day but we thought it was a party we were missing.Don't let the strike keep you away, managemnt is doing a great job and hopefully the strike ends soon.

Look I'm not a fancy traveller & I don't expect the world. I just want polite staff & a clean room. Neither are here due to the employee strike & one has to wonder how much Sheraton/Marriott are just hoping this will fizzle out.We arrived Sunday & there was no word or warning that 6AM the next day, the hotel staff would go on strike. The hotel has a duty of care to inform guests of disruptions as they become aware of them. The negotiations have been ongoing since June, 4 months now & incoming guests should've been given an opportunity to book somewhere else, now we're stuck for another 4 nights still & cannot rebook because every other hotel now is on rack rates due to the 5 hotels now emptying nearby.We're in a room we paid extra for a view, that has not been updated in 20 years. I thought the Sheraton name was 5-Star (though relooking trips advisor has them at 3.5 star). AND... we still need to pay for the resort fee. Resort fee? What? This is a hotel near the beach, not a resort. Why is this not in the fee I paid when I booked the package through Expedia?Here is a few of my gripes:- Limited staff at check-in, though the next day there was no staff due to strike- We arrived early (12 noon), room not ready which we expected & we're dragging our own bags around the lobby. I suggest that the hotel should take bags to your bell desk not reception & then the bags could've been put in the room as soon as it became available. Instead, we had to dig out a bag tag before the receptionist would then send the bags up- "I'll be helping you to check in today..." was what the receptionist said. I know this, I am standing in front of you- Wallpaper is falling off the walls & is dirty- Lifts are being turned off regularly & the lift on the left (out of 3) has only opened once since we've been here causing lines & overcrowding- Pool closed one day due to no staff- Housekeeping closed with our room not cleaned now 5 days with 4 to go. Yes, we are staying near the beach & tracking in sand every day. So yummy- Collecting our own towels & toiletries from the lobby- Woken every day around 6 AM when the protesters start banging drums. This morning they were so loud, my bed was vibrating- No restaurants or food available. Though on the first night, we were served a cocktail by the most loveliest lady, I wish I got her name- Ugly bins in the floors to deposit our own rubbish- Toilets near the gym are those non-water ones in the urinals & now 5 days in without cleaning, are starting to reek. Don't go in, be warned!The most upsetting part is the hotel management. What are they doing during this crisis, & yes it is a crisis to make the stay as comfortable as possible for those guests sticking it out? Nothing. Absolutely nothing. We can hear the protesters with the doors closed 24/7& they block the entrances & intimidate the people coming in & out with DON'T CHECK IN, CHECK-OUT! I've even seen them taunting cars driving in to turn around & go somewhere else. We've got nowhere else to go guys.

We never even got to checkin. On arrival there was a picket line chanting ‘not to book in’ as we had booked and paid for the hotel in February through our travel agent we proceeded to the desk to check in. They wouldn’t check us in although whilst I was arguing with them 3 other guests were checked in. They cited to us that they could only service some rooms due to the strike. We advised we didn’t need housekeeping as only 3 nights. But they would not budge, they sent us to the Astor Waikiki Beach.a few blocks away. Although we had a top view the hotel was very old and bathroom needed a refit.There was no follow up from them to change our airport transfer pickup from the new hotel back to the airport either.

After saving for an overseas holiday for my family, to say I am gutted is an understatement! I chose this hotel at a premium price to celebrate one of my children’s birthday. Upon arrival my daughter bursts into tears as the protesters scream at us “DON’T CHECK IN”. Are the people going to hurt us daddy she asks? Once checked in I find we have no restaurants, no bar, no housekeeping. We have to change our own linen, remove our dirty towels. We have to go to the lobby to get shampoo and soap as well as new towels & sheets. To top this off I still am charged $35 per days to park my rental car & my daily resort fee. Totally disgusted with Sheraton. Can’t wait to go home.

On arrival on Mon 8th Oct 2018 for our “fully Paid Accommodation”, we saw Union Protestors outside.We respect their right to protest however their chanting, drums and loud speakers starting around 5am till around 10pm or later at night, totally disrupts any rest or relaxation.What concerns us is that we paid in full the total 1week stay to “My Cruises” an Australian travel agent then they contracted Sheraton Princess in Hawaii, but no one seems to take any compensation responsibility.I feel a very big “Thumbs Down” ( at present 11th Oct) to both My Cruises Australia and Sheraton/Marriott in Hawaii

Before you book into this hotel make sure the Unions are not protesting. You will find intimidating protesters at entrances of the hotel chanting with loud speakers. (A real spoiler for kids). The fun only than just begins. If you are lucky you will have a clean room (some poor buggers didn't have clean sheets). The protest chants start at 8am and continue to after 10pm. Forget about opening your window to enjoy a sea breeze, that won't happen unless you want to hear the screaming protesters.. But bring your cleaning skills as it will become part of your holiday fun. Start with making the bed, emptying rubbish but there will be no clean sheets. Get your own towels but be quick as you don't want to miss out. There is no bar open or restaurant so I suggest to bring your own alcohol and food to get through the day. But you will get a resort fee refund - so if you can persevere you could save a few dollars, plus you save a fortune in Tips as there is no service staff. Here are some pictures of the towel bins when we were a bit late to get our towels. My tip is to get there early and grab as many as you cAn so this doesn't happen to you. I am hoping the store over the road has some cleaning product as i will be scrubbing my shower tomorrow as it's looking a bit grimy. On the plus side. The location is great to make a quick exit to the beach and shops.

service was always excellent.Staff friendly & helpful.That is all staff members.Room was clean & always ample towels etcLocation is just right for us.Amenities adequate for our needs.Liked best, see above!Liked least nothing

The room we had was very clean and quite roomy. If anything the bathroom, while very clean, seemed a bit tired and could use a spruce up. The staff were uniformly helpful and cheerful and the room service and housekeeping very thorough and reliable. The location is perfect - right in the middle of Waikiki within walking distance of most places of interest, bus stops, restaurants etc. I don't think the evening buffet in the Pikake Restaurant represents good value. But the food in the Splash Bar is great.

I stayed here for my niece's wedding. The hotel is very clean and beautiful!! There is live music at night and everyone on staff was fantastic!! It was easy to walk to restaurants and shopping. Beautiful!

I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) American Express (AMEX) card member and I decided to redeem my hard earned award points for the very first time to treat my sister and elderly mother in a wheelchair to a family trip to Hawaii. I was very excited about using my reward points for the first time and to be taking my mom on her first trip to Hawaii.I booked my reservation via the SPG website for 3 adults in a room with 2 double beds at the Sheraton Princess Kauilani. A total of 140,000 points were redeemed for 5 nights (4 nights with 1 free night) and $172.75 in resort fees ($35/daily). The reservation was for Jan 2019 which is nearly 5 months out. I was pleased to see that I had just enough points to be able to book the hotel stay. I then purchased the airline tickets right afterwards on my SPG Amex card.Checked my account the next day under "MyTrip" on the SPG website to forward a copy to my sister. To my shock & dismay, apparently, my confirmed reservation was TAMPERED with and it showed 1 king bed instead of the 2 double that was originally booked. To make matters worse, I was slapped with $400 'extra person' charge ($80/day) which was never included in the original confirmation that showed only the resort fee of $172 but no charge for additional person when I reserved it for 3 adults. All these changes were made (by the hotel) after my reservation was already confirmed and made without me even being informed of any changes. My anxiety level shot through the roof when I saw the additional $400 charge since I had already purchased non-refundable airline tickets. Luckily, I had made saved copies of the original confirm reservation. It allowed me to compare the differences and note what was changed so I could report it. I called SPG member services and spent nearly an hour on the phone with the representative at SPG. She called the hotel directly to checkout the discrepancies. I was informed that a staff at the hotel had made changes to my 'confirmed' reservation from 2 double beds to 1 king bed because I had made a comment under the "special request section" of my reservation for an "Accessible Room if possible" to accommodate my mom in a wheelchair. Initially, I was informed by the SPG rep that the hotel stated that they didn't have "accessible rooms" with double beds which was why our room was switched from 2 double beds to 1 king and that the hotel is not aware of the added $400 charge. (Bogus! ) Also, you would think that such a drastic change from 2 double beds for 3 adults to 1 king bed for 3 adults would require some sort of notification or email by the hotel to the customer. But none was sent to me at all.When I inquired further why a $400 extra person charge was added to an already 'confirmed reservation' at a fixed rate of $172, the SPG rep indicated that she couldn't see the charges on their end in the system and that the hotel could not see it on their system either even though it was clearly evident under the SPG website under "MyTrip" reservation. I offered to send both the SPG rep and the hotel staff via email copies of both the original confirmed reservation showing only $172 in charges and the tampered reservation showing $572 in total charges with 3 adults. Eventually, after further discussion with the hotel by the SPG rep, it was discovered that indeed there were ADA accessible rooms with 2 double beds and that we would be putting us in those with the $400 fee for additional person charge removed since we were using SPG points and the SPG points does not charge for the additional 3rd person. To put a smoke screen in all of this by the reps, I was informed that it was a coding error by the hotel since they have only one code for 'ADA accessible rooms' for king bed and the hotel does not have another code for the 'ADA accessible' double bed rooms which completely makes no sense at all since inventories of rooms are tracked meticulously by hotel staff.The SPG rep assured me that she would add notes in my account to make sure that we are given an ADA room with 2 double beds with no additional $400 charge for the extra 3 person.What really upsets me in all of this and what I have learn:a) Hotel staff can tamper with a 'confirmed reservation' and change what you have agreed to purchase "after" the agreement is already made without your consent.Lesson learn: Save all documention immediately following your original reservation so you have a backup copy of what you 'agree' to purchase.b) Double check everything before your trip so you don't have problems such as this issue at check-in which would be a nightmare scenerio especially when traveling with a disable elderly person.c) Find a reputable hotel... I realize that I was not given honest answers through the whole process. How are they allowed to tamper with a "confirm reservation" without notifing anyone especially when the bed type is changed without consent and the total cost changed so dramatically? How can a hotel with 1,152 rooms not know that they have ADA rooms with 2 double beds automatically? How come the hotel can't see the charges applied on a reservation like the $400 extra person charge that was added to my reservation? Unforuntately, I have already purchased 3 airline tickets so I'm not able to cancel the hotel reservation. And since I don't have enough points to switch to another Sherton property, I'm stuck with this reservation. If I had more points, I would completely cancel this reservation and move elsewhere and not deal with this type of dishonesty for profit.

Our birthdays became memorable because of our stay in this hotel. No problems at all, very close to all amenities and a block away from the beach. Daily housekeeping was the highlight of our days, going back to our room after a long day of tours and activities with clean washroom, new towels and bed made. I am definitely staying at this hotel again and I will recommend it to all my friends and family.Thank you for making us feel OHANA.

Great location, close to beach and shops. Entertainment every night great atmosphere. Beds are comfortable. Hotel rooms dated and small for price. Hit with daily report fees on top of cost of room and taxes.

We have stayed in PK 4 times now Last time 18th september 2018. We love the Hotel obviously. Rooms clean a bit dated but a lot of space. Location brilliant. Pool view was great partial ocean view too. Splash bar Happy hour. Good as well. Will stay again. We had friends stay there with us this time. And loved it. Would recommend to stay at The Princess Kaiulani. Pamela. Cordaz..

After being made to wait over an hour to check in because the lady at front desk couldn’t find our booking we were given a DISGUSTING hotel room over looking bins and a car park. But the worst thing was the carpet was soaking wet! Not sure if this was from the air conditioniner which looked like it was installed in 1980. Needless to say I refused to stay in such filth and we were put in another room but this didn’t make our stay any better. Only one plus side the location was good. As Australians we were made to feel second class and it was very obvious that is what they think!

Room good size however maintenance issues were only resolved after twice contacting reception. Lights not working properly & shower leaking. Cleaning staff however did a very good job servicing the room,

Pros:Rooms were very clean.Comfy beds and beddin with lots of pillows.Shower worked great.Housekeeping staff was fantastic.Cons:AC didn’t work that well...only could be set to 68 degrees or higher.Hallways were quite hot.Rooms were small.Towels were threadbare.Front desk staff was abrupt.

We spent 5 nights in this fabulous location, across the street from Waikiki Beach and some of the more expensive hotels. The hotel was clean, the bed was very comfortable, the staff was friendly and the elevators were quick. The decor was not updated but this did not matter since we did not spend a lot of time in the room. We heard very little outside noise even though we were on a busy street.The resort fee covers pool towels and beach chairs, which was an added convenience. An overall great value!

The hotel has large rooms, a wonderful staff, a large salt water pool, gym, live hawaiian music a great resturant and a wonderful bar with exotic drinks called the Splash Bar.. They also have pimeapple tasting,lei making, and on the weekend people set up tables and make art, jewlery, and quilts.. I've stayed here 15 times and this is the only place to be..I give it 5 stars

Location is great, close to the beach and shops. Staffs were very helpful during our stay, especially Jeffrey who assisted us when I asked to transfer to a new room due to a noise construction. Room 2369 has a nice view of a mountain and ocean. Cleaning staffs are very friendly, and did a good job cleaning our room. Food in the buffet area is delicious. I recommend this hotel.

We booked our stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for the location. The hotel is centrally located - just across the road from Waikiki beach and in the heart of shopping and dining options. Ideal for just popping back to the hotel for whatever reason arises when travelling with a small child/ children. For the location and in comparison to surrounding resorts, in my opinion it is reasonably priced - especially if you manage to find a deal that includes free nights for part of your stay.We had some trouble with our first room - the layout was logistically not viable for 2 adults and a 4yr old to stay in with a double bed right against a noisy wall air conditioner unit, amongst a couple of other issues. Having said that, I could not fault the customer service provided by the reception staff member Bryce/Bryance. His problem solving skills and patience dealing with one jet-lagged Mumma after more than 24hrs in transit were second to none and there was no stress in resolving the situation.I would recommend this hotel for location and value for money compared to other nearby options - save a little on your accommodation and spend more on your holiday experiences!

My whole entire family members visited Honolulu from many different locations and one of the hotels we stayed at was the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.First and foremost, the princess rooms are outdated and requires an extensive renovation.They list non-renovated on the spg website so I wasn’t surprised at all after check-in, but it would be nice if A/C works well like the rooms in Tower. Beds are super not comfortable.Tower rooms are renovated but not fully. Description of the ocean view King has bathroom wall painted purple but not in my room. I was on the 25th floor looking towards the Waikiki beach which was a nice view but 80% of my room was renovated. Bed was comfortable.Customer service is not consistent from person to person. Cathy at check-out was very professional and super friendly; however, rest of the front desk staff were less than average.Housekeeping staff were great except they missed putting towels and change linens during my stay, had me to call guest services to request change.I expected superior service from Sheraton especially I spent nearly $4000 on total folio.I don’t know if I would want to stay at this Sheraton again next time.

This was the first hotel I ever stayed at when my cheerleading squad visited Oahu in 1993 loved it then and loved it on our last trip just last week! I know it is pretty old, but they maintain the hotel pretty well and the service was amazing! We have been to Oahu many many many manyyyyy times so we kind of know what we are expecting. There was a storm heading towards the Islands and staff kept all the guests aware and I never felt unsafe, I was glad I stayed at the PK! The storm wasn't that strong, only wind and rain. The only downside was that we couldn't have late check out since they were booked solid. Our room was clean and we would def stay there again! We even had dinner at the Splash Bar, service was a bit slow, but they were really busy. Mahalo PK for our wonderful experience and making us fall in love with Hawaii over and over again!

Had a “twin share room” on the 11th floor. Didn’t mind the fact we had a view of the car park but the room was poor and not worth the good money we paid. Air con was hopeless, no fridge, the room was so tight we couldn’t move - definitely not setup for a couple and child, yet they expect an additional resort fee. Chlorine in the pool was eye burning, and don’t start me on the poolside staff member who didn’t want me sitting in the cabana late one afternoon (after 3.30pm)assuming I didn’t want to pay for the use, didn’t even want to take my order that would have satisfied the cabana/bar fee. We visit regularly and thought we would try here. For the same price there are better places to stay in my opinion.

the hotel is close to the beach and the international market is next door. The hotel is very close to the major bus routes and the pick up for shopping tours. We loved the hula show by the beach. All you can eat restaurant was wonderful.

タワーのオーシャンビューに泊まりました。真正面がビーチ、ではなく、斜め前がビーチでしたが、十分に良い眺めでした。部屋もキレイで十分な広さがありました。ロケーションは◎ビーチに行く前にホテルのプールのところでビーチタオルを借りて、そのまま持って行くことができます。さらにとても助かったのが、宿泊中に無料で貸し出してくれるWi-Fiルータです。スタッフの方々も感じがよくて、とても良かったです。ワイキキとはいえアメリカなので、ある程度英語ができた方が、Wi-Fiレンタルなどもスムーズかもしれません。Nice view, good services and great staff.It’s not front ocean view but great Waikiki view.The room was nice and clean.We got a free Wi-Fi router rental which works great during the stay. They gave us beach towels when we walked to the beach.Great experience with good staff.Mahalo.

The hotel is ideally located right in the centre of Waikiki. The International Market Place is just round the corner, and there are plenty of shops and restaurants on the doorstep. We had a Princess pool view room which unfortunately was very dated and tired. We had a lovely view, you could see the ocean over the hotel across the street, but the room looked like it hadn’t been updated for about 25 years. The bed though was comfortable. On check in we were advised we needed to pay the resort fee , we had already paid this through our travel agents. And on checking out they tried to charge us for a phone call home, even though we had been advised we had free international calls on checking in. I had to query both these charges which were then waived but feel I shouldn’t have had to do this in the first place.

The hotel is situated in a very good place,well within easy walking distance to beach and bus/trolley stops.shops and eating places also very handy.we had a partial oceanview room which was clean but rather dated there also seemed to see very small insects around the wooden desk but the bed was clean and comfortable.the bathroom was small with a shower over the bath.we had originally had breakfast included but we had to delay our holiday for a few days because of illness we somehow lost breakfast! At $24 per person for breakfast we decided to eat out.i don’t think we would stay there again

Here stands on the centre of popular street 'Kalakaua', and also close to Waikiki beach. It also good for family with toddlers. Our room was at lower floor of lower tower and was also facing to the parking tower. It was unfortunate. But I think hotel is very convenient for going everywhere.

I’ve stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani several times and I had another good experience. Your experience may vary because I am a Marriot/SPG Platinum and they have always upgraded me to a renovated room with a partial ocean view. I would recommend paying for the upgraded partial ocean view room. If you get one of the rooms that hasn’t been remodeled you may not want to return. The renovated rooms are big and the only negative is the paper-thin walls where you can hear everything from your neighbors (some things you just don’t want to hear !). The hotel still gives the free breakfast/ dinner coupons for the buffet which is good. There is a pool but the lounge chairs fill up quickly. For a medium priced Waikiki hotel, this is still a solid choice.

The hotel was ok overall but be aware that your experience will vary greatly depending on which tower of the hotel you stay in. The Northwest tower is more up to date with larger rooms and better amenities. The Southeast tower is very old, outdated, the air conditioner doesn't work well and my brother's room needed to be fumigated for bugs! We were able to get moved after the first night due to our status but if you have any option, make sure you choose wisely. Outside of that, the location is perfect and pool is decent.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is our go-to hotel for our staycations. We love it so much there that we decided to have our wedding and reception there. The Kapuni ballroom is the perfect place for a ceremony and reception. There is a lanai that overlooks Waikiki beach and also has the best sunsets. The hotel itself is located right in the heart of Waikiki, right next to the International Market and right across the street from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. The property itself is quaint and cozy, with accents of old Waikiki. The best part of staying at the Princess Kaiulani and the reason we keep on returning is the warm and friendly staff. The staff has become like family to us! Uyen at the front desk always has such a warm smile to greet us. She makes sure that all of our needs are met and always provides an exceptional customer experience. Dana, Kayla, Shar, and Eric at the Splash Bar are the best and always take care of us and provides the best service. We love spending the entire day at the pool because of them. They go out of their way to make sure we have the best experience. The management staff of Mark, Jesse, and Greg make sure all our needs are met and go out of our way to take care of us. It’s the staff that makes the hotel. My wife and family will continue to stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani as long as the warm and friendly staff remain and provide exceptional customer service. Thank you to Uyen, Dana, Kayla, Eric, Shar, Mark, Jesse, and Greg. From: The Tom Family.
