I revisited the Princess in June this year, and it didn’t disappoint.The location is spot on, we stayed in a tower ocean view room. The rooms have been renovated since last time 8/10 The hotel also gave us a portable wifi hotspot to carry any where on the Island for free which was cool.The facilities where great and staff very helpful.Price was also very fare compared to The Moana Surfrider where I stayed two years ago.I have been to Hawaii several times and this place is hard to beat for value and location.

A quick overnight trip brought us here. PRINCESS KAIULANI:She was appointed Crown Princess of the Kingdom of Hawaii, and was next in line to be queen had it not been for the overthrow of the monarchy. She died at the young age of 23. LOCATION:Talk about centralized. Being smack dab in the middle of Waikiki makes walking convenient and Ubering cheap. It's walking distance to Waikiki's highlights like the International Market Place, Royal Hawaiian Center, and the Waikiki Yokocho. ATMOSPHERE:It's an older property but well-maintained. Vehicular access can be annoying as you have to yield for droves of pedestrians due to the sidewalk that fronts the property. The tower we stayed in rose about 10 stories with another taller tower next door about double its height. The hotel's pool and open-air restaurant greets you with the registration desk off to the side. The small pool harmoniously blends with the hotel's outdoor restaurant along with the businesses and public sidewalk of Kalakaua Avenue giving you great people-watching views but not much "pool privacy". While it was busy, it never felt over-crowded. ROOM:Our room overlooked the pool along Kalakaua Ave. via a small balcony with chairs and a table. Bedding was comfortable though a little springy. While no built-in charging ports were available, a handy power strip was found under the bed. A/C was strong. The floors, ceilings and walls are thin, so we experienced a lot of noise from the room above us in the morning, possibly from a small child running around, or a noisy housekeeper banging things with the vacuum. BATHROOM:Shower-tub combo, single basin, good water pressure and drainage. RESORT CHARGE:At $33/day, the perks are multiple (see my pic) but appeals to a certain market. Parking is not included and rings in at an additional $35/day. That's why we Uber!SERVICE:Ziggy checked us in. He was friendly and professional. The male associate who checked us out was friendly but I didn't even receive a simple "thank you".A big mahalo to the security officer I spoke to after getting home as we left a CPAP breathing machine in the room. He was very helpful and gave clear instructions on what to do. LOST & FOUND:I've never heard of chargerback.com but that's who they use for lost and found items. Filled out a simple form online, paid for shipping, and received our item via USPS in under a week. FITNESS CENTER:While I didn't use it, I saw it from our balcony. It's on the second level and overlooks the restaurant and pool. TIP:They have a nostalgic mail letter drop, the type that starts at the top floor and goes all the way down to the basement, with access points on each level across from the elevators. OVERALL:Great location, adequate rooms, perfect-sized property.

We chose the Sheraton Princess because of the rares for rooms. Now that we have been there, we will ask for this hotel every time. The staff, the rooms the views, the location, the restaurant are ALL the best. Try it, I am sure you will agree,

This hotel is incredibly centrally located across the street from Wakiki Beach (which is public, so there's no need to pay extra to stay directly on the beach) but the pool at this hotel is probably nicer than the (crowded) beach, to be honest. Nice bar too! I stayed here for a week in a nice, very comfortable renovated room that had a terrible view (parking lot) and bird poop all over the balcony, but that didn't matter to me as whenever I wanted to go outside I just... left my room. I didn't try the food here other than the food cart by the pool near the street which sells a great acai bowl and coffee. The common areas of the hotel could benefit from a bit of renovation, and I didn't quite like that the elevators weren't secure (anyone can go up to any floor without a key) but I was happy with my room. Other than the nice room and amazing pool, the real reason I'm giving this place 5 stars is because I idiotically left a large amount of items in my closet when I checked out and the hotel not only tracked them down immediately (including an expensive designer blazer) was super duper nice about mailing them to me. I would absolutely stay here again when I return to Honolulu.

Let me start by saying that I booked our 6 night stay using my SPG points (so we only had to pay for the resort fee) - I certainly wasn’t expecting the best room and when we checked in to our room I guess it was more or less what I expected. We were in the Kualani Tower Room 1189 on the 11th floor. This tower is so dated and in desperate need of refurbishing. It smells of stale cigarettes and is musty. at first glance our room itself was okay dated with maybe a bathroom renovation done in recent years but the step in bath/shower is awkward and the toilet space is tiny! The towel rail is above the toilet and is loose. There were also no shampoo or conditioner in the room - this was rectified when I asked for it the next day.The biggest problem we had was the air conditioning. The room was so hot and the air conditioning just did not work properly. We had the temp set to 18.5 C (65F) and it was still hot in the room and it was so noisy we couldn’t sleep. After the first night I called reception to ask if there was anything they could do. The lady who answered was very understanding and explained that their systems were down. She said they would get a repairman to come and look at the unit and would let me know the outcome and if there was anywhere else available in the hotel. I never heard another word from anyone. The air conditioner did seem a little quieter but still the room was too hot to sit in. The safe didn’t work properly it was flashing battery when I told reception they said we would have to be there for that to be looked at - we didn’t bother. We went to use the ironing board it collapsed every time you put any pressure on it.I’ve read reviews about mini bars there certainly was no mini bar in our room.One morning when we went out for the day there was a room service tray left out the front of someone’s room - it was still there when we returned at 10pm that night!We stay in Sheraton properties every year and to put this property as a category 5 astounds me. The location is great but there are plenty of other hotels with a great location!! I am sure the rooms overlooking the ocean are better but unfortunately I won’t be back to try them. We travelled with 2 other couples who stayed in 2 different hotels and I would stay at either of those before thinking about the Sheraton again.

This hotel is quite dated but the people who work here are kind, beautiful and full of Aloha spirit.The location is amazing.Each room has a balcony. I recommend that you book the Tower room with ocean view. The higher the better. Waikiki is very busy so there is quite a bit of noise on the street and traffic. The lower building over looking the pool should be avoided as it is very noisy.I would stay here again if the price is right.The $35 per night resort fee is a little steep and cannot be waived. Wifi is ok and cost $3 more per day for faster speed.

We stayed he for my father in laws medical reasons. Our first room was ok EXCEPT for the leaky AC unit. We reported it and were given a better room. Skipped the breakfast as it was 27 per person..... And I notice almost every hotel in Honolulu charges the BS “resort fee”. Weather you use it or not and we didn’t. Just another way they get more $$$$$.!!! Staff was friendly and aside from the AC issue the rooms were clean. Would stay here again....

もう一年ほど前になりますが、いまだに息子がとても良かった、また泊まりたい！といっているホテルのひとつが、シェラトンプリンセスカイウラニホテルです。こじんまりした印象ながらも、清潔で、行き届いたサービスは心地よく、そして、なんといってもそのロケーションは、ワイキキの西にいくにも東に行くにも、とても便利でした！息子は、プールが"思いきりきちんと練習できるプール"で嬉しかったそう笑そして、ロビーに飾られている、プリンセス カイウラニを見るたびに、安心するそうです。私も、プールサイドでゆっくりしながら、ハワイアンミュージックをライブで楽しむことができ、ゆったりと過ごすことができました！

This hotel was fine -- nothing to write home about. We spent the first few nights in a non-renovated room and it was definitely a late 80's early 90's vibe. We spent one night in a renovated room and that was nicer. They had more outlets around the room including USB outlets. The rooms have the option to be adjoining, which means that they're not very soundproof around the adjoining door. We could hear our neighbors talking. The bathrooms are pretty small and even in the renovated room, the shower/tub is not updated. I was surprised by the lack of towel holders/hooks in the bathroom. It's a beach hotel and it would have been nice to have a place to hang our wet swimsuits. The location is pretty amazing -- close to the beach and a ton of shopping and restaurants. The parking is TERRIBLE. The garage is usually packed at night and you spend a ton of time circling. A lot of people just parked illegally because there were no spots left. I would stay here again, but I wouldn't be too excited about it.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Jennyrenny06
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: This was the 2nd time we stayed at this wonderful resort after our first visit in 2015. To start with, the location alone is wonderful, you would be hard pressed to find a hotel at a better location within $100 of this resort. The staff are fantastic, facilities are good and free GoPro hire and Wi-Fi dongle are the icing on the cake! The resort pool is never too crowded and the close proximity to the beach means you are spoiled for choice. Coming from Australia, our flights get in very early in the morning and the PK staff have always allowed us access to a complimentary room to 'freshen up' when we arrive as early as 8AM, they staff have also gone above and beyond to grant us early check in, a life saver after those red eye flights! I cannot speak more highly of this resort, yes the room are not ultra modern, but that is part of their charm. Whenever I close my eyes and think of Hawaii, I think back to the sunsets on the balcony of my pool view room, listening to the music, a cold drink in hand and watching the ocean. I cant wait for this October when I will return to the PK to celebrate my Honeymoon!Thank you!

This hotel was very clean, a little out dated but perfectly fine. It’s a great deal for the price! Our room had an amazing view! The only reason it didn’t get a 5 Star is because they have entertainment on the open air lobby and u can hear it in your room. So no napping till that’s over! The picture is the view from our room.

After researching numerous hotels before our trip, we settled on the Sheraton PK, having visited there once before many years ago. They are slightly less expensive than neighbouring hotels, which attracted us, and we knew what we were going to get. We were not disappointed. We chose a Princess Pool View room and loved it. Being on the 4th floor, we weren't too high up and could sit on the balcony and enjoy the music, without getting vertigo. Our room was immaculately serviced, Reception gifted us a bottle of champagne for my husband's birthday and staff were always courteous. Used the Splash Bar and Pool quite frequently. Decent coffee just across the road and could just stroll across or down the road to find somewhere to have a beer and appetizers for happy hours.

I stayed here for 8 nights and enjoyed everything about it but the parking situation. The parking garage is always very full with most of the spaces on the lower floors reserved for valet or other unknown purposes. The rooms are nice, I had a city view with a partial ocean view on a high floor which overlooked the International Market. The room itself was comfortable and had what I needed for my stay. In room safe, king size bed, adequate closet and drawer space, a lanai with seating and a refrigerator. Now a couple things that I had to figure out when I arrived was for some reason the TV and refrigerator were unplugged and when I called the front desk they asked me if I checked that. Of course not, I simply assumed that things like that were taken care of. Simple fix, no problem. The cleaning staff was awesome and very responsive to my needs and schedule, which I appreciate immensely. The hotel bar is adjacent to the pool and is a nice spot to have a drink at the end of the day. I really liked the location of the hotel and will likely stay here again when I’m back on the island.

-Stayed at the Princess Kaiulani one night for a quick getaway. It's nice to feel like a tourist every once and again, so we took the time to drive in from nearby downtown Honolulu to the PK for an over-nighter. First of all, there are 3 other Starwood properties in Waikiki (including the Sheraton Waikiki, the Moana Surfrider and the Royal Hawaiian). Of all the properties in the Starwood family, the Princess Kaiulani is the most value-priced (even though we paid around $300 after the $35 resort fee, $35 parking fee and taxes). Yes, even though it is the most economically priced...it still puts a dent in one's pocket! Enjoy the splurge!!!The last time I stayed at this property was prior to the refurbishment. Happy to report the renovation/refresher packs a huge improvement! The fact that it is less "lux" than its sister properties, it more than makes up for in comfort and amenities. To name a few: every room has a balcony (a must in Hawaii so you can enjoy our trade-wind breezes while sipping on a glass of your favorite cocktail...or starting your morning with a cup of java); each room has a mini-frig (to stock up on your essentials like soda, cheeses and yogurt); a water dispenser in the lobby near the elevators (so that you can fill your own hydroflask for the day and do away with plastic bottled water -our ocean honu turtles thank you for that); towels and beach chairs are free for the asking (for when you venture a block down to the famous beaches that Waikiki is known for)!I requested an early check-in (Saturday at 10am) and a late check out (Sunday at 4pm) and both were granted. So thrilled they could do this for the kama'aina (locals)! Much mahalos!While here, we used the gym facility which was quite adequate and offered more machines than most other hotel gyms. But why not get a workout in the pool instead? So we headed to the pool... We enjoyed the pool very much. It is not overly crowded and we did not have any trouble finding chaise lounges for us. We also split a burger and a smoothie with very friendly pool-side service. Never had a roasted pineapple in my burger before, but it was divine! Tip: If you can find it in your budget, splurge on an ocean view. I live here, and it still leaves me breathless! What an indulgence for the ocean view to be your last sight before bed, and the first think you wake up to in the morning!

We really loved this location here in Waikiki, the hotel was right in the middle of everything and only a couple of minutes walk to Waikiki Beach. When we checked in l requested a beach view but we could only get a partial view which we were still happy about! We also had an amazing view of the pool area and it was lovely listening to the island music from the band in the afternoon and evening. Yes the place is a little outdated but l think it’s still a beautiful place to stay. The bellboys were quick to take our luggage off us to take to our room! The staff were courteous and helpful. The foyer, bar and pool area were great to just sit and relax. We bought cocktails which l thought were quite reasonable. We never had any meals here as we found it more reasonable going to Royal Hawaiian Centre Food court. I think the pool should be opened longer at night as sometimes we would be out all day and still want to have a swim in the pool after 7pm but that’s when it closed so we would have to go over to the beach which lm not complaining about that as the sunsets were amazing on Waikiki beach. We stayed here as part as our Cosmos stop over so had no choice in this hotel but l noticed it’s quite expensive to stay at, so if l was going to come to Waikiki Beach again l think l would go to the hotel next door, the Ohana Waikiki East by Outrigger which looked really good and was quite reasonable for money and still close to everything. I really enjoyed Te Moana Nui Tales of the Pacific which was in the Hotel Premises, definitely would recommend seeing that show! Overall we loved our stay here!

To be honest, first on Oahu/Waikiki/Honolulu, if the only reason to go is to be able to say you've been then don't bother it isn't worth the expense or the time it takes to get there (esp' from the UK). It's incredibly expensive.As for the hotel, yes it's location is central in a busting metropolis but again boy you pay for it. I bought a 'pay up front' all inclusive' package for my trip, when I purchased anything I paid cash but I still had a bill of £265 to pay on departure. Car Parking, although it says included is not, iy $35 per day. The room was fine, the corridors drab, reception, splash bar, pool and eating areas I felt impersonal. I confess to feeling underwhelmed I'm afraid. I did find Maui altogether more attractive.

All accommodation is expensive in this part if town, but this is so central to everything you need.....The beach, the markets, the public transport, it's all there at your front door. The staff are friendly and helpful so no complaints there. Like many hotels in the Waikiki district, it needs a massive revamp.......

So I had some concerns about this hotel before I left however the hotel and it’s staff went above and beyond to make my stay there incredible. Yes, it’s an older hotel but it was very clean and the staff was amazing. I will be heading back there soon on a business trip and have no problem staying there again. The location is perfect and since it’s sister hotel to the Westin right across the street, I was able to stay a the westing beach and have drinks/food and charge it to my room at the westing pool bar and restaurant.

We had a great 8 nights here last week (July 2018) and would definitely stay here again. The location is fabulous- right next door to International Marketplace, across the street from Moana Surfrider and the beach, really central to everything except Ala Moana Mall. We had an ocean view room on the 10th floor, the view was spectacular over the rooftop of the Moana Surfrider. The staff were unfailingly helpful and made us feel very welcome. The rooms aren't top-notch in decorating terms, but we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in December 2017 and paid through the nose for a room that was frankly no nicer, and the staff at the Hilton had no interest in their guests except to add extra items to their bills. The central location of the Princess meant we could pop back to the hotel in the afternoon for a swim and reasonably priced pool cocktails, then go out again for dinner and more shopping :) The only complaint is that the pool is really deep with a very small shallow end, so all the kids had to cram into a small patch. But this is really the only quibble we had during our whole stay.We will for sure stay here again when we return to Waikiki, hopefully soon!

Booked this hotel as part of a package through M Hawaii and it was fabulous! We upgraded to an ocean front room which looked out over the ocean towards Diamond Head and over towards the residential area of Waikiki - made for a spectacular view at night and during the day. The hotel was clean and bright with a nice large balcony. A cot was provided for my toddler and we also received a welcome back. As a negative, we travelled with friends who also upgraded and their room reeked of cigarette smoke, it was unacceptable and the only place people could have been smoking was the emergency exit. They alerted management but Im not sure a lot was done.We also had a free breakfast for the kids as part of the package in the buffet, we were treated like we were trying to get something for free that didn't exist, but we showed them our bookings and they (with a lot of effort) allowed her to have food. Annoyingly they watched us feeding her, we weren't going to even have the stuff - there are much much more breakfast options in Hawaii, this was just convenient for the kids. The rooms have a mini bar fridge and a coffee machine which was stocked every day.The nightly entertainment by the pool was really good and other than the breakfast and smoke in the room, it was a great trip.

We’ve had the best holiday in the Cabana’s by the amazing blue pool most days. Jen has been amazing to us and so friendly and personable. She is definitely an asset to the staff and hotel. Cannot wait to come back here and have another holiday by the pool

Right in the heart of Waikiki . Great hotel in a great location, really good service, clean and although the building appears older, the pool restaurants and bars are great.Pool and beach towels and chairs are included and wifi is fast

Efficient staff, clean and good facilities. Pool was never crowded and there are enough loungers. Gym was good with all you would need. We changed rooms from a refurbished to an old one so we could have a king size bed. Very little difference.

The Buffet was great, fresh Hawaiian poke, roasted pork, hot crab legs, and perfect prime rib. Show was worth the price alone, the dancers were great and very entertaining. Obviously the fire knives was my favorite part. The cast of the show was great and friendly after the show as they stayed and took pictures with the audience.

While not right on the beach at Waikiki it is just across the road. The counter staff went out of their way to assist and exceptionally helpful as decided to stay another day due to late night flight. Stayed in same room. The room quite spacious, light & airy. Beds very comfortable. The Sheraton needs a bit of a spruce up & the lack of poolside lounges were evident especially during the day & later into the afternoon. Having to pay a daily resort fee on top of the usual room tariff was new to us & seems to be taking hold elsewhere as well.

This was one our 2nd stay at this hotel. You can save a little money, because it’s not directly on the beach; however, it’s only a block away. I would recommend getting a newly remodeled room. Hotel is truly in the heart of the city. Walkable and safe area. The service here is excellent, front staff is very friendly. Paid for remodeled room, but we received a nice upgrade, so we had a view of the ocean. Loved the bed and pillows. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony. Service at the Splash Bar was exceptional. Loved listening to the Hawaiian music in the early evening.

First time staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani this year and it didn’t disappoint. Walk out either front or side and are on the main strip.Was upgraded to 11th floor family room so more spacious. Breakfast was included when booked, do huge variety and energy for the day. The pool is open from big buildings so sun from 10-7 (closes then) which is better than other hotels.Dated but still grand with pool bar & tables.Also, they offer chairs & towels for the beach and bring out fresh fruit & chilled water to customers tanning on beach at certain times in special seated area. Loved our stay and will be back.

I’ve reviewed Sheraton Princess Kaiulani in the past but this was the first time we’ve stayed as guests in the hotel. We chose PK because of the live music and convenient location to the beach and night life in Waikiki. The hotel staff went over the top to make sure we were comfortable. I mentioned it was my husband’s birthday so a management staff member, Randi, arranged for there to be a beautiful piece of birthday cake and a birthday snack basket for my husband. The view is amazing, the staff is wonderful, and we’re thrilled. The hotel is beautiful, clean, comfortable, and contains the amenities one would need away from home.

It was the last 1night hotel for 17 nights in Hawaii. I was supposed to arrive from Big Island and leave for Korea the next day. I spent a lot of money on hotel during in Hawaii(Trumph int'l Waikiki, Disney Aulani, Hilton, Maunakea beach resort), so last day was just a short time, so I chose the Sheraton Kaiulani for the cheap price. But it was a big mistake. With the credit card I used to check in, they were approved for my dinner at the hotel. and it did not cancel credit card approval (approximately $ 140) even though it paid cash for resort fees and dinners when checked out. The cancellation of the credit card authorization was not immediate, so I was waiting believing it would be canceled.However, the credit card payment was not cancelled and was withdrawn from my account. I've sent a lot of emails to Sheraton But their answer to come back -- I don't know because there's no evidence... I should have received a separate cash receipt. I just got a zero bill only. Of course I knew there would be no problem. Because I have been doing this -Use credit card when checking in and pay cash when checking out.- to other hotels. So where did my cash go ....??????? I felt sorry for choosing the Sheraton name. Dinner was good because it was cheap. It was relatively cheap considering the price of Hawaii. I wish I had not paid double the fee for double payment.Anyway, since there is no evidence at the hotel,---They say they have never received my cash. CCTV is at the wrong angle and they can't see me paying cash. Should I waste my golden time just now only for $ 140???I think I should make this issue known so that no one can be harmed.I hope no one else will have problems like me in the future. If you're just going to use a credit card, never give out cash. I don't know where the cash will go in this hotel.

We stayed june 24th thru the 29th. Location was perfect. Not even a minute walk to the beach. You can rent towels and beach chairs to take to the beach free of charge. The pool was great as well the kids part which is 3.5ft is small but still worth it. The bigger part of the pool is deep but still great. The only thing we didnt like was that the pool closed at 7pm. The Splash Bar is great aswell. Drinks were good and happy hour is perfect. The gentle man who's in charge of the cultural activities there referred to as "uncle", is great with the children. Both my daughter of 4yrs and 7yrs old enjoyed the Lei making as well as the Ukulele lessons that were free. Each day there is a different activity at the hotel as well as an evening show with music and a Hawaiin dancer. Around the hotel there are plenty of places to eat like food trucks as well as ABC stores to buy your quick necessities. We attended happy hr in the near by restaurants just so it wouldn't be so expensive for a family of 4. Parking is $35 for overnight stay but they do offer hour rates as well. Once cheked in they upgraded our room to an Oceanview for free so that made this hotel even better. We loved it and definetly will be back to this hotel, thank you Sheraton PK and Mahalo.

Business trip to Hawaii where I would normally stay on the base, but all lodging was booked. We were offered this hotel in Waikiki near the ocean front. Located one block in from the water, it is a great location for exploring in any direction. As an SPG Gold member, I was upgraded to a partial ocean view room. You could see the swimming pool from my balcony and all the people walking the main stretch of road. The room was ok, but is outdated. Hotel could use a renovation. Typical amenities in the room with a fridge and safe. The air conditioner seems a bit weak as the room doesn't really get too cold.The gym was pretty user friendly with many treadmilks, elipticals, bikes, free weights, and life fitness machines. They also had a section for stretching and/or yoga. Plenty of fans to keep things cool while working out.Breakfast buffet was ok. I tried it one day only because I received a free buffet as an SPG Gold member. Nothing really to rave about, but it was decent. I did not use any other facilities as I was here on business and did not have time. An overall ok stay.

Excellent location, comfortable beds and pillows, nice resort feel, helpful staff. Resort fee included portable wifi and GoPro hire! We stayed as a family and size of room and resort facilities were ideal.

We love this hotel. The location is perfect, close to beach and shops. The hotel has a pool and it is very clean with a lot of sun chairs. Our room was in the tower and we had the perfect view of the beach, pool and the mountains. There is a TV, fridge, safe, very comfy bed and plenty of room to walk around. The bathroom was also very clean. The shower is over the bath and the water pressure was good. There was a hair dryer. There is a pull out clothes line over the bath. The room is air conditioned. Wifi was free and very good. We had a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table and still room to move. Free water bottles x2 everyday and the room was serviced daily. You get your towels for the beach by the pool and you can also get beach chairs at no cost.There is entertainment every night. The splash bar is for casual dining and we used it a few times, the food was good, the drinks were cheap and the staff very friendly. The main dining room looked lovely although we didn’t use it. This is a must stay again place. The service was wonderful.

We stayed at SPK for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. The location is the best bit...awesome - only a short walk to pretty much everything, the room was small (but we weren't there to see that bit...only to sleep). We were only on the 2nd floor, but had an awesome view over the pool area and nightly entertainment. The staff were mostly great (& our issue at checkin was sorted quickly by manager). The resort fee is something we are not used to in Australia, but the bottled water and island-wide WiFi included in the fee, was definitely worth it. Can not recommend this hotel enough. Will be back with family!

Stayed here 10 years ago and was looking forward to our return visit.It still has a great location. Thats about it the hotel has become tied, shaby and is overpriced.They need to do something about the birds in the breakfast buffet area apart from anything else its unhealthy. Requested a particular room 8 months earlier and recieved a room no where near the one requested.Bought a bottle of wine to drink on the balcony, discovered that wine glasses weren't supplied in our room only light clear plastic cups. Rang housekeeping and was told a Portage charge would be aplied if we wanted wine glasses. Thought the daily resort fee might have at least allowed us to have wine glasses.All in all came away fairly disapointed with the Sheraton brand.

We had room #522. Our room was not one of them that had been renovated yet but it was still very nice and clean. Our bed was sooo comfortable! We had a view of the pool with nightly entertainment pool side. Very nice, it was like our own private box seats at the theatre LOL!!! To the right, we had a view of the open air restaurant. We would go out on our balcony to see if it was crowded or not and if you looked left you could see partial view of the ocean, which was also nice. Moving back to poolside there is an opening that leads you to the main strip. In the evening you could see the vendors selling their flash wares. It was such an awesome view from our room - we just loved it. However the only down side which turned it from a 5* to a 4* was the size of the balcony. It was extremely small, barely enough room to fit a small table and two chairs.Take the room with the breakfast. For us it was so worth it. We really loved the breakfast: omelette station, hash browns, bacon, 2 different types of sausage, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, salad bar, fresh juice, coffee, pancakes and French toast alternated days, and they also had a Japanese breakfast too. The food (North American side) was very good!Down by the pool deck, the guys give out beach chairs and beach towels to take to the beach. Mr. Freezies, oranges and apples are offered poolside next to where you pick up the towels and beach chairs. They also go on the beach and offer their guests fresh fruit and water a couple of times a day. Make sure you take the hotel towel or they will not know you're a guest. Also watch out for them in case they miss you.Across the street at Kings Village, there are vedors that set up there in the evening. Go to the very top, you can get pad thai, fried rice, chicken, shrimp, beef, etc on skewers. I took pad thai and chicken on skewers for $10. and it was a lot of food and also very good! Down at the bottom they had fresh salads, fruit and pastries for dessert. These were being sold anywhere from $2. - $5.00. It's definitely worth it and fun to buy from the locals. Back at the hotel our local tour desk guys were awesome, helpful and soooo friendly :) And if you want to rent a car, go to our tour desk guy. As a guest you will receive 50% discount on car rental. Pick up is immediately across the street. It's so convenient.

Wow what a place to stay. Across the road from the beach, so no need to pay the higher prices of beachfront motels. Check in very quick & informative. Mi fi was a great thing for quests to use whilst there. Rooms comfortable, bed amazing so easy to sleep. Coffee machine in the rooms was fantastic for coffee drinkers like me. Loved the balcony & the fantastic view we had of the street & ocean. Watching the surfers having a coffe. Bliss. The splash bar, very friendly, great food & fantastic staff

The idea of booking a hotel room that is part of Waikiki history is great in theory but when it comes with a hefty price you would expect something decent. The foyer area is all modern but very busy. Did not get the Aloha experience or feel getting off the shuttle as we have previously at other hotels. The hotel room 622 in the Princess Kaiulani tower was so old the furniture seen better days , bathroom so small with no extraction fans so was rather smelly. View from dirty balcony was not too bad. After first night requested a change in room due to state of bathroom and after 3 days were told they upgraded us to a more expensive room on the tenth floor. Well the bathroom was the same size but with extraction fan so minus the smell. Room furniture was slightly better, comfort of bed and pillows was much better and room appeared more airy, but been an upgrade from 6 to 10 you not paying for a better room but a better view. The pool is not very practical as there is not much room just to stand around in the pool as it gets very deep very quickly. You cannot stand around the sides of the pool either as it so deep. Pool rather small for the size of the hotel. All the social media photos make it look amazing but it is not. Resort fees are a rort, activities offered to guest should be complimentary and getting MiFi and 1 day GoPro , which if you are not aware of, is not highlighted or advised at time of booking would be cheaper to buy yourself. The other service that is part of this resort fee is the beach cold water and fruit service , which we did not experience as it is o my offered in front of The Sheraton Waikiki which is a bit of a walk from SPK. Only thing going for this hotel is the location.

Our first trip to Hawaii & we stayed for 10 nights in Pool View rooms, us in 1 room & our son & grandson in the adjoining room. The rooms were fantastic & cleaned daily. The staff were excellent & we were well looked after in Splashes bar. We would definitely stay at the hotel again when we return to Hawaii.

Just returned home from spending 10 nights at PK. It is our second trip to Hawaii and first time staying at PK and we will be returning.From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and big Aloha's. It was also a nice touch that we received a nice welcome basket of fruit and snacks.The location of this hotel is perfect, the pool, the splash bar everything we encountered was fantastic.The room was always cleaned and it was nice to come back after a day of exploring to bottled water. The staff at the pool were so friendly and always asked about our day and wished us well for a daily adventures. Also the staff at the splash bar remembered us and always asked how our day was and were generally interested. We look forward to returning as soon. as we can.

This is the 3rd visit to Hawaii for my Mum and I and our 2nd stay at the PK. This hotel has 3 towers of room all with different views. The most popular are the pool view or the ocean view rooms but we prefer the rooms at the back of the Princess wing that face the mountains. They are much quieter than the front rooms though a little dated and in need of updating. They have windows that can be opened unlike rooms with balconies where you have to keep the doors open if you want fresh air. The reception staff are always very helpful especially Sharen and Erin who have done much to ensure we have the room we want. The breakfast buffett is good though over priced in our opinion. We also had dinner in the restaurant one night and found it to be good with a wide range of dishes. The location of PK is excellent being in the middle of the shopping area and close to many places to eat. There is an ABC store directly across the road which is great for picking up food and drink and other little necessities. We always enjoy our stay here.

We stayed here for 4 nights. I booked our room 3 months advance and requested to be on a higher floor. They put us in the 26th flr. The room is renovated, comfortable bed but the bathroom is tiny. The location was perfect its close to everything you need. Shopping, Restaurants, Beach, and even Kings Village night market. They have very friendly staff. My favorite staff was Monette (not sure with her name) she's our server every night we go to The splash bar.They offer 15% off for SPG member.

Just spent another beautiful week at PK after a week in Maui.. once again, was great to be greeted by Gregg and Kathy again, soo nice of Kathy to have a basket of goodies sent to our room, loved it ! .. we stayed in the Princess Tower and it was great to see lovely Leonora again who gave me a big welcome back. I have to give a call out to Wayne the locksmith, he came and replaced the safe we were having problems with, what a nice guy he is, he even went to the trouble of returning to my room with a gift for me :o) .. was so nice to see Angie again at Splash bar, she took us out for an evenings entertainment .. needless to say, I’ll be back in November, to show my son the hospitality of PK .. PS.. I don’t want to come across as too critical, but, the surrounding pool pavement is looking very dirty and shabby, it really needs cleaning.

We are again at PK what a great place to stay the best staff willing to go above and beond to make your stay a memorable one ,location could not be better.And the new show in the Ainahau Showroom has the WOW factor "Waikiki's ROCKN Reception 'what a great feeling good show singing and dancing theme from Hawaii and Vegas it has captured the way wedding receptions were in 1955 all fun also to have the involvement with the cast during the show is a winner good for everyone a must see well done PK MIke

Perfect location right in the middle of Kalakaua Avenue. Cross the road and you're on the beach. The rooms have been updated, although clearly updated on a budget!Pool is super deep with just a small section roped off where it's more shallow. The poolside food service was great.Grounds a really nice and people at reception were lovely. Great to get the complimentary portable WIFI device.I keep hearing that this hotel is going to be demolished?! The lifts are extremely old and the hotel layout probably not ideal. It would make the perfect location for a new hotel.Only problem with our stay is that I'm still waiting on my SPG points!!!

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani has opened itself up as my second home each time I visit the beautiful state of Hawaii. Having stayed here now literally an uncountable # of nights, I still find myself pleasantly surprised with something new the hotel has to offer with each new stay. The location is quite frankly unbeatable. Steps away from Waikiki beach and right in the heart of all the action. It has solidified itself as a timeless classic among the hotels that flood the streets of Waikiki by maintaining it's old-school charm and allure. And while I can go on and on about the vast oceanic views, the live-music performances, or the insanely appetizing buffets, I'd be remiss is I left out the one piece of this puzzle that makes this hotel such an integral part of my Hawaii experience: the staff. Throughout all of my check-ins, my lost key replacements, or any one of my annoying requests for information, I'd be greeted with a warm welcome and a smile. I can't say enough good things about the people that help make this place run as smoothly as it does, especially Sabrina at the front desk in particular. She has become my go-to fixer for everything. If there was an Employee of the Month recipient, she'd be my nominee every time. Thank you Sabrina and thank you Sheraton for turning this place into a home.

This hotel is quite old and our room well in need of a complete makeover. Reminded me of visiting surfers paradise as a child. The room although roomy enough was quite dated. The bathroom had wallpaper on the walls and not one tile! The bed was comfortable but pillows not so much. The room has your basic amenities. Coffee making machine, bar fridge, iron and safe. Ladies, take your own hairdryer with you, don’t rely on the one provided. It was also quite old. The hotel amenities are also quite dated. Pictures you see online are very deceiving. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Close to everything, short stroll to beach, shops and trolley transport. Staff are friendly enough and accommodating. If you’re after luxury and 4 or 5 star then this hotel is not for you. If you want a standard room and excellent location then I would recommend this hotel. Unfortunately for me, I won’t be returning. There appears to be plenty more to chose from.

Higher floor rooms have water view. Pricing up but still best among Sheraton in Waikiki given location. Live music for Sunday brunch and each evening. SPG discounts on drinks and food higher here than at Moana-Surfrider. Very clean rooms but small balconies. Staff is truly friendly and helpful. I stayed 7 nights without breaking the bank. Also, Sheraton contracted airport shuttle recommened to avoid driving all over before arriving at your location—same low pricing.

This was my first time back to the Islands in 20+ years and I was surprised by how much things have changed. I arrived at the hotel and was checked in with a smile and was walked through the amenities the hotel had to offer. I received the room I requested. High floor with a sea view and wasn't disappointed. I opened the balcony and the trade winds welcomed me home. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The television had more channels anyone could dream of watching and the wifi was extremely fast.The pool bar was a nice place to grab food and drinks and the bartenders were welcoming and we talked 'story'. Without getting too nostalgic, it was good to be back. Hopefully my next business trip will be equally enjoyable.

The bad first as this really bugged meAt checkout I paid my bill in full then upon my return home found three separate charges on, separate days on my credit card that I did not authorise $40.23 $26.77 $92.95. Emailed the hotel and nobody bothered to email back then rang the 0800 number – they said they would contact the team and see what was going onWithout any contact from the hotel 2 of the charges disappeared off my credit card – so I emailed again asking what the 3rd charge was for and low and behold the 3rd charge disappeared off my credit card! To date the hotel never bothered to contact me with an explanation!! I am glad they disappeared but why were they put on in the first place.Check in – we walked up to Ugenx and checked in – she never smiled of greeting us with a Ahola – nothing – obviously didn’t want to make her guests welcome.All I can say is why work at a job you don’t like! And management you certainly need to re-train Ugenx on how to greet her guests! I purposely got her name as I have never in all my years got such a bad greeting at check-inAsked for a refurbished room – told your room is on the 17th floor. When we got to the room – no refurbished room and the noise from the huge air conditioners next door was terrible. So when you check in make sure you are not on that side of the building facing the International Market!The room was dated but very very clean and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job each day – the beds super comfortable as was the pillows. Nice bathroom products and plenty of tea/coffee each day plus bottled water.With the air conditioning on, the room was still too hot for us at night so requested a fan and kettle.These were both bought to us straight away which was lovely and with the fan on at night the room was a good temperature. Air conditioning not noisy.Ate/drank a few times at The Splash Bar – food and service excellent!Great position on WaikikiThe pool boys/girls lovely and greeted you every morning, handed out towels and we tookBeach chairs from them to the beach each day – the beach chairs tommy Bahamas and very comfortable.Behind Princess K if you walk to the lights you will find food trucks each night – I think it was $20 for steak and salad – good and then there is The Food Pantry next door which has all you want.If you forget the poor check-in and the unwanted charges on my credit card it was a good stay - I have taken 2 stars off because of this.And I loved sitting on my Lanai each morning seeing Waikiki wake up!

Very disappointed this time. Didn’t get my interconnecting rooms or pool side that I paid for and booked. They Had two separate rooms in two different areas of the resort. Then they put us on the 11th floor in one of the towers we didn’t sleep for two nights. Very noisy.. you could hear the fans and motors on top of the roof as it was the last floor. Also the aircon was fixed right next to our bed. The air was hitting directly onto our faces when we slept. That is how low the aircon was. Been in Hawaii several times would not recommend this resort to anyone. Very disappointed.

Came to Waikiki for a family holiday and can’t fault this hotel.Clean and comfortable rooms, great location, good food and drinks at the splash bar and great pool to cool off in.Special mention to Kathy at check in who went above and beyond to make sure we had a comfortable room for our child and family in the room next door. But all staff we came across were friendly and helpful.We have been to Waikiki a number of times though our first staying at the SPK. We will definitely be staying again.

Stayed 5 nights over Memorial Day weekend. Room was clean beds comfortable bathroom clean. Nice location off Kalakaua Av. Had problem with room type at checking on but resolved after 2 nights. So that was fine. Pool area great and splash bar had excellent food. Very nice stay would consider coming back.

I am in Honolulu for a long term work assignment and have been staying here since September. This is a great hotel for the value- rooms with great views, decent gym, good breakfast spread. The location is absolutely fantastic: right in the middle of waikiki and steps away from the beach. And the customer service is phenomenal! (Christy, Uyen, Sabrina and everyone from the breakfast area and the splashbar!

We stayed for 5 nights and have previously stayed here before and that is why we came back. The hotel is clean and tidy and offers all of the amenities needed when staying. It was unfortunate the pool was closed for renovations whilst we stayed. We weren’t told until we arrived which was disappointing. The staff were friendly and we would stay again. Clean tidy and good value for money!

Had a wonderful stay here in a great location on the 30th floor (of 31), overlooking both the ocean and mountains. Club room came with access to nightly free snacks, beer and wine in a really comfortable setting and decent food. The room decor was a bit bizarre as there were NO drawers... no night stands or closet with drawers, just places to hang your clothes out open compartments,... weird but not awful. room was large with a very small flat screen TV so it felt like watching a game from the cheap seat in an arena, but again, not there to watch a lot of TV, Staff was wonderful, resort fee was ridiculous.... but it was still a nice staff.

4th stay of my tripDates of Stay : May 7st - May 11thWhen I was planning this trip I had a hard time deciding between the Hilton and the Sheraton because , normally , Hilton properties = problems but this Sheraton has a $35/night resort fee .I kept going round and round , unable to decide , but finally chose to break my trip into 2 stays in order to avoid putting all my eggs in the same basket .The Sheraton was not bad but not as good as the Hilton .Room was nice and clean but needed renovating , especially the bathroom (rust around bathtub faucet , dark spots in mirror)Unlike the Hilton , this hotel has 2 public computers in the lobbyDuring my stay , the pool was closed for renovation . Not a big deal because the ocean is a couple of minutes walk away and , being hard of hearing , the noise did not bother me too much .They moved me from the Princess pool view room I had booked to a full ocean view Tower room not sure if it was because I'm Marriott Gold or because of the renovations .As a Gold Marriott member , I got 1 voucher for a free breakfast (my stay was for 4 days) , good buffet with an omelet station but the restaurant is open air and having birds around the food all the time is not something I appreciate.Good , problem free wi-fi but frankly I can't tell the difference between their High-Speed (free to Gold) and the Basic wi-fi at every other hotel chain .Now for the resort fee .Once you remove all the stuff I personally don't need (kids' stuff , "cultural" activities,etc) and the stuff nobody needs (free phone calls and such) , I was left with the newspaper and the water.Which means I paid $140 for approximatively $7 worth of goods , nice profit margin .Because of that I'm going to remove 2 stars out of the 4 stars I would normally give them .

After a great stay in January, my husband and I decided to come back and try the Sheraton PK again. This time, we had even better service! We are SPG Gold and were treated like royalty. Prior to arriving at the hotel, the guest relations team reached out to my husband to ask if we needed or were celebrating anything. At check-in, we were upgraded from a partial ocean view room to a full ocean view room for our 5-night stay. The views of the mountains and beach were fantastic, and the patio has plenty of space to hang out and take it all in. Shortly upon settling into our room, housekeeping delivered a complimentary bottle of wine with a note from the guest relations manger for the occasion we were celebrating. This totally took us by surprise, and was an incredibly kind gesture. As SPG Gold, we received two free breakfast vouchers for our stay. There was a mix-up with the date on which they expired and after talking to the front desk, the manager on duty told the person at the desk to give us two more vouchers for the "hassle." The hotel definitely could have cured the immediate issue without doing more, and we would have been happy campers. The general management delivers service that is above and beyond!We also received impeccable service from other employees at the hotel. I'd like to recognize Kim, our breakfast waitress, and Eric, one of the bartenders, for being exceptionally kind and attentive. Housekeeping serviced our room promptly every day, and refilled water and toiletries as needed. One of the employees who works at the pool deck even recognized us from our January visit and made a point of welcoming us back. What stands out to me the most about the employees at the Sheraton PK is that they all seem to like and want to help each other, and as a result, they work together to make sure your experience is great.The location is great, the price is right, and the service is AMAZING. Thank you to all of the people at the Sheraton PK who made our stay extra special. We didn't deserve any of it, but we really appreciate it!

Although we had only a week at the hotel the staff were very polite and professional we loved the pool and the fact that it was so close to the beach. Cross the road and you are at the beach in Waikiki. They had facilites for those with wheelchairs and their porter and travel desk were great in helping in any way they could to make your Hawaii experience as good as they were able to do. Oh housekeeping was top notch you could not ask for better.

My wife and I recently spent 3nights here on our way back to Australia, after a 3670 mile road trip across America. We have stayed here before and will continue to return when we can. The staff are very helpful , the rooms are clean and comfortable and the position is perfect. We feel so relaxed and at home there we find it extremely hard to leave and return home to Australia. This is somewhere you don't feel rushed and the downstairs area is all open and the gardens are perfect. There are bigger and newer places in Honolulu, but we will stay again and again.

We stayed here for 2 nights, and the location is great for the price. Center of the Waikiki strip and close to the beach. The hotel was pretty crowded, but that’s Waikiki! The hotel is just fine- nice pool area, nice room. We didn’t eat in the restaurant because it cost a fortune for the breakfast buffet, but the coffee shop had good options and was reasonably priced. I would recommend for a short stay at Waikiki.

This hotel is in a good location & this was the reason we booked. We also liked the look of the pool!!! We booked a 10 day stay & were not informed at any time prior to our visit that the pool would be under construction for the fist 6 days of the stay. We also had to replace our keys a number of times as there was a problem with the door. The bathroom was clean beds not so comfortable & there was one window that we think may have never been cleaned as it was so black you coudnt see out.

When you check in, they should explain where you can get those "amenities" included in the resort fee! After all you paid for it! They didn't even explain and apologize for the pool construction saying we should have been informed! Well we weren't! We booked it months ago and it didn't say there will be any construction!! I asked if we could use other pools, she just rudely said no! didn't even suggest if we want they can arrange for it even with a fee!!! It says gopro rental, We didn't see any gopro! We didn't even want to ask anymore because of their rudeness!! For an expensive hotel, I don't know where our money went! I asked about the trolley early in the morning, we had to walk to another booth when she said it was already open when it was not! We should have just waited for their travel desk to open! Geez! they just want to send you away! Oh and when I approached the front desk all of them were chatting away and I was standing there for like 3minutes already, one girl even pointed out to the other that they have a costumer waiting but just ignored it until she finished her story!!! Terrible hotel! Terrible staff!!! For a hotel with a famous name, you didn't live up to your name!!!

First, it's all good. It's freaking Hawaii, with views that are endless, weather that is perfection and Aloha spirit for miles. I've stayed here 3-4 times over the last 6-7 Christmas vacations with friends and family, usually 4-5 rooms for the bunch of us. We are loyal. We are reasonable. Obviously a bit price sensitive as well.They've done some work on the Princess. In the lobby, mostly. It's back in the rooms, though, where it really is...not great. This year, we were on the 9th floor of the original tower, which features great views of and over the Moana. The view is awesome. The beds are STILL heavenly, something Westin is known for. So, that's the most important stuff. It's just for the first time I really noticed the furniture, carpet and walls are super duper tired. Enough to actually affect your mood. One of our rooms actually only had one undersized picture on the wall. There was a 4" tear in the wall paper that flopped in the breeze...We split our trip into two hotels because we had different groups coming and going, overlapping. We spent the first 4 nights at the Princess and then moved over to the Outrigger.Let's just say that we booked 9 nights at the Outrigger for Christmas '18. I almost wish it was otherwise. I really love the breakfast buffet at the Princess and we have great memories. But...

Hotel is close to shopping location such as Waikiki beach, T Galleria by DFS with a lot of brand name store. Many place for eating.Just about 5-10 minutes walk to Waikiki beach, if you go during Halloween there will be an lot of people dressing up can enjoy the night.

I regularly stay at Starwood Hotels and was happy to see a Sheraton hotel in the Waikiki Beach area. During my week stay in Hawaii, I actually stayed at the Sheraton Princess on two separate occasions. Both times I received optimal customer service. The guest service agents are very accommodating and give close attention to details. Kalei provided a great room with a semi ocean view and even sent a personalized note and gift to welcome my stay to Waikiki Beach. I was truly impressed with her professionalism! Kathy also provided world-class service with a nice room upgrade and hospitality options for me to consider since I had a late flight. Although this is an older hotel, the staff made my stay a memorable experience!

My first impression was of a run-down property in a prime location. Lines at check-in were long, room was poorly soundproofed, and one elevator was out if service my entire stay. But by far the worst thing about this hotel was the enormous cockroach I found in my suitcase.

I usually love Sheraton hotels.. this hotel decided to start renovating the pool on our second day with no notification! Our room which we paid to upgrade to was over the pool! We paid an extra $35 per day for the pleasure of listening to jack hammering and work being done on the pool not to mention the fact we couldn’t use it! At checkout they ‘generously “ took off 2 nights resort fee for our inconvenience!! Ugh!!! The resort fees, taxes etc are ridiculous! It’s NOT WORTH IT!! By by Sheraton Princess Kaiulani I’ll stay somewhere else next time!!

Thank You Carol for my lovely room. You took the time when other's don't. It's people like you at various Sheraton Properties that keep me Gold Status. I was SO comfy in that room. Than You Again. Keep SmilingGwen Peev

Very disappointing. We booked rooms here for a week to celebrate my elderly parents’ 63rd wedding anniversary. After we were here 2 days, they closed the pool for regularly scheduled maintenance. We were not advised the pool would not be open when we booked or when we checked in. We are now sitting here listening to the lovely sound of a jackhammer. Will not be back.

I just stayed 4 nights on the 24th floor of the Princess Kaiulani and I honestly have no complaints. The beds were comfortable and the views were breathtaking. The bathrooms were nice and updated. Not to mention it's steps from the beach...

My family and I (2a & 2c) stayed here in April and couldn't fault it. Our room was bright, clean and comfortable for the 4 of us. The staff where amazing and helpful and the location was just perfect. The outdoor/pool area was great and we would definitely stay there again.

Many people complain that this hotel is old and dated which is good and bad. The good is that it has an “old Hawaii” feel unlike many of the more modern hotels like the Trump hotel or the Ritz Carlton. The bad is that some of the rooms feel dated and the walls are paper thin. I could hear everything going on from the room next door. You can’t beat the location which is in the heart of Waikiki. The staff like most places is hit and miss. Some were very friendly and helpful and others were very aloof and did not smile. If you are price conscious this is a good choice. If money is no object, your options are wide. For the money, I would stay here again.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for 10 days during our wedding. We got upgraded to a king ocean view room which was surprisingly unexpected. The view was magnificent and they give you a wifi device so that you can still use your phone while on the go. The location was right near the dukes statue which was about a 2 min walk. If you ever wanted to stay near Waikiki beach I recommend staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani!

We only stayed one night here between our timeshare and flight home and thank goodness it was only one night! The location is great but this place is very dated and amenities are non-existent. Beware, there was also a resort fee of $35 that we were totally unaware of. We had a tower room that offered both city and ocean views and that’s the only reason this review gets a 3. Guess I had higher expectations for a Sheraton. Stay at the other Sheraton in Waikiki instead or another hotel all together!

We never dreamed we would be disappointed in a Sheraton but we were i this one. The room is extremely small, barely big enough to accommodate a full-size bed. The bathroom vanity is the smallest I have ever seen. We are glad we are moving motels tomorrow. We recommend you check out other hotels before booking this one.

The hotel is nice but quite dated. The elevators, carpet and hallways could definitely use a face lift. The wifi is horrible, but free. (Also Confirmed by other members of my group). The staff was helpful but stopped short of being friendly. HOWEVER...the hotel is Clean and centrally located on the strip within walking distance to many attractions. Shower Water pressure is good but goes from hot to warm/cool back to hot again. The AC in the room was ok but seemed to struggle keeping up with the climate. The beach is a 2 minute walk, the zoo and Diamond Head are about 10 minutes. Restaurants, bars and shops are everywhere, all within walking distance.

Very rude at checkout, we had a $30 Credit to use, we asked at check in what it could be used for and were told “Anything, just make sure it is charged to your room”. We used it for an Appetizer and drinks. At check out we were told, “I’m sorry that was not for alcohol”. The clerk Erin and manager Brian H were extremely rude. The house keeping standards were also not very good. There are many options in Waikiki with Amazingly nice people working there, I would recommend avoiding this hotel.

Welcome to Princess Kalahni was lovely, from the minuite I stepped in I felt welcome and cared for. Check in was fast both times, The foyer is large and spacious with friendly RELAXED staff adding you to their "family" Everyone seemed to love working at the "Princess" it made me relax and be free o ask questions, use all facilities and join in the conversations and wander around sit and relax anywhere and take in the atmosphere. I truly felt like I was in Honolulu. (If youve ever holidayed in a place where the marketing far exceeded tbe actual experience of the hotel/destination, you will understand my comment. Food great, rooms, lovely, fresh, clean..ahh the bedzzzzzzzThe breakfasts time cheery staff and great choices on buffet. Omlettes made to order by a lovley lady and man..great fun:) Pool, great! Diiner show excellent. The location..perfect. right in the middle of shopping area..opposite Waikiki beach a 20min along the promenade walk to the zooDaytime laze around the pool after sightseeing all day, dine in style or chillax at the bar bistro then shop till drop till 11pm. Wander back to a quiet evening at Princesses many lounge areas, listen to live entertainment in a delightful decore of this tropical paradise. Are the rooms quiet? Yes.( I dont know how it.)

We stayed here 6 nights here and loved it. It is a beautiful location and the view from our balcony was awesome! We were able to enjoy watching the ocean and saw several firework displays. We had the breakfast buffet on our last morning and it was delicious! The splash bar is a great place for snacks or a late dinner.

Best thing here was the service from Valerian Garrido at the Pleasant Holiday Tour desk. He went out of his way to help us & to offer advice.We only stayed one night in transit to the Islands Cruise but did book a pool view room. Well to get a view of the pool you had to go onto the tiny balcony and look sharply left. Stretching the truth a little. We had a nasty rattle in the air con duct & both had to use ear plugs to sleep.Overall the rooms are getting a bit tired & could use some refurb but OK for a short layover.

We spent a week at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani on a dream holiday to Hawaii. We had a pool view room in the Princess wing, the room was very comfortable with excellent quality beds and a pleasant decor. It was well furnished with useful amenities. All staff we encountered during our stay were very friendly, welcoming and professional. They helped us with all of our enquiries. We made full use of the services provided for the resort fee, unlimited international calls, mobile Wi-fi, daily water in room and on the beach, beach towels & chairs, 1 day Go-Pro rental, hotel activities (lei making, hula lessons, etc). The hotel is in a fantastic location for shops, restaurants, the beach, buses, local attractions etc. The room was efficiently cleaned daily. As we had a late flight, we were given use of a hospitality room to freshen up before departing for the airport. All in all, our stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani exceed our expectations and we can sincerely recommend it.

This is a great hotel to stay at if you want to be close to everything in Waikiki,it’s situated in one of the main streets Waikiki across the road from Cheesecake factory and Dukes next to international markets full of shops and restaurants and a couple of doors from Macy’s as well as many other outlets and restaurants.The staff are fantastic and make you feel welcome from the time you arrive. Great pool and relaxing atmosphere surrounding it where you can have breakfast, lunch or dinner. They also have free shows every night at pool area where you will be entertained with singing and hula dancing.They have free wifi as well as providing you with a pocket size wifi for you so you will always have access to wifi wherever you go during your stay. They also provide you with free international and local calls.Recommend to anyone who wants to be in a good hotel as well as location.

This was our second visit to this hotel for an 8 night stay.Overall was happy with the stay. Staff were mainly friendly. We were in an updated room which was very nicely decorated and booked a partial ocean view. We were on the North side of the tower so could see ocean and mountains. The downside is that you are also overlooking the international marketplace and the (I assume) air conditioners on top are on constantly and are very noisy, the first few nights we had trouble sleeping. The last time we stayed we were overlooking the pool which I think is a better option.I also don’t think the resort fee is good value. Image attached. Last time we stayed we at least got a couple of free drinks at the bar as well as the wifi and phone calls. The Go Pro rental we thought would be great for our helicopter tour, but then we were told we had to purchase the SSD card ourselves (for $US30) and for something we don’t have use for it was a waste of money - Why offer this as an inclusion in the resort fee and then charge for the card which you need to use it? They could easily include this and wipe for the next user.Everything else on the list wasn’t worth anything to us.We had the buffet breakfast included which was convenient and generally pretty good. I like that they employ older workers there.We used the pool a couple of times, generally could always get a sunlounge and while the pool isn’t huge, it’s perfectly fine and flows nicely from the bar and breakfast area.The only thing I really wasn’t happy with was one of the bellhops ‘suggesting’ to a taxi driver that he point out to us a hotel on the way to diamond head that he said Mark Twain had stayed in. We’ve been there before and we know the way to diamond head so lucky for the taxi driver he did not take us the long way around. It did not sit well with me and we did not appreciate this tactic. Hopefully a one off...

This was our fifth trip to Hawaii and last year we stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani so this year we decided to go back and stay here.Last year we arrived at the hotel at 7.00 am and to wait till 2.00 am to check in but this year we arrived about the same and we were checked in straight away by a very helpful lady called, Celeste. We got into our room to find it was larger than last year with fantastic views. The room was spotless, we couldn't fault it, big king size bed. This Hotel is fantastic. Location is perfect right in the middle of Kalakua Ave central to great shopping and restaurants. Ala carte breakfast and dinner is great value for money.Staff were so helpful and always gave you a smile and greeting when passing.We had an issue with the in room safe, when I reported to reception desk, they sent a member of the staff and it was done straight away. while sitting around the pool, staff delivered cold drinks and snacks to us. If your looking for a great hotel to stay at, I would certainly recommend the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. We will defiantly be staying hear again next Year.

Wow what can I say.... we was really worried about this hotel before we arrived. The reviews didn’t seem great and we had never stayed here before. Well put it this way, we will be back! This hotel is amazing... we loved everything about it. Nothing was to big or small for the staff, who were super friendly! I want to say a big shout out to the wonderful Michelle who was such a beautiful lady. Rooms ticked all our boxes, so did the pool and the food was so yummy! People say the rooms are dated.... it’s Hawaii! What rooms aren’t????We will be back! So thank you everyone at SPK!!!!

This hotel hasn't changed much since I first stayed there in 1980. It was named after the heir to the Hawaiian throne Princess Victoria. If you stay there make sure you have an ocean view with Diamond Head in the background.Their web page states that parking is available for a fee. I was not charged however. So check before you book. It's located directly across from Waikiki Beach in Honolulu. There are nice restaurants within walking distance, also many fast food restaurants. PS: I have stayed there 4 times first with my wife and then with my children and most recently with my grandchildren. Enjoy your stay.
user_name:
Les B
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: The hotel is set back a little from the beach so I am unsure if the pictures on this listing have actually been taken from the hotel or its sister hotel, I certainly didn't have a view like any of these. We had opted for a city view as it was cheaper but when we checked in our "view" was of a brick wall! Seriously six feet or so outside our window (room 327) was another building! NOT ACCEPTABLE. I requested a room change and they were gracious enough to allow this This was by the elevators but a far superior view. The rooms in the photos are NOT the only rooms in the hotel, these rooms are pool view/sea view and the ones on the other side of the hotel have NO BALCONY and are considerably smaller - bear this in mind when you book. There is sufficient space if all you intend to do in the room is sleep. Upon arrival we had a hamper of fruit, juice and dry food snacks, which was most welcome (we were told this was because we were long stay guests - 7 nights). The pool is smaller than I had expected but as we went in March there were always loungers and it was big enough for our needs but I imagine in the better weather it would get crowded. Free towels are available with your room key and I saw many guests take these over to the beach (less than two minutes away). The splash bar has happy hour between 11am and 6pm and the drinks choice is good, many rum based cocktails if you are into that sort of flavour. The food is a bit overpriced and there are better options outside of the hotel, that being said the seaweed popcorn was nice (special mention to Letitia!!). The staff were lovely, all of them and so friendly and helpful. The show is held three nights a week and is well worth seeing - pick up a voucher book from the lobby and you can get 50% of a second cocktail and show ticket so $90 for a cocktail and the show for two people or the premium dinner inclusive package for $120 each or there about. Its definitely worth seeing it was one of my favourite parts of my vacation. The AT&T free myfi option was also very welcome and saved me lots of money in data and roaming fees. It is the little touches like this that made the hotel a great one. . I don't know if its a US thing but the hotel don't provide shower gel like a UK hotel would. They do provide shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap so I'm glad I packed my own! They provide flannel, hand towel and bath towel, although the latter is quite small. The room did come with a fridge so pick up a few drinks and they'll stay nice and chilled in your room while you are out. They gave us two bottles of water every day (included in the resort fee). our room had a detachable clothes line over the bath for drying swimwear etc and a full laundrette in the basement $5 for wash and $5 for a dry. Its worth doing if you would rather pack less clothes - it was a popular feature of the hotel. It is a hotel I would gladly go back to if I can get back to Honolulu!

We have been coming back to this property for years and it never disappoints.Staff are very professional and friendly and I still think it's the best value for money in Waikiki. Just cross the road and you are at the beach.We love the beach service where they bring you apples and waters at different times of the day.Rooms have recently been refurbished.

I stayed in this hotel for four nights. The good things first:- The bed was fantastic and gave me really good sleeps. - My room was always clean and well prepared by the maid. - Most staff I interacted with were friendly and nice. The tour desk staff is very knowledgeable and provided me with good advice. - The location is very good. Everything in Waikiki is within easy walking distance. Now the downs:- The interior of the room is old and cheap with furniture looking like 1980s plastic. The cups for coffee and water were paper and plastic, which reminded me rather of a youth hostel. To sum up, the room didn’t feel like Sheraton. It clearly needs an upgrade. - Windows aren’t sound-proof. One could well hear the noise from the street and from the pool area (live music in the evenings).- I had to complain twice before the drain in the bathtub was de-clogged. Before, I had to cut my shower in fear that I might flood the whole room. - The breakfast buffet is just ok. Not really many choices. But at least the hotel caters for the Japanese guests. - I’m particularly annoyed about the “resort charge” of roughly $35 per day (see picture for details). In my mind, it’s a barefaced rip off with a number of “benefits” that nobody needs: free breakfast for a child if you don’t travel with one? Let alone if breakfast is included in the rate? A promotion booklet by local retailers and restaurants? I would expect that the things one really needs, like free WiFi, was part of the service without the need of being mentioned, as it is international (=non U.S. perhaps) standard. Because of the “resort charge”, I follow the contributor who wrote about this hotel on 26 March 2018 and deduct one point from my rating.Given the price I paid per night, I conclude that value-for-money is not very good. The hotel doesn’t fulfil what one would expect under the Sheraton brand. Thus and despite the good things mentioned, I can not recommend this hotel.

I stayed at the Princess Kaiulani in 1974 on my first trip to Hawaii. This year, I returned for my 70th birthday and my 40th visit to the islands. I chose the Princess Kaiulani and was not disappointed. From the moment I arrived until departure, the visit was A+. Excellent accommodations and first class staff and treatment. What a beautiful vacation. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a memorable Hawaii vacation.

We booked a package through Hawaiian Air. Fantastic value for money, location in the heart of Waikiki, with the beach across the road. Whilst the room is a little dated, the views from the high rise rooms were fabulous. As part of the resort fee you get wifi and can take beach towels and chairs over to the beach which is great. Will be back!

My expectations for this property were low based on reviews, but wow was it a pleasant surprise. We were upgraded to a tower ocean view room on the 21st floor and the view is spectacular. Rooms are small, bathrooms are older, but very clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet is very good, and there are plenty of local spots a couple of blocks behind the hotel for great quality authentic food at very reasonable prices. The beach is across the street, and the beach services make this the first place I’ve ever stayed where I felt the “resort fee” was 100% worth it. Plenty of towels, free comfy beach chairs, and they even have staff members who wander the beach periodically offering bottles of water and fresh fruit. A staff member even offered my kids a free popsicle when we returned our beach towels. This property is an excellent value, in a spectacular location, staffed by folks who seem happy to make you feel welcome and valued. We will definitely be back.

I stayed a week at this hotel in the month of March. The rooms are great, breakfast is phenomenal towards American, Japanese, and Korean items, and the nightly live bands are a nice cap to end the night. Downside is, if you are tired you have to wait till the bands are done playing in order to have peace. The rooms hide none of the noise outside. But the location of the hotel is centrally located in the Waikiki area so you have access to traditional shopping, high end brands, and the beach is across the street.

Shout out to Robert, the front desk manager. He went above and beyond to assist us when an administration error occurred. We will definitely be returning because of the great service he provided. Thanks Robert.

OK, older hotel but expected that. Platinum member, expected a better room, but happy with the maid service which kept my room really clean. Nice staff, generally reasonable prices, good facilities, but I automatically deduct one star from any property that charges a "resort fee." It is a lie, it is just a way to show a lower room rate for the booking sites. I have plenty of friends in hotel management that readily admit this.
