An eight day break at the Sheraton was a delight, although we arrived way too early to check in the bell staff were on the ball and stowed our bags.The front desk did a pre check-in to save us time and we spent a few hours exploring the hotel and surrounds.Then, even earlier than expected, the front desk got us up to our room as early as possible.The staff here are all very professional and friendly.The rooms are clean and spacious and we'll appointed.A special vote of thanks to both Julian and Cathy on the front desk for their thoughtful consideration and to our chamber maid for an excellent job.

This hotel is not on the beach but if you get a floor above about 10 you will see the sea and a glimpse of the beach. The staff I have found are very friendly and competent. The hotel overall is a little tired. However I like this area of Waikiki, perhaps because I know it. I have stayed here before and would do so again unless I wanted to spend more on a beachfront hotel.

Bargain priced Sheraton across the street from the Beach.Easy access Hotel if you have a car to get around the Island.VERY GOOD Buffetts.... you have access to the other Beachfront Sheratons by staying here.Very nice History of hotel of Princess Kaiulani.The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki.... everything is in walking distanceRate as a 3.5 star hotel. Do not get the lower side view rooms if traffic noise is a concern to you.

Bartender Eric and server Kayla were very friendly and provided great service. International Market Place right next door with many shops and restaurants. Nice pool, Waikiki Beach just across the street. Taxis almost always available at entrance to the hotel. No valet parking. We have stayed here many times.

Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is located in the heart of Waikiki, about a block away from the beaches. There are shops, restaurants, hotels close by in a busy Waikiki strip. The hotel is older but well maintained. The bed was comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Vin checked me in and out; she was efficient and pleasant.

Other than the location, the Hotel is poorly run with marginally acceptable amenities. The property is mostly for package tours from Asia so be prepared to be inundated with hundreds of people crowding the lobby morning, noon, and night. I could not check in early so I had to roam around Waikiki for 4 hours, the desk clerks could care less even though I checked back 3 times, The hot water came on in room only when it wanted, the tub was always full with about 2 inches of water, the air conditioner was either on or off but did not turn off when room was cooled. The TV station numbers did not match with the station guide on the TV guide in the room. The pool area is adjacent to the lobby, restaurants, and walkway to the main street so there is no privacy by pool. The staff was indifferent and didn't really know their way around the area.

Great location. Across the street from the beach. Right in the middle of everything. Farmers market across the street had all kinds of local cuisine, fresh fruit and baked goods. Not open every day though. Hotel will provide towels and beach chairs with cooler and drink holder in the chair. All types of restaurants and good shopping. Can be very busy on the streets in that entire area. It's like NYC on a very nice beach.

I am so happy we only stayed here for one night coming back from Maui... The look of the lobby/pool is misleading. I do not know how anyone would choose to spend 300 dollars a night here. We were just staying here one night coming from Maui; arrived at 7pm so we just needed a place to sleep until we caught our flight home the next night at 8pm. Hawaii to Canada is a 12 hour flight mind you so we were hoping to get a good nights sleep. For a Sheraton and an SPG/Marriot member the room we were given was as basic as you could get. I have never stayed at a Sheraton this horrible in my life. Should have been a Motel 6 more likely. For our last night in Hawaii we decided to go out on the town since we had the later flight the next evening. Came back to the hotel at 2am and was woken up at 7:30 in the morning to a CHAINSAW... at first I thought I was dreaming but then at 8am BANGING right above us with a hammer..... We were in Hawaii for a total of 18 nights and on the most important night to get sleep they placed us in a room with construction above us.... My husband called down IMMEDIATELY and the hammering stopped. I hope I can upload a video because this was absolutely WRONG! We talked to the manager and we could not fall back asleep so they gave us a later check out which was very nice of him. There really was not anything else he could have done to make us happy going on 4 hours of sleep. If you want a cheap vacation hotel this is your place but if you are looking for somewhere decent stay elsewhere (Hilton Hawaiian Village was excellent!). The walls were chipping and the Bathroom barely fit two people in it. Horrible.. Good thing Marriott just bought out Sheratons! Only good thing was the staff and the location.

Stayed at this place for eight nights. A little dated but the room was comfortable and well catered. We had an adjoining room with family with double doors between. Staff were friendly and when asked for help were very good. One night part of the curtain system fell off the roof and maintenance come up to the room straight away and fixed it. The resort charge was a nonsense at $27 a night. The lady who took our orders around the pool (Lei) was very chirpy and kept our drinks topped up and worked hard for her tip. The pool was too small for the amount of guests. Overall a good stay but not sure I would go back.

We've stayed here probably 4 times since 2006. Great location, just across street from Moana Surfrider and about a block to the Pink Palace, both of which are right on the beach and cost LOTS more. All staff we interacted with were very friendly, informative, and helpful, especially Madalyn, our housekeeper. Buffet breakfast also very good, with lots of Japanese treats, so it was lots of fun to try new foods. The parking garage shows its age even more than the guest rooms, but the lobby has been freshened up and is quite attractive. Our 9th floor room overlooked the pool and terraces and directly across at the Surfrider, a beautiful historic building. We had a bit of a beach view toward Diamond Head. Unless you just have to have a full beach view, the Princess K is a super place to stay in Waikiki. We'll be back.

We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. The location is very convenient. Close to the beach and shopping. Room was very comfortable with a small balcony. Ours overlooked the city but there are many that face the sea.There are many ABC stores within walking distance and the main street is right there. The trolley buses etc go right by. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Absolutely beautiful. Grounds were gorgeous with lavished bouquets of flowers every were. Like walking in paradise. Very well maintain inside and out. Employees of this establishment are very courteous and friendly. Location is prefect and other activities are close by.

We spent 5 nights, 6 days here while in Oahu. It was part of an Aloha Hawaiian package. We found it to be very convenient, accessible and comfortable. Our room did not have a lot of bells and whistles. It did however have a great ocean and city view from the 24th floor. We ate at the Poland Terrace once for dinner and thought it was pretty good! Very comfy beds that make it hard to get out of!!There is a great pool area, semi-close beach access. Close to the trolley, stores, restaurants. No complaints, just not 5 stars because the room didn't wow me. And as is common in Honolulu there is an additional daily resort fee whether you use those services or not.

Just stayed here recently for 2 weeks. This is my fifth holiday on Oahu and I thought I would try somewhere different to stay ie.. here at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, because the price was right coupled with Hawaiian airlines flights. After checking in we weren’t too happy with our room of 2 double beds in the tower (my booking did state “or king bed”). We went back down and we were assured we would be given another room next day. Sure enough for extra money ($AU474) we were moved a few floors up with a king bed. I also want to mention "Kathy" on the reception desk was so helpful and friendly. As can be seen with the photo’s we weren’t top floor but our views overlooking the pool and entertainment stage as well as ocean views were excellent, the room was clean and tidy. I didn’t notice too much traffic noise from the 10th floor and it was nice to hear the live music from down below each afternoon. We didn’t hear any construction noise from next door either, but, we did hear our adjoining room neighbours from time to time through the connecting door, but not enough to worry about. Some reviews have mentioned the dated carpet and wallpaper in hallways, I actually like it like that, gives an original Hawaiian feel to the place. We enjoyed the fruit and water provided at the beach for residents of PK and the beach chairs provided are great. In my previous reviews I've mentioned how much I loved staying at Outrigger, which I did, but I now prefer the more peaceful and relaxing resort type feel of PK,... We’ll definitely stay here next year....Another thing I was rapt in, Alamo car rental is directly across the road, made it sooo easy for pick-up and drop-off.. takes about 30 seconds to wander over lol... Just as a footnote .. we tried to rebook for about this time prior to end of year, but was all booked out .. I know why .... the word is out

We stayed at this hotel for a week and it was great. The location is very central and it's also very close to public transport. We had 2 rooms: one ocean view in the 10th floor of the tall wing, and another in the 21st floor. We joined a tour of the islands in the last 3 days and we had to change rooms. It went smoothly and we got a better room (we had booked ocean view on the tour). In the non-renovated 10th floor the room wasn't perfect. It needed paint and the curtains looked sad. but it didn't matter. The staff is super nice and they go out of their way to help. Everything works, one of the washing machines ate my $4.00 and I called the reception and the service manager appeared at the laundry with the money 5 minutes after I called. I would highly recommend this hotel, it's on Kalakaua Ave not on the beach (but very close to it) so not in the top range/price bracket, but it's very very well organised, friendly and clean. Just a small warning: it was pretty noisy even in the 21st floor, but that is Waikiki traffic, very hard to avoid on the main streets.

This hotel needs some major work done on its rooms. They are old, rundown, and dingy. But who comes to Hawaii to stay in their rooms??? If you are looking to save a bit of money by not staying on the beach then stay here. It's just across the street from the beach in the middle of Waikiki. This hotel is close to great shopping and across the street from Dukes beach bar.

The hotel is older and looking a bit tired. Room was clean and beds comfortable, bedding seemed new and good quality. I liked that the balcony looked over the pool (we were on the 4th floor in the lower block). There was plenty of space around the pool so you could really relax without feeling cramped. The entertainment every evening down by the pool was a real bonus, lovely singing and hula dancing. The gym is spacious and well equipped. In a great location, close to the main road but far enough away so there was no traffic noise.

My family ( 2 adults and 1 teenage daughter ) including my parents stayed here from the 4th to the 12th of October and really enjoyed ourselves. We found the hotel staff very friendly and very helpful. We were on the 22nd floor with ocean views, which were stunning. Our room had 2 large double beds which were ok except I found it hard to climb into as they were very high, I'm short lol. Bathroom facilities were good except we didn't have the clothes line in ours like my parents did next door. They have a coin laundry on the lower level which we used and was air conditioned as well. The only downside to the hotel was no air conditioning in the elevators and when there were lots of people getting in and out, it was very hot. The pool downstairs was a little disappointing and smaller then it looks in all the photos we seen. However our awesome poolside waitress Lei made up for that with her upbeat funny hospitality. 4pm to 6pm is happy hour, make sure you try a Minage! It's delicious. The food poolside was reasonably priced with 2 different menus. The live music pool side every night was awesome and these guys were super talented. This hotel is central to everything! Waikiki beach is just across the road. You can hire for free beach chairs down stairs when you pick up your towels. Definitely an awesome place.

Good booking in when we where informed there will be a 150 dollar resort fee I asked what for and was told car parking Internet water in rooms,I said I haven't got a car and won't be using the net so the clerk who was helpful spoke to the manager and it was cancelled, we where in the old tower and it is old and tired but clean cleaners worked hard,the outside pool was nice but could do with more seats and parasols, the concearge was good as was the staff I came into contact with,the hotel is on wikiki and loads of shops resturant close.

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I was impressed at the atmosphere, room, and other amenities. I also would like to express my appreciation for Lei (service staff poolside) who went above and beyond to make our experience extraordinary. She is amazing!

Have been here since October 8 and each afternoon have spent time in the splash Bar. The music is fantastic but what really makes this little pool side bar special is the waitress, Lei. She is friendly, helpful and really helps you have a good time. If you have a chance to visit be sure to ask for Lei.

Some of the reviews of this hotel slightly worried me but on the whole I was pleasantly surprised. The public areas are bright, clean and modern and we had upgraded to a high ocean view and were certainly not disappointed the outlook was fantastic. The room was large, and immaculately clean (great housekeeping!!) although some of the furnishings did need updating and the drawers tended to stick shut which could be annoying!! Good hospitality tray but only fruit teas so if you're a tea drinker take your own!! The bathroom was a bit of a let down, again very old fittings and a bit cramped it definitely needed a make over!!! The hotels greatest asset is its staff who generally speaking were terrific, attendants in the dining room were fabulous, ditto the poolside servers (especially Heidi) and the housekeeping staff and bell hops - totally excellent!!! Reception I didn't find that helpful I was fobbed off with a few questions (silly things like where can I buy one stamp?). The dining arrangements may not be to everyone's taste, breakfast lunch and dinner is buffet service, which is very very geared to the Japanese, Chinese and Korean visitors although there was bacon and an egg station at breakfast. Buffet never changed once though, EXACTLY the same each dinner service (and it's 42$ per head) "a la carte" was available we were told at Splash, the other restaurant. I've no idea what they think a la carte is but in my opinion it's not sandwiches, burgers etc so if you want a really good choice eat out, and the online menu is NOT what's on offer there!!!

Stayed her for two nights post cruise.The only negatives was the outside noise due in large part To the single pane glass in the doors.Also Wifi was of no real value as it kept dropping off and was never resolved despite being reported.

Our rooms have just been updated, with great views of the ocean, located across the street from Waikiki beach. The pool area was the center of the hotel - relaxing by the pool during the day, evening entertainment every night (always someone with a guitar singing, some hula dancing too), and the bar just flowed into the pool & lobby area. The staff was always helpful, we always felt safe, the décor definitely relaxing - a charming place to stay.

despite a late arrival thanks to Delta delays again we received the usual friendly welcome. Our booked room was immediately available and despite it's hotel star rating it is certainly great value for money, offers all the facilities, well located in Waikiki and the staff throughout the hotel are great. The restaurant is adequate, the pool comfortable and access available to the beach.We've stayed in all the ocean fronted hotels but will continue to return here every year unless the standards drop, no sign of that on this visit, thanks Princess Kaiulani

We came to the Sheraton P.K. (as it is known by all the local taxi cab drivers) on a family trip awaiting a cruise back to Australia. I was very impressed by the professionalism and courtesy shown by the staff members who assisted us in making the most of our 36 hours in Hawaii, particularly the concierge.The location is awesome for checking out the local sights - It is a manageable walk to the beach, and around US$5-$10 will get you to and from a lot of the shopping/restaurants/nightclubbery, although the Ala Moana shopping centre is a bit further out and Pearl Harbour/Pearl City is another story entirely.We were given a fair warning from the concierge that a taxi to the Pearl City shopping mall would cost around US$80 or take somewhere between an hour and a half to two hours to get there on a bus. Seeing that bus stops are conveniently located a short walk from the hotel, we opted to take the US$2.50 bus up to Pearl City, discovering that in rush hour, it certainly can take two hours by bus.The hotel features wi-fi, the price of which I believe is part of the occupancy charge for the rooms, but would seek further clarification. Further, there is a hot breakfast buffet featuring Western and Japanese options, distinctly featuring a staffed omelette bar to cater for Westerners and as well as nattou to cater for Japanese guests, or Westerners who have no idea what they are getting themselves into. I would make a snarky remark on the lack of Vegemite, to cater to Australians such as myself, but the hot buffet options were numerous and delicious and I found myself loading up with a bowl of miso soup (and some nattou) and even jerry-rigging a bagel with salmon and cream cheese using the available options. Top-notch.One last thing. The pool is a very nice one, cocktails are easy to come by and the staff are even happy to whip up something that is not explicitly mentioned on the menu (such as a long island iced tea) at reasonable cocktail-y prices.Tl;dr: Excellent base location for exploring the Waikiki area, little bit of a hassle to go further afield but overall nice rooms, great staff and an awesome island vibe! For extra credit, try saying "Princess Kaiulani" between your fourth and fifth cocktail.

I loved the location. Staff very friendly and will go out of their way to satisfy your needs. Although they renovated the lobby of the hotel, for some reason I didn't find it to my liking. Perhaps because I am an older person and the seats very low and difficult to get in and out of. There is no place there to eat unless a buffet and who want's that seven days a week. Thank goodness for kings court which did the trick.

Pro's: 1/ Good free wiki, 2/ friendly staff whether front desk, maid service, or by the pool, 3/ right in the middle of Wakikki, with great transport access directly outside.Con's: 1/ the walls must be really 'thin', cause a couple of night we heard entire conversations of the 2 guys in the next room, so bad I was ready to complain & ask for a different room, 2/ the bath towels are very small. I'm not a big guy, but barely wrapped around me, 3/ resort fee, what a load of crap, this sort of thing should be banned, or included in the room fee, not added!!

For the price princess kaiulani is perfect. Across the street from the moana surfrider which is right on the beach so you get the great location for a great price. Pool is on main level which is always preferable compared to a rooftop pool. Hotel was fully booked but whenever we arrived at the pool there was always chairs for us and never had to save a spot in the morning. Staff were extremely friendly and always helpful. Had a bit of a misunderstanding about about our safe because the battery wasn't working but it was sorted out. Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is a block from the beach, a two minute walk to Waikiki beach, and is in easy walk to everything, shopping, the zoo and the army museum as well as eating places. There is a restaurant, bar, heaps of areas to sit and chill, read or chat to friends in the massive lobby area. The pool is a good size but the deep area is bigger than the shallow area, however the areas were separated with a floating rope. I would be watching small children if I were swimming there as they could easily get out of their depth. Booking I was easy, staff were friendly, the room was clean and well maintained, and we had a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool,and the Main Street. My only negative comment would be that the concierge was not always at the desk. We just felt that when the concierge needed a break (as in lunch etc) there should have been another staff member take that position.p for the duration. We had to come back a few times to see if the concierge was back which was a bit frustrating especially when we needed to organise our departing airport transfers.

The Princess is still as good as ever even though it was supposed to be demolished and rebuilt a couple of years ago. I think they're putting it off because of their high occupancy rate. You don't shut down a profitable business.Everything is still clean and tidy and their sweet sleeper beds are to die for.Staff are still attentive and pleasant.I wasn't impressed that they have removed all but two of their computers from the lobby and half the time they don't work. Their WiFi however does work most of the time.

With a very quick trip in Hawaii before boarding a cruise ship back to Australia we stayed at PK and was not disappointed. When arriving at 7:30am (1 room with booked the night prior to garentee its availability) our rooms were ready and both rooms had been upgraded to beach views. We had wonderful service from Kathy at reception and also from the concierge (I wish I would have got her name). We used the hotel restaurant for breakfast and was satisfied. The omelette station was a great addition but found it strange that they had a large section of the hot buffet dedicated to asian customers.As there was also a large section of the hotel that were Australian why didn't they also cater to us?? Overall it was a nice stay and would come back again.

Step back into old Hawaii and stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. A charming older hotel with an ambiance that newer hotels just can’t replicate. It’s open air lobby design takes advantage of the breezy trade winds. The lobby and pool were never overcrowded and the beach is just across the street. We booked directly with Starwood Hotels so got a great deal on a room. From the moment we checked in we were treated with a level far exceeding our expectations. Christina was not only extremely efficient and friendly but went out of her way to be helpful. Great attitude and customer service. She even remembered my name and room number the following day. Christina helped us enroll in the Starwood Preferred Guest program, gave us a box of chocolates on the spot then had our cards delivered to our room enabling us to activate and use them right away. Show the card at the dining room for 15% off, charge the dining room charges (not including liquor) to your room and get 25% off at checkout. The room was decent size, very clean and quiet, and had a mini fridge. Microwave available upon request. Our ocean view room had a large private balcony with a spectacular ocean view. Note to be careful during the day as the cement can get quite hot in the sun. The hotel is built on the former site of Ainahau, the home of Princess Kaiulani, who loved peacocks, hence the peacock theme throughout the hotel. Loved the Princess Kaiulani wallpaper in the lobby. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, a great deal when using the SPG card. Coffee, juices, toast, pastries, oatmeal, Japanese breakfast (miso soup, natto, tofu, pickled vegetables), breakfast meats, fruits, salad bar and omelets to order. Walking distance to many nearby restaurants, jazz entertainment across the street, and an ABC discount store for snacks located a few doors down. We didn’t want to leave and ended up spending a great day poolside. We enjoyed our stay here very much! Mahalo nui loa!

My wife was recovering from open heart surgery and we were hoping for a stress free holiday in Hawaii. We weren't happy with our initial hotel and had stayed at the SPK a few times before so we decided to see if we could switch hotels. Luckily we met Celeste Pagan at the SPG check-in desk and she went way above and beyond to find us a lovely room with a great ocean view at a reasonable price. Her friendly smile and comforting manner made us feel part of the SPK family and gave us a totally relaxing experience that we will always remember. Celeste was always there to answer any questions - she spoilt us during a difficult health recovery period - our guardian angel !

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, but who really made my stay special was Shawna Deguchi! She treated me like family making sure the room I was given made be happy. The view was excellent and the room always clean!She is an asset to your company, because she has a genuine concern about the happiness of the customers.I highly recommend this hotel and the entire staff!Thank you

We are staying here in October with friends for our 40th anniversary and our friends birthday and the service we have had already answering our requests is amazing! The replies have been so quick and staff, especially Terry have been really helpful. Looking forward to our stay if this is any indication of what we can expect.

We were in a bind to find a hotel for one night and we sooo lucked out that the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani had a room open. The reservation associate was very pleasant and accommodating. When we arrived we were greeted with happy, friendly, and helpful staff. Uyen, the hotel associate that check us in was so helpful, accommodating and friendly. She went over and above the call of duty to make us feel welcome and make sure we had everything we needed. She gave us all the information on what the hotel had to offer so we didn't miss out on anything. It was in a great location, relaxing and it exceeded our expectations. Uyen is a great asset to this hotel. Thank you for all your help!

This Sheraton must be THE stop for EVERYONE one block from Waikiki and everything that it offers. It was really too busy for us. Masses of people coming in and out all day and night. Nice rooms, our pool view room had a quarter (the coin) sized view of the ocean! Comfy beds and nice room accoutrements. The highlights were the Big Kahuna guys at the pool and the bell boys/porters/very capable 'assisters'. They were all so nice and friendly. Fresh fruit and popsicles offered every afternoon poolside and at a location for SPK guests on the beach. Beach towels and sand chairs to take to the beach for free use, too. Big downer: the fire alarm being set off at 2:15am due to (reportedly) a guest hanging laundry on a room fire sprinkler. Well, at least we know the fire alarm system works.

Arrived 9/1 thru 9/8Checked in and had the best experience in a hotel. Celeste at the front desk checked us. There couldn't be a nicer person. We felt so welcomed. During the weekend we had a problem with a loud next door. Ms. Yin was on weekend shift at front desk. We told her of our problem, she was so apologetic and took care of the problem right away. The two ladies Celeste and Yin are a credit to Sheraton. Sheraton is very fortunate to have these two ladies representing the hotel.............

What a nice place to be. In the center of everything. Waikiki beach is across the street. Once the crowds thin it's a great location. Hotel has great food quiet and lots room. This is where I'm going to stay when I come back.

The hotel location is very nice, close to DFS and shopping mall. But the room condition was not pretty good, hopefully can improve the room condition soon.Btw, thanks to staff Uyen, her grateful customer service during my stay.

This is my third trip to Honolulu and my first time staying at this hotel. Our room balcony faced the pool. In the evenings, we had wonderful Hawaiian music to listen to when the band played. The hotel also offered lots of fun activities like lei making but I spent most of my time at the beach and shopping at the night market. The Hotel is a block away from the beach and is closer to the fancy shopping area. Hotel offered complimentary beach towels and beach chairs. We were also celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and the hotel provided a bottle of champagne! Lovely stay and I will be back again.

I am giving the Sheraton Princess Ka'iulani a 5/5 stars because the customer service I experienced was AMAZING!!! Erin at the front desk was VERY accommodating and she took the time to find us the best room she possibly could. Plus, she granted our request for 2 PM late checkout, which was awesome because my flight was later on in the day. She also called us right after we got to the room to see how we were doing, which I appreciated very much because it shows that she REMEMBERED us and that she CARED. Best customer service I have experienced at ANY hotel. Also, the location is PRIME! You're literally right across from Waikiki Beach, close to fast food chains and convenience stores, and just steps away from the best shopping and dining in Waikiki, including the new and improved International Marketplace which was right next door! The room was well furnished, clean and neat. The bed was VERY comfortable. The bathroom was well cleaned and the shower had the PERFECT water pressure and heat for a nice relaxing shower after a day of running around Waikiki. I also appreciated the AMAZING ocean view we had from our lanai (balcony). It's the perfect hotel for a short term or long term stay in the middle of everything Waikiki has to offer. Plus, the room rates are better than most hotels in the area, which is great for a Sheraton location. I would definitely stay there again and I HIGHLY recommend it.

Handy to everything , room cleaned ,clean sheets when requested , fresh towels and bottles of water daily. The staff we dealt with were polite and willing to help. Some parts maybe a little tired in the décor, and the rooms basic , would have loved a jug instead of the coffee machine ! Double glazing would have been a bonus as we are used to it , but when you are tired after a busy day sleep takes over, overall theses things where not enough to spoil our trip. Tommy who booked trips for us very helpful. They have people selling their hand crafted jewelry near the pool ,some nice pieces

A very old hotel (surprised Sheraton has its name on it) with run down rooms and facilities. The rooms were sparse with old towels, sheets and fittings. Bathroom was tiny with old handheld shower and weak water flow. Windows and doors were not double-paned so there was lots of street noise. Room key was old fashioned that kept getting wiped out if you let it sit next to your cell phone! Housekeeping service did not even vacuum the room once for the week we were there. Overall, avoid this hotel if you can.

After checking in to the Hotel, the first impression is of a very economical hotel. The feeling remains consistent after staying. The staff is not helpful and if one ask for even a tea bag, the answer is no.The cleaning is average and food cost is exorbitant.Quite dissapointing stay.

The room was okay, sheets were not washed when expected, frustrating when you have sand everywhere. Upon checking out i asked if i could use wifi to work while i waited for my flight and they pushed for me to pay for another night and stay in my room for a few hours rather than give me a wifi password in the lobby. One clerk was very pleasant, but one talked to me like an jerk i had to deal with him most often. Also, pigeons were eating my breakfast at the 25 dollar breakfast buffet and the staff didn't do anything about it. I would be okay with this kind of service if it was less than 200 dollars a night. But the price is crazy.

I stayed at this property and the Sheraton Waikiki and found the rooms at both to be comparable. This property is located across the street from the beach with a very small pool but you do have access to a private beach area with waiter service. I found the people who work here to be extremely friendly and helpful, check in was seamless even though I arrived early and the concierge was wonderful in helping me book a rental car at an amazing price ($38). It seemed most of the guests were Japanese but that was primarily who was in Honolulu.Breakfast was included in my rate and was expansive with lots of traditional and Japanese options.The property is smaller than the Sheraton Waikiki and therefore felt less like a "factory".

This was a high rise on the main st straight across the road from the beachWe had two rooms one for the kidsI enjoyed staying here but I'm not a high rise type of guyThe pool is averageThe restaurant is ok with a all you can eat nightLocated next to the poolThere is a coffee stand and convenience store straight out the front Great location Good price Stay here for a easy fair prices holiday

This was our second stay at princess kaiulani we love staying here. If is a great location short walk to the beach and central to the shops. Lovely pool area rooms nice and tidy. We had the pool view room which was great can see and hear the entertainment from our balcony each night. Leilani was super friendly and remembered us from last year. Well recommend staying here

We have just returned from our stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. We honeymooned there 37 years ago and this was the first opportunity we had to return. We booked our holiday through luxury escapes some 8 months ago and was very surprised that everything that was offered was actually there. Fresh fruit either at the poolside or behind the Dukes statue, free bottles of water every day and because we were staying more than 7 days we also had a lovely basket delivered to our room. We have just spent 10 days at the hotel and was impressed, a little dated perhaps, but nonetheless the staff, the room attendants and just everyone was ever so friendly. I don't agree with the $26 a day surcharge but that's everywhere you go. Our friends chose to stay at the Hilton Hawaiin and they paid $36 a day. We were central to everything. The only thing I will say is that the furniture and rooms should have a little facelift just to bring them up to scratch otherwise nice one Princess Kaiulani. Thank you for having us. Until next time. Aloha. Giuseppina and Orazio

We booked our stay 6 months in advance and chose this hotel as I was a SPG member. I was perplexed at check in to be told there was a mandatory $25 resort fee per room per day (we had interconnecting rooms for our family). When I question free internet with my SPG membership they claimed I had to pay for it. I asked what else I got for the $50 per day (total) and they said free parking (we had no car) and beach towels (we used 4 in 5 days!) and free water and fruit at the beach ( no sign of this - apparently when they saw you with the towel they came to you to offer this service). What a rip off.Again, as a SPG member I received no other special service. No special check in, and in fact the staff were very beige. No one was exceptionally special with their customer service. Even walking past the pool towel boys every day there was no greeting. Everyone here is just doing their job to the bare minimum. I actually asked a bell boy directions to the Cheesecake Factory and he couldn't tell me. He couldn't even read the map to point me in the right direction. The rooms were OK, they were clean. The bathrooms are tiny. The balconies are barely big enough for 2 people to sit out there. On the positive the location is perfect. You're amongst everything. Would we go back - probably not.

My husband and I had booked another hotel online. When we checked in we were shocked as the hotel resembled a hostel not room at he price we had paid. We left the hotel and decided to look for alternative accommodations. A few blocks away we went to the Sheraton Princess and explained our dilemma. KArry at the front desk went out of her way to assist us. She allows us to see a rooms the hotel,had available (the same price we had paid at the other hotel). The room was clean , well appointed and comfortable. It was not luxurious but clean, bright and comfortable. The we was adequate room for our suitcases. The bathroom was smaller but quite adequate for 2 people. They have free wifi and bottled water in the room. There is a lovely pool surrounded by outdoor dining and a bare there was entertainment the tow evenings we were there. Beach service is also available. They also have a hospitality room where you can shower and change after you have checked out , before a flight. It too was very clean, fresh towels, shampoo, conditioner and soap available. I cannot say enough about Karry at the reception desk. I hope the Sheraton management reads about Karry , an outstanding employee. I would recommend this hotel and stay again.

**FAIR WARNING I AM SPG GOLD MEMBER**stayed from 22AUG16 to 31AUG16, business trip.Upon arrival, the check in was a breeze, I did not get the same welcoming response as other SPG hotel, usually they hook you up with a towels or tea or some type of drinks. Its not a biggy at all. The lobby does not have A/C like most sheraton I've been to.Being an SPG Gold Member, I had a room upgrade to the 21st floor, with the ocean view. If you are not SPG gold and not willing to pay extra, you may get the lower level floor room, nothing wrong with that except from level 19 and below it has not been renovated, so I was told. The newly renovated room is good, the view is awesome :D I love it. You are right there on the strip, if you do not want to rent a car, this is a good location.The bed was very good, I sleep good at night, if I have to nitpick, some guest are a little loud at night, and I got woken up by the cleaners once or twice at 8 AM.Breakfast is $26 and dinner is $46, in room is well...extra. However, you live across the street from fast food restaraunt and down the street (walking distance) Chuck's Cellar is pretty damn good steak! (at a premium price of course) they do have singers come every night to host a show while you eat dinner.Parking is NOT free(most hotel in Waikiki isnt), $25 a day to include resort amenities, such as towels 250 spg point, the elevator for the parking garage is a little bit hard to find, however they do have it. Premium internet is $8 (?) a day for non SPG gold and platinum (you need to tell them its free, the IT guy does not know this, I actually had to point him to the website on SPG where it explicitly says complimentary premium internet) Premium internet is pretty fast, I was playing games a couple time (overwatch) and it dint lag (most of the time) Basic internet...if you want to do anything other than checking email, forget about it.There are no Spa or massage service here, instead they ask you to go across the street to the Westin (this is where you also go for the beach). The Massage service was good HOWEVER what they dint tell you upfront is a 21% service charge, kind of a hidden fees since they dont tell you, I was a little irritated when I saw the bills. the cost of my massage was 205 as stated on the pamphlet, I was able to get some SPG discount, however, after all cost and discount included it came to be $240 for a 75 min sessions, rip-off, considering other places do it for cheaper price.The shuttles from hotel to airport is $16 I dint personally sign up but I inquire about it.I also attended their luau, its a pretty good shows, I am not big into the whole luau thing however I was impressed. I also met the niece of one of the Olympian, she told me her uncle was the shiny Tonga guy that bear the Tonga flags in the opening ceremony.Overall its a good place if you are on a budget and want a SPG experience, however if you looking for a quieter place, with more of a luxurious resort feels, I think the Westin are better, you get what you pay for.so how would I improve this hotel? definitely the resort fees and service fees needed to be emphasize, the activity outside of the hotel need to be cheaper, they want $26 transportation to Hanamau bay (its $5 for first time entrance and other time it will be free) but if this is your first time in hawaii you wouldnt know any better, this is a Sheraton, however they charged like its the Westin, need to lower your prices a little bit for us 90% lower income folks. More in-house activity, the Sheraton (or le-meridien) in Vietnam have Casino, the Sheraton in guam have jazz & blues singer on certain days.

When we arrived we were treated to a fresh basket of fruit to our room, The staff is wonderful, they cater to every need, the rooms are beautiful and the food is great. i would stay here again. I give it 5 stars

I enjoyed my stay, room outdated, housekeeping not great by no stretch of the imagination and front desk staff not very equipped to handle issues. What they lack in professionalism the bar staff makes up for with their personality and genuine concern for the customer. Not because of alcohol, cause I don't drink, but if you dine there they push to satisfy. They're not intrusive but very engaging. If you can deal with Motel 6 type cutomer service and finding things left by previous guest. This is the spot in the middle of everything. They would have scored better but I couldn't in good conceous give great rating with the problems I encountered.

We just returned from a 10 day stay at The Sheraton PK. We arrived very early in the morning and was very happy to be told by lovely Gregg at front desk that we had a courtesy room until our checkin. I was a little worried when i saw the room as it was very dated and small however i knew from the photos online that the pool view rooms were in better shape. We were then excited to hear we got upgraded to a higher level with a beautiful view. The room was great, always cleaned beautifully. We then were suprised with champagne for our 10 yr anniversary! After reading the reviews i was expecting super friendly staff but unfortunately that wasn't what i always got. Especially at breakfast service. The poor waitresses looked miserable. And i had the concierge Terry be very abrupt to me after asking about the local bus service even though she was friendly enough to tell the people infront of us the whole story of Princess Kuilani. Also we would've been happy to have had breakfast everyday if the price wasn't so high. Overall it was great, the kids loved the pool and the location was superb!

I have stayed at this property a number of times - and it continues to improve. A soft refurbishment of the foyer and rooms has brought the property in line with most of its Waikiki competitors. Where it excels however is the great value amenities for the resort charge. Unlike others that just provide internet, parking and beach towels the PK also offers beach chairs (this is 100m from the beach) and has a team that visits the beach regularly (3-4 times a day) to supply cold water and fresh fruit free of charge. Poolside bar and restaurant fine but watch the pigeons!

Right in the center of Waikiki beach. Great food. Friendly staff. Can't go wrong with the Sheraton name. Hotel could use an upgrade though. Its getting on in age and needs some modernization. Overall I would recommend to stay there.
user_name:
Rich S
Miami, Florida, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. We had a partial ocean view room, which had a great view. We arrived very early in the morning, and they allowed us to park our car, store our luggage since our room was not available, gave us chairs, towels, and let us know when our room was ready. Service was top notch all three days, even down to bringing us water and fruit on the beach. Central to everything on Waikiki beach. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Loved the location. Straight across the road from the beach and close to all the action in Waikiki. We had friends staying in more modern beachfront accommodation that was actually so busy, we found it refreshing to return to the calmness of the Sheraton PK. There was never a wait at the elevators, although it was a little hard to read some of the floor numbers (this is an old hotel). Service by the pool was great. Didn't actually spend much time at the resort as there is so much to explore outside of it. This hotel is a good choice if you're looking for location over luxury.

We were on a package trip, 2 adults and a 4yo. Initially I was disappointed with the hotel; the pool area was small and dated. I soon realised that many of the hotels had small pool areas and we weren't really missing out.The staff were friendly, the hotel was just across the road from the beach, the ubiquitous resort fee included car parking (unlike almost any other hotel), there were some great daily activities, including lei making and beading, nightly entertainment, and hotel restaurant was good quality and reasonable prices. I'd recommend the place and would happily return.

I like the accessibility to the beach and stores all within walking distance...staff was very professional and respectful...stay was nice being on the 25th floor a great view at night I recommend anyone to stay here on your trip to Honolulu...breakfast buffet is first class...they also offer their own luau which is very nice

Great hotel, great location, very close to beach and shops. Staff friendly and helpful. Pool great. Lots of free entertainment in evenings.The rooms are very well presented but are showing their age. The room was always clean and tidy with clean towels every day.Was very noisy due to shopping center being built next door but this show be finished soon so problem solved.

The hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect. The staff was beyond helpful and friendly. Located across the street from Waikiki, the hotel is in the perfect location. There was a beautiful band playing of a night time and it was beautiful to sit on the balcony and listen. The room was great. Bed was very comfortable. However, the bathrooms were average. Overall, fantastic hotel which I wouldn't second guess staying at in the future.

This hotel gave the appearance of being well kept. It was dirty and in a state of utter disrepair. The staff were rude and at times confrontational. The food was over priced and the bar menu was extremely limited.

I had a nice stay at this hotel, but choose your room carefully! The tower has amazing views of the pacific and surrounding Waikiki Beach area, but the room was very dated in the tower! I am an SPG elite member, so if this was the room I was given...then all the rooms must be like this.The bed was not the greatest, although I slept ok...and waking up to that view made it a lovely morning, until turning around and looking at a 1980s styled room. :-( An SPG elite benefit is the 4pm check-out. This is the first hotel I have encountered that makes you change room, so from 12pm-4pm I was accommodated in another part of the hotel on a lower floor facing the street. No real view, except of the shops (so was fine) but the room had been renovated and was nice. Much smaller, so its a trade off.The staff are lovely, and this is more of a hotel for families it would seem.Parking was tricky, bit of a maze back to the hotel.Honestly, lovely hotel...but its in desperate need of a renovation, and not just a refresh as mentioned by the manager on other reviews. These rooms need to be gutted and redone.

Overall good. very friendly house keeping staff with helpful hints. Beach very close in the heart of the fun zone. kids got bug bites but probably not from the room. Clean rooms but charge for microwave.

While the location is great, lounge service is very slow and the free hotel WiFi can't stream YouTube, even at 144p, without interruptions. There is an upgraded WiFi service that costs $14/day, but I wasn't about to pay for it. The air conditioning in our room was set to 68F but the room never got below 75, which is slightly warm for my sleeping habits.The location is great, with a 3 minute walk to Waikiki beach and perfect for shopping at Prada, Louis Vuitton or the Rolex store and with several very good restaurants nearby, you have a lot of options for dining. On that point, the hotel does offer a nightly buffet for $42 and a daily breakfast buffet for $26, which by all accounts are very good.My room was satisfactory for my stay with two double beds and a very "industrial" bathroom, consisting of a toilet and sink like you would find in a gas station washroom (no vanity counter top with the sink) and a bath/shower combo. Maid service was very good and highly attentive during my stay. I don't normally leave a tip for cleaning staff, but I did this time. The furniture in the room is very dated and the hotel apparently has an upgrade plan according to their Twitter account, but I'm unsure what their timeline is. Something I should mention is that if you have a room that faces the pool, don't plan on going to sleep before 9pm due to the band that plays nightly. This caused some concern for us as we had people in our group working midnight's and couldn't get sleep before starting work.If I was on vacation, I would have opted for one of the other nearby hotels, but this one wasn't my choice.

My twin sister and I just stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and we were very impressed. We were upgraded to an ocean view room for 5 nights. We had the best time. The hotel is centrally located close to local amenities. There is an ABC shop directly below for all your supplies while on holidays. Close to the shops and restaurants and of course Waikiki Beach. Our room was quiet, comfortable and clean and serviced daily. All staff were so helpful and friendly, nothing was ever a problem. Special mention to Terry the concierge who was so helpful. She has such a bubbly personality and is an asset to the Sheraton. She helped us with confirming tours and transfers and gave us tips on how to get around Waikiki etc. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying in Waikiki. Great location, great services and fantastic staff!!!!

This property was nothing but disappointment. As a platinum SPG member who travels 50% of the year for work i was expecting a well kept property for the price and location. Please keep in mind this was the last day of a 10 day trip to Honolulu and Maui where we stayed at the Royal Hawaiian and Westin (Maui). Unfortunately the Royal Hawaiian was sold out so I booked this hotel as a last resource. The good........very little. My husband enjoyed the buffet which included all you can eat crab legs which was offered as a free perk for platinum members. The hotel's location is ideal for those who would like to shop or want to walk to nearby restaurants. The bad..........we were upgraded to a ocean view room which smelled musty, incredibly small, and the bathroom had to be atleast 20 years old in dire need of updating. The hallway leading up to the room was dark and the carpet dingy.I will not ever be returning to this hotel and highly recommend you avoid this property like the plague. Luckily our stay was 1 night.
user_name:
Jaziwaz
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Fabulous staff, great tour desk, well maintained rooms and hotel grounds.The pool is lovely, clean and warm, and the poolside atmosphere is inviting and relaxing. The staff really go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible and create a worry free holiday!

Nice and close to the beach and the main street with all the shops. Rooms are a good size with balconies. We enjoyed the pool each day after a visit to the beach over the road for a swim. I have stayed here three times and would definitely stay again.

I was a first-time visitor to this hotel and to Honolulu, and I could not fault the customer service one bit. Everybody from the doorman to the repairman (who came to fix a leaky air conditioning unit in my room) was friendly and helpful.I arrived exceptionally late at night after a long flight from New Zealand, and was pleasantly surprised to be told that my room had been upgraded for free - I had paid for a room in the tower with a partial ocean view, but instead stayed in a deluxe ocean view room. I had a good view of Waikiki Beach and the ocean, and I had my own balcony to enjoy the view.The hotel is a little outdated in terms of the decor, but everything was well presented and of a good quality. All in all, a good place to stay.

We had a great view of the beach from our room. Ideally situated for the shops and beach though because of this you do get some road noise from about 6 30. Very comfortable and modern and well presented. The service is excellent in the hotel and staff very friendly. The pool area is lovely and especially nice staff who were very kind when hubby got a knock surfing and provided an ice pack! The breakfast again was really good with lots of choice. Would go again to this hotel

You cannot fault a Sheraton and once again we were not let down. A true Hawaiian welcome, beautiful staff, entertainment, food amazing. Pool, just right, restaurant perfect. Accommodation needs a little update but very comfortable. The rooms are comfortable. Thank you Sheraton.

Clean rooms, though the smallest on the islands I have tried!Staff went out of their way to help!Location was decent, restaurant was good but way over priced! Pool area is nice, and spacious.Bar was small but service was fast. I would definately return.

The Princess Kaiulani is very well located on Kalakaua Avenue, and pretty much in the center of Waikiki. The hotel has been here since the 1960's, and while it has been refurbished a number of times, it hasn't been recently and that makes for dated rooms with bathrooms that are clearly from the 60s. Ok, it's Waikiki and you're not supposed to spending all of your time in the room - but they're not very fresh. Definitely clean, but not much to write home about. You'd be much better off using this hotel as home base for exploring Honolulu and not spending too much time on the property.All staff members are accommodating and friendly - and I enjoy interacting with all of them.

Although we enjoyed our stay, we felt the value for money was not compatible. Having stay in Hawaii 4 times now there are a lot better places than this. Their one saving grace was the staff, who were fantastic. We were really made welcome particularly by a lovely lady named Angie whilst in the pool area. Just overpriced

Nice and clean and one street back from beach with nice views if your high enough. There was a lot of construction going on next door so that was disappointing but the rooms were clean and staff very helpful.

This hotel is in serious need of a renovation. I've been to this hotel twice and the staff is very nice. The lobby is beautiful and the greatness stops there. The rooms are old and musty. They offer the government rate which is good and they are centrally located near the beach. If you are a platinum member they offer you food and drink vouchers to make up for not having a lounge. But they didn't allow me to bring a guest which I found a bit odd.

While it appears to be an older hotel on the strip, it has a great access to the beach, shopping and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and readily available to assist if required. Once you step out the front door you find yourself surrounded by the atmosphere that is Waikiki. The only downside was the construction going on next door which will be done eventually.

We were really happy with our stay at the Sheraton....it was noted as a 3 star in the ratings but we thoroughly enjoyed it. The location was perfect...yep bathrooms were a bit dated and rooms were quite small but how much time do you spend in your room anyway? I loved going to sleep to the hum of Waikiki and music and happiness coming from the restaurant downstairs. The Splash bar was perfect for a cool afternoon beverage whilst the kids still swam and we frequently ate their - hot wings and a cold beer!! Staff were lovely - couldn't have enjoyed it more....

Stayed here for one day in our trip to Honolulu. The hotel offers a mini refrigerator and a safe. It's about one block and a half to the beach. The view from the room was ok. It has a wonderful pool but no hot tub. Hotel does not provide beach towels. It's affordable and in close proximity to some shops.

Our stay here was great!!! It's 1 block from Waikiki Beach. And as for shopping, well there's just about anything you could want up and down the main street. We happened upon a place called Dukes Lane which is a huge flea market. We had so much fun going there. As for the hotel itself, the lobby is beautiful as is the swimming area. Only complaint is that the pool closes at 7:00 pm. The breakfast buffet (which was part of our package) was wonderful, lots to choose from.. Yes, the hotel is on the older side. But impeccably clean. We were told that upgrades are in the works. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks for making our stay a great experience!!!!

Quick stay for work, rooms are functional but run down as is the rest of the property. However there is plenty in the surrounding area so its a good budget friendly hotel in Waikiki. Look at surrounding SPG properties for better amenities and rooms if that is a priority.

I've traveled a lot and this hotel is bad. Not anything a brand name hotel should be. If the rate is great and you are not planning on an intimate night with another then it will work. Don't be fooled by the Sheraton name. It's a motel 6 across the street from the water. I don't want much from a hotel. But. I want something as nice or nicer than my own home and this is not it

This is a good hotel if you are looking for location. This hotel is very convenient to the beach, the shops and downtown Waikiki. It has a great lobby and bar but the pool closes at night (hard on kids) and no hot tub. Rooms are clean but need upgrading. Lots of construction taking place next door at the international plaza location. They do offer beach chairs and towels but it is a little trek to get to the Sheraton area and not easy to find.

Travelled with friends earlier this month and didn't want to spend a fortune on accomodation but wanted to be close.to everything. This hotel is centrally located being right across from the beach. Close to Dukes, buses right out the front of hotel, ABC store next door. Staff very friendly and helpful and very happy to give advise and suggestions on ways to get around!

Love coming to this location as a local. Always get upgraded, big fluffy beds, and pool with a bar. Entertainment at the pool during the evening that you can sit outside your balcony and listen to. Walking distance to everything in Waikiki if that's your thing. Late check-out if avail. The dinner buffet is rather limited, but not bad.

We stayed here for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon trip. We arrived at midnight following a late flight and was very impressed when the lady on check in said she would upgrade our room as we were a honeymoon couple! Great we thought! Until we stepped out the lift on the 18th floor, we were quite surprised by the huge change in decor compared to the modern looking lobby areas. Then we were even more surprised by how outdated our room was, it was clean but everything from the decor to the furniture appeared old and worn, similar to the other reviews, it was like stepping back into the 80's. The bathroom was tiny - you had to step over the toilet to get into the shower. We were then wondering, if this was an upgrade, dread to think what the original room was like! As it was then early hours of the morning we headed to bed. So imagine our horror after just a few hours sleep, being woken at 5:50am by lorries and construction noises. Now daylight, I went out onto the balcony to discover that our 'upgraded' room overlooked the construction site next door! Despite being 18 floors up, the noise was horrendous. After complaining at the desk, we were moved to the 22nd floor to a very lovely, very modern, very recently renovated hotel room on the other side of the building. We had no complaints at all about this room, it was lovely! Once the room issue was sorted, we had a lovely stay and had no other issues with the hotel. The location is great, the staff are lovely and very helpful. They're obviously in the process of renovating the hotel slowly but surely, it just would have been nice to have had some pre-warning about the construction site next door and not been 'upgraded' to overlook it! I would only recommend this hotel if you can get a room on the top few floors facing away from the construction site.

thank you PK from the up grade to the partial ocean view and the fruit and champagne basket for 50th wedding anniversary, from the early check in , to the time to leave we enjoyed our time there. we were recommended by friends who have stayed twice before we can see why thanks Kaiulani .

Great location, nice rooms, good view and right close to great restaurants and the beach made this a great place to stay. I was here for 6 weeks total and have no complaints. I did find the restaurant in the hotel to be quite expensive so I would head to Duke's or The Cheesecake Factory which was close by. Staff was friendly and always did well cleaning the rooms and common areas.

Our family stayed here while visiting Waikiki.We loved the location and the staff. Everyone always had a smile! This isn't a new hotel, but it met our needs nicely. We loved being able to see the ocean!We appreciated that there was a restaurant on site and so much nearby to do.We enjoyed the cultural activities there. Uncle was great with both the adults and the kids. The kids still talk about the fun they had participating in the classes.The pool staff was very good with kids. They loved when the wagon came by to bring treats.It was great to have beach gear on site, too.Some of us did the tour and lecture, too. Very enjoyable. The story of the Princess was very moving.We would stay again.

An enjoyable 2 night stay which started with a friendly, efficient checkin. The room was comfortable, clean and the wifi worked well. The pool area is great as is the busy lobby area. Couldn't get a better location to access shops, restaurants, trolleys/buses and the beach. Well priced and highly recommended.

The Hotel is in a great location, 5 Minutes walk to beach and main shops. The Hotel was a little dated but was very clean and the staff were amazingly friendly.We booked most of our excursions through the hotel and found them all to be very good and reasonably priced.The pool was clean and not too busy so could grab a sun bed, Food and drink were very nice and some good entertainment.

Very happy with our stay at this hotel. We had an early morning arrival from Australia and the standard check in time is 3:00 pm. When we asked if we could drop off our luggage and use the restroom to freshen up we were offered a courtesy room for an hour so that we could shower and change our clothes. Big tick of approval for this.We had a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool with partial ocean view. Although the decor is a little outdated the room was clean & comfortable.The location was great for us close to the beach and trolley pick up points, a short walk in either direction for restaurants and shopping.The concierge was good and we also found Serina at the tours and activity desk very helpful.Good selection of cocktails and beer available at the splash bar, they have happy hour between 4pm and 6pm.We ventured across to one of the other islands for a couple of nights then returned for one night before heading home. On checking in we were upgraded to ocean view room on the 16th floor overlooking the pool once again.The view was great however there was an adjoining room with sub standard sound proofing as we could hear the people talking and child crying.The only other negative was a bit of traffic noise. If we go back to Waikiki we would more than happy to stay here again.

We booked to stay at this hotel as part of a fly/stay deal in May. When we booked we had requested a room on a higher floor that was less noisy after reading reviews. I followed this up by personally ringing Waikiki, prior to holiday to check my request had been received, yes but when we arrived we were still on the 2nd floor. It took 10minutes before reception could/ would find a room with a double higher up. This was disappointing as we have stayed twice at the Sheraton on Hawaii island - loved it and thought it may be similar here. The location is excellent, close to the beach and the main drag. That I think is it's best feature; it is in the middle of Waikiki and close to everything. Our room on the 5th floor, once we had sorted out the original problem, was fine,the clean and quiet if somewhat dark with not a lot of lighting for nighttime. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom although clean, looked, and was a little tired . There was a balcony for the room which was very pleasant. The hotel caters to numerous large tour groups and on one day my husband was physically pushed out of the lift while 2 other people from the same tour were helped into the lift. This was not a nice look. We did not say anything until the end of our stay when the manager wrote a note of apology, but still it should not have happened. . We asked for the room to be cleaned regularly which occurred; not always replenishing sugars and tea etc, but overall given the name of the hotel slightly disappointing. One could say the hotel is modern in part but plastic glasses in rooms is not really a chic look,nor great to drink out of especially when you are paying a resort fee of $us 25.00 pd We did eat at the restaurant one evening with a group of friends and this proved to be disappointing especially as because there were 6 of us we were automatically charged 20% tip when the meal and service did not warrant it. We would return to the Sheraton at Kona - this one, not so sure.

Great location very central to all in Waikkiki walking distance to beach shops restaurants and trolley buses.ABC stores are conveniently located which you will visit more than once as there isn't anything you can't get there from fresh food to alcohol ha ha There is one located at side entrance and one across the road from the front entrance.

I have traveled to Hawaii a few times and this was the first time I had stayed at this hotel. I was really happy with my stay. Yes the rooms were a little old but it was clean and comfortable so I was not worried at all. The location was great, close to the beach and also the trolleys to get around. I enjoyed sitting by the pool and in the evening listening to the music that they have playing. Yes the buffet I thought was quiet expensive however the splash bar was priced similar to other places around. I will definitely be staying here again as I visit Hawaii regularly

Our shuttle driver told us that the Pk as it's known locally is one of the oldest hotels in Waikiki. All you need to hear after travelling from the UK.However on arrival we was pleasantly surprised at how good the public areas are kept. Staff greeted us very warmly. On getting to our room though it's age shows through. Nothing major, just looking tired. Maybe highlighted more as the past 4 hotels we have stayed at have just had refurbs. To be fair though it's still a great place. If you need the pool it's not that big and is quite deep. The beach is just 5 mins walk so who cares about the pool. Never saw many people using it anyway.The Concierge service is first class and certainly goes the extra mile to help with any of your needs. Many of the staff have worked here for years. They are a wealth of local information so well worth asking them for advice.My only slight moan is room cleaners. Rooms do have edges as well as middles and they were forever forgetting to replenish. Milk. Sugars, plastic glasses etc.Would I return. Of course.

We have stayed here twice in the past few years and highly recommend this place because of the location. It is not beachfront, but its only a one minute walk to the beach, where they will provide you with towels, chairs and water if you like. It is simple, clean. Staff are helpful, professional and consistent. It was a great location to shop around, walk throughout Honolulu. We went first as a couple with friends, and the second visit, we went with our children and another family. We were lucky to get our rooms side by side with access to eachanother rooms between wall. It was a great environment, quiet and relaxing. Highly recommend for its location, price and value. We would go again if we visited Honolulu again!

My most recent stay was 5/30/2016. Been here so many times I've lost count. This is my #2 go to hotel in Hawaii. I've never had any problems here. This review is an overall impression of the past 10 years and is not about a specific stay. Hotel: I would classify this hotel as upscale business travel or high turnover vacationer so expect crowds, wait lines and not much quiet. To be fair, this hotel is over 60 years old so some of the rooms and amenities are starting to show their age. However, facility is well maintained. Pool area and bar is nice and staff always friendly. Dinner buffet has good selection, never had a bad meal. Service: This is THE REASON why I like staying here. Front desk is always friendly and accommodating if I have a special request. Because of flight schedules I often arrive at 10AM-11AM but they always find me a room if my original one isn't ready. The extra breakfast coupon for being SPG Platinum is greatly appreciated. Room: Older rooms tend to be on the small side but have always been clean. Rooms facing poolside are noisy because of traffic. Linens are always clean and crisp. Five pillows on each bed is nice. Carpet, dressers, chairs, etc. are getting a rather worn and stained, about ready for an upgrade. Bathroom: (mostly) Clean, very small and in need of upgrade. Calcium buildup on shower heads and fixtures is a long running issue and gives a poor impression. Location: Heart of Waikiki. Literally across the street from Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to world class shopping and restaurants. Overall a very good hotel with a staff that makes it what it is. I always look forward to each time I stay here.

We experienced a little trouble with a smoke alarm during the early hours of the morning. Construction work in the area starts real early. Swimming pool closes at 7pm which is too early. Just a very short stroll from Waikiki beach. All staff were very helpful and friendly and Terry at concierge was just awesome. She helped me with so much information / insight I was confidently able to follow her advice and enjoy my holiday. Tour desk operators were not very helpful however.

We are from Australia and stayed at this resort (3 rooms in total) for 7 nights. The rooms itself are fine! I Didn't have any problems with the room. We had a balcony overlooking the pool. The bed is super comfy and the bathrooms fine. The child's crib though is from the 80's and my son kept getting his foot stuck between the bars while he was sleeping which would wake him up screaming. The tour operator was great! He booked in all our tours nice and easy! The thing that I hated the most was the resort daily fee. Being from Aussie, I totally did not understand this extra charge which was about $30 a day. Not only that but when we checked in they said they needed a credit card to hold $10 in case we mess the room up. Which is fine but they never advised that every day they would be taking out the daily fee from the credit card as well!! I had only brought cash in to Hawaii so I never had to use my card and get charged the fee! After querying it with manager, he said it takes approx 30 days to get the money back off hold !!! What the! Lucky I noticed it after 3 days so only 3 days worth for taken out. I still don't know why the free wi fi and car parking isn't included already in the price and you have to pay this extra fee when you're there. The walls are paper thin. could hear our neighbours conversation very clearly and I'm pretty sure they could hear our son crying when he wakes up :( also the pool is very small!! We seen some awesome hotel pools along the beach but the Sheraton pool was just a backyard pool. They have the space so not sure why it's so tiny. Overall all, I would stay here again. The beds were comfy and the location was great!

We just came from a very expensive hotel in Maui to this one and straight away the service here beats it hands down.They gave us a room key before our room was ready so we could shower and freshen up, grab what we needed out of our suitcase and head out relaxed.The staff are always smiling and genuinely helpful.The only reason I don't give an extra star is the bathrooms are tired and the hallways need a revamp of colour. Very 80's.Overall I loved the position and view was great. It's a little loud till about 10:30pm as the street noise echoes up the building but hey what do you expect......it's a pumping place.

While this is not the newest hotel on the block it is a great budget friendly option. Had great staff interactions throughout two recent stays. Christina at the front desk was super helpful both trips and remembered me from the first stay. She helped me out tracking down a forgotten piece of luggage from a shuttle. A six hour flight with an 18 month old really frazzled the brain and we totally left it behind. Not to worry it was waiting for us when we left super early the next morning for our flight to Kauai. Like I said it is an older property but the rooms were clean and staff were friendly and helped us out with a number of things.

One night stay since our hotel for three weeks did not have room for one night. Overall room was quiet and clean. Outdated with old green carpet and fixtures/etc but was clean and had partial ocean view. SPG Gold so got breakfast vouchers which was great. Breakfast was good, quick and hit the spot before heading to work. Pool area is a little small and closes early if you have kids that want to swim at night.

Check in was smooth, the room was spacious, clean and well appointed. We were on the third floor with a partial ocean view. The hotel is only 50 yards from the main Waikiki strip. Our only complaint was the bar service near the pool. It was slow and mildly dysfunctional. It took three reminders to get change of a $50 bill after buying just a beer!!They have a pretty good band that plays in the evening and we spent a pleasant couple of hours on our room verandah, listening to the band while we reviewed the day's activities over a bottle of wine.

This Resort was wonderful!When I first arrived the atmosphere is fantastic, it definitely is a "fancy" place to stay and I was traveling with a hiking backpack only, I did get a few looks but everyone was more than friendly.The first room I checked in to was horrendous. It was in the main building on the 7th floor. They need to do much better cleaning, there was dust and crumbs everywhere, the beds were clean but the overall look of the room was really bad. The sink and rust in it, I would not have used the shower as the drain had rust and or mold around it. The light switch looked like it had not been cleaned for ages. The tops of the picture frames were very dusty as well.When I brought this to the Front Desk agents attention he was more than apologetic and fixed things straight away! I was more than okay with having some one go in and do a quick clean but he insisted in upgrading me. The room I was upgraded to was in the secondary tower in the 24th floor and it was amazing! Very Clean, Ocean view etc. The top 5 floors have been recently renovated, I could tell just by walking out of the elevator that this was the best floor to be on!I did order room service and it was amazing food and the staff were fantastic!When I checked out the next morning they held my bag for me and offered a complimentary room to shower in on at the end of the day before my flight.I have nothing but good things to say about this Resort and the staff. Their Customer Service is impeccable.

We stayed in a partial ocean veiw room on the 29th floor. The room was very clean and neat. Housekeeping done a wonderful job. Food was excellent in the Splash bar. Front desk staff were pleasant. Very central to everything. They had the farmers market across the road with freshly cooked hot food, fresh fruit sliced ready to go and a must try is the Malasada. All in all a wonderful place to stay. Looking forward to 2018 when we return.

Buffet dinner in a restaurant with pleasant surrounds and nice atmosphere, in door and outdoor eatingExcellent selection of hot and cold food, large range of cakes and fresh fruit desertsSignature dish is the Angus roast beef and crabs in shells, Japanese sushi Mixture of Asian and western foodsVery attentive staff with excellent service.Adjacent to a musical show. and

I love this hotel for the pool area, it is large and the patio comfortable with many chairs. I especially love the free entertainment at night with the different bands playing Hawaiian and contemporary music. The mai tais are the best in Waikiki, hands down. The lobby has changed and no longer has all the beautiful orchids it once had. The location is great, centrally located in Waikiki. The rooms average. Also what happened to the Christmas Village that use to be on display each December?

I wanted to like Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The location and the resort fee which includes parking is an amazing benefit! Which was practically the only reason why my family and I decided to book our stay.I already knew before hand that the hotel would be outdated and a much needed renovation from the previous reviews. And I knew the bathrooms wouldn't be up to par compared to other places. But I was willing to look the other way because of the location. During our stay, most employees were friendly. But what I could not grasp was how the hotel will not allow their guest to bring outside food and to have it be eaten outside near the pool. Obviously there are tables and chairs, but what makes the employees say to their guests that you can't eat outside food when right next to use there are other guest drinking drinks they purchased from the bar. I wish I got this employees name, but she literally told me to gather my things and to eat in my room! Overpriced food from the splash restaurant and buffet isn't even worth your time.
