Take advantage of the complementary photo shoot the hotel offers. You get one print free of charge, and others are available for purchase through package deals. Again, overpriced, but it is pretty fun getting your complementary picture at the end.

This is the second time we have stayed here and we cannot fault it. Sure it may be on the slightly older side but its location for beach, shopping and restaurants is ideal . The staff are super friendly and the hotel is value for money we are going back next year to Hawaii and will definitely be staying here again.

This is an older property to be sure, however it is reflected in the price! For this location in Waikiki, you really can't go wrong. The pool is great, the rooms are clean and quiet, and you're right in the heart of Honolulu!

This is my second stay at this hotel and it was just as good as last time. For around $200/ night, you get a central Waikiki location, a pool, beach chairs, and live entertainment. For $100 to $200 more per night you could stay across the street at the Moana Surfrider which is much nicer but if you want something more economical, the Princess is a great choice. I had a wonderful corner room again with an ocean view (room 1962). Every night there was a Hula show and live music in the bar after the show. My stay as a Platinum member included the breakfast and dinner buffets. I can’t complain for free but I wouldn’t pay $25 for the breakfast nor $45 for dinner. I would opt to eat at the Moana Surfrider breakfast buffet for a little more money. Eat across the street and stay at the Princess.

I think we were staying in their oldest wing. The rooms were a little bit dated, but clean and a decent size. The wifi is included in the resort fee, as is a 'free' photoshoot - but be warned, it's not just a couple of snaps by the waterfall in the resort, it is a full on cheesy photoshoot. The pool isn't as big as they make it out to be in the pictures, but it was cleaned everyday (I saw them doing it), and there were plenty of sun loungers. The chi chi cocktails by the pool were a highlight.This hotel wasn't cheap, but I imagine for Waikiki it's very good value and I would stay here again if I returned.

I have stayed here many times for business. They customer service has always been very nice and my rooms are always clean and comfortable. This hotel is right smack in HNL across the street from Waikiki beach. Close to shopping and many restaurants. Definitely will be returning soon I hope. However, note, I prefer beach scenes way off away from people. Waikiki is not that type of beach scene. Great people watching however.

My wife and I just spent 12 days at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani celebrating our 30th anniversary. You will love it as much as we did. Not on the beach, but across the street from it, you can walk through the Moana across the street and enjoy drinks meals on the ocean. Beautiful theme, worth the time to learn the history, wonderful luau show, the beatles tribute was fun as well. Food was great, but the price tag was typical for a buffet on the strip, $24 breakfast, $50 dinner. The best part was definitely the people, ask for Kerry at the check in desk, she took care of everything we needed. Pay for the upgrade to poolside higher floors so you can see the ocean. I told Justin at the desk that we missed the kukui nut necklace making session and he took his own necklace off and gave it to me for my wife. That says it all. Watch out for the free photo session, they want $30 a picture or $200 for all of them. Food in the Splash bar was the best on the beach, small plates were a bargain. Pool was excellent, workout room was available 24-7. Resort fee included parking, which made it well worth it, other hotels fee was $30 and up not including parking.Stop comparing and hit the button, this is the one!

We like this location - - so near the Beach, Restaurants, Shopping, etc. We like the large open-air lobby. My only complaint had to do with housekeeping - - which seems to be 'always'. Our room was not ready when we checked in because the people did not leave the room until after 1pm even thought check-out time is 11am. Room was not ready until after 3pm (which is check-in time). We were given our keys and when we went up to the room -- - the housekeeper was still making up the room. The next day we were out of the room from 8am until 3pm and the room had not been 'made-up'. We had to find a housekeeper and asked if she would make up the room. They used to give you a welcome drink - - but not this time. They used to give you a one-time continental breakfast - - but not this time. Watch out for the 'Resort Fee.

Agree with a few comments on here in that the hotel is in a great location and is good value. The rest of the hotel is not as modern as the foyer but it is clean and regularly serviced. Staff are very helpful, checking in was smooth as was check out. Debbie at the bar area is a character but also helpful. Wifi is good, pool great and chairs are provided for the beach a short stroll across the road. Plenty of food choices of different styles in walking distance. We had a partial ocean view room and with balcony on pool side, had a relaxing time on there listening to music every night from the pool area. Food at buffets not that great but good little coffee booth outside side gate good value.

Had a great time at the Princess Kaiulani. The location is just a short walk to the beach. The room was well laid out and very clean. The staff were very good. There is a resort fee, which seems to be common for the area, which covers bottled water, internet, beach towel use etc. The beach towels and water come in very handy. Each evening there was some good music out by the pool. The activities desk was very helpful in setting up tours. Overall a great stay and i would recommend this hotel as a great balance of location and price.

My boyfriend had taken me to Waikiki before but it was only for two days. So I wanted to go back. So we went back for five great days of fun in the sun. We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. It is a really nice hotel if your having a birthday or anniversary they will send a bottle of wine or champagne to your room. Check in was easy. The flight was fantastic first class in wonderful. Once you fly first class you never want to go back to coach. They feed you a full course meal and you get to watch all the movies for free. Your seat reclines into a bed also they give you a pillow and a blanket. Plus you get to drink free.... Yesssss........ Ok back to the hotel it was really nice with a great view. The bathroom was clean but the bathtub could of used some updating. The location was a dream around so many stores and restaurants. There was a KFC across the street with really good chicken. We did a lot of shopping and if you get a chance to go buy some cookies from Honolulu Cookie. Waikiki is a great place to visit but to expensive to live. Milk is eight dollars and cereal is seven . dollars.

Went recently for the 4th time to Waikiki. First time at this hotel. The Princess has all the amenities needed. Spacious entry undercover for transport to and from hotel. With seating if you were waiting for q shuttle. With a very helpful gentleman helping everyone with bags, taxis or anything really. Very nice and clean ( loved the decor) in the lobby. Hawaiian music welcomes you. Smooth checkin and given all the information I could take in at the time after a flight from Brisbane. Our rooms were ready even though it was early. So off to the 5th floor. Stayed in 512 and 508. Room was clean with a king size bed. Fridge,safe, adequate hanging space,coffee maker all the usual. We had a pool view, slid back the patio doors and beautiful music,view of the entertainment, pool looks great and you can watch the coming and going of people. But best of all a view of the beach. Used the pool a lot and it was great, pool towels available, also beach chairs, water and fruit brought to you at the beach. Included in the resort fee of $25 per day. 2 bottles of water in the room per day and free wifi which worked well. Also included free car park if you needed it. Couldn't really fault this place the location is very good right opposite Moana Surf Rider everything at your doorstep. Beach across the road.

This is my second time staying at this property and my experience was similar to the last time, being a SPG Plat member I was upgraded to a higher floor with a view in a refurbished room. The property itself is old and dated I tend to spend little time there aside from sleeping and sitting on the patio looking at the ocean. The Westin Mona Rider across the street has a great beach restaurant as well as a amazing coffee shop. Take this for what it is good location and not pricey

This hotel is wonderful. We stayed in room 2865 which gave us sideways views of the ocean and the lovely Honolulu skyline.The room was cleaned everyday and equipped with a safe and everything else you would expect.Waikiki beach is close by - a couple of minutes walk, and if you sat near to the Duke statue; a rep from the hotel came round 3 times to bring cold bottled water and fruit free of charge - wonderful. You can even use beach chairs from the hotel free of charge to take down with you. Fabulous service.There is a $25 resort charge per day (plus tax) so I guess this could add up.Although we were able to get to our room straight away - check in is not until 3pm which could have been a huge problem for us as we arrived at 9.30am, and check out is at 12 noon - our flight was not until later in the afternoon - but on this occasion it worked out well. My only negative is that they are building what appears to be a new hotel next door and they start work around 5am - it gets noisy and the air con doesn't quite muffle it - if you can request a room on the other side then that would be better.

Great location, nice pool and mostly friendly staff. Pool was quite deep (over 8 ft at deep end) so not great for small kids but perfect for our requirements. Easy walk to the great beaches of waikiki and it's shopping and eateries.

Stayed for two nights because of work. As a result my room was to cleaned after the first night! Carpets are frayed and worn out! Dirty? Location and staff are what save this hotel.The bathroom was bare bones, not enough room for all toiletries. Paint is falling off the corners o the walls.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kailulani for 9 nights, we had a partial ocean view room so we could see a snippet of the ocean and a lot of the Waikiki strip - the only downfall being the construction of the new building beside the hotel there was always a lot of noise, so sitting out on the balcony was deterred as it was too loud. The rooms are spacious and offer everything you need king size bed, shower, bath, toilet, hair dryer, ironing board (which I found very handy), plenty of hanging space in the wardrobe, bar fridge and a safe which was great so we could store all of our money and important documents. The facilities are clean and well looked after and the staff are all lovely :-) The only thing I would say is if you're coming from Australia and happen to be on the flight that lands at 6am, make sure you get your travel agent to see if you can check in earlier otherwise you have to wait until 3pm which is a long day after you've been on a flight for ten hours, because all you want to do is shower and have a nap. When we arrived our room wasn't available until 1:30ish in the afternoon but we were lucky enough to be offered a complimentary room to use for 1 hour to be able to shower etc. We didn't eat at the hotel but found plenty of options along Waikiki beach as there is so much to choose from. Enjoy your stay :-)

This is such an outdated hotel it borders on just plain "ridiculous". This hotel has not spent any money on anything since the 70's. How can Sheraton put there name on this place. Let's start with the rooms. They are very small and outdated. The furniture is leftover from the 60's. The bed is not to a Sheraton standard and the linen is marginal at best. It would all be OK if everything was well maintained but it isn't. The only thing that is descent is the tv (lcd tv). The bathroom is small with no counter space to place your stuff. The rooms air conditioning struggle's to cool the room because the hallways are open to the outside and not air-conditioned. Regarding the rest of the hotel, the lobby is OK but nothing special. The pool is small and not well maintained. The only thing I can nice about this place is the location. It's right off the Main Street and within a very short walk to really nice hotel's you can visit to see what you missing out when you stay here!

This hotel has everything, position, nice rooms, pool view balconies, restaurant and bar and nice pool. The staff were very good until our last morning. Imagine our horror when at 4 am when the shuttle was waiting at the lobby we discovered that the elevators from our floor were locked for the night! No one could explain how we could get to the lobby and no one came to help us. We are both in our 70,s and panicking. Finally located the service elevator which deposited us in a service yard. We could see the lobby (the shuttle had gone) But we could not get to it as workmen had barricaded the area as they were replacing carpet! No one would help us once again. Finally a young man ,no connection to the hotel, saw our plight and guided us through the back streets and round the block to the front desk. The manager could only say "sorry"! And yes we got a shuttle and luckily our plane was delayed!

We stayed there for a week as part of a tour group and we were pretty happy with the location, staff and services we received. Ensure you enjoy the farmers markets everyday across the street (two locations) to enjoy local fruits and foods. Accessibility to beach and tour trolleys is great, walking distance to most restaurants for all budgets, as well as to major shopping. Hotel is a bit outdated but nicely equipped. Our room was facing the construction and it was VERY noisy to the point of not enjoying sitting on the balcony. Noise is minimal if door to lanai is closed. Staff is very friendly and will accommodate most requests. Pool area is a bit small for the size of the hotel but had room to sit for the most part. Elevators can be slow during peek times. Did not eat at the hotel. Rooms provided fridges which was great. There's a single coffee cup maker as well. Bell service was fantastic - they are always around to help. Also concierge and tour desks were extremely helpful!

Stayed here for 2 weeks. Great location we had a room on 12th floor of Tower block facing the sea. Rooms are a good size but a bit out dated. We had a wonderfull cleaning lady she told me where to go when my partner had bad sun burn, pool is ok when you cab get a bed as you do get people putting towel's on the beds and going off the day (didn't expect that here lol). You also get fruit and Water brought down to beach. When you go the the concierge ask for Terry lithium she is the best person in the hotel always has a smile on her face remembers your name when you walk past,she will also arrange things for you and when you want to go the the Cheese Cake Factory which is a must, Terry will phone thru and book you a table saves you wating outside for so long. She is one in a million. Also ask terry to book you in at pearl harbour as she can phone through and see if there are any free tickets, then just get the bus which is behind the hotel next street down by supermarket.Talking about the beach make sure you get your sun loungers from jason (he has the yellow and red umbrellas)very friendly man and will give you lots of advise. And if you go to him every day he will give you discount. We had a great time here and we are going back in 2018 as it's bali next year.

I am constantly amazed when I read negative reviews about this hotel. I am a regular visitor to Hawaii and have stayed in a variety of hotels from five star to three star depending on my budget at the time .I have just returned from my third stay at the princess and in my opinion it is the best value in Oahu. If you are looking for a great hotel in a perfect location at an exceptional price then you can't go wrong. The staff are great, the rooms are fine particularly the partial ocean view and the location is just across the road from the best part of the beach. Fold up chairs are provided for the beach and the staff bring over fruit and water every couple of hours.Around the pool I had no problem getting a deck chair at any time of the day ( try doing that at the sheraton Waikiki) and the nightly entertainment provided a great end to the dayThe princess is an unpretentious 3 and a half star hotel that offers everything that you need for a great time in Hawaii . Perfect location , great rooms , more than adequate pool and bar area and staff who I find go out of their way to make your stay a great one.A special mention for Erin at the check in desk, she is a gem .

I was very impressed with the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.Not only was the price very reasonable for a Waikiki Hotel, but the location was GREAT - the beach was only a short block away. The room was quite nice, with a good balcony view over their large pool. And there were fast food restaurants across the street (Restaurant prices were outrageous in Honolulu.)Although Prada, Gucci and the like were around the corner, the "old fashioned" souvenir shops were also close by. And the Roberts Tour pickup point was across the street. (We took a lot of Roberts Tours while in Hawaii) Beyond that, the staff I interacted with were all very professional, courteous, and friendly. One facet that sticks out was their 1 hour courtesy room. When we checked out on the morning of our departure, I mentioned that we had a "Red Eye" flight, so we would ask the Bell Captain to hold our luggage till the early evening. The Desk Clerk mentioned that we could get a courtesy room for 1 hour to freshen up before our flight. THAT WAS A GREAT IDEA..For anyone going to Waikiki, I highly recommend the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. I am not familiar with other Sheratons or Starwood hotels, but will definably check them out, based on my experience at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.

I would stay at this hotel again! The front counter staff that assisted me was great! I arrived a couple hours early and she found me a room and actually upgraded it because she realized I was a bit tired. Really good happy hour specials and the food was delicious. My room was great and the beds were really comfortable and clean. The location of the hotel is perfect!

Room is from the 70's. Old scratched up furniture, musty smell, dirt and dust. Absolutely disgusting. I couldnt stop sneezing and had a sinus headache from the dust and mold in this hotel. The walls are paper thin you can hear everything in the room next door. Wallpaper is falling off the walls. I can't believe this is a Sheraton property.

The location of this hotel was great, right in the heart of Waikiki and it was across the street from the beach. The hotel feels a bit dated. The elevators were slow and packed at times. I feel like you almost need stanchions so that people walking behind you don't cut in front of you to take the elevator! The room was clean. There was only one day where the housekeeping staff didn't clean the room until late afternoon. My balcony was facing another hotel and outside there was construction going on. It was tolerable as I was out and about before the construction workers started their day and came back when they were done for the day. If you are really going to make use of the balcony, try to request a room that is not facing the construction. I didn't use the pool nor the restaurants so can't really comment on those, but the pool is not very big and when I pass by it, it seems to be utilize by mostly kids. Overall, I am happy with my stay and would stay here again for the location.

We stayed at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a week booked through the My Holiday website. The Princess Kaiulani was rated four star hotel, however I don't think that is the case. The location of the hotel is excellent, very central to everything in Waikiki, and only one street back from the beach.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms (we were on the fifth floor) were adequate in size and clean. The Beds were very comfortable. Walls are paper thin and on most nights we were awoken with loud chair scraping, loud laughing etc. The bathroom is tiny with the shower inside the little bath. Minimal things provided in the room including plastic cups as glasses - however the Ice bucket was handy.Room servicing was slow at times with a couple of times our room not being cleaned until mid afternoon - but the cleaning ladies were very friendly. The pool area was ok however only accommodates around 40 lounges.. and with many rooms, clearly not enough.We had the buffet breakfast on the first morning and whilst the omelettes were lovely, there were not a lot of other selections and did not go back. Overall probably a great hotel if you are on a tight budget, but the hotel is very tired and in need of a revamp. If you are after a little more ambience and atmosphere, pay a little extra so you won't be disappointed.

we staid twice in our trip there, at the beginning and at the end ! When we came there second time, the person at the reception told me we forgot lots of clothes in the commode and give us a pack with all inside before we went in our room ! Thanks !The pool with life music in evening was very nice too !The room was decorated like very exotic with bamboo bed and strow !

The amenities at this hotel are amazing, and quiet being that they are not a huge resort. Loungers by the pool with bar service was always quick! Just a short walk to the beach and shopping. Rooms are not incredibly modern but were very clean and comfortable. Our room had amazing views of the ocean across the road. Would stay here again in a heart beat. Already dreaming of coming back

The ideal location to the beach and shopping makes this a perfect hotel. Everything in Waikiki within walking distance. The appearance of the hotel is simple. Might be outdated to others, but worth the price value. The rooms were well appointed and extremely clean. The noise from adjoining rooms might get a little distracting, but you still have you privacy.The International Marketplace next door is gone; being replaced by more upscale shopping (not sure if really needed, but its re-opening in August 2016). The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. If you decide to stay here, please look up Greg at the front desk. He is very helpful and always has a smile on his face.

Very good location just off the main shopping strip. nice rooms,our room was upgraded to a pool view. they had music by the pool every afternoon, good atmosphere. Would recumbent this hotel to friends and family

Close to the beach, restaurants etc. The hotel is nice and clean, but simple - not somewhere I would book if I was after a 'relaxing, don't want to leave the hotel' type of holiday. Staff were friendly. Pool and pool area was small, would be hard to get a spot by the pool each day (not that we tried, we went to the beach).

We stayed in a city view room over looking the construction of the old International Market on the 12th floor (room 1263). Noise was not an issue with the construction since most of it was completed and no work after 6pm. The location of the hotel was awesome, we were right across the street from the beach and paid half the price of the Hyatt which was right next door. Our room had a balcony with enough room for a table and two chairs. The hotel rooms are in need of renovation, but the size was fine for a family with two young children. We had a couple of issues during our stay, but each was dealt with promptly by the staff. Overall I would stay at this hotel again because of the location, price, and amenities available. Positives of the hotel:Location - close to beach, restaurants, shopping, grocery store, and anything else you might need or want.Swimming pool - even though it was not a heated pool it was still warm enough to swim in. I would say it was at least 78-80 degrees at the end of March.Lobby - was very inviting, had lots of areas for you to sit at and enjoy the breeze and have a ChiChi (which were delicious).Noise - or in our case lack of street noise in room 1263. Even with the construction and the busy street below we heard very little and no nose from the rooms next door.Staff - gentleman who does the kids activities was very friendly, restraunt and pool staff very prompt and friendly with service. Even with the amount of sand our children dragged in daily the cleaning staff made sure there everything was vacuumed and wiped clean. Bed - love their beds. I have difficulty sleeping on beds other than my one, but these were very comfortable and I was able to sleep through the night.Pricing - after a lot of research they had the best pricing for the location. The resort fee was very reasonable, it includes daily parking unlike other hotels which charges you separately for parking, wifi that worked well enough to stream videos, daily Kona coffee in the room, bottles of water daily and brought to you on the beach at certain times, towels and chairs to take to the beach, refrigerator in the room and safe in room. Negatives:Rooms are in need of a renovation, which I believe will be occurring this year. Pool closes at 7pm because of the nightly entertainment by the pool.Restaurant food was not worth the price. Even with a free voucher for a breakfast and dinner it was not good. The fresh cooked omelette were ok, but there is only a few items to choose from to put in the omelette. Pancakes were awful, boxed pancake mix is better than those served. Juice choices were good as were the choices of fresh fruit.Dinner buffet was so bad I didn't go back for seconds and I love to occasionally indulge at a buffet. The roast beef we had at a luau was better than the Prime Rib served, crab legs were not fresh as can be, sushi was very low quality, and whatever pasta dish they served one night was inedible. Dessert should be the best thing about a buffet and even that was a disappointment. They charge $42 per person for dinner and $24.50 for breakfast.

The hotel was booked for us our tour company who arranged the trip and cruise.The room was lovely and the air conditioning worked perfectly. We ate breakfast in the hotel a couple of days, the price was about average for a hotel but had quite a choice.What made this hotel though was the staff. They were all wonderful. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary while there and they treated to a surprise bottle of sparkling wine which was very kind of them. The concierge was very helpful in advising a nice restaurant and booking it for us.We very much enjoyed our stay and were sorry we had to leave. I suppose all good things must come to end!

I have stayed at the Sheraon Kaiulani several times and have a great time always, where else do the cocktail waitresses give you a hug the night before you check out. Hotel is a little dated but rooms are roomy and clean.We are not staying there this trip as wife is in a wheel chair and downtown Honolulu has brick sidewalks. Enjoy.....

Great hotel, fantastic location. Older hotel, full of wonderful staff. Lovely white towel , super great bed. Location perfect, we had twin beds 7th floor, pool below with a lovely ocean view. Yes the bathroom could be updated but would I return again, at a heart beat. Bill the concierge is the go to front man for dining out, save you the daily paper, get the correct bus.... You name it, Bill is the man.

This hotel is literally right across the street from Waikiki beach. It is close to everything from beach activities to shopping to dining to nightlife. You can walk anywhere in the Waikiki area from here so you dont need a car, buy if you have a car you can park for free because the daily parking fee is covered by your daily resort charge. The libby offers a variety of options and is an inviting area to join into activities like lei making, etc... There are a lot of large tour groups that stay here so I dont know how you feel about that. But the staff were delightfully friendly and very helpful. I will definitely stay here again (this is my 3rd time staying at this hotel). I feel that I get a good value for my hard earned money here.

This hotel is showing her age. It is in need of a remodel. But it was comfortable and clean. The property alone would get 3 stars but what they do for the SPG Platinum Members is what earned them their 4th Star. First, being a resort property they don't have to do 4PM late checkout. But what they do instead is have a block of just normal non-upgrade rooms that they will give you till whenever after you check out. This was awesome as my flight was at midnight. Secondly the gentleman that checked me in recognized that I was on business and gave me some parking tips for those purposes. They also give you a great free breakfast and you can even double up the coupons for dinner instead at the buffet. There aren't any hotels located good for business aside from the airport and most of those are crap. I will be staying here again next time I am on business.

The Sheraton Princess Kuilani is in a central spot in Waikiki.No hire car needed if staying here.The staff in every department are friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant buffet breakfast was its own worst enemy. Over priced for the food offered, although the omelette bar was great.Our room, on the 14th floor, was compact but clean and had a nice view of Waikiki beach, Diamond Head and the west coast mountain range. The daily room charge was a bit over the top and really not good value.The walls were very thin and giggling Japanese women next door were overhead all through the night.The hotel bar staff were amazing! Always ready with a smile and a perfectly made Mai Thai.If in a deal, this hotel is worth staying but beware of paying too much!

This Hotel is in a great location, very central to everything. Staff are lovely and very helpful. We stayed for 11 nights in Feb 2016. Had a Pool view room which was very roomy and very clean. Unfortunately, the walls of this hotel are SUPER thin. We could hear a normal conversation from the room next to us! YIKES.Most of the street noise was blocked out by the doors, which was good because there are sirens all the time down the strip! Laundry is good and not too expensive $3 for a wash and $3 for dryer and $2 for powder.WIFI was poor in our room, but ok in the Business Centre in lobby, which was a bit annoying late at night. The only other thing that was a bit annoying was the lack of easily placed power points to charge equipment with. Most of these were behind the drawers or tv and the others were in the bathroom.Buses to shopping etc are just down the road outside Dukes statue and the tour desk at the Hotel was very helpful and offered a wide range of tours at a reasonable price compared to the street vendors.

This hotel is located handy to eating places & shopping. No car required. Rooms are clean & service is of a high standard. Stayed in a corner room in the newer tower. Amazing views. There is a laundry in the basement which was handy.

The location is excellent. Convenient for shopping, sightseeing, Waikiki Beach and everything else. Guest rooms are comfortable but not upscale at all. It should be alright if you spend time here just to sleep. Room rates must be really low for wholesale, for most guests are Asian group tourists.

I read a lot of negative comments before staying at 'The Princess'. I was glad to find out that most were either a little unfair or from people that obviously expect way too much for the price.My wife and I stayed twice, before and after a cruise in January. Yes, the rooms are a little tired compared to a five star resort, but they were clean and comfortable! My only criticism is the resort fee, which I find to be a little expensive.So, if you want somewhere well priced with almost the perfect location, stay at The Princess.

I had to hold my breath the entire time I was anywhere near the elevators. The smell of musty rags, dirty dishwater and oil .... like the oil you use to fry food was present just past the pool and on to the elevator lobby. A horrible smell.

I found the location of this hotel it's greatest asset - it is centrally positioned and we could walk everywhere. The building we stayed in was positioned side-on to the beach, meaning we had lovely water and city views from our balcony. The rooms were fairly average size for hotel rooms. They were clean but we found the housekeeping a little hit-and-miss as everyday at least one item that had been used wasn't replaced/replenished eg. cups, water, inconsistent number of towels supplied etc.We didn't have any issues with construction noise as we were on the opposite side of the building. We could occasionally hear it, but not enough to bother us. I could imagine it would be much louder on the side overlooking the construction site.Every member of staff I encountered was very friendly and helpful - pretty much every person I encountered while in Hawaii was like this.I would stay there again based on it being a bit cheaper than other places around it, though it would be nice to see the hotel and pool area get updated. I can't wait to return to Hawaii with kids - I loved it and I am sure they will too.

One of the best and most convenient locations in Waikiki. Just across the road from the beach, and in the heart of Waikiki.The hotel lobby is amazing and there is always plenty of staff and things to do. The pool is great (would be nice if it stayed open a little longer than 7pm for evening swims). There is plenty of areas to sit and enjoy the wifi and watch sports on TVs. There is also a lot of pictures and items about Princess Kaiulani, which was a nice touch of history and information.We also watched the Polynesian show that was preformed in the small indoor stage, which was amazing. The fire twirler was my favorite part. The buffet was also amazing, with crab and sushi, plus plenty of other tasty dishes and deserts. Wait staff was good too, and kept the drinks coming.Tip: Sign up to the SPG group when you are at reception to get discounts on the hotel buffet. - we both signed up and got a free box of chocolate macadamia :)Our room was just what we needed: nothing too flash but enough to have an amazing night sleep, we stayed for 9 nights so we needed a comfy king bed every night and that's exactly what we got. There is a great little coffee machine in the room, and the TV and plenty of channels to choose from. We stayed during the Honolulu Festival and had a great view of the parade from our room too.Tip: bring pegs to hand your clothes on the balcony chairs as there is not enough balcony room to have a air drying rack.Next time I come to Hawaii I will definitely return and will recommend.

Our first visit to Waikiki and we stayed at this hotel. Our room overlooking the pool could have been too noisy but it wasn't. Lovely clean room, easy walking distance to the main area of Waikiki, nice pool and indoor/outdoor bar area. We checked out but our flight was not until late at night. A nice touch that they gave us a room for up for an hour to freshen up. Would certainly stay here again.

We had a great time at this hotel. We could walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had a balcony at 6th floor and had a great view of the ocean and some buildings - but it's Honolulu. I can recommend this hotel. Nothing special but the location is good.

This is our second stay at the princess and they have earned our loyalty through: good service, excellent location, hotel amenities (such as free parking, beach chairs, daily bottles of water and unlimited beach towels). I had called a few weeks previous to confirm the reservations and let them know it was a special birthday for my wife and reason for the trip and was floored when we had our room upgraded and a bottle of wine and treat basket waiting for us. The hotel is perfectly located across the street from the main beach at diamond head. It's literally 5 minutes from room to beach. Don't forget to check out towels and beach chairs from poolside big kahuna station. Sadly some comments trash this place for outdated carpets and other small things. My view is that my wife is not giving birth on the carpets so I don't care if they have a little wear to them or were popular in the 80s. Everything was clean and smelled nice and that keeps my wife (me) happy. The room was clean and serviced nicely daily. The wifi was great. My advice is since you are paying the resort fee, take full advantage of the things it pays for. The pool is lovely and gets good sun exposure during the day. We took advantage of the professional photographer (in the lobby). We had called a few places prior to our arrival for family pictures and the hotel service was way cheaper and what I liked best, they weren't pushy trying to make the sale. Other merchants sell stuff daily also in a non pushy manner. My son's favourite daily event was helping the staff feed the Koi fish. I highly recommend this hotel (unless you are a carpet enthusiast).

We visited the Sheraton PK over the Christmas-Ny period which is a very busy time of year in Waikiki. We arrived at night time so check in was fast and easy, once settled in the room we noticed the air con was broken but called reception and they fixed it within the hour. The location of this hotel is awesome, great for people who want an easy walk to and from the beach and sidewalk shopping. We had Christmas dinner at the hotel restaurant which was pleasant but was very expensive for a buffet ($59USD a head not incl drinks our bill came up around $430 for six people I think that was overpriced especially when you have to tip on top of this). Housekeeping was great and staff were super helpful when it came to ordering taxis and weighing bags! All and all this is a clean, comfortable hotel which has everything you need to enjoy your time in Waikiki.
user_name:
Sam H
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: First time at this hotel and was really happy with all aspects of my stay. Have been to hawaii many times and stayed at other hotels with more stars. .yet to me this was by far the best for the price. Clean, tidy and comfortable..i cant fault it . Staff were always helpful and courteous. So convenient , in the centre of Waikiki. Highly recommend this hotel for those on a budget. Will definitely be back and staying ay Princess Kaiulani ...

Stayed here for 7 nights in a Pool View room. Although our room wasn't ready when we arrived at midday we were guaranteed a 1pm checkin with the package we had booked. We had a lovely room on the 7th Floor towards the Diamond Head end and was high enough to see the ocean. Although the rooms are small and old they are clean and serviced daily. The Lanai's are very small and only just big enough for 2 people to sit on. We also used the Pool area and pool service which was excellent although the pool is a little fresh it was lovely and refreshing and not too cold at all. The resort fee of $25 USD per night per room is good value if you utilize all they offer such as the parking, wifi, beach services and 60 minutes of free international calls per day. We utilized the calls and wifi and got great service both in the room and in the public areas of the hotel. The show in the hotel at the moment is the Te Moana Nui show which is a very enjoyable 1 hour Polynesian performance with an amazing fire dance! Overall this hotel is clean and comfortable and very central to everything in Waikiki however the rooms are very tired,bathrooms outdated and walls pretty thin. The beds though are extremely comfortable and had a great nights sleep 7 nights in a row! I would recommend this hotel for its central location and very friendly staff.Had a lovely 7 nights at the Sheraton Princess.

Stayed at the hotel with my wife for 11 nights, great position across the road from the beach, excellent rooms, clean and everything you will need or require for your stay.One more really important point, really really comfortable bed.Was upgraded at the front desk on arrival, and all staff were helpful throughout our stay.I highly recommend this hotel for any type of stay in the paradise that is Hawaii.

The Hotel was clean, service was very good and food was good. We only stayed at the Princess for 3 nights but enjoyed the time there. First thing I found out was they charge to shuttle patrons to/from the hotel to airport which was new to us, maybe that is standard in Hawaii or we did not match the criteria of garnering a free shuttle ride, either way not a deal breaker. The hotel did provide a free bottle of champagne which was very nice of them and was greatly appreciated. We also were given a free portrait but unfortunately every time we stopped to set it up no one was at the desk and when someone was finally there they had to time available, bummer but not a deal breaker.the reason for the review was the outstanding service provided by Lei at the Splash bar and Grill. Here is a waitress that does her job at 10 all day long. Professional, Polite informative and just a great person. We did not spend all our time at the splash bar and don't get the wrong impression, but while the splash bar is pool side it is best to have your best employees attending to the patrons needs and she gets 2 thumbs up and a 10 on our rating. I hope management sees this and gives special attention to Lei because she deserves it. Thanks Lei If we come to Oahu, we will stayat the Princess Sheraton.

We stayed for five nights. Our flight was coming in late on a Tuesday evening and I had called the hotel ahead of time to let them know my group was coming in late. They were very understanding and ensured me that our rooms we had reserved would be held. I also had asked that my husband and I's room be close to my mom and sisters and that is what we got. We were on the same floor we were just an arms length away. We stayed on the 7th floor room 718 close to the elevators. They stayed in room 702. Although our room was close to the elevators we did not get a lot of traffic noise in the hallway at all. Our room was facing the pool, but from a distance you could see the ocean and beach. I would consider this more of a partial ocean view. Both rooms were like this. Overall I felt the room was very comfortable and clean. You could tell in the the bathroom it's starting to rust in some parts, and maybe it could use an update, but it was functional. The only thing we had a problem with was the safe in the room. For the first few days we were there we had no issues with it. The last couple of days we were there it wouldn't work. I tried several times to reset it but it still would not open. Finally called the front desk and someone came and opened it. We had it reset and tried again, (this time I took all of ours stuff out and kept it with my mother in her room safe) and it still remained shut. Could not open it even after resting it. All I have to say is be careful. Yes, I did know my secret pin/code to unlock it. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was close to everything and a block in and half from the beach. The resort fee that we paid included the beach towels and chairs to carry down to the beach. We would check them out by the pool and carry them down to the beach area. You had to have them back b y 6 pm. If you sat in a certain area down by the beach the hotel staff came down a few times during the day offering cold water and fruits, which I thought was a nice idea.  We loved the lobby of the hotel it was great. The daily breakfast we had could use a tune up. It was the same thing almost every time. The only thing they switched out was the potatoes from roasted potatoes to hash browns and from sausage links to another kind of sausage. The hotel staff were very nice and we never had an issue with them. Whenever we left our room and housekeeping was around they were always very friendly and nice. Overall our stay was nice. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others especially for the location.

We stayed at SPK for a week in February. Although it is one of the older hotels and a little dated it was clean, the staff friendly and was in a great location. I would give the hotel 3.5 stars out of 5 if there were the option. We had a room on the 10th floor overlooking the pool and the Moana Surfrider and it was lovely.

This is not about the great Beatles show, it's about the health concerns of the environment where the show is held. The furnishings in the lobby were stained, dirty. The show area was terrible. The stage looked bad, the air had that musty mold smell and after about 45 minutes I needed to get out, but the performers where great and I didn't want my exiting to be a reflection on their show. It was great. The next few days I have been suffering the effects of being in that unhealthy place for only 1 1/2 hours. So, Sheraton.... Spend some $$$, clean the lobby furnishings or replace them, place dehumidifiers in the show room and disinfect the room. Better for your guess, show goes, and especially the Beatles impersonators.

My husband and I stayed here at the end of our honeymoon in January 2016 when our flight home got canceled. We ended up having to stay 3 extra nights. We didn't want to completely blow out our budget so we chose the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The front desk staff are friendly and we were upgraded to a partial ocean view room on a high floor. The rooms are very dated, but clean. We had a balcony that overlooked the pool area and offered us a nice view of Waikiki beach. The building is old, but had gone through some renovations. One thing that has not been upgraded as far as I can tell, is the elevators. They are very slow and you can be waiting a long time. We took advantage of the beach amenities (beach chairs and towels and fresh fruit) and lounged at the pool one afternoon. This is not a beach-front property, but it is very close. There is only one option to eat within the hotel and it is a buffet and expensive. We never ate there. This hotel is very close to many great eating options in Waikiki. The only hiccup we had came on our last day. We had previously requested a late check out and when we got back to our room at 10:50am our key had already been recoded. I had to go down to the front desk, but since I was coming from the beach, I didn't have a photo ID, do we had to wait until security could let us back into the room. They apologized for the inconvenience, but said we should have come to the front desk that morning to get our key re-keyed. I think the system should have been able to be programmed to have our key work until our requested check-out time. Other than the one hiccup noted above, our stay was pleasant. It wouldn't be my first choice when we come back to Waikiki, but it suited our needs.

The worst room I have been in in Hawaii. Room was small, out of date, dirty and furnishing were scraped and fallowing apart. During stay desk didn't help, e-mailed hotel and got no response. Later e-mailed G M, he didn't response to any of my concerns and gave me a few points and didn't want to be bothered with me.

Checkin efficient but even though our friends checked in a little earlier and were told we were on the same floor, when we arrived we were booked into a room 6 floors away. Good side view of Waikiki beach from our small balcony. Room has safe, air con, and the beds were great. The bathroom is very tiny and tired looking. Small fridge and coffee machine and while the hotel is getting very dated the room was very clean. Did not like the pool area at all as it is just off reception and a thoroughfare for guests going to the beach and shopping. Towels and beach chairs are available FOC and water and fruit is taken regularly throughout the day over to the beach for distribution to guests. All in all an enjoyable stay.

Stayed for 8 days in Feb/ March. Amazing service from the moment we arrived. We arrived at about 8am and was offered a hospitality room. Received a box of chocolates and a fruit basket in our room on the first night. Our room was spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 kids. Had a pool view room which overlooked the stage so the kids could watch the nightly entertainment from the balcony. The girls had a hula lesson and made a bracelet in the lobby. Everyone was very nice and helpful. I can't say enough nice things about this hotel. Can't wait to come back.

Went there with my 2 kids and mum and dad found the location awesome rooms were clean and tidy my m um took me to this wonderful place and cou ld not fault it go Id customer service dreamcome true the only downfall was the construction going on but h ou ignore it after a wil

This is the second time we have stayed at the Princess Kaiulani in 6 months and it was just as great as the first time.This trip we stayed in a pool view room at it was nice and comfortable, it was high enough that we also got a view of the ocean.I would highly recommend this style of room it was quiet and of a night time you can relax on the balcony and was the entertainment on the stage next to the pool.

We had a very high balcony room overlooking the pool - it was excellent as you had a sea view as well from that height. The pool was good but busy and the nightly outside entertainment was good as well.

Overall I thought this hotel was fantastic. We had a great time there. Breakfast before 7am outside in November and good standard of food. Just one blip and that was a cockroach in the communal area downstairs and the bellboy looked at me as if to say 'So what?' Nice room, good staff, great place. April 2015 is furthest back Trip Advisor would let me select, but this is a much older holiday from the 90s.

The hotel is quite old, but don't let that stop you from enjoying it's central location and very friendly staff. We arrived very early in the morning and check in isn't until 3pm so were so happy when we were offered a room to shower and change in prior to our rooms being ready. Having laundry facilities at the hotel was another big plus and it wasn't expensive. The tour desk staff were very knowledgeable and did not steer us wrong. 10 days of being looked after was easy to take

My room was very pleasant. The hotel location was convenient, there was a nice view from a sweet little balcony, the bed linens were clean and crisp with comfy pillows, and the TV had my favorite channels. :) The $26.18 amenity fee covered self-parking in the garage, which you do not frequently find in this area, so definitely a plus. However, there was an issue there that made me distrust the staff. Upon my arrival, the valet who met me in my car said there was no elevator to the tower, so he'd arrange for my bag to be taken to my room. Ok, no big deal--I'd expected to give him a tip anyway for watching my car while I was registering. The next day I discovered he had lied to me about the presence of an elevator. As I was driving up the floors in the garage I saw a big sign showing the way to elevator access to my building. Seriously! This made me pretty distrustful of this place as they clearly are more interested in taking advantage of their guests to the point of lying rather than serving the guests' best interests. So, feel free to stay here if you like--it's nice enough and convenient in many ways. But be advised that the staff may do shady things in order to squeeze more money from you.

Older property in the middle of a refurbishment, hence excellent value for money. Very little disturbance from renovations going on during the time we were there. The newly renovated communal area look fabulous, but rooms still in need of modernistion but this is a "work in progress" at current time. Rooms on higher floors have better views, but lots of wind noise at night.

Was very concerned to read the awful reviews re the Sheraton Princess, so I emailed the hotel with my concerns. Was responded to by Robert P who allayed my concerns, and ensured that we got a nice quiet room. Both myself and my wife are disabled, but the staff were wonderful, accommodating and the room was clean and serviced by Belinda everyday. We would definitely stay here again, even had a view of the beach from our pool view room, just brilliant.

Throughly enjoyed my visit to the Princess K. She is in the best location, across from the Moana Surfrider and Waikiki Beach. Food buffett was fantastic and everything was in easy walking distance. Staff were typical of the Hawaiian hospitality - friendly and would do anything for you. What really stands out for me is the location, views of the headland and the beach. Our room was great, nothing lacking there, lifts were plentiful. Don't have one complaint. It was very relaxing and yes I did 'let it go'. Taking my daughter back in November.

We stayed at the Princess from the 14th to the 22nd of Feb 2016.This motel is a three star motel and is perfect for the unpretentious traveller or you could also insert here, the mad Australian traveller visiting an American state with a poor Australian dollar exchange rate.The motel is within a stones through of the main Waikiki beach, that close that the sand is still wet on your feet by the time you get to your room.Rooms are dated but clean and well serviced. The pool is huge and a great place to relax after a hard day shopping. The staff are all helpful and happy as are most of the locals we met in Waikiki.The first think you must do is a trip on the local trolleys, US$20 hop on hop off all day to get your bearings, I would suggest you do the Blue line then the Pink line.Mahalo

Great view of the beach even in our pool view room, great housekeeping, friendly staff, positioning in Waikiki was brilliant, very impressed of how close it was to the beach. Yes the bathroom were old but you're not in Waikiki to use bathrooms. Thanks Sheraton!

Stayed for a week recently for a conference. Cost is cheaper than other hotels due to special conference rate. Overall experience is very good. Friendly staffs at check in and cleaning staffs too. Even though I didn't ask for housekeeping, I did request for water and towels from the cleaners and she was always pleasant to deal with. Had the partial ocean view on the high floor son that was a bonus. The hotel does need upgrading as all the furnishing in the room are dated and a little run down for a Sheraton brand compared to Hyatt Regency across the street. Elevators also need upgrading as the wait is long during peak hours. The other odd thing is that the restaurant always smell of fish, something should really be done about this. There is nightly entertainment so one can just enjoy the music by the pool. Location is great, right in the middle of Waikiki.

Stayed there last week, very good hotel, great location, rooms clean but on small side (your in Hawaii and not spending the day in room so who cares). We were booked as a standard city view, asked for a beach view and were upgraded no charge. They will if they can. Read mixed reviews about this property but there is nothing wrong with it. Its in a great location right in the middle of the action, there is construction on the opposite side but the noise is not that bad (unless facing it from your room, get out and enjoy the beach and the island). would stay there again and would recommend to anyone. It does cost less than other properties and is not as fancy but a very good home base for visiting Waikiki and Oahu.

I have stayed at the Hilton previously. It is a little far out. The Sheraton is not it has a prime location. Just a tab bit out dated considering we could of got a house rental for around the same price, Which is true for other hotels as well. They had a lovely little pool and sitting area. I enjoyed the whole trip and surrounding areas.

I booked this hotel 5 days before i checked in. I called shareton a day before i checkedin and they told me no reservations. I spent 2 days to chase this reservation but at the end getaroom only can put me 2 stars hotel with the rate i paid for sheraton. I have to cancel it. Very disappointed on this reservation. I will never use this service again.

We have loved staying here and Herb down in the bar has a great personality and my husband and I have enjoyed talking to him when we go down. The rooms are nice and clean. We have not eaten at this hotel so don't know much about the food.

We chose this hotel from a package deal as it fited in with our budget. We were not disapointed. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated in a central location and short stroll to the beach. The room was well appointed and had the most comfortable bed on the planet.The room was serviced daily to a high standard.We were given a welcome basket of fruit, nuts and drinks which was just lovely.Our housekeeper gave us a little flower and card.We had a partial ocean view. This was great because as we discovered, if you have a full ocean view, you have the afternoon sun directly on the balcony which would have been very hot. Try to get a room on the pool side of the hotel as there is a major construction happening on the other side.Would definately recomend this place to either couples or families. Be prepared for some noise at night when street performers are playing. Some arrive at midnight.Note to manager: please put some heating in the pool. Soooooo cold.

We stayed here in October 2015 for a conference and I must admit I spent more time working then enjoying the hotel amenities. But when I had time to relax, I thoroughly enjoyed our balcony overlooking the pool area, accompanied by an ocean peak. Each night music was provided and we would sit out on our balcony and relax. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and staff were friendly. This is a great location if you enjoy people-watching and walking about Honolulu. I'd definitely stay here again.

The wife and I stayed here for 7 wonderful nights. We had a pool view room and every evening we would sit out on our balcony and listen to the Hawaiian music being played by the pool side usually with an accompanying dancer. The room was one of the larger hotel rooms we have stayed in. The hallways outside the rooms were dated but once inside the room it was reasonably modern. The hotel is a short walk to the beach. Also it was very convenient to the Cheesecake Factory and Jimmy Buffett's with Hard Rock Cafe a pleasant stroll up the road.

Really happy with the service we received during our 3 night stay. Large comfortable bed and excellent location. We had the buffet meal one evening which we would recommend. Would definitely stay again!

The staff was always friendly great beds and excellent staff. Anytime I go back I stay here. Better yet is the pool. It's outdoors and is on the ocean side what can be better than that. Location makes it great as well with all the restaurants and it sits in the heart of waikiki. Get up early and take a walk on the beach and watch the sun rise

We had a great 9 days in Hawaii staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani we were on the 4th floor with pool view rooms.With connecting room for our daughter and granddaughter the beds were good and the room clean every morning .Close to everything and not far to walk to beach or restaurants we would recommend this property in Hawaii for a holidays.

Stayed here twice before in 2012 and 2009 and will again this April. Fantastic location, rooms fine if a little outdated but we'll worth staying here. Cheesecake factory across road which is also a plus! Do they still have the free pineapple each day?

Stayed here for 6 nights, rooms are pretty average they look alright on the photos but they need new carpet and paint, the balcony area is poor and needs renovations also, the bed was comfy though it didnt have the usual split in the middle, the pool isnt anything special and the food downstairs at the bar is average also, the location is great u just walk outside and your on the main strip.I forget the guys name but if you go downstairs to the lobby theres a guy there who helps you book things like pear harbour, he was really nice and helpful and helped us out alot with things like that.Also got a huge shock when we were checking out when they told us there was a $25us a night 'resort fee' it was my first time in the states so i didnt no they did this in some of the hotel chains, i asked what was it for because i had already paid for the room in advance and the manager told me you paid for the room and services but not the resort, he went on to explain that this fee was for things like the telephone to make international calls which was annoying because we were using our mobile to call back home to Australia @ $1au a minute,it was also for car parking and some other things which we didnt use at all but still got charged $150us at check out.I wouldnt recommend this hotel and wont be returning here.

I got to the hotel and found out I was up graded like before and the staff remembered me from the year before I had a great room facing Waikiki beach 26 fl the room was clean and very very comforble the hotel is in the hart of everything abc stores at the hotel the morning buffet had every thing it's worth the money and lunch at bar I enjoyed I found my self eating at hotel it was always good and fresh I will be back for years to come .and thanks to Gregg at the frount desk he helped all my request happen super nice guy very profeslnal .

I've stayed here 3 times. The rooms may need a little updating but the location and overall hotel is great otherwise. I love having the convenience of a parking station nextdoor though you do have to pay for that in resort fees. They do an amazing thanksgiving meal there.

Stayed for 8 nights at the beginning of Feb 16. This was our first trip to Hawaii and the US. We found that the room very well presented, clean and tidy. The hotel it self is old but well maintained. From our pool view room we could also see the ocean and palm trees at the beach. The hotel is in the middle of Waikiki and within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants. The only complaint would be the extra US$26.18 charge per day for Internet, local phone calls and 2 bottles of water.

We have just returned from our 40th Visit to Honolulu. For the last 20 visits we have been staying at this magnificant Hotel - Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The staff here are just so helpful - especially Alex in the Reservations department. As soon as we have booked our Flights we contact Alex and request our "usual" Room. In no time at all Alex replies to our request that we have this room. The Hotel is situated in a perfect location - close to the Waikiki beach, shops all around, great restaurant and bar and little market in the mornings at the Hotel. Lovely swimming pool and music by the pool at night. Thoroughly recommend this Hotel.

What a fabulous hotel. We had a pool room view. The room was clean, the decor perfectly fine. Central to everything you could possibly want from a hotel. Will definitely recommend to everyone visiting Waikiki. Thank you Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a lovely place to stay and enjoy our first visit to Hawai'i.

Room was clean and staff was great. Very close to the beach, and had good restaurants close by and within walking distance. The lobby and grounds were clean and very nice looking. We had a late flight out (9:00pm) and they had a room where we could store our luggage all day after we checked out. They also had a room where we could lounge, shower, etc had we wanted to but didn't use. This was great as we didn't have to worry about our luggage as we enjoyed our last day. I would definitely stay there again our next time in Honolulu. I felt it was a very good value. BTW...we stayed at the Sheraton Kona on the Big Island prior to coming to Oahu and were very impressed with that as well. Good job Sheraton. Regards, Kris and Ron

We needed a hotel for our last night in Hawaii- we had a busy schedule, so we just needed a place where we could sleep before leaving early the next day. I had read mixed reviews of this place, and was a little worried, but there was no reason for my concern. The front desk staff was wonderful. Yes, the hotel decor could use some updating, but it was clean and comfortable, and after a day of sightseeing and an evening at a luau, we didn't really care about the color scheme. We were there on a Saturday night, and I was surprised to see that the construction site was in full operation, early Sunday morning, but we were high up so we didn't even hear the noise. It was interesting to watch. If we ever make it back, I'd love to stay in the same room to see the completed project. The resort fee included parking and breakfast, which was fantastic. It also included some pictures and other things, but we weren't there long enough to take advantage of those things.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were very excited to stay at this property. Upon entering our room, however, it was like we were back in the 1970s. The room was very, very outdated and run down. The lobby carpet was also extremely worn and frayed and the whole property just had that feeling of having seen better days. The staff was very friendly, however, and they put us in a slightly better room for a small upgrade fee when I requested it. I heard talk of renovations and certainly hope this hotel does them soon because it is in dire need of it. If you are staying in Honolulu, I would look around for a more updated hotel because it is not as if this place is dirt cheap.

This is the fourth time I've stayed at this hotel. Even though the rooms are a bit outdated the location of this hotel makes up for it all. Right next door to Macy's, loads of great restaurants and just across from the beach. I would recommend getting a high ocean view room to get the best view. On our return stay here we stayed in the ocean view rooms and there wasn't a lot of difference aside from the room being slightly larger. The main difference is the traffic through the hotel. The ocean view rooms have a separate lift tower and it is so lovely not to have to wait for the lift. The main tower gets incredibly busy and often have to wait for the lift and cram in with a lot of people. The pool area has a great atmosphere as does the lobby. Rooms are clean and staff are very helpful. This is a very popular hotel!

We have visited twice in 2 years and love this hotel! Yes it needs some refurbishment and currently is next to a building site ( but you cant blame the hotel for that!), but the rooms were clean and the bed very comfortable! The rooms had everything you would need! The staff were lovely! Nothing was a problem for them! Always called you by your name in the restaurant and bars. Service was good! AND every time you came into the hotel we were welcomed home! A lovely touch! Breakfast a bit expensive and slightly disappointing on choice not quality and quantity! Limited choice for American/ European tastes eg no cooked tomatoes, hash browns. Baked beans or mushrooms for the cooked breakfast! But the evening meal.....wow.... Excellent price to get a fresh crab, beef, and a variety of lovely food buffet! The soup delicious and the deserts to die for! The meals at the bar were also good! The local raw fish dish beautiful! And a good price for drinks! At the end of our stay we checked out but had a late flight! The lady on the desk told us to enjoy the resort - we got towels for the beach and pool! Free wifi and then access to a room to freshen up! We also access our cases at any time and never felt that we were pestering the bell boys- who are soooooo lovely! The concierge (unfortunately i cant remember her name) was fantastic!! She was helpful with giving us directions to places and advice on other things! Nothing was too much trouble! Tommy on the tour desk was also brill and he recognised us from two tears ago! Now thats service! So if you want a hotel that that is aesthetically perfect but doesn't care about its customers then this isn't the hotel for you! BUT if you want a hotel that treats its customer with respect is friendly, clean and goes out of its way to make your stay in Honolulu special then book into the Sheraton Princess Kaiuliani.

Stayed for 1 night on way to the big island. Great position with restaurants and beach a short stroll. Got upgraded to ocean view which was nice but being back 1 street from beach only got a glimpse of ocean. Very friendly staff and couldn't be more helpful. The room is older style but more that comfortable with a decent bed and bathroom, not 5 stars but clean and adequate. A small lanai was nice to sit and relax with a drink. Ate a meal poolside which was good and the service was quick and smart, which was appreciated after being awake for so long after a 10 hour flight. The entertainment of hula dancing and singing was fantastic and was great to watch while eating my meal.Had a couple of swims in the pool which was refreshing after the flight. All in all if you are looking for a 5 star hotel this is not for you but if you are after good 3.5 stars in an older style hotel which is close to everything this is not a bad place at all.

I stayed here over Christmas and New Year and had such a wonderful time. The staff were really friendly - they let us into our room as early as they could after our overnight flight, and were super helpful with booking things for us. They were really friendly, giving plenty of complementary water, fruit and other snacks. They were also really helpful booking us in for the Christmas dinner at the last minute.The location is phenomenal and is right across the road from Waikiki beach. All we had to do is cross the road and we were right on the sand ready to go!The hotel is also incredibly close to all the shopping in Waikiki, including food and all the fun things you could want to buy.I would definitely recommend the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani!

I booked this hotel thinking it was on the beach, so when I got there I had no idea there was two Sheratons. The rooms were old and moldy smelling. The hotel staff was great. The downstairs lobby was nice, the pool was nice.I wish I liked the hotel better but it was overpriced for $200 a night. I could have got a best western room nicer for cheaper. In all fairness the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet and very cool. I did like hanging out on the balcony at night.

The first time I stayed at this hotel I had a wonderful room that could see the ocean. It was big and clean and well kept. Although this time it is the opposite. I imagine they keep this room for the maid who gets too drunk to go home one night. The last time I was here they offered a free upgrade and breakfast with my American Express Platinum which they no longer do with american express( so you platinum members take note). Lastly the women at the desk informed me that I was upgraded a little bit.....well if that is so then I can only imagine the dumpster they were about to put me in. When thining about this hotel I recommend not. stay at the sheraton waikiki. Its a much nicer establishment with more to offer.Oh and before I forget the hotel restaurant is well over priced.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in the Ainahau wing (which I believe is primarily for large groups and tours). I was visiting for a work event and had a room on a high floor with a partial ocean view. The hotel is not on Waikiki Beach but a bit inland on the other side of the main street called Kalakaua Ave (it's a short 5 min walk to the beach). The lobby has the pool area and main restaurant right there with a few conferences room at the furthest end. It's nice but nothing that says wow, welcome to Hawai'i. Check-in was quick and smooth though the Ainahau elevators notoriously always had a line at the peak hours (checkin time, after lunch, after dinner). And were packed to the brim - they felt old and would just stop (return to the lobby) if more than 6 floors were pressed! Imagine being in the elevator and coming back to the lobby instead of getting to your room :( The hotel floors and the room itself feel very old and worn out. It was clean but old. The room and bathroom were very basic - and again the fixtures and furniture felt like the original 70's decor. Customer service was warm and friendly. Decent hotel for families. I wish it's renovated / redone soon.

We stayed here for 10 days in a pool view room on the 3rd floor. The room was spacious clean and comfortable. The pool was great. The service at the restaurant and bar was fantastic and staff all very friendly and helpful. Great location across the road from Waikiki beach. Very good value for money

We spent a week in Las Vegas to see the New year in before flying to Honolulu for two weeks in the warm. We loved this hotel as soon as we arrived. Very good parking (included in resort fee) with disabled parking on third floor with immediate lift access to reception.The hotel rooms are large with all you need, comfortable bed, safe, fridge, with a view of the pool and outside entertainment.What I particularly liked was how open it was, you did not feel hemmed in when sitting at the Splash bar or the pool area. The bar staff were brilliant, efficient and friendly and always ready for a chat and providing free popcorn! The food at the bar was very good and at a reasonable price as were the cocktails. Visited a number of other hotels but felt the Princess was the one for us. Would certainly stop here if we go again.

We just got home from staying at this hotel, and needed to tell everyone about this hotel. It was amazing, clean, close to everything that we needed and wanted (beaches, zoo, aquarium, stores and restaurants) and the staff were really friendly too.I read on other reviews about the noise from the near-by construction sites bothering people, but we had absolutely no problems with this at all. Next time we are there, we will be staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani again.

I stayed in 1550 for a conference. This room has a balcony with a beach / pool view: while other conference-goers who got rooms next to elevators reported rooms plagued with a nonstop metallic clang (1548), mine was quiet and had good light-block curtains. The room temperature was comfortable.The breakfast buffet had broiled salmon, omelettes, broiled white fish, and hard boiled eggs. The omelette chef is amazing, but even with her speed, the line can be long. Most of the carbs are highly refined: white rice, sweet pastries, french toast, pancakes, etc. There is miso soup with a selection of add-ins (tofu, scallion, natto, e.g.). The cut fruit was fresh and thoughtfully cut (small enough to fit in the tongs): standard selection + papaya, for a tropical twist.Major caveat: the elevators are extremely slow. Allot 15 minutes for an up-down trip: sometimes you luck out and three in a row come, but usually you have to wait; moreover, elevators that stop at the lobby close quite aggressively -- if you don't get in them right away, they'll be whisked away to another floor before you can hit the up button to call one again. I have avoided returning to my room (to get something, e.g.) because the elevators could be so slow.Check-in was smooth and the desk was happy to send toothpaste up for me, which was much appreciated. My room key stopped working one evening, and I was able to call the front desk for help: a security person came promptly (he must've lucked out with the elevators) and got me a new key.It's a good room, but I wouldn't pay these prices myself. (Many colleagues staying another day switched to the Hyatt nearby.)

This is the third time we have chosen to stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.This is a great hotel with great staff and ideal location for sun surf and shopping.Entertainment abounds all day long.Anyone wanting an Hawaiian experience won't be disappointed by choosing the Princess.Always love it there.

My wife and I stayed at the PK in a pool view room on a MyHawaii deal from Australia and I must say it was better than expected. We were allocated room 408 in the Princess Wing, overlooking the pool with a great view of the stage for each night's entertainment (the stage view from some rooms on levels 2 and 3 may be impeded by foliage). We even had a small view of the ocean. Each evening's entertainment poolside was different but all very pleasant as we had our dinner on the balcony (lanai). The room itself was comparatively large with a huge king size bed, large flat screen TV, a Kona coffee machine, iron and ironing board. Minimal noise from the Main Street. The furniture was "beachy" - just what we expected in Waikii! The room was very clean and well-serviced daily in the afternoon. There was an ice machine on our floor, which was very convenient. The balcony was in shade in the morning, in sun in the middle of the day and then in shade late in the afternoon, which was great. The fridge was the coldest we had experienced at any hotel and large enough for an evening bottle of wine and breakfast goodies from the adjacent ABC shops and street markets. The bath was low-set which meant easy access to the fully adjustable shower. The safe was also quite large and easy to use. Unexpectedly, we were given a lovely fruit basket compliments of the hotel on the first morning. Plenty of lounges under umbrellas poolside. There is a laundromat (washers and dryers) for $3 a load in the basement, with a small sitting area. The resort fee of $26.18 covers parking (we didn't need it), wifi, daily water, phone calls (including 1 hour to Australia every day), beach towels, beach chairs and fruit & water in the Sheraton section of the beach. Our SPG membership gave us discounts off meals at the PK, Moana and Sheraton Waikiki. We did not hear any noise from the construction next door and the PK is an easy level walk to most things in Waikiki. The staff were very pleasant and obliging always. This was our fourth trip to Waikiki and the first to the PK - we found it very relaxing and a lovely place to stay.

Our first time staying in Waikiki could not have been better thanks to the beautiful ocean view room we had and the friendly service from the staff. Whilst our level 12 tower corner ocean view room was a little older it was immaculate and the view we had from our bed and the balcony of the ocean was breathtaking. This is also one of the only hotels that offers free parking in Waikiki which saved us a lot. The dinner buffet was what you expect from a good buffet (we ate here on NYE) with a never ending amount of fresh seafood being brought out from the kitchen. We look forward to visiting again!

Once upon a time, this hotel was at the far end of Waikiki hotels but now it's in the middle of everything due to area's expansion and sprawling. Even though they charge resort fee, this is not a real resort where you want to spend your vacation time at, but a place to sleep during your Waikiki vacation, Convenient for shopping, dining and to beach. Full of Japanese, Chinese, and Korean group tourists. The facility and decor are basic and decently clean, not upscale or luxurious.
