I was there with my son and 13yr old granddaughter The first room we stayed in was old and smelt like vomit after complaining Than we packed up everything and moved to another room to find it had one King size bed Than finally getting a comfortable room which was acceptable For our troubles the manager gave us 1 free breakfast for two when there is 3 paying adults. Than after settling into this room a couple of nights later around 11:30 pm we discovered the ceiling was leaking quite a lot near lights. After being moved once again late at night. We were not given any apology no compensation for the way we were inconvenienced The Manager did not contact us or attempted to contact us The way we were treated was disgustingWe will not be returning to this hotel Also wifi is dreadful

I had little expectations arriving here in waikiki as I havnt been back to Hawaii in 25 yrs ... From the moment I arrived I was greeted with genuine smiles and efficient service ! We were able to get into our room early big benefit after a big flight . Great room the Best beds ever !!!!! Can I just say the cleaning staff are very friendly and have lots of local knowledge so big thanks to you . Great nightly entertainment around the pool awesome coctaiks .All in all a very pleasant relaxed atmosphere great for all types of travellers a real gem !! I'll be back maholo !!

Nice lobby and pool area. Great location. But very rundown and presently being re done. Our floor filled with construction workers by 7:00 AM. Lots of dust and noise so not up to Sheraton standards. Was amazed at the condition of the balconies that were being re finished - crumbling edges. Can't see how a hotel can let it get to this state.They also have the audacity to charge a resort fee which is basically a surcharge. Very disappointing for a Sheraton Hotel. Best thing was the friendly staff.

We stayed for a week I early sept and had a fantastic time. We had a pool room view on the 7th floor of the Priness wing. We could also see the ocean from our room which was a nice surprise..My only negative from our stay would be the resort fee that is compulsory and is basically a fee to cover the cost of using the wifi. As the majority of places these days have free wifi this seems to be an additional cost that could be waived. The hotel pool closing at 7pm is also a problem as most families with young children use this facility and with the weather being so warm it is constantly being used. I know my children were very disappointed that it closed at that time.I did also request a inter connecting room prior to our arrival as one of my children had to share with my parents but we were not able to get one.

This is by far the raggediest hotel I have EVER seen and they have the nerve to charge ridiculous prices for the pealing wallpaper, outdated EVERYTHING (fixtures, furniture, elevator, EVERYTHING), horrible smell, and obnoxious "entertainment". Sadly, I was told I was upgraded - which really makes me wonder what kind of room I had before the "upgrade"....the lobby is nice but it seems as if they ran out of money after renovating it. Very nice location but completely raggedy rooms and bathrooms! And the wifi doesn't work regardless of what they try to tell you the "password" is.

Ok so this is a tired old Princess, she has seen the neighbourhood grow and develop into a densely built up metropolis .. But.. It is well maintained, clean and comfortable. For the price, it can't be beaten. There is a nice pool, bar, nightly entertainment, buffet restaurant, gift shop and 24hr desk. Our room was a twin and comfortably accommodated us and our shopping!! The location is the key to this place, it's right in the heart of the shopping and dining area and just a hop to the beach.. The staff were helpful and efficient. The rooms and patios are fine but really, to be honest, the bathrooms are just plain old and in dire need of a make over. They are not manly and offensive just very old and dated. The only real negative was the resort fee of USD 27 a day per room for towels, water and s fruit bowl. This was steep! Overall a very happy stay.

I was booked for high floor ocean view, and opened my curtain (which had holes in it) and saw another hotel complex and then had a sliver of ocean view cranking my neck to the right. The description wasn't as expected. Now for the food - $16 dollars for pancakes is robbery, $3.00 tray fee, why am I being charged for a tray? And 18% gratuity - insane! I don't get tipped for going my job, why would you think a person delivering breakfast should get that much of a tip? And to wash clothing they charge $3.00 per load and $3.00 per load to dry. I felt robbed.

Love Love this hotel and will definitely be staying there again. Was in Oahu for a short vacation and always like to stay in different hotels each trip but I think I've found the place I want to stay from now on. Wish I gotten the name of the young gentleman that checked me in, he was so nice and personable. I had been upgraded to a POV room and I can't begin to tell you how great the room was. The bedding and pillows were to die for, best nights sleep in quite a while. The room was spotless, kudos to the housekeepers. Everyone that I came in contact with exuded the Aloha Spirit. Excellent location. Thank you Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a great stay. I'd give you 10 stars if I could instead of 5 .

This hotel is a block or so from the beach, in a great location along the main drag. We could see the ocean from our hotel room, and walked to Waikiki beach to splash in the ocean. The lobby is open air, centered around a standard looking pool. I do take issue with the elevators-no air conditioning, though it was a relatively short ride, if we were lucky enough to go straight to our 26th room floor without a crowd of other people, the hot box made me dizzy and nauseous. The rooms are pretty standard, but whoever cleans the rooms did awesome- my mom must have brought the whole beach with her one day and left tons of sand everywhere, the room cleaners made the room like new. We didn't try the Pikake restaurant, we weren't tempted, you could smell it every time you walked in the lobby and towards the tower elevators, if you like seafood and a Japanese flavors you might find it appealing. They do include parking with the resort fee, with unlimited in/out privilege, which is totally worth it if you're renting a car (most other hotels charge $15-25/day on top of the resort fee!).

I’m a huge fan of low-stress travel and the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani made my stay in Waikiki effortless. From booking to check-in to check-out, everything went well. The ease of everything enhanced my trip. Here’s what I loved: 1. The room – well appointed, balcony with a south facing view, 42-inch flat screen high def TV, private, small fridge, desk and a full-size dresser. 2. Wi-Fi – decent internet speed was accessible everywhere on the property. 3. The location!!! The hotel is caddy-corner from Waikiki Beach. This means the hotel is next door to the best shopping in the Hawaii, and about a 200 – 300-foot walk to Waikiki Beach sand and water. 4. Outside services – the pool and outside services are in front on the hotel but surrounded by tropical gardens, walls, and a black lava koi pond. The outside team assists with the pool, but more importantly you can check out then take your towel and a foldable chair to the beach. This process was really easy, and there was never a wait. We changed are towels 5. The lobby of the hotel is expansive and Lanai style so you constantly get to feel that warm Hawaii air. 6. The pool is warm and clean and there are plenty of chairs. I really liked how the pool had a real deep end that was over 8 feet. 7. My wife and I work out almost daily so having a real gym was awesome. They had high-end treadmills, ellipticals, weight machines, but what I thought was great is that not a lot of hotels have, is free weights. 8. Water! The hotel has a water dispensing service that is sourced from an artisan well off-site. We were able to fill up our water bottles with delicious Hawaiian spring water, so we saved a ton of money on not buying bottled water – we also received 2 complimentary bottles in our room per day. 9. The Elevator – my wife loved this; the elevator close door button works! As soon as you push button or select a floor the doors close and you’re on your way. We probably saved 30 minutes over the course of our trip by never having to wait on our elevator. 10. Parking – parking was convenient and included in our resort fee. The parking is not on the main street that goes up it down, it along with the formal entrance is on a side street which means getting in and out is a lot less stressful. 11. Communication – I communicated with the hotel via email, over the phone, and on Social Media. Every communication was prompt, and courteous. Because they were so attentive on Social Media when I was trying to decide where to stay, I chose this hotel. Shootout to Esther for making this happen. My stay here was fabulous, and pricing was so much less than adjacent properties, and there was so much more included in terms of services than a condo rental. It was a real resort experience, with all the amenities and convenience that comes with it. The only downside is that I didn’t have more time to stay there (we were only in Hawaii for one week), but two weeks or ten days even at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani would have made this Hawaii trip even better. I can’t wait to come back!

We were only on Oahu for 2 nights for a college tour of UH before going over to the Big Island for our real vacation. Wanted to be close to the ocean and restaurants but more importantly was the price. You really can't beat this budget friendly hotel because of it's location.....just across the street to Waikiki beach and close to good food. It is an older hotel and the rooms show that but they are clean and comfortable. It's not anywhere near luxury but that wasn't what we were looking for. The nightly poolside entertainment is really enjoyable. Highly recommend.

This is a lovely hotel. It's got a tropical and breezy flavor. It's not fancy or stuffy. It's what beachy Waikiki is suppose to be. And even more, the staff is excellent.We had some great people helping us today: Erin at the front desk, Kaley in the patio restaurant and Justin, also at the front desk. Everyone was helpful and pleasant. But Justin went above and beyond his job description. He is personable, professional, intelligent and an excellent guest relations host for the hotel. The General Manager, Frederick Orr, is savvy in the choice of his staff. They are a tribute to his good management skills. Definitely go to the Sheraton Princess if you want a laid back and hassle-free holiday in Waikiki.

A pleasent hotel with friendly staff, who were very serviceminded. The rooms were nice and clean, and the size was ok. And the hotel has a ok location. The pool at the hotel was ok pool, and furthermore a good restaurant at the poolside. A good service is, that we could lend beach chairs for free.. A good pool and at poolside

We stayed here from 9-9-15 to 9-15-15 while on vacation for our 40th wedding anniversary.The manager of the hotel had a bucket of champaign for us in our room to celebrate ou anniversary. This hotel is beautiful and very clean. The room was very clean and we were on the 10th and had a HIGH OCEAN VIEW room. You could see right down Waikiki Beach looking towards Diamond Head, I would recommend this hotel it close to everything to want to see. It is a trip we will never forget.

From the moment we arrived, Erin at reservations had it all under control. Erin was on top of our anniversary, the location of our incredible room with an awesome view of the ocean, amenities, and a few terrific offers that we were able to consider during our wonderful stay.

First the pros:- If you get a room with an ocean view it's absolutely lovely. The balconies are large and feel private. In the evening, when there is a band playing pool-side below, you don't want to leave. - staff is very friendly and very accommodating.- great location As for the cons:- I think your experience of this hotel will greatly depend on the room you get. Ours had updated linens but otherwise needed a major refresher. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the ceiling had water stains, and our bathroom could have definitely used some fresh, no moldy grout. Beside the entrance to our door someone had written on the wallpaper with a sharpee and there didn't seem any effort to remove it. - I think the rooms good use a bit better cleaning or perhaps supervision. A wipe down of the outdoor seating would have been nice. Our tv and lamps were also really dusty and the carpet was in pretty bad shape. - The room across from us ordered room service on night and left their plate in the hall that same night. It was not picked up until almost a full day later. Again I'mnot sure what the process is for room service pick up but a day sitting in the hall seems like a long time.- I understand this is an older hotel and I actually love it for that. I wish some of the original details came through instead of being hidden under 80s era interior design. The beds were fine, linens were clean, the view was great and everyone was friendly. Overall it was an ok experience -- definitely room for improvement. With a few tweaks it could be a really amazing place.

Our partial ocean view room is old and lack of maintenance, we face the International Market side and there on going construction until 2016 so it is very noisy. Will not stay at this hotel again on our next visit.

Had a very enjoyable stay here. Comfortable room and good facilities in the hotel. The breakfast buffet was also great as all fruits were so fresh and delicious. Loved the ocean view from balcony. BTW, the room was upgraded as a compliment to gold SPG member. This property had everything I look for in a resort hotel and is definitely a place I hope to stay at again.Justin at the front desk was awesome and cared a lot. He deserves a raise!

Ideal location- you don't pay the premium for a beachfront property but enjoy the location right across the street from Moana Surfrider and the Outrigger. Plenty of spots to eat and an easy resort to get in and out of to run to the store in need. The pool was not the best for children as there was only s small area that was shallow enough to stand which became very busy in the middle of the day with children in the water and the rest of the pool (about three quarters) was way too deep. This was disappointing however did not stop us from relaxing by the pool as everything else was fantastic- service, enough chairs etc. our accommodation request for an interconnecting room was not available which was an issue with a child so advice would be to confirm with the resort before you depart that they have the interconnecting room available if you have requested this for family.

This was our first trip to Hawaii,wedding etc and my brother an sister Inlaw stayed at this venue and hands down it was much better that it's rich relation down the street away. My wife and I dinned at this venue most nights and found it very comfortable, great music,great pool area and in the shopping area it centre. I would certainly recommend this venue to friends an family, bit lay back type.
user_location: Batemans Bay, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
cass1010
Batemans Bay, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The hotel was across the street from Waikiki Beach and close to all transport facilities.The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of hot water in the shower.Bar facility and evening Hawaiian music and dancer was enjoyable. Easy walking distance to restaurants.

1st visit to Oahu and loved it. The hotel is close to the beach and shopping. Most of the tours picked up from close by. There is a resort fee per room which gets you free bottled water daily and free Wi-Fi in the lobby. The restaurant was good and reasonably priced. The cocktails were cheap and fantastic. Staff were helpful and friendly.

in front of moana surf rider, from the hotels in the area that belongs to starwood this is not the best around the pool too simple, the hotel looks like old but just 1 block from the beach at least maybe you can ask to join the beach from moana

This was our first trip to Hawaii and both my daughter and I loved it!! The hotel is in a great location as it is easy walking distance to the beach, shopping and dining. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is dated but very clean and comfortable. Our only issue was a problem toilet which blocked or flooded, or both 4 times during our 7 day stay. After the 2nd incident, hotel management should have offered us another room, rather than having to wait for maintenance then house keeping to deal with it on each occasion - very disappointed.

i travelled to honolulu last year for the first time and loved it!!i found this property to be in a great location close to the beach and to restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff were all so lovely and friendly and happy to help as much as they could.The rooms were a great size, yes dated but very clear and comfortable. The pool area is great and we loved the night time entertainment.I would recommend this property to anyone wanting to stay in honolulu.

We (2 adults and 2 kids) stayed here for 10 days. Hotel is in a great location and we had good views from our room. All the staff we dealt with were very friendly. My only issue is the daily resort fee, USD26 is just a cash grab for what you get.

Although an old fixture in Waikiki, it is still a wonderful place to stay. My wife and I have stayed here a couple times now on SPG points and loved it every time. It's very convenient to all of Waikiki, yet not right on the beach in all the crowds. They have very good entertainment around the pool in the evenings when it feels good to dip in the pool to relax after a day of travel or sightseeing. The desk staff is always friendly and efficient and takes the time to explain any amenities provided. It used to be valet parking and is now totally self-park, which is fine with me. The garage is at the rear of the building and just short walk to the lobby.We've always managed to get an ocean view room, which is nice. Some of the lower level rooms wouldn't be as nice.

We stayed here after staying in Maui, it's a much busier island and we didn't need more than a couple days here (as we prefer the quieter destinations). However the hotel was nice, clean, in a good central location close to the beach and the staff were friendly/helpful. The gym had fantastic equipment. Dinner buffet was pretty good, the breakfast buffet was standard and we were happy to just get the continental instead. Overall a good hotel, would be happy to stay again.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. And we loved this hotel it was within walking distance to the beach and shopping and dining. We had a beautiful view of the beach from our room and the staff was always friendly and helpful with everything we needed. We will highly recommend this hotel to all our friends planning a trip.

Sheraton Princess Kiaulani is an old property. There's no escaping that fact. It desperately needs an interior redecoration and an exterior facelift. But being that it's a Sheraton property, the staff were friendly and amazing. The view especially if you get the balcony views overlooking Waikiki beach are also to just take your breath away. You do get a nice pool, a decent gym tucked in a corner of a convention hall, and the location of the property is easy to get to and to remember.

Staff were exceptional, no task to big and very helpful.Location is great (beach, shopping & dinning).Comfortable & clean bed.Hotel & rooms aren't maintained to the standard you would expect for the price (peeling wallpaper, paint chips, etc.)We had a 50% promo for our room and were upgraded(Bonus!!!),however if we were to pay full price this review would of been totally different.It was just the aesthetics that were a problem to us, but If you manage to get a great deal, I strongly suggest this hotel as we enjoyed our stay.

This hotel is in a very good and convenient location. The staff were good and friendly. The bar is a pleasant place to have drink. The rooms and other areas of the hotel apart fro the lobby are in need of an update. Good wifi. Good value for the price.

This hotel is right in the heart of the Waikiki Beach area of Honolulu, and has all the amenities of a great hotel. But what really impressed us was the friendliness and competence of the entire staff. We had a problem with our television, and within 10 minutes we had a tech in to fix it and he was in and out in no time, problem solved. The maids, the front desk, the concierge, the waiters and waitresses, pool staff - no matter where we went, they were so gracious and helpful it was stunning. This hotel is a little older, and the sound between rooms travels (you noisy Aussies!), but the beds are very comfortable, the air conditioning works very well and we were always comfortable and enjoyed our stay immensely. We were in walking distance of the beach, great restaurants, shopping, and Da Bus! We stayed 6 days and saw most of the island taking the city buses and a Circle Island tour that picked us up and let us off at the hotel door. We enjoyed our stay here immensely, and I would recommend the hotel for anyone coming to Honolulu for a stay.

Recently stayed 2 weeks at the hotel and it turned into a home away from home for us.Check in was quick and faultless and the service from the hotel staff and housekeeping was exemplary at all times.The room was made up each day to a very high standard. On a few occasions we slept in and having housekeeping clean and reset the room after lunch was not a problem.The air conditioning had to work overtime while we were there as it was hot and humid, but no faults there either.We did not use the restaurant while we were there bu the setting and buffet loked great.Altogether a flawless experience for us and we would definitely stay there again.

Best location for the price - easy access to the beach, Macy's and all the restaurants. Nice friendly staff. The rooms need an update, but once that happens the price will go up no doubt, so we were happy for them to be as they are. They are very clean. Food in the restaurant is good and the bar knows what they are doing. So all in all, a great spot to base yourself. We were there for a week.

A 4 night trip to Honolulu & I was on a budget so after doing the usual searches & lowering my expectations a bit I chose the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. With an Ocean View room in the tower looking out over Waikiki & the Westin Moana Surfrider I was happy with the room for my stay. Sure, the hotel is quite a veteran of Waikiki accommodation and the rooms are not refurbished but my room had a sweet sleeper bed, widescreen TV and a clean bathroom.For travellers to Waikiki who won't be staying in their room much during the day it is a great hotel with a great location and you will save lots of dollars!The staff are friendly and helpful, check in was easy and early so that is a big bonus rather than waiting around all day for your room to be ready. The towel & beach chair service is excellent if you want to go over to the beach rather than hanging by the pool.Music every night poolside so good for grabbing a cocktail & relaxing either before heading out for the night or on the way back.Free WiFi, parking,2 bottles of water & phone calls included with the resort fee so I got my value out of it. Also The Link @ Sheraton is great for checking your flights & printing boarding passes or checking your work emails if you really have to.So I can easily recommend Princess Kaiulani for smart travellers who want location, sharp pricing and lots of Aloha when staying in Waikiki.

This is just a great place to stay and makes the perfect 'home base' for any trip to O'ahu.-Its central location, easy parking and friendly staff makes for a pleasant stay. You are surrounded by all that Waikiki has to offer. Plenty of places within easy walking distance. Seniors that have issues being on their feet for too long will appreciate how centralized this place is. Its not the cheapest place in Waikiki but not near expensive either.-Entertainment by the pool is nice although with so much coming and going of guests and non-guests, it can be a little hard to relax and get into the vibe of it all. But that's ok because you'll be drawn to all the commotion happening just outside and be swept up like salmon in a stream flowing here and flowing there.-This area is pretty much across the street from a police station (next to the Surf Rider) and kept in good shape. Although you still need to be on your guard against pick-pockets and other undesirables (like any big city) this area is fairly clean and safe as opposed to offerings nearer to Kapahulu Avenue (nearer the zoo).-The resort fees aren't so bad and as I said, parking is VERY easy here which is a huge plus.-My one gripe is that the AC is connected to other rooms...Meaning if you have some jerk ignoring the rules and smoking in their room, your room with wreak of cigarettes. A simple call to security however will remedy it real quick. Please, be considerate of others, you don't know if your neighbor has breathing problems, take it down stairs...After all, I'd offer the same respect to you!-Remember, don't let Waikiki consume your trip. Get out of town and enjoy all that the island has to offer!

My wife and I have been coming to Hawaii every 4 months for the last 6 years and have stayed in other hotels, but by far the Princess Kaiulani is the best hotel we have stayed in the staff are very helpful and friendly the location and activities are great.We are booking out of the hotel tomorrow morning heading back to Australia and have already contacted our travel advisor to book our next holiday to Hawaii and told them to make sure that we get a room at the Princess Kaiulani staying here has to be the best trip we have done thanks to the staff and relaxing atmosphere that the Princess Kaiulani has to offer.

Had 3 nights in the Princess Kaiulani with friends, part of a group of 6 which included travel to Maui and the Big Island.The Princess Kaiulani is in a great location right on the centre of Wakiki.2 of our group had stayed at teh Princess Kaiulani in 1979 and wanted to go back again, they were not dissappointed

We recently stayed at this hotel for the 3rd time. We just love it. The staff are friendly and the location is just fantastic. Sure the rooms are a little tired and the bathroom need renovating but we just love staying here. The pool is delightful and well staffed. The bar is friendly and I used the gym everyday day and it is great. Our 1stchoicefor our next visit which I hope comes soon!

We have stayed here several times. It is very conveniently located across the street from Waikiki Beach, near great shopping, and along bus lines making it easy to get around. I always ask for a partial ocean view so we can sit out on the balcony, watch the people and ocean and just relax. Our son just returned last week and truly enjoyed his time at "the Princees K". He stays there every year. The rooms are nice, affordable, restaurants great and nightly entertainment very enjoyable. Can't wait 'til I can go next year! Also, the staff is great, very accommodating and helpful.

My boyfriend and I went to this hotel and we were very pleased. The staff was incredibly helpful and the location was right on the main strip! We arrived and they had bell men available to handle all of our luggage. We received free parking, free wifi, a free photo of us, two bottles of water, Kahuna Beach service (beach chairs, towels, fresh fruit, and water while on the beach), and free late checkout because our flight was at night. On top of that, we were given a hospitality room (smaller hotel room) where we could shower after a day at the beach before our flight free of charge - which was AMAZING. The staff was very helpful and even explained to us how/when to take the bus to Diamond Head for a hike. The rooms are not completely "up to date" (mostly bathrooms), however, you aren't spending much time in your hotel room anyway...lets be serious. Everything was clean and it was a very relaxing, hassle free experience! We didn't feel like we were being taken advantage of with fees like we have at other places. I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki! Pool, across the street from Waikiki beach, restaurant, gym, bell service, photography packages, beach service, public computers, free wifi, free parking, etc.

Stayed here for 3 nights on our Honeymoon Aug 2015. Staff are FANTASTIC......they gave us a complimentary congratulatory bottle of champagne for our honeymoon and they're so lovely and helpful, The location of the hotel is perfect, right on the beach street of Waikiki. Stayed in 2 rooms (one for 1 night on our arrival, the other for 2 just before our departure) 1st room was on the 18th floor and was just a room, not big, but not too small, the second was on the top floor (29th) and was a great size. Again, was just a room but was much better than the one on the 18th floor. Rooms were both clean and tidy, and well equipped, just a little old/dated. Bathrooms could do with a revamp. Don't let this sway you though, certainly delivers what it promises! Hallway noise is quite loud in both rooms though (doors slamming, people talking etc.) but the hotel/staff can't do much about other inconsiderate guests. Pool and bar area is nice, albeit busy and lots of kids, but it is a family destination. Bar staff lovely, great service, and have great cocktails.

The staff here is out of this world amazing! The front desk staff was extremely accommodating. The housekeeping was extremely proficient and thorough. I also had a very nice conversation with the guy working valet parking about restaurant recommendations. I stayed in the older side of the hotel and have no complaints. The air conditioning worked well, the bed was comfortable, bathroom was all in working order. The location of this hotel is awesome! It is just about across the street from Waikiki Beach and next door to an ABC store and some fantastic restaurants. I would totally stay here again!

As soon as we arrived everyone was so welcoming, the hotel entrance and grounds are beautiful.We arrived earlier then check in time but our room as ready so we where able to check in straight away, which after a 9 hour flight was amazing!Our room was 14th floor and the view was not what we where expecting, at all. I called reception to ask to change rooms because in all honesty when you pay for a high ocean view, you want to be high up, with a full view not a view of a roof and some ocean.. Sharon at reception was so helpful and lovely and we ended up on the 27th floor and I couldn't appreciate it more! It was stunning, the view was exactly what we had hoped for! The beds are amazing, the rooms so clean and comfortable, the location is perfect. I would recommend trying to get onto a floor higher then 14/15, but other then that, Sheraton pk is well worth it and we can't wait to come back!!

I will admit that it was unseasonably hot and humid during our visit to Waikiki but this hotel's "standard" rooms (even those on the Sheraton Club Level left a lot to be desired. The wall paper was peeling from the walls and they had to move us multiple times to find a room that was event moderately cool. The first room was 86 degrees and climbing! Also please be aware that if you plan on using the balcony and are placed in a room on the south side of the tower you will be forced to listen to incessant construction noise from 5am - 7pm every day! This renders a balcony less than useful!! There is a mandatory charge for bell staff so be prepared to pay for the privilege of handling your own luggage.

Second time in the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel in Waikiki Beach (1st time in 2013). Hotel had improved in appearance in reception areas and room we had was very comfortable, clean and had great views to Waikiki Beach/Diamond Head. We were on the 14th floor and it was relaxing to sit on the balcony at dusk (with a beer or cocktail in your hand!). The front desk staff were very professional and helpful, the concierge service very good and the housekeeping service very efficient and friendly. We had dinner in the hotel a few nights and the food was excellent. Hotel is also near lots of restaurants to suit all tastes/prices. Only concern was regarding the pool which had a film of crease ( & sand) through mainly Asian clients coming from the beach not changing or showering before entering pool. Some other hotels in area had signs saying "appropriate swimming costumes must be worn in the pool".

Room was not what I was expecting. Stayed in the Hilton and LOVED the rooms...but the Sheraton is suited better for those guests wanting a place to socialize. I was in Honolulu for business, so rather have a quiet and clean room. Room was clean. Bathroom very outdated. Grout on bathroom floor needed to be scrubbed...actually looked very grosh around the toilet area. I could hear the guest in the next room talking at 3am...irritating to have an adjoining that the hotel does not place some sort of barrier in between the doors to prevent this. Bed was comfortable. Nice linens. Those in my group enjoyed the pool and party atmosphere of the common areas. I rather stay at the Hilton.

This is my second stay at the Kaiulani, but the first since the recent renovation. I was pleasantly surprised by the overhaul of the lobby/common areas, which are much improved and definitely emblematic of the "new" Sheraton brand. SPG Platinum recognition was great-- upgrade to the Jasmine Suite with amazing ocean views, 4pm late check out honored despite it being a resort, snack amenity, discount at F&B outlets, etc. The resort fee included internet , a souvenir photo (Which we unfortunately didn't take them up on), and beach service-- chairs + water /fruit service on Waikiki. Splash , the pool bar had fantastic cocktails (the Mai Tai and Tropical Itch were our favorites) and the food was really good too (the garlic fries!!!). The check-in speed was a little slow, but thorough and helpful. This is the best SPG paid rate or points value on Waikiki, particularly if you are going to spend most of your time outside the room (which was a tiny bit dated, but spacious and with a beautiful balcony facing the ocean).
user_name:
zephyr221
New York City, New York

review_body: The "resort" is located near the beach and that is its only advantage. Its age is showing and it is clear that Sheraton is not interested in bringing it into the 21st century. The rooms look, feel and smell old. The bathroom is despicable, more in line with a cheap roadside motel rather than a resort as it likes to call itself. Mildew in the shower abounds and the curtains are simply disgusting. For all this "luxury" they have the nerve to charge an extra "resort" fee. If you really want the experience of a resort, find another place. This is a poor value for the money.

Fantastic friendly staff, perfect location across the road from Waikiki Beach. Beautiful open bar near the pool with an open restaurant and buffet area. Rooms could do with an update but they are clean and comfortable. I highly recommend a pool view room high up as you will also see Waikiki Beach if your high enough. We were on Level 5 and we could see it.

The Sheraton Princess Kauilani was the perfect place for the trip I wanted with my daughter before she leaves for college next week. We spent 17 Glorious days at the Sheraton Princess Kauilani and we took full advantage of the beautiful Island if Oahu. This being our first trip back in 8 yrs after an accident this trip was monumental for myself. The Island captured the hearts of both myself and my Daughter all over again as if it was our first visit. First let me recommend this Hotel for the kindness and sincerity of the staff, the amazing Ocean View, Clean, Comfortable beautiful rooms, the amazing Lanai that you can sit on morning or night after all your adventures just listening to the Ocean waves, in the evening you can listen to local music being played often by someone on a Saxophone. I never found this individual but the music was nearly nightly and it soothed the soul.Next the Ocean is across the street, you are so close yet you are not trampled by the tourists all running toward the beach. You can walk at your leisure to the beach. There are Hotels with drinks and Appetizers otherwise known as Hawaiian Pupu's right there and right at the edge of Waikiki behind the police Station that looks like a tourist center there is a small window beach cafe with the most amazing lunch items and snacks. Right along the main strip there is a small ice cream shop with the Famous Dole Pineapple Sorbet. The Waikiki Beach is second to none, beautiful and inviting, warm and wonderful.However that's not near all there is to do. We three times took our Rental Car and went around the coast roads taking pictures and absorbing all the beauty of each and every scenic outlook. I wouldn't miss one of them. Although classified as illegal my daughter did the Dead Mans Cat Walk hike with two warm local kids her age. This was well worth the effort the scenery is spectacular. We visited the ONLY Palace on US Soil, originally within the Hawaiian Monarchy, The Iolani Palace, as well as Queen Emmas Summer Palace. We located the Royal Burial Grounds and paid our respects to the former Kings, Queens, Princesses and Princes. Their History is not to be missed within a visit to Oahu. We of course went to Pearl Harbor, not once but twice because one day the boats weren't allowed to go to the Memorial. A trip to Hawaii isn't complete without paying your respects to the men that gave up their lives there so we may continue to visit this beautiful paradise. Moving toward the other shores on this beautiful Island we went to Kailua and Lanikai Beaches. These are more local beaches yet they are filled with beauty less tourists and they were simply amazing. We doing Teddy's Bigger Burgers in Kailua, and the Hawaiian hamburger, with fresh grilled pineapple this was delectable, with Sweet Potato fries and the Chocolate Peanut butter hand dipped Milk shake. After a long day of swimming it hit the spot. The next day we visited the Pali Look out, then the Valley of Temples, another must in my opinion. We were lucky to see the Waterfall in the distance across from the exit of the Pali Look out flowing quite magnificently even though it is far away and it was in the DRY season. The Valley of Temples was absolutely beautiful. There is a Buddhist Temple there along with Many other religious Shrines to many Faiths. This was a peaceful and amazing place to visit and I wouldn't have missed it for the world.The next day we set off on our adventure to explore the North Shore. We visited the Dole Plantation, then a quick first trip to the Historic town of Haliewa. Dole was wonderful yet busy. The pineapple fresh and the Sorbet were amazing. I've often told people until you have tasted Fresh pineapple in Hawaii you haven't tasted Pineapple really. Due to the fact that after being harvested if it is to leave the Islands it is injected with many preservatives, which dramatically change the taste of the Pineapple. After a wonderful visit to Dole and the gift shop where we bought lip balm in tropical flavors you can't find on the mainland we headed toward Haliewa. We quickly observed all the changes in the years we were absent, then made our way to the Coast Road. To visit Sharks Cove Tide Pools, and Turtle Bay. We stopped and took many pictures of Sharks Cove Tide Pools but this trip we didn't make it to swim in them because my back was still hurting. Next we went to Turtle Bay, to say I was blown away would be putting it mildly. We observed 20-30 Turtles coming in and out of the water eating the Algae on the Lava boulders in the water. You are so close to these Sea Turtles, but must remember never to touch them so that you never change their Natural Habitat. After all the Sea Turtle is the ONLY living Prehistoric thing we have left. In Hawaii they call the Sea Turtle the Honu. It's worth your time to look up the Honu and investigate the meaning behind it and how it applies to you. I guarantee you will be captivated with these beautiful creatures as I was... We spent a couple of hours just watching them and taking pictures we were so excited. Loving this so much we came back the next two full days after breakfast to swim with these beautiful Sea Turtles. At this point I must digress, for breakfast everyday we went to the most amazing, affordable restaurant for breakfast. Keoni's right on Kuhio Ave. The food was all fantastic but I fell in love with the Banana Pancakes with Coconut Syrup or the Macadamia Nut Pancakes with the coconut syrup. They also came Banana/Macadamia Nut that were great. On the third day to the North Shore my daughter did the most amazing adventure ever. she went on a free dive with Sharks with no cages. This was a private charter with no more than 6 people. They went to a secluded spot where the water was 650 feet deep, the boat Captain and Shark expert got in the water to make sure of the Sharks temperament .. And then for two full hours they free swam with Galapagos Sharks. They also saw 2 Baracuda that were very afraid of humans and swam away quickly. My daughter used her GoPro camera and filmed this adventure of swimming with the Sharks, a memory she will cherish for a lifetime. ( this was especially wonderful for her because she's starting College to be a Marine Biologist with Shark Studies as a Primary Interest for her.) again after a very long hot day we found. Teddy's Bigger Burgers and we're thrilled. The other day we found a host of Shrimp Trucks that make fresh Shrimp in many different ways and you sit at picnic benches enjoying the tropical environment while you eat outdoors. We enjoyed shopping at the stores especially the Red Dirt Shirt Store on the North Shore, as these shirts can't be found anywhere else in the world, they now have a whole new variety called Lava Rock Shirts that are amazing too. We found the Haiku Stairs, deemed the Stairway to Heaven another illegal hike but we decided to save this until our next visit. Everyday after our adventures we swam in the beautiful waters of Waikiki Beach and sometimes even our swimming pool at the beautiful Sheraton Princess Kauilani that has converted their pool to a salt water pool at some point. Amazing in and of itself. Reconnecting with Hawaii in this amazing 17 day trip and spending it at the Sheraton Princess Kauilani was incredible. I feel like I'm surely leaving things out here like the adventure we had in going to find the shop to purchase the Go Pro the several times I missed my exit and we laughed till we cried. Of course the day we spent at the Aloha Stadium Swap Meet where souvenir vendors are there to sell any thing and everything your looking for, there are over 400 of them. The night we drove to Ko Olina to have dinner but the restaurant was too busy so we took take out and sat at the Marriotts Ko Olina Beach Club Resort and ate a picnic on the beach watching the Sunset. The Afternoon Tradewinds Sail that leaves from the Sheraton Waikiki Beach, (coupon on Groupon), the sail was FANTASTIC!!!Like I said I know I'm forgetting things because our 17 days were packed and sitting here now, I've got tears in my eyes wishing I was back for another 2 weeks right now. For anyone looking to go to Hawaii it's NEVER out of your reach, it's never some where you can only dream about there are ALWAYS ways to make this happen. If you need tips contact me, this was my 8th trip and I plan on making #9 at Xmas. To get me for help thethirdeye08@gmailHawaii is amazing and somewhere everyone should aspire to expierence, the feeling you have after being there is incomparable.

This is our 5th stay at this amazing hotel and once again it was spectacular. We stayed on the 22nd floor with incredible views of Waikiki Beach, The rooms are a little tired but are still beautifully maintained and serviced by super friendly staff. Poolside show every night and singers and entertainers in the lobby, what more could you want. We will stay here on every visit to Hawaii without doubt. Centrally located to everything, beach, restaurants, shops and who could ask for more. And all at a very competitive and inexpensive price. Mahalo Nui Loa and Aloha, until we meet again !!

The location is fabulous. It's positioned opposite the westin Moana on waikiki beach. The great part is they delivery water and fruit if you stay in front of the duke beach area between 11 & 2pm, trust me you need a nice cold water and a fruit if you have been sitting, swimming through out those hours. Staff are very friendly and the bar service are great. I recommend this place to anyone... Thanks jenny

We stayed here for 10 days and I have to admit the accommodation was more than comfortable. Although the hotel is in need of an update and the decor is a little old and tired, it is clean, very comfortable and its proximity to local beaches, shopping and attractions is perfect, basically right in the middle of the Waikiki strip and just across the road from the famous Waikiki beach. The staff are absolutely wonderful, friendly, accommodating and will do all they can to help, even better to,see is they employ a good percentage of mature age people here and this is excellent in this day and age, it's always lovely to have a young staff but there is another whole world of older workers out there with far more experience and superior service skills so,the mix is good to see at this hotel.... The pool is small but well maintained with a great area to relax and the music every night is top notch..... The tours desk and concierge were informative and very helpful.... The only slight negative is the buffet breakfast which is below average in my opinion, the selection is poor, quality is not great and the variety (little as there is) never changes. I heard the egg bar was ok but alas for me I have an egg allergy so couldn't use it,my he only consistent thing about the breakfast was it was consistently bad, however the breakfast staff were wonderful, polite and very very friendly......

We had stayed at the princess Sheraton. It was quite a clean and beautiful hotel. The staff were mostly friendly, there was entertainment every night and the service was great. This hotel has a perfect location! It's right near the beach and very close to the shops everything was in a convenient walking distance. The pool was a decent size and very clean. The highlight that this hotel had to offer was the beach chairs that were available to use whilst going to the beach and every few hours staff would come to the beach to offer water and fruit. Overall this hotel was quite peaceful, beautiful and the staff were friendly. I would recommend this hotel for families, couples or anyone who likes to relax during the day and go for a nice stroll at night after dinner and visit the stores.

We were quite pleased with the view from our room while staying here. The rooms could be able to be cooled off better but were very clean & the service of our room was excellent. It was serviced as soon as we walked out the door for the day and was cleaned very well.

We were pleasantly surprised by the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The hotel's location on Kalakaua Avenue opposite The Moana Surfrider by Westin is fantastic. The service was friendly and the breakfast and poolside service was great value. Hotel rooms were acceptable for a 3.5star hotel... much better than we were expecting... Very happy to stay here again! WIFI included with the compulsory Daily Resort Fee was very good... as was Daily Resort Fee included international telephone calls and car parking...

Hotel is very good place for families. Close to the beach,about a block away.Higher floors have great view of city or ocean.Also has a dinner show which is very good.price not bad for show in Hawaii.Rooms are very nice.Staff is great.before you go try to get a package that includes breakfast.It saves money.Breakfast is around $30.00.Only problem is birds trying to eat your food.food. Sitll would recommend hotel.great place.

Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is on the main strip (Kaiulani Avenue) directly opposite from the Moana Surfrider so its location is perfect for access to beach, shops, bars and restaurants. Everything is close so when travelling as a single, couple or in a group you can feel quite comfortable getting around Waikiki. The rooms (with balconies) not all are renovated however they are very comfortable and spacious.

Pleasantly surprised, especially after reading some not so good reviews. The staff were very helpful, the position was awesome in terms fobbing close to everything, such as restaurants, shopping and the beach. They even upgraded us to a ocean view room, which was a nice surprise.

The cleaning person knocked and entered the room despite being told that we were still in there and that it was only 9 am -not even close to check out time. The manager seemed nonplussed by this....The room we had was on second to last floor and the view was incredible. We stayed here on July 3rd/4th (but I am writing this review too late to choose that date from 2014) and we could've watched the fireworks from a side emergency exit window area if we had chosen to. We walked to the fireworks show instead as the distance was very manageable and walking at night was very pleasant.The decor of the room was a bit dated (there were apparently some renovations going on so we didn't get the newer room because of the great deal we got). The AC worked wonderfully and the included breakfast was quite yummy. The bartender made some great drinks and we were able to very easily arrange a shuttle to the airport with the help of the concierge.Definitely a good choice in terms of price and location.

My wife and I had a most relaxing 10 day stay at Princess Kaiulani. The staff were very attentive and nothing was a trouble for them. We like the area that the hotel is situated in and the extra benefits: bottled water, free Wi-Fi, 1 hour of calls back home per day made our vacation all the more enjoyable.

We stayed for three nights at the beginning and at the end of our Hawaiian holiday. Central location right across from the beach & walking distances to shops & restaurants. Rooms clean, views of pool & if high enough the sea. The entertainment in the evenings is great, music ,Hawaiian & Japanese dancers, sets a holiday atmosphere. The buffet is delicious & kids under 12 eat free! Staff friendly & helpful.

We found a very competitive rate at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for two nights last week.As a gold SPG member, we were upgraded to a delightful ocean view room. The room was older (we knew that going in) but more than functional. Unfortunately, the air conditioner decided to leak all over the entryway in the middle of the night. What made everything better was the managerial and front desk staff, who made sure we were satisfied with our stay despite the glitch. We were moved to an even better room with a view and the resort fee was waived. Thank you!Most of all, we enjoyed the pool server, Lei, who was kind and very accommodating. We really enjoyed spending time at the pool enjoying delicious lunch and cocktails in one of the cabanas. Lei, thanks for taking great care of us!

I get to enjoy this hotel twice a year when I travel with my wife,she stays there 4 times a year on business trips. It is always a pleasure our favorite room is 2762 I have enjoyed that room twice my wife 3 times best I've experienced over tha last 3 years.the staff are so kind and friendly from Kathy at reception to Eric in the Bar, Angie and another young lady who wears glasses (forgive me I wrote your name down and lost it) but she always looks after my wife, maitai and sushi-me in the Bar. My wife always feels safe and comfortable when she travels on her own. Our favorite hotel Thank you for looking after my wife every time she stays. David Parr

We got a pretty killer deal to stay here, which made any issues pretty easy to take in. I feel like most Waikiki hotels are dated and not nearly worth what you're paying, especially compared to other resort towns. I tend to avoid staying in Waikiki for exactly that reason, but here's what worked and didn't work for us at the PK:+ Cost. Just over $100 a night, we were 'upgraded' to a partial ocean-view that just happened to be adjacent to construction of the new International Marketplace. I honestly didn't mind the noise, it felt far off and I'm okay with the sounds of the city when staying in a city, but I'm sure that's a dealbreaker for many. + Location. Super central, we were able to walk anywhere around Waikiki without it feeling like much of an effort. + Resort fee. While resort fees are complete bull, this one at least got us both wi-fi AND parking, which in a $30-40/night parking city is not too bad. We had no problem getting in and out and about. + Common areas/staff. The lobby and pool area were very nice, and actually tricked us into thinking we were really getting a crazy good deal when we first arrived. I liked the open pool, bar, and ability to walk in and out of the property so easily, and the person who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. - Room. Dated as mentioned, just nothing special, not really a huge minus if you're not spending much time in your room but worth mentioning that the rooms feel less Sheraton than Holiday Inn. We went in not expecting any view at all, so we feel like we came out ahead in the end, and one nice thing about the 'city view' of International Marketplace is that it's very expansive, like you're not right up against another hotel. I would likely return for another value deal at a value resort like this one, and throw the extra dough into food/experiences.

Paid for the cheapest room, and got lucky with a pool and ocean view. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Pool and sundeck were great if you're too lazy to go to the beach. PERFECT LOCATION. Beach just across the street, and central to all the big dining restaurants and shops. Would recommend, 10/10!

The hotel staff are relaxed and friendly and very helpful.. The hotel itself is located in an excellent position right in amongst the best street in Waikiki. Kalauka Ave is full of hotels, restaurants shops and convenience stores. Everything is nearby. The hotel has a nice pool area and great bar. The service includes beach towels and the Big Kahuna service on the beach of fruit and water, towels and umbrella. Two bottles of water in room each day. Easy operational safe facilities. Good TV and spacious clean rooms.

I had an oceanview room on the 28th floor of the ainahau tower. These are the best rooms in the hotel. Room was clean, the pool was nice, they had entertainment every night. It was a nice place to hang out and lounge until you figure out where you wanted to go. Breakfast is delicious and convenient, although a bit pricey ($25). Rooms are a bit outdated, but for location, I would stay here again. Beware of resort charges and parking fees (if you rent a car).
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
206simoneb2
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: I could write about all the things that did, and could have gone wrong, but the important thing is that Justin at the front desk was an all around awesome human being that actually cared. Not only did he give outstanding customer service, he got to know us, we got to know him, and he did it all with a smile. We received follow up calls to ensure everything was going well for us, and he gave us some amazing local advice on where to go and what to eat off the beaten path (trust his taste in shaved ice). Justin honestly and truly made our stay at the hotel one to remember. It wasn't what he did, but how he did it. Management also deserves credit for allowing Justin to do what he did, so bravo all around to the entire team.

The rooms are old, some air conditioners don't work as well. The drinks at the hotel not so good and a bit pricey. However, the staff makes your stay worth your while. They are great!! I have visited this hotel more than once.

To be honest we were not expecting much, but we were very pleasantly surprised! This hotel has the best location and a fraction of the price of the beach front hotels! Bed was amazing, pool was awesome, rooms are just what you need! Would definitely stay again! I'm very fussy with hotels and was very skeptical about this one given the cheap price and some negative reviews but so glad we gave it a go! Loved it! Highly recommended!

I arrived at the Hotel at appoximatley 04.00 hrs, only to find that my travel agent had booked me in for the following 2 days and that I did not actually have a room booked for the 04.00 hrs. arrival. After disussing the situation with the Front Desk Staff and presenting my SPG card, I was immediated placed into one ot the SPG rooms on a dedicated floor and automatically upgraded and at no extra charge.The room overlooked the bay and down to Diamond Head and what a view from the 25th Floor.I can not comment enough on how dedicated the staff were in making sure that I was catered for and made comforatable after traveling through the night.I will be travelling back to Hawaii 2016 for a vacation / cruise and will certainly stay at the SPK again.

We opted for this hotel, as a bit cheaper due to it being a block back from the beach but the location was excellent. So close to Waikiki beach and shops and restaurants. The hotel is a little dated but rooms good size with balcony that could seat 4 people. Staff were friendly.

Enjoyed the stay here! Staff were great and had no hesitation in helping when needed. Food was good!Only issue was the room needed a better clean, was quite dusty and wifi needs an update as it was constantly dropping out.Otherwise enjoyable stay.

Wow. We really enjoyed out time here. After reading some of the other reviews I was a little worried about the construction work next door and the worn outness of the place, but seriously some people are very fussy! We stayed in room 702 on the corner next to the construction site and didn't hear a thing. Booked a pool view room and got a partial ocean view room. Yes the hallways were a little tired but then I didn't sleep in them and really the rest of the place was just brilliant. The staff were lovely and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely stay here again if and when we go to Hawaii again. Don't believe the negative reviews...

As a Starwood Platnium 100 member, I am typically quite spoiled by the hotels already. But I must say the Princess greatly exceeded my expectations - from friendly staff who understood my situation (recently engaged) and upgraded me to a room with a fantastic ocean view to showing great flexibility for late checkout with alternative room. The staff here are absolutely amazing and customer centric. I would definitely come back in the future - as I believe it is the staff who makes an hotel!

Hotel a little dated and can only get wifi in the lobby. But rooms big and comfortable. Pool area lovely. Expensive to eat in the restaurant, but extremely close to lots of shops and restaurants which are all reasonably priced. Just across the road to the beach. Hotel staff very helpful in booking excursions. Would recommend to anyone travelling on a budget.

The room that we stayed in was great in terms of comfort. We were able to get some good rest while we were there for a week. The view was great as well as the pool. It can get a little crowded but it didn't bother us that much.As mentioned before the design of the room was on the older side but it was nice and clean which was the most important thing for us. The bar near the pool was great. They had good drinks and the food wasn't too were very nice.Location was also great with easy access to everything. We didn't like the fact that you had to pay $27 or so everyday as a "resort fee" but other than that it was great. Overall if you want a nice hotel for a decent price. This place is great. Staff members were very nice and polite.

Booked this hotel thru Travelocity with a great deal on room/rental car combo that couldn't be beat. Yes, we ended up paying the resort fee, but this hotel's resort fee includes parking. This made the fee seem worth it as most other hotels seemed to charge for parking AND a resort few. Plus, the WiFi connection was great and the chair and towel rental for the beach was great. We were lucky to get upgraded to an ocean view room, and it did have a wonderful view of Waikiki beach.All of the employees we encountered were really friendly. No lines at elevators, that we encountered. Rooms weren't huge, but ours worked for us. No free breakfast, but we went to the ABC across the street for muffins and it was perfect.Also, great location for this hotel. Everything you'd need was within walking distance, although we did have a rental car to get to North Shore and Pearl Harbor.Last time we were in Waikiki, we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel, I much preferred the Sheraton. If you're looking between the two, because they are in the same price range, I'd go with the Sheraton. Hands down.

Awesome place to stay, handy to Waikiki Beach and a multitude of shops and restaurants to satisfy all kinds. Not sure why people would complain as it ticks all the boxes for comfort, facilities, location, hospitality. We where roomed on the 2nd floor floor second room from the end of hall near main street (234) with a pool view and noise level was non exsistant while balcony door was closed but then enjoyed the hussel and bussel sounds of Waikiki when the door was open, at night you could here the band and or soloist on at that time. Rooms where clean and tidy on arrival beds where oh so comfortable and all staff very helpful and obliging to our needs.

Fantastic stay here. Greeted by Christina at the front desk who was very friendly, courteous, and efficient and we were quickly up to our room. We had a partial ocean view on the 5th floor (partial meant we could see the ocean but our view was framed by other hotels and trees). Although the beds were doubles (we knew that going in) there still seem to be enough sleeping area. The room also included a small coffee maker, safe and refrigerator that we made use of.While not on the beach itself, it was a 5 minute walk to Kuhio beach. The zoo and Kapiolani park are about .5 mile away AC in the room seemed like it couldn't keep up during the days (mid July 2015) but it was rather humid during our stay. Also, I'm not sure if the sliding door to the balcony was supposed to be so hard to open. I suspect it wasn't as the lock to latch the door didn't work. I would've moved rooms as we have a 3 yr old but the door couldn't be opened (or moved) by him.The lobby seems like it was renovated and the room decor was fine, but the rest of the hotel does need a facelift. Especially the pool, which seems like it was designed as a diving pool and not a hotel pool since the "kids" zone of <5' is about a quarter of the pool (who needs a 7' deep pool at a hotel?) Self parking (included with resort fee) was great, and we never had much of an issue parking even with all the construction in the parking structure. Overall a great stay at PK. Would definitely recommend this to others.

Very close to beach Leonard's and rainbow drive in as well as diamond head punch bowl and tantalus. The staff are not just helpful pleasant and curtious but they seem to love their jobs which always makes our stay very pleasant. Love the place and the people! Mahalo

This was our third time staying here. I knew this hotel was dated,but the price we paid($150 per night or less) for Ocean view room in Waikiki,I don't think it's bad.I didn't like we need to pay resort fee($25). We didn't use anything but Wifi service for this fee.Location is great,close to everything,shops and restaurants.Only a block from beach. Since I made a reservation through Orbitz and couldn't request 2 double beds. I sent a request directly to the hotel,but no 2 double beds with ocean view room was available.Front staff was helpful to tell me they would put rollaway bed for no extra cost.

Stayed here for 6 nights earlier in July. I wish I had checked Tripadvisor before I booked my stay here. It is very easy to understand that this hotel is number 60 out of 82 hotels in Honolulu.Even as a SPG Platinum I felt that I was staying in a dingy and tired roadside motel. You are forced to pay a resort fee at about 30 USD per night. What in the world makes this hotel a resort? There is no beach, and the pool is small and filled with kids, no place for relaxing. The pool area is very small considering the number of rooms.- nearly 1200 rooms. Check in was slow, once we got to our room we were shocked. How can this hotel bear the Sheraton name? It does not appear that this hotel has been renovated since the 70s - when they built the tower. The view was great! That's the only positive I can say about the room. Housekeeping was spotty as well - they did not restock the toiletries fully on any morning. There was always something missing - shampoo, soap, etc. The wifi signal in my room was very spotty. I read somewhere that the whole hotel was due for demolition, I can understand why.I could hear snoaring and the tv from the room next door, poor isolation. The furnishings were 1970s, and the bed was absolutely not even close to the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper bed. No sockets close to the bed - just like any other old hotel. Slow elevators that took forever. The breakfast was okey - but utterly disgusting. Pigeons were feasting from the buffet every time they got the chance. The staff members tried to keep the pigeons away, but as soon as they got busy with other things the pigeons were back. In my country this would be considered a health hazard.The dinner buffet were nice as well, even though the food were supposed to have a different theme each nice we found most of the food to be the same on the two nights we visited. We also found out that two breakfast coupons could be exchanged to one dinner buffet. The dinner buffet was almost 50 dollars, PLUS tip and drinks.However, on our first night we went downstairs at 9:30 PM to get some food. We were informed that the kitchen were closed, and there were absolutely no food to be had. The bar was open, but they weren't serving food. I find that very strange....1200 rooms and absolutely no food to be had after 9PM??? As we were very tired after travelling for 24 hours we just settled for a Subway right outside the hotel entrance.The platinum/gold desk were never staffed. Having 1200 rooms, and two persons working at the front desk meant that there were long ques. Once I had to wait 20 minutes to change my room key (that wasn't working). BTW - I could hear people complaining about the hotel several times when I passed the front desk.I will give one star for the nice room view, and one star for the nice restaurant/bell boy/beach service staff. The restaurant staff were really accomodating. So was the bell boy staff - they also kept parcels for me without any hassle. The hotel don't have any beach stand - but you can borrow chairs and towels by the pool and take to the beach. They will also give you a bottle of water and an apple - but only on certain times. Found these guys to be very accomodating. The other staff we encountered, at the front desk and housekeeping, were indifferent.For the rest of the hotel - zero stars. Location was good.Verditc: I wont stay here again in a million years! Take your money and go elsewhere :)

Hotel is excellent.Pool is awesome.Rooms are clean and nice views also.Across the road from beach, Lot of dining choices nearby.It is right on the wikiki strip. Diamond head is walkable. We did not use the breakfast here, but it was available for separate charge.

The Good - the location is right near the beach and the main strip for shopping and dining. The ordinary - definitely the rooms are very dated with a need to fix some things aesthetically but clean and comfortable. I was warned about the construction behind the hotel but staying a Saturday night so no construction was on Sunday.We only had a drink at the hotel and ate out otherwise. The staff did not make the experience personal or remember anyone, just processed us as they are required to.I was here for work so not focused on the hotel features but I would not choose to stay here for a holiday, I would look for something more modern and personal.

We stayed here 4 nights booking on line. It is a very nice resort hotel lovely pool area and eateries. Just two small disappointing things. We booked on line and when we arrived to check in were told there was a $25 daily "resort fee". When we enquired what for they said supply of 2 bottles of water daily, free local phone calls, a souvenir photo (we never saw a photographer anywhere) and free deck chairs, fruit and water on the beach twice a day. We didnt mind the fee but please outline it when booking . Also our room while being very comfortable and clean was obviously one of their "bottom of the range" being that our view was a wall until you walked to the balcony then it overlooked the pool plus the air cond was very loud from the neighboring tower of the hotel when sitting on the balcony which we didnt do much because of this AND it never had any sun. Look these things didnt spoil our stay and in hindsight maybe we should have requested another room but we still had a great holiday and would definitely stay there again.

Ok First the good. The location is good and the place was fairly clean. When you check in (especially if you don't park first) you think "This is going to be great" then...the not so good.Front desk staff was OK but not super efficent or welcoming. They just go about their job and you feel like they would be just as happy if you were not there. My room had a partial Ocean view and full view of the pool. It was a good view but if you don't go down by the pool and listen to the singers you'll still hear them really well. The wall paper in my room was peeling off. Towrds the end of my stay I noticed water dripping from the AC vent. I could hear the people in the room next to me like they were in my room. I knew when they opend and closed the closet. I could easily hear their conversations. When I took a shower I noticed the soap dish was not clean and the grout in the floor was dark grey in some places. I asked the maid to clean the rest room really well. She cleaned the tub better but not the floor. The next time I saw her I asked her if she could get the floor scrubbed. She explained that she might but it took a machine. They were able to get the machine up to clean the floor but if a gust wants the floor clean get it cleaned. The bar had good drinks and a good staff. The food was pretty good. The pool closed at 7pm which seemed since the sun was still up. There was a stand to get your towels from at the pool but they had two people there and required you to electronically check the towels (whiç˙ were nothing special) in and out with your room key. The pool staff was not perticularly frindly or welcoming. Guest are allowed to use the pool at sister properties if you want to walk over. I have stayed at worse hotels but I have also stayed at better. I am really suprised Sheraton doesn't either fix this property or at least rename it so it does not hurt their reputation.To end on a posative the bed was comfortable (but there was a dark stain oin the sheet that I noticed near me feet on the first morning.) So maybe not so posative of an ending.

Not worth the money very old facility and badly in need of an upgrade. The room was a special price.... on ly to be told we were being upgraded to a room next to a construction site. Very noisy and sold a lemonn. Small room And the additional charge for resort fee is outrageous as the things should be part of the room fee.

Our rooms were great, views were good, bed was comfy. Staff were very helpful. We had trouble with trips we had booked in Australia, staff were very helpful in trying to fix. Location is great as is so central. Would stay again.

Cost $263aus a night and charged an extra 'resort charge' of $35aus a night that was payable upon check in for items that definitely doesn't offer much value. Should of been optional extra. This price was for a partial ocean view. Was partial alright, through the palm trees, between 2 buildings and you could see a glimmer of water. Location was great though.

Ok, not your "luxury" hotel - but if you are in town for work, are not spending much time in the room, and want to be in the heart of Waikiki - there is no better spot. Beautiful ocean views (book ocean view), and outstanding staff, a nice, quiet pool with great service, and right in the heart of Waikiki. Rooms need updating, but it's a third of the cost of the Moana Surfrider, right across the street, and on a high floor a better view! I really enjoy this spot and would call it a value find in Honolulu.

We stayed at the Princess Kaiulani for three nights prior to our cruise. It is a wonderful, charming hotel. I just love the history, pictures, and quaintness--even though it is still a large hotel in Waikiki. We had an ocean view from the 21st floor--breathtaking! We rented a car and was able to park it in the garage; had WiFi; and supplied with 2 bottles of water each day. An interesting view was right next door/below where a huge project is being developed--all the while preserving the Banyan trees!! Love it! The lobby/dining/pool area is completely open for sweet trade winds to come and go. There are several sitting areas complete with rockers and lovely books to peruse. Would definitely go back again.
user_name:
Donna H
Ocean City, New Jersey

review_body: We stayed further down in Waikiki. I ended up getting sick. My gf found this location in the Sheraton. On Sunday at 730 the waiting room already had a couple of people. We ended up driving ourselves, but I did overhear the receptionist a couple times say that they had a pickup service. I was seen pretty quickly after filling out the paperwork and copies of my insurance card and Id were made. Pua the nurse took my vitals and assessment. The doctor came in quickly after. After all tests were done I left with a shot in my butt and a couple of prescriptions. Quick, professional, and polite. If you get sick while on vacation and are staying downtown go to straub doctors on call!!!

Having stayed here twice this year so far with another trip in Sept I always know I can expect the friendly service of all the staff at this property. Its like coming home. Sure the rooms are in need of a remodel but I try to stay in the same room which is always clean and I love the notes left by the maid staff. My associates who stayed at another property always seem to want to meet at The Splash Bar because of the friendly atmosphere and making feel like family. Looking forward to Septembers stay.

Stayed at the Princess from the 22nd June to 4th July on holiday with my wife.Booked the high ocean view tower room and found it to be excellent.Good size room very clean with great views. (Comfy Bed) . Great Location Staff all great . Front Desk . Splash Bar and Room Cleaners everyone all good.Those who complain about building site next door are to hard to please its out of the hotels control and while we heard noise the first two days after that never bothered us. Big shout out to the Girls and Guys at the splash bar . Great personality's . Great service.Will be recommending this hotel to friends and will defiantly be back

I had the most amazing time in Hawaii this time and staying at this hotel made that happen. First of all it is located in the middle of everything beaches, shopping, eating, sight seeing etc. The men and women all the way from working the desk to the housekeeping always smile and welcome you everyone at the hotel treats you like they have known you all your life. The rooms are very nice and very clean and well kept up. I would and will stay here again this is one place where everyone cares about you and how well your stay is very friendly. I actually hated to leave there.

Myself and a friend stayed here, we booked a suite with partial ocean views. We were on the 23rd Floor, and the view was amazing, you could see all the way up Waikiki Beach and all the way up the mountains on the other side. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Sure, the room was a little dated in decor - but this honestly did not bother me at all as it was very clean. The linen and towels were crisp, and the beds were comfortable and the shower was great. The location is awesome, only a minute walk to Waikiki Beach and really close to all the main shopping areas. Another great perk of this hotel. is if you like to spend your days by the beach, the staff would come down to Waikiki (identifying you by the hotel towels) would see if you needed anything like water, fruit or food. Would highly recommend staying here, Overall was an enjoyable experience. Can't wait to return!

We visited this hotel as a holiday stop between Sydney and Washington DC. The staff were so kind to us especially my special needs son. A big cheer for Kathy on the front desk for helping us with a hospitality room after a red-eye flight and before a late night flight. Also a cheer for Debbie from the poolside dining and the breakfast staff. This place was so welcoming and we were able to relax and enjoy the facilities and beach. I would highly recommend this place for families.

If I personally came here on vacation and spent more than $120.00, I would not be happy. It's 2 blocks from the busy, busy beach. The rooms are tired. Decorated in 1979 I am guessing. But, the linens were crisp and clean and the staff was lovely.

When I come to Hawaii I will be staying at this hotel, the services here are wonderful, the location is just perfect, next to the beach, wow what more you can ask for. the food here is amazing they did a good job.

We checked in today and I am more than certain that this will be my first and also last stay at this hotel. Reception staff is rude and uninterested- on our first attempt to check in we were ignored by a lady who chatted with another staff while chewing gum. On our second attempt to check in I was told by the staff that they would serve the person who had jumped the queue first and I had to wait.. Rooms are old and dated and the music from the bar is loud.Opening my suitcase I felt drops of water on my back and realized it was leaking from the air con. This is only day one and I regret we decided to stay here. Well it won't happen again and we might just give Sheraton a miss in general. A hotel like thisreflects badly on your other hotels and careless reception staff as a the first impression isn't helping.

Staff very nice. Decent room, but looks like it could use some updating. Wasn't there too much, just to sleep. Didn't eat there, didn't use the pool. Nice view of the ocean and Diamond Head from the side.
