The hotel does look a bit out dated and it was a bit pricey for a three star hotel but for the location we didn't mind it. It was close to the beach, buses to Ala Monana shopping centre and Honolulu, the markets and lots of eateries. The staff were professional and always greeted you when you entered and left the premises. Most tour buses leave from the hotel opposite (Hyatt) so it was confusing sometimes as to where we were suppose to meet but other than that it was a very enjoyable stay. Would recommend others to stay here.

The hotel was part of a package. The location is great because you in the middle of Waikiki Beach area. There is plenty to do outsideof hotel. Most of the common areas are open and no A/C. The restaurant on the first floor is good for breakfast but expensive. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Consearge has great suggestion for eating places outside of the hotel. Room wasclean and comfortable. The entire place was not as nice as othe Sheraton facilities that I have stayed at.

I have written only one other review and that was to praise a great hotel in Seattle. This hotel on the other hand is well deserving of a poor review. This hotel is tired and beat up and needs a makeover. This alone is bad enough but to add insult to injury I found several of the staff to be down right rude. The only positive thing about this place is the location but there are plenty of hotels in the area and you I would advise anyone to look elsewhere. If it weren't for the fact that we spent only two nights there before heading to kona, I would have changed hotels to avoid a totally disappointing vacation.

Booked 2 rooms for my family at this property and it did not live up to SPG standards. It is an older hotel in need of upgrades. The location itself is great as it is in the heart of Waikiki just across from the Westin Moana Surfrider so everything is within walking distance.When we arrived at the hotel the reception had a hard time finding my reservation and insisted that it might be another hotel with a similar name. Thank goodness I had the reservation number in my phone. Well he found it due to the fact he did not spell my name correctly ( even though I spelled it out and is only 3 letters long ). He then had difficulties getting my rooms arranged and the CC reader wasn't working well.We finally made it to our room and the rooms were OK. There is no thermostat to control the room temperature. It was AC on high, low or off. The satellite TV had poor reception due to the winds I guess (not that you are going to watch a lot of television when in Hawaii). The balcony is tiny with a small table and 2 chairs squeezed in. There is a small fridge in the closet and that was nice to keep some drinks cold. The rooms have no sound insulation at ALL!! Our neighbours were loud and you can hear all their conversations. They stayed up late and got up early so basically we did not get much sleep. Received a note under the door the next day saying they need a credit card to secure the second room. I went down and the front person was quite rude saying it is necessary. I don't doubt that by why was it not taken care of when I registered in the first place. Both rooms were in my name and registered as such. She could have been nicer saying they dropped the ball and could have been more apologetic. Instead she made it feel like it was my fault that I was trying to scam them.The hotel is very busy with big tours and there is a lot of traffic. Not much to do within the hotel itself. The pool is OK but my friends have nicer ones in their backyards.Will not stay here again.

Stayed in this hotel Oct-Nov 2013. The main floor lobby and pool of the hotel are attractive, the price to stay here is excessive.Forget about eating in their restaurant, it is not worth it at $39.95 for a dinner buffet with few items other than crab legs. Their other menu for daytime dining was excessively priced as well. Drinks at the bar by the pool were also expensive, without the expected quality of liquor at these prices.There is a mandatory daily resort fee of $23.95 which gives you "Complimentary" -ha ha!! Wi-Fi internet access that is extremely limited in bandwidth. I was unable to send even a text email with their "Complimentary" internet access.On the bright side, your resort fee does include attached parkade parking so, if you rent a vehicle, that is very good value.The rooms are 'okay' but a little dated. The bathroom and shower have the black mold beginning to appear in the silicone sealant. -This is a normal, frequent occurance that can be managed with more attention to detailed cleaning.This is a non-smoking hotel but some people still 'sneak' smoke within their rooms. I am an 'outdoors only' smoker and still found the smoke that drifted into my suite intolerable, to the extent that it would wake me up in the night. -I can't imagine the revulsion a non-smoker would experience.There was a very nice view from my room, pool plus partial ocean view and Diamond head.The rooms are not sound proof and you hear the constant automatic slamming of doors from other hotel rooms. Even conversations from the next room!!! The patio doors are also not particularly sound proof so you do hear any excessive noise that is occurring on street level, even from 9 floors up!!I found the bed quite comfortable but the pillows were way too soft, even with 4 stacked!!I did submit feedback to the hotel regarding my disappointments but received no reply. To me, this says they don't particularly care. Rumor has it that the hotel is scheduled for demolition in the very near future, like December or early 2014.Location is very convenient but, if you are out after 10:00 pm, expect to see several prostitutes in the area. It didn't feel unsafe but some people are just uncomfortable with the mere presence of prostitutes in the near vicinity.I would recommend staying somewhere else, maybe even with a kitchenette, where you can spend a little less money once in a while by making your own breakfast or whatever.Hope this helps. I am giving a little information back, for all of the valuable info I have benefitted from on Tripadvisor in the past

This hotel is old and tired.The staff does the best they can with what they have to work with.It just should not have the Sheraton name on it.The in-room internet was fine and the TV service was good. AC was OK.The noise from the street can be unbearable,Housekeeping was inconsistent and the bathrooms outdated.Would have checked out if we had not pre-paid.

Whatever you do, don't stay here. I was expecting the the standards of a Sheraton but instead was shocked to find one of the worst hotels I've seen. This is not up to the standard of any of their other properties! Old, dirty, broken and infested!Our first room was extremely musty and the A/C didn't work. The carpet was stained, there were holes in the blinds, and the bed side lights did not work. It was small and old and generally dirty. I called down about the A/C and they said I could look at another room one floor up.The second room looked like the first but the A/C worked. It was slightly musty and the lights worked but honestly it looked like it hadn't been updated since the 80s. My roommate tweeted pictures of our first room and they called us to see at that point if we wanted to see a third room in the tower. The third room was in the tower and seems like it was updated slightly more recently than the others. Perhaps the early 90s. This room had a weird blood-like stain in the bathroom. We took it out of frustration. Upon returning from dinner, I flicked on the lights and found a visitor on the bedside table. A COCKROACH! I tried to kill it but it escaped into the drawer. The hotel staff offered to come spray it or fumigate the room. But I have asthma and don't want to stay in a chemical fog. I just want a bug free clean nice room! We are stuck here because we pre-paid for the two nights through an Alaska Airlines vacation special. I'll NEVER do that again. We chose it because it is a Starwood property an because we wanted our last two nights to be relaxing and tranquil and special. I'll go so far as to say this has ruined my vacation. I've never been so disappointed in a hotel of this caliber.We also found out from the staff that it's due to be torn down next year. I just want to make sure no one else makes the mistake did. It's not worth it! The staff seemed apologetic and embarrassed but that has not made up for this mess.

I've stayed at this hotel over the last several years and I'm done with it. I liked the location and the fact that most (if not all) all of the rooms have balconies. But after my most recent stay, I'm done with this property. I'm a loyal Starwood member but if I can't stay at a different affiliated property, I'll stay at the Marriott (see my review). While the actual room was OK, the bathroom was in disrepair. They should be embarrassed at charging $200+ a night for a room in that condition. I'll admit I'm terribly annoyed by resort fees, but at the very least I expect to be able to use the services provided for by the fee. I think it's "amusing" that as airlines unbundle fees and charge for those that passengers "want," hotels are bundling fees together that I do not want and make it a mandatory fee. The only "bundled" fee I cared about was the Internet access (which I can get for free because of my status at most every other Starwood property but not here). I had 3 wifi enabled devices with me, and was only able to access the Internet once in 5 days for about 30 minutes before it dropped off. But I know my devices worked (one excuse the hotel used for my inability to connect) was that I was always able to connect in the lower level public areas of the hotel. I asked the front desk for assistance at least 3 times for this and another service issue and was met with either enthusiastic offers of assistance to indifference, but it didn't matter, no service commitment was followed through on (and the one time I asked to speak to a manager he/she was not available). Literally they would promise assistance within 15 minutes and an hour later I would still be waiting in the room with no help (and no note or voicemail apologizing and offering assistance). I started my stay at the Courtyard by Marriott (because no Starwood property had availability) and wish I'd stayed there. Give this property a pass. Oh, and there are prostitutes at the southeast corner of the property in the evening near Kalakau Avenue, annoying for guests that don't want to be bothered with that attention.

Check in was very friendly and efficient. Was sent to the wrong room first but this was rectified quickly. Our room was very clean and serviced beautifully. Food at the hotel was lovely, however there were 1 or 2 not very friendly dining room staff. Actually, the service around the pool area in general was not as good as I would expect. Marsha at the Travel desk was awesome. Booked our day trips efficiently and was lovely to my children. She even took the time to give them a talk about Pearl Harbour. Thanks Marsha! You really prepared them well for that day trip! Had no problem at all getting poolside chairs and never experienced queues for the lift. Would never, ever again go to the medical centre attached to the hotel. My daughter had a throat infection and they tried to sell me antibiotics for $250!!! After a lecture from me, they returned 10 minutes later with $30 antibiotics. Disgraceful!! Bathrooms need renovating and paying a resort fee is a joke. It's in a great central location and we were very happy staying here.
user_name:
heastcott
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Staff were pleasant that is it. The facilities such as the gym were a joke and the room probably resembled what I could only imagine to be a back packers retreat. Thin walls where you could hear the hair dryer from next door at 11 pm, dreaming that your wife had woken to dole her self but to realize it was coming from next door. We were that distressed we started searching for accommodation that night even though we had pre- paid for the accommodation, so our holiday was not ruined any further. Thank God the Moana Surfrider had accommodation available.

Stayed three nights, bedroom spacious, clean and bedding most comfortable with two king size beds. Good location for the shops, restaurants and Waikiki beach.Excellent room service, helpful staff.Down side being hotel very busy, queues for lift and difficulty finding empty poolside chairs.Cost of breakfast quite high but plenty of alternative breakfast venues close to the hotel.Good central location for exploring Honolulu,

Positive feedback: Bed linen, matress and pillows were great. Room was serviced to a high standard. Location is great. Hotel lobby very inviting. View is great.Negative feedback: Rooms look shabby, outdated and 'tired'. Unfriendly dining room staff. Pool in need of some urgent cosmetic work. WIFI did not work in rooms. Several computers in the computer lounge did not operate correctly. Breakfast is very 'ordinary'. Plumbing is poor (overflowing toilet, no water for several hours). Large amounts of mould in bathroom. Paying a 'Daily Resort Fee' is a definite rip off. Wouldn't stay here again or recommend it.

We stayed here one night at the end our 2 weeks in Hawaii. It's a decent hotel without the modern decor of competitors. You get what you pay for. We were quite content given the zip code and proximity to the beach, restaurants and shops. We were high up which was windy but gave us a nice view.

We recently stayed at this hotel and after looking at the photos on the website we were greatly disappointed. We booked and confirmed online for a room with 2 double beds as we were travelling with our teenage son. Upon arriving at the hotel we checked in with no problems. We opened the door to our room to find that we had only one bed. After then returning to reception we informed them we had booked a room with 2 beds and were told there was none available. A manager was called with no solution other than to take the room or go to another hotel. We were too tired to look for another hotel (after flying in after an exhausting flight) so we accepted this room. They brought up a portable bed. The upside was the manager offered us a free dinner voucher. Overall the bed was comfortable and the view good, but this hotel is very dated and really in need of a total renovation including the lifts...very scary on occasions! It is expensive for what you get. I don't understand why these hotels charge a "Daily Resort Fee", these items should be included in the room charge anyway. As we are SPG members we were very disappointed with this whole experience and having stayed in many SPG hotels around the world, it changes what our expectations are of the SPG hotels in the future.

After a week stay in Maui, we stopped over in Oahu and stayed 2 nights here in August. Everything was perfect. Check in was easy. The parking structure was just around the corner. Waikiki Beach was across the street. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. Room was clean & bed was comfy. Slept like a baby. Had a street view/pool view. Had the buffet in the restaurant and spent a lot of money in the bar. They have the best Lava Flow!!! My husband and I are not real picky travelers, but as long time SPG members we do have specific expectations when we stay at Starwood properties or at any other hotels: outstanding service (it is easy to smile and be courteous and helpful), a safe environment, comfortable accommodations, and value for our hard earned money. Sheraton PK did not disappoint. We look forward to staying here again.

Recently spent 7 nights here. Thoroughly enjoyed the accommodations and amenities. The room (27th floor) w/balcony - was spacious and had a fantastic view of Waikiki Beach and the ocean (even from the bed when drapes were opened). The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of storage space (large closet & large dresser). Having a small fridge, in-room coffee, and in-room safe were pluses. The check-in was slow (only one front-desk agent!) but we found staff to be friendly & courteous - especially our housekeeper "Gloria" - who was fantastic (genuinely happy, friendly & accommodating). There is a resort fee...however it includes parking, free wi-fi & use of beach towels & the nicest Tommy Bahama beach chairs...(Note: this property is not on the beach - and you will have to carry your chairs over - but just cross the street, walk 1/2 block and your there). The pool area is the hub of the hotel and almost seems like the lobby...there were plenty of lounge chairs...much of the dining and entertainment is done around the pool also (food is pricey). The internet lounge was very comfortable with plenty of desk-top stations for guests use. As other reviews have mentioned - the Sheraton Princess is a little "dated" and could use some sprucing up but it is a great value, in a fantastic location, with all the amenities you could want. If you're looking for luxury - you might be dissappointed. This was my 6th trip to Hawaii and I honestly don't spend much time in the room - so the money spent for "luxury" would be wasted. I am "picky" though when it comes to hotels - reputable, clean, safe, good location, etc, - Princess Kaiulani fit the bill and I would stay there again.
user_name:
gogoddess
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Checked in tonight-- a 3 hour ordeal-- I have never written a review before but my experience has been so horrible I feel the need to save someone from my experience-- if there was not a cancellation fee I would be gone by now.The hotel is dated-- I was put in the most horrible room on the other side of the elevator-- it was like train tracks were in the room with me-- when I went out of my way to request a quiet room. The room they moved me to has furniture that is completely beat up and damaged and the air conditioner does not work-- but the RUDE hotel manager thought she was doing me a favor by taking me away from the room that shared a wall with the elevator-- when I said I wanted a room with a working air conditioner she told me "this is Hawaii after all-- it will be warm and noisy."I am paying $200 a night-- for that I expect air conditioning and furniture that isn't completely damaged-- do not stay here-- it is so dated, the staff is rude (I asked the hotel operator if there was a charge for the bottled water-- she said look for a tag and hung up on me.

Stayed here for 4 nights on the 6th floor with water views. The room was big with all the amenities and was clean, it looked a bit dated though, but that wasn't a big deal. The bed was comfy and we had a balcony that opened to the view of the pool area and the ocean, the live music by the pool bar was also entertaining. They have parking facilities, beach towel & deck chair service. Every morning I would look forward to the yummy buffet breakfast.Nice staff and good customer service, a perfect location and reasonably priced. What more can you ask for.If I had the chance to go back to Waikiki, I would stay here again.

Most reviews here are fairly accurate. Great staff and customer service keeps this hotel running. That and the less expensive rates and convenient location keeps the hotel occupied. Alas the facilities and rooms are in bad need of a renovation. The pool is very small for a hotel of this size. The lobby is pretty and well kept. The buffet area right by the pool/lobby area often sends not the best seafood odor throughout the floor. The nightly music entertainment is okay and food is so so at best. There are better hotels nearby and on the beach, but you'll pay more.
user_name:
Colin N
Miami Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: Checked in October 8,2013. The computer system was down which caused check in to take about 10 minutes. They were unable to issue a key so a manager escorted us to the room on the seventh floor to let us in. Everyone was very polite and helpful. The room was large and clean. The view was of the tiny pool,nice but not special. The beach was a short walk across the street to one of the best beaches on planet earth. The building is old and needs work but for what it is and where it is it's great.Property is really in the heart of downtown Honolulu. A short walk to resturants, attractions,beaches. Public transportation is nearby and easy to figure out.We had a plumbing problem that was repaired right away and the television repair was tried one day and the set was switched out the next call. Had a great time and would recommend it highly

The only good thing to note about this hotel is its location.Aside from that, I was not inspired to come back. The entire hotel is in desperate need of a serious makeover. The room, whilst clean, showed several signs of wear and tear, and the fitout needs modernising. First time in many years that I came across non-adjustable aircon - all you can do is turn the fan on or off, but the temperature is pre-set and cannot be changed. As a result I found the room to be uncomfortably warm during the das and somewhat chilly at night.As for the staff, they were generally quite friendly , however an experience at the end of my stay significantly brought down the overall impression. Having realised that I had left a power converter and phone charger in my room I called the hotel 20 minutes after checking out, at 6 in the morning. I explained the situation and was assured that security would immediately go up to the room to retrieve the items. My friend, who was staying in Waikiki for another couple of days, could then pick them up later in the day. When he asked at reception in the afternoon, there was no record of the incident, and staff were indifferent and quite rude. I then called the hotel - from overseas, as I had travelled home - and also received sub-standard service. After being passed back and forth between Reception and Security, it culminated with the hotel's customer service manager telling me that 'there is nothing else we can do' and 'oh well, that's just the way it is...'.Thankfully the items weren't particularly valuable, but the inconvenience combined with the arrogant attitude of some hotel staff means that I for one won't be going back.

just home this week from hawaii and 11 nights at the pk after reading some reviews before travelling I did wonder if I had made a mistake with my choice of hotel,however from the word go we had great stay.Kathy who checked us in made us feel relaxed after our long trip from England via San Francisco. Our room was exactly what we had asked for superb views and high floor. bed was heavenly and Anastasia looked after our needs very well.Pool guys were great too, in fact we didn't see anyone without a smile which makes you feel happy yourself.I work in a large hotel myself and know how hard it is to please people but looking at the reviews i just couldn't see what else people needed to complain about. well done pk we loved our stay and thank you .ps the use of beach chairs and towels was a bonus.

One street away from the Beach! and on the main drag of all the excitement of Waikiki!!!... We stayed here as part of a group and were on the far wing side. My room was on the 26th floor with awesome views. My room was very well equipt, nothing too flash yet had everything we needed. There are many eatery's in the hotel and even more around it, it is a very centrally located hotel. We were able to use the bell rooms scales to weigh our bags before we hit the airport. The pool is open, only thing I wasnt too keen on was that it was open and it felt like random people could have rocked up to the pool but I guess you need to have a pool card (from reception for guests only) to get a towel. There was WIFI for a cost $14.95 per day cause we didnt need the other deals that came with the $25 combo tht is mostly suited for families with children. and th laundry room was below deck and frikkn hot...but we got through it lol. I didnt like that we had to park 15min away 'cause we didnt have parking in our combo but didnt realise this until we arrived so we paid another holtel around the corner to hold our van for a fraction of the cost that the Sheraton PK was going to charge us-Major downfall for what we were paying and there were always parks available. Apart from that, we had a good stay and were here for two nights and three days. If I can afford it next time around I would like to stay at the other Sheraton on the beach x

Nice hotel in a great location. Very convenient to get to everything in Honolulu from here. Very clean room and we were upgraded to an ocean view from our honeymoon. They also brought us a free bottle of champagne for our honeymoon which was very nice. For the price it was great for us.

If you want to be in the middle of everything, to be close to the most beautiful places on earth, to have exceptional service, this is the place to stay. No, this place does not boast the Ritz, posh and glamour, it boasts, convenience, and great service. The place is still a very nice place to stay. If you are there to critique the hotel room and not what it has to offer, then you should really stay at a more expensive place, then expect what you paid for. This place exceeded my expectations, and I am very sad that this place is closing next year. Sheraton Princess gave my family and I a lifetime of wonderful memories. Thank you for the great customer service!

Stayed at the Sheraton Pricess Kaiulani for one night (one night too long) early October. It is well known that none of the hotels in Hawaii have AC in the corridors, but this Sheraton has practically no AC in the rooms as well. There is one knob in the room for AC with 3 levels: off, low, and High. Even at High, there is practically no movement of air in the room, leading to a muggy, suffocating, dirty room. I tried everything from opening the balcony door, sleeping on the floor right under the vent, adjusting the vent blades, etc, but could not sleep a wink.This, coupled with a pool that shuts down at 6pm, no lounge, and terrible views were reasons enough for me to pack up and leave for another hotel. Your options will be limited if you are traveling as part of a big group, restricted dates, or budget restrictions.

We had stayed here twelve years ago,but sadly it seemed to have hit the slide. We arrived at 1pm but our room was not ready and indeed it was gone 3pm before we finally got the key. It took three trips to reception to finally make the breakthrough.The room was clean but not particulalry large and it would appear that the door lock had been replaced on a couple of occasions - the final replacement not fitting particularly well. The whole place appeared tired and badly in need of a refurb.Our three night stay was probably about right.On the plus side the staff were friendly and helpful, and any bills incurred in the other 3 Sheratons in Waikiki can be charged straight to your room bill at the PK. Did appreciate our small town in Fife Scotland (Anstruther) getting a mention in Kaiulani's travels in the hotel foyer. But gone was the welcoming letter, and the vase of tropical flowers.

Yes it’s a bit tired but you can’t beat the location and the view from a deluxe high ocean view room (check out the photos) but make sure you get an even numbered room overlooking the pool. The odd numbered rooms don’t actually look at the ocean they face the city. It’s clean and comfortable and the staff are very friendly and obliging but it certainly needs a reno and the soundproofing is practically non existent. We were woken on our first morning about 6am by some ‘moron’ yelling – and I mean yelling – “I need coffee”. Thankfully they were up early to check out and we weren’t disturbed again. We did find a few tiny ants in our room but maybe only a dozen over the twelve days so more of a curiosity than anything else. The ‘Pikake Terrace’ buffet is overpriced – about US$40 a head for any meal – and we never ate there - it seemed to be only frequented by the Japanese who presumably get it as part of a package deal. Would I stay there again? Well it’s the second time I’ve stayed there in 3 years so yes I would but I’d look at other options first.

So far, I went to Hawaii four times and stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani hotel. This is the best hotel in Oahu, its clean, walking distance to restaurants, shopping and to the Waikiki beach. This hotel have complementary pineapples in the afternoon for their customers. If you stay at this hotel don't forget to visit the International Market just behind the hotel.

We booked a tour of Hawaii through an agent. She set us up with Aloha Tours making all the arrangements for hotels and tours. As a contributor to Trip Advisor I looked up our hotels. After reading some of the negative reviews I wondered what type of hotel she booked us in. She told me she has sent many people there and she hadn't have any negative reports. When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly and well informed staff. Our checking was very smooth and efficient. Knowing that the hotel is an older one it didn't show it in the lobby or pool or other public areas. The rooms were well maintained and clean. The air conditioning keep the room cool to our liking. Our room was on the 10 floor overlooking the International Market Place. It was enjoyable to sit on the balcony and listen to the music. When we closed our patio doors you could not hear it so sleeping was good. While the street people can be a little bothersome at times not only in the area of the hotel but in all of downtown Honolulu. It appeared to us that the business owners and merchants try to control them on their property the city has little control over them on the sidewalks..We were there to celebrate our 40th anniversary. It was a surprise to find upon our return to our room a bottle of champagne from the manager. His thoughtfulness was touching. We offered our thanks to Mr. Orr kindness. If we found ourselves in Honolulu again we would strongly consider stay at this hotel. We would recommend it to our friends as a good place to stay.
user_name:
Steven E
Hillsboro, New Mexico, United States

review_body: I stayed here just over a week ago and was very sad to leave. The hotel is a beautiful building located only a short walk from the beach. The rooms were comfortable, clean and tidy. The front desk staff and the bell guys were very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere at night was lovely with the sound of the music from the entertainment by the pool drifting all over the hotel. My only bug bear was the smell of fish as you walk through the hotel at dinnertime, but that's only because I don't eat fish. The restaurants all around this hotel do fantastic food & fresh melon and pineapple to die for. Great restaurant to try is Cheesecake Factory. Word of warning tho, don't leave it too late or the waiting time is unreal (even though it's worth it) and also make sure you go there hungry!

The property is old. That picture of the pool? -- don't know how they took it because it is tiny. If you are looking for convenience: in the center of shopping, and across the street from beach, then stop here and book. Bathrooms -- old but very clean. Rooms clean and smelled fresh. We prepaid a 1 night stay for two rooms on same floor and got just that! Plus we each had nice views of the ocean looking over the roof line of the Surfrider. Decent sized lanais. Ate at the Surfrider, and had outdoor drinks there, too. Check in was a bit slow, as was checkout. Bonus: Parking Garage -- for your rental car!

Stayed here a week ago. The room was on the 7th floor and faced the pool. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The drawer and closet space was plentiful. The bathroom, though clean was very old and the drain in the tub didn't work well. I have stayed here many times over the last 12 years and it's always been a good stay. I especially like the downstairs area by the pool and restaurants. Everynight they have good Hawaiian music and hula dancing. You can't beat the location! The entire staff is always ready to help. I especially appreciate the chairs you can take to the beach. Even though this place needs some TLC, i would stay here again.

Second Hotel i visited in Waikiki. The hotel is nice and clean, the staff is very helpful and the overall feel for the hotel is nice, however due to the fact that there are other hotels along the beach in Waikiki, the hotel fails to deliver the out of the ordinary views that some of the other hotels at Oahu has to offer!

This was my 4th time vacationing in Waikiki. My wife, toddler son and I were on a budget this year so we stayed at this hotel instead a higher star hotel than we had in the past.I have to admit that I was skeptical after reading some bad reviews, but our experiences ended up much better than expected.We stayed 6 nights in Sept 2013 in an ocean view king in the Ainahau Tower.The room was a bit dated, but nothing to really complain about. I was fine for us and housekeeping did a good job each day for us.If you're keeping a car there, when you first arrive, you will drop off your luggage with the attendant who will then direct you to park in the self parking structure. You can then check in at the lobby and the bell staff will bring your luggage to your room. Make note of your rental car details (make/model/color) since you need to provide this info when checking in and getting the car permit.For parking, the only elevator access is on the 3rd and 4th floors on the Ainahau tower side. Just look for the signs that show where there is an elevator. For most this may not be needed, but we had a stroller so we always needed it.The hotel lobby is always busy with people, the elevators do sometimes take a long time and get crowded, there is a lot of noise from outside at night time, and the rooms are dated. This all really wasn't a big deal since I know Waikiki and what to expect, especially if staying in that area. If that kind of stuff bothers you, then spend the extra money someplace like the Surfrider or Sheraton on the beach or just stay further away from the busy part of Waikiki or go to another island like Kauai or the Big Island. But if you're not high maintenance and used to the busy pace and noise of Waikiki, then this hotel is fine.

Loved the welcome drinks - and our reception lady Ping was just wonderful. Got a special deal that included upgrade to a pool view and free buffet breakfast daily. Great view - and the breakfast & staff were fabulous. Even had a cook making omelettes to order! The location is wonderful - a short stroll to everywhere. The resort fee was worth it for free wi-fi, free parking and the free international calls to Australia. Have stayed at Sheraton waikiki too - and while it is more impressive location and decor wise, this place was far more comfortable - and much less crowded. It was easy to find a table around the pool for our cocktails. Would stay here again :)

Just booked today for another holiday in April next year. Only downfall we couldn't get free breakfast at the same special as last April. Looking forward to renewing acquaintances with familiar staff. We prefer a Poolside room in the Princess Wing. 27 weeks to go but whose counting, Only worry is when does International Market area demolishing start? Could create a lot of noise.

My Wife and I stayed 7 nights at the hotel , like our previous stay in 2011 the Staff were very helpful, the Hotel room was clean. The noise from the airconditioning motors was bad 24/7, we were on the 27 floor overlooking The Markets. We understand that renovations are to be at the hotel in the near future we hope this reduce the noise level, we like to stay again.

This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel in the past 3yrs. On my first visit i felt the hotel was looking a little 'tired' and could well do with a "spruce up". On my second visit (12mths later) i noted that it still looked the same - 'tired'. On my third visit (12mths later again) - i felt i was living "Groundhog Day". Nothing had changed - even most of the staff were still the same. Whilst the decor and fittings may be getting a little old and dated, the comfort of the beds is unbelievable, couple this with spectacular views of Waikiki beach (high ocean view room) this hotel does tick the box. it is on the famous Waikiki strip and is walking distance to everything you need. Ernie at the Tours Desk is Excellent!!! Very friendly and extremely helpful. We understand that this hotel is about to undergo major renovations work - which may explain why it has gone up $100pn compared to last year! Once the renovations are completed, this hotel will be able to compete with any other 5-star hotel in Waikiki. The hotel is constantly busy with many travellers coming and going. A sign of its popularity and value

I apologize for the late review but I was inactive on TripAdvisor for a while and am just catching up on my reviews. We stayed here for one night in March 2010 after our cruise. It is in a great location with lovely poolside entertainment at night. The rooms are basic but we were not there to stay in our room. We were in Hawaii! It is a quick and convenient walk to everything in Waikiki we wanted to do and also to Kuhio Avenue so we could take TheBus to Pearl Harbor.

This hotel located just next to the International Market Place. Just off from Kalakaua Street and cross the street from Hyatt Regency Waikiki. You can hear all noises from the streets and hotel poolside. Most guest rooms are not seeing the ocean well. I booked as a Ocean view room but I have to go to the Lanai then I am able to see the ocean the end of the Lanai. The hotel offers Luau Dinner every evening. Also has the seafood buffet dinner at the 1st floor. The taste was good. To the Waikiki beach about 5 min. walk.

We spent 4 nights here before moving on to an outer island. Our room was miniscule by US standards & reminded us of European-sized rooms. However, it was adequate, & the king-sized bed was very comfortable. The hotel's location is only 1 block from the beach & it's surrounded by plenty of interesting shops & restaurants. Our room in the Princess Kaiulani (sp?) wing overlooked the King's Village shopping area, which was fun to watch from the lanai. NOTE - the parking garage, despite the signs, does NOT have an elevator.

My wife stayed here for one very delightful night as we were transiting to the Big Island to stay at a private resort there.The number ONE asset of this Hotel resort is the staff! Everyone from the receiver at drive up to staff at reservation desk to porters to restaurant staff was absolutely WONDERFUL! Smiles & Aloha’s all day every day. The staff was also very knowledgeable & helpful on directions & suggestions of other places to go on Waikiki beach!Our check in experience was very good and our room was exactly as advertised with a great sea view balcony! Very clean if not slightly dated furniture but perfect or our needs.The check-out experience was flawless and left us with a great feeling to start our first Hawaiian tour!Mahalo staff & management! Y’all did a great job!

My wife and I stayed here for the 5th time in September of 2013 for our anniversary. As is past visits, the bed is extremely comfortable, the room is basic but clean and best of all is the staff! From the housekeepers, to the bell desk, the concierge, and best of all the staff at the pool bar. We visited several bars and restaurants during our stay and I must say the staff at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Splash Bar has the best crew out of any of them. Angie, always remembers us, even though we hadn't been there in over a year. Tiffany and Tehani were also very friendly, personable and provided outstanding service. We wanted to come here one last time before they start renovations. I really hope that Sheraton does not price us out of the place and is still able to keep it a peaceful relaxing place in the center of Waikiki and most importantly, if anyone from Sheraton or Starwood reads this: Keep the crew together and keep providing excellent customer service.

I stayed for 3 days at the Sheraton Princess. They put me on the 27th floor so I had a great (partial) view of the ocean and the city. The only problem was that it was very windy and made the patio door shake which got pretty anoying after awhile! The rooms were a little small, but adequate for one person. Being on such a high floor it was a real pain trying to get from the lobby to my floor without having to stop 26 times on the way down!! The elevators were always crowded and not much air moving, so quite stuffy! As most people point out, this hotel is a bit dated, but the rooms were always clean. This property was just around the corner from the main drag, a block from the International Marketplace, and across the street from the beach. I don't have anything negative to say about this hotel, and would definately stay here again!

Although this hotel does not have top rating we found it perfect for our circumstances. We were only staying two nights on our way home from Canada. The staff were at all times helpful and very courteous and the room was immaculate. We were lucky enough to have a room on a corner so we could look over the pool area, and look out at Waikiki and the surfers only two blocks away - so the hotel location was perfect. Free Wi-Fi was a good bonus.The late check-out - 11am- was very helpful. We were allowed - free of charge - to leave our luggage in the hotel, and as we had a late flight we were able to book a room to shower and freshen up late in the day - again no charge.

We have just returned from our 12 night stay at the Princess. It had been 6 years since our last stay there and after reading recent reviews, wasn't sure if we had made the right choice by staying again. Rest assured, we had. Ok, we knew fro previous experience the Princess was becoming very tired and in need of attention but that didn't deter us as the positives outweigh the negatives. Location location location is what it's all about at Waikiki. The PK has that. Across the road from the beach, towels & beach chairs provided daily and a great fresh fruit and bottled water service when on the dedicated area on the beach - much appreciated. We had a pool view room in the Princess wing. Our room 318 had a wonderful view, not of the beach but who cares as we went there every day anyway but of all the action around the pool including night time entertainment on the stage.Room details: Quite spacious, and our extremely efficient housemaid kept our room/bathroom spotless.Plenty of towels, toiletries and bottles of water replenished each day.Our room was directly opposite the elevators but this didn't disturb us at all. (No-one can avoid noisy guests arriving back late at night which only happened once).Lots of storage spaceOur bed was extremely comfortable (although the pillows were too soft for us)The carpet in our room had just been cleaned prior to our arrival - niceThe room appeared to have been freshly painted recently. The large flat screen TV was also a bonus.Bathroom was small and needed upgrading but was functional for our needs.All in all a very comfortable room for the price. We are sad that the whole thing is to be demolished next year to be replaced most probably with something lacking the atmosphere of the PK and costing many more $$$. Go while you can.We've stayed over the road on the beach and really, the rooms there weren't much better as far as size and amenities go and a lot more expensive. I would ask for a pool view room though as rooms the other side of the passageway overlook the carpark etc.I recommend staying in the Princess wing, we haven't been in the others so can't comment

I stayed here with my wife and 2 year old son when I attended a conference. It was a nice enough hotel, close to Waikiki, shopping, and had a pool. The pool was nothing to write home about, but it was really fun for my son who loves just splashing around. We had some difficulty connecting to the wireless network, but it was resolved since the front desk patched us through to the NTT Docomo tech support. Also, I would recommended getting the resort package if you are renting a car, since it includes internet and parking. Overall, it's a good value, much cheaper than the other Sheraton. It's well-located with good restaurants just around the corner, including marukame udon.

Looks can definitely be deceiving. Hotel looks very nice from outside. Unfortunately after 10pm the sidewalks around entrance to hotel are littered with prostitutes that harass you as you try to come and go from or to the hotel. The lobby is very nice and island feeling. Once you get in elevator, you get the feeling, this is going to bed bad... Elevator opens and there is the disgusting hallways on the room levels. The rooms are old, with bad air conditioning, small and dirty bathrooms, tiny beds like you would get in Europe or in a hospital! Staff are not well trained in customer service and are not easily able to help when a problem or concern arises.
user_name:
ExpertTravelCritic
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for three nights in this hotel located in the center of Waikiki. Ideal for the beach, shopping and people watching. I was surprised (pleasantly!) at how many people were out walking, shopping... even after 10 at night! At check-in, we got a wonderful upgrade to an 11th floor suite in the main building with an absolutely huge balcony and a terrific view (although the bathroom seemed a bit small relative to the size of the room). The fruit basket was lovely and very much appreciated!We had the buffet dinner at the hotel one night. We rarely do buffets, but this one had a nice, varied selection - crab legs and prime rib stations - and plenty of great desserts. Skip lunch that day and maybe breakfast the day after! Special thanks to Yin at the front desk and Rod (or Ron?) at the Pikake Terrace for their outstanding service during our stay!

Great location just across the road from Waikiki Beach and next to the International Market Place. The beds at this hotel are so comfortable and room is clean, the bathrooms are small and could do with a make over however still clean. The pool area is very basic but the staff by the pool are very nice and helpful. The hotel offers water and fruit twice daily if you on the beach they will come and find you if your down near the Duke Statue, also on a first in first serve basis the pool staff will give you beach chairs to take to the beach which is a great idea. I would recommend this hotel to all types of travellers.

Fantastic location in Waikiki beach. The hive and centre of all activity. We have stayed here with family 4 years in a row and would highly recommend to other travellers wishing to spend some time in Waikiki. The hotel has a great buffet breakfast selection, and the pool and seating area is good. The views over Waikiki are awesome. The decor is a little dated and the hotel rooms are basic but perfectly sufficient and fine.

Nice location,2mins from beach,shopping awesome pool,very friendly staff and a very clean hotel,lots of restaurants,street performers nightly,band playing every night,absolutly loved it and will be back in March 2014,

Super location just across across the street from Waikiki Beach. Lots of reasonable restaurants nearby (KFC, Subway, Denny's) as well as the open air shopping market and the ABC convenience stores. Also a great pool area, easy access, lots of chaises lounges, with evening entertainment. Be sure to go to the cultural center for afternoon entertainment (free and outside.)

If you want something close to all Waikiki ammenties the Princess Kaiulani is excellent. It has some age on it for sure, however, for me, the convenience of its location out weighed this. Walk to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, coffee shops, markets. Meals available from the in house restaurant were good value if you chose to eat in. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay again.

The hotel is located right in the middle of waikiki which was perfect for the pro bowl street party going on right in front of the hotel. The room was clean and very quiet. We had a beautiful view of waikiki.

Have stayed at this hotel for three years and enjoyed it's conveniences every time. But, apparently, we heard that they are demolishing it in 2015 and making it into condos so we will not be there again...disappointing.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is a great hotel for the price. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very hospitable. They had entertainment every evening poolside.it was in a great location. Just minutes from Waikiki and shopping. The pool was kind of small and outdated,

This resort has awesome location and charge abilities at other Starwood properties. The lobby has been redone so the first impression is good. But, once in the hallways, right from a 70s hospital is your first indicator of what your room is to look like. It has not been redone since the 70s I swear, and it shows. Dated, worn and some items out of service, i.e. coffee maker, safe.THe bathroom had no rounded show curtain something I've not seen in the least expensive hotels in 10 years, dated counters, it had been painted over and over again, and the room was hospital green, like the halls.

While the hotel is certainly dated, the location and views are fantastic. Located across the road from Waikiki Beach everything is within walking distance. The beds are so lovely and comfortable and complimentary WIFI the perfect addition to the room. If not within easy walking distance then easily accessible from the trolley stop downstairs.

We returned to this hotel again this year as had such a great experience last time. Once again we loved everything about it. The location is fantastic and the staff go that little extra mile to help. We loved the staff at the pool bar and our check in lady was wonderful. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning and the food was great. We also had the dinner buffet one time which was nice. While at the beach, staff bring water and fruit. Great service. I cannot say enough about how great this hotel is. We love it. We are very sad to hear that the hotel is closing next year for renovation as we don't know where we will stay! Very sad.

If you want to be in the center of all that Waikiki has to offer at a great price, this is the perfect choice! It's just not fair to be critical of the hotel because it is an older property. Anyone who does even the slightest research will see this isn't the most luxurious of Starwood properties. However, the outstanding staff makes up for it in so many ways. From check-in staff to room service to housekeeping to bellman, every team member we encountered was extremely professional and helpful. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfy. We were on the 27th floor with a partial ocean view. The higher room the better, not only for the obvious reasons, but also to avoid the sounds of the Waikiki hustle and bustle below, which we could hear every night. Decent food and we especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet by the pool, although expensive at $25 per person. Finally, at $24 per night, the resort fee is among the cheapest you will find. So if you want to save some money and have a solid home base in the middle of the action, book the Sheraton PK!

What a great location right in the middle of everything. We must have stayed in the older side of the hotel, because the room was small and needed some updating. However the room had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. There is a resort fee to be paid of 25.00 daily but it is worth it ,because it includes parking. So if you rent a car this hotel is for you. The staff at the front desk were also every friendly and helpful. We would like to say Thank-you to Shawna for all her help upon checkin, she really took care of us.

Stayed in the Ainahau Tower (rooms with balconies) in an Ocean View room which had an amazing view of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head permitted you stay in an even numbered room. I was is 2462 which was a corner room closer to the water which was an even better view. I suggest staying on levels 20-29. Cleanliness and service was very good and location is great only a 2-3 minute walk to the beach and the infamous Cheesecake Factory. I never used the pool since it was so close to the beach but they have a great towel service and if you stay at a certain location on the beach they bring fresh fruit and water between 10am-2pm. Only downfall would be their food menu and room service. Not much variety and only serve until 830pm but not a major issue considering restaurants on the main strip are open until 11pm. Great hotel and value. Would definitely stay there again if I had the opportunity 4/5!

We got a really good rate so this hotel was great value for money as Waikiki is super expensive. This hotel is smack bang in the middle of Waikiki beach and close to almost all eateries. We had some lovely cocktails at the pool bar and really enjoyed the drinks service they had at the beach (nothing fancy, just cold water and fruit).

We recently stayed at this hotel for three weeks and I would highly recommend it to everyone. The hotel staff were always very friendly and helpful, there is always entertainment happening in the lobby and pool area throughout the day and evening and the hotel was clean and comfortable. The amenities, such as the pool and fitness center were great and there was a huge variety of food available at the buffet and pool bar. The location of the hotle could not have been better, it was across the street from Waikiki beach and a short stroll to restaurants, shopping, the trolley/bus stops and nightly entertainment.

I've stayed here before (prefer the Sheraton Waikiki on the beach) it's a great location right across the street from the ocean! You don't stay here for the swimming pool you stay here because it's a good price for the location. It's an old property, that being said, I heard from a reliable source it's being torn down next year 2014 for a major renovation. Our room this time was a Diamond Head ocean view, spectacular. ABC store across the street has everything you forgot, or fresh pineapple and yogurt for a nice healthy breakfast! Sheraton always takes good care of you, super comfy beds and pillows, great staff! The only downside, but this is just normal because Waikiki is big city afterall, if you are a light sleeper, you will not be able to leave your lanai door open without sirens and trucks and busses beeping like crazy.

This hotel is impressive at the foyer however when you get to the room it is very much a 60,s style motel room there is nothing wrong with that but it could do with some updating.Our romm had a blocked WC which went over the floor but was cleaned up and we had paid for a high ocean view.You could only see the ocean between the hotels in front.As we spent most of the time out of the room we did not feel so bad.It is in an excellent location.The only other issue is the $24 a day surcharge for internet fruit and water.This is great if you use it a lot and if you spend all your time om Waikiki beach.If you do not it is a serious waste of money.Do not forget to collect your beach chairs as it will cost you $50 per day for a bedx2 and parasol on WaIkiki beach.Staff were really helpful.

great location. Enjoy the staff, surfboard lockers, and the pool. Close to the beach, shopping, and restaurants. You cant get closer unless you are on the water, but for the price, you never will. Love staying here and will always chose this location if staying at a hotel in Waikiki.

We are staying in this hotel for 5 days. Watch out this hotel is OLD, I am a dedicated Starwood Platinum member with 475 nights in Starwood properties. We were told we were up graded to an ocean view, but the two rooms are very small. In the kids room the chair has to be placed in front of the adjoining room door. In our bathroom you have get in the room and close the door to get in the tub. No club lounge, but we were offered free Continental breakfast for my wife and I but not the kids, even though they are on MY reservation. The pool is small and crowded. The room is clean, but wall paper is coming unglued from the wall. We love the location, and the WiFi is free.I don't feel this hotel is at the Starwood standards, and after you get used to the Platinum member perks, I feel very let down.

What a disappointment! This hotel is so outdated. Decor in the room felt like a 70'ies hostel. Poorly working AC, room not cleaned properly, no AC in public areas and generally poor service. On the positive side: room was good sized, big balcony, excellent location.Bad experience with the service at onsite Tour Company. A very rude and unipolite lady!! Not fit to work in the service industry.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel is set one block back from the beach. The hotel reception/concierge staff and housekeeping are friendly, helpful and efficient which makes you feel welcome on a personal basis. We stayed in a High Ocean View Room, the room was clean and spacious and the views from the balcony were exceptional. There are plenty of restaurants nearby the hotel which should suit all tastes and the hotel has buffet service in their restaurant. Cost in the hotel is approx $40 per person for dinner but nearby restaurant meals could average $50 per couple. Read some reports about hotel "crumbling". Although hotel could do with "freshening up" we had no complaints about our room or the reception area. Chairs and towels supplied if you want to go to the beach with complimentary soft drinks brought to you around 11.30am and 1.30pm (nice service!). Based on service and location I would recommend this hotel.

Stayed here for convention. The location is very good. Plenty of places to eat nearby and a short walk to the water. Not a bad walk to the convention center either if you have walking shoes. It's about 1.3 miles -25 minutes. Staff very friendly. Exercise room is very good. Breakfast was fair. But the room is very much a dated motel room - quite disappointed. The bed had the typical Sheraton bedding, but the bed was very saggy. Curtain had cigarette burn and was hanging off the rod in places. NO WAY to adjust the A/C. Seriously, you get an on/off switch. - no temp control. The furniture is old, scratched and worn - vintage. The safe was broken and they had a service tech try to fix it but no luck. Barely any space in the bathroom and the floor grout was filthy. Only plastic cups and extremely limited bath acme entries - I've seen better at their lesser brand, Four Points. The carpet was old and worn and had that look that you don't want to go barefoot on. I was in the princess tower which I'm told is the oldest and due for renovation. But really, as a SPG platinum guest, I'd say this is the worst Starwood room I've been given in my 10 years as a platinum level guest. Would not stay here again unless they do in fact do a total tear down renovation.

And yes the service was disgracefulThe reception even said that when we arrived at 8.30am our room wasn't ready till 1pm and every 30minutes after that until 4pm the reception told us bluntly we had to wait or our room and we could us the freshen up room until our room would be ready which consisted of a toilet shower and to small couches.. WTF!And we booked a more expensive room and still couldn't mert our early check in .. 4pm is out of line!..Also the staff at checkin reception had the hide to say the never heard of AGODA booking company ... Even the manager stated it on check out .. Obvious a bit simple minded an lack of international knowledge ... In there small little world of Hawaii America... Also extremely condescending staff .. Especially to the Japanese people whom don't speak much English..What a rip off for such a run down hotel. Should be have the price for a 3 staff hotel with a small backyard pool what a joke!.. The lift on the 27th floor took about 5 minutes each way to get up an down!...what a hassle that was too.. Nightmare of a experience ... warning DON'T STAY AT SHERATON PRINCESS

What can I say. The staff are extremely friendly and they need to be because the property, lets be nice is tired and I mean Rip Van Winkle tired. I am a loyal Starwood Platinum Guest an just love the brand. It pains me to travel 12 hours from the US East Coast and come to "Paradise" and be put in a room like this with a bare functional AC unit, a broken refrigerator, peeling wall paper, broken towel holder on the door, lights not working, What a let down!! The worst part was the front desk said I was in a very nice room with a city view and I would pleased. Starwood, this property needs a do over bad. Tough to say this is a Starwood Property. Not Good folks

We stayed there for 5 nights during a convention.I don't have much to say about the property, except that it is old like many Sheraton properties. When we checked in, we found that part of our reservation was not registered in the system. It was quite a jar after an exhausting 36-hour flight. But the staff empathized with us and they patiently worked on the system to get our rooms sorted out. Some of us had to wait for our rooms to be prepared. Thanks to the complimentary drink vouchers, we could relax in the poolside restaurant while we waited.The missing reservation was still unresolved during our stay, and everyday I returned to the reception to find out how it was. And every time I came to see them, the staff greeted me graciously and checked the system. Fortunately, they managed to get it right although we had to move to a different wing of the hotel.The rest of the stay was enjoyable. The hotel was within a short walk to the gorgeous Waikiki beach. It was also close to a variety of stores and restaurants. And just outside the hotel gate was a Greyhound double deck tour bus ticket counter, and an ABC (some kind of a general store) where we resupplied our needs and even shopped for souvenirs.The hotel seems to be always packed with tourists, especially in winter months, so it would not be a convenient place to spend your whole day.The swimming pool was too deep even for me, so I didn't bother to swim there. Besides, there's a whole ocean to play in!

My husband and I stayed here last year for our honeymoon although we made the best of our trip finally a year later I'm getting around to writing this review. I have to say the location is what you are paying for but word of advice TRIPLE check your room.Our bathroom tub was disgusting it looked clean at first till we lifted the tub plastic thing it was so dirty I don't think it was ever cleaned. If I can upload the picture I will. Although the cleaning staff came right up to clean it we didn't feel as comfortable here.

The rooms are a little bit dated, but good. The bathrooms need a little updating. The location of the hotel can't be beat for the price. One minor issue is the parking structure. The elevator is only accessible from the four floor. If you park on the third or second floor, you have to walk all the way down or walk up to the four floor to catch the elevator. You can use the stairs on all the floors, but when you have a stroller (like we did) it was a little inconvenient. Overall, the hotel is good. I would stay here again in the future. The best thing is the parking is included in the resort fee as well as wi-fi.

This hotel is definately about location...and the extremely helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are clean and maybe the hotel itself could do with a facelift as it is starting to show its age, but all said and done i just love coming back to this hotel....from the start...easy check-in, Darlette is the best gal at reception to.... a big thank you to Marsha Southworth the (very best) Travel Consultant, who can plan all of your tours at the drop of a hat as she knows Hawaii inside out and can give you the best advise on what tours to take while your there....will def be coming back again to see all the familiar faces....had the best time again....

This hotel must date back to the 50's or 60's and doesn't appear to have had much work done on it since then. We booked a city view room but got a pool view which actually had a fabulous view of the Moana Surfrider across the road. The tiny balcony was enough for two to sit on and enjoy the view although you needed the rest given the effort required to get the door to roll open. The bed was super confortable and there is a flat screen TV. The fridge rattled so much we had to turn it off. The bathroom has the original fittings. The walls are thin so conversation in the next room is easily overheard. The wifi, included in the manadatory resort charge of $23 per night, worked for only 15 minutes of our 48 hours stay despite the assurances of the external tenchical help desk that they would resolve it. BUT, the staff are super friendly and for the second time in 2 years we were given access to our room on arrival early morning and upgraded. Best of all it's right in the centre of things and you can use most of the facilities of the fabulous Moana Surfrider across the road. However, with service and resort charges, taxes, etc it was $300 a night - a lot for something so tired.

This hotel is all about the location and the friendly staff. As others have stated the place needs a serious renovation. The balconies next to our room look downright dangerous. The rooms are pretty cramped and for the number of SPG points required to stay I would've expected a better looking room. The restroom has peeling paint and a warped door. All the staff were wonderful and helpful. They were extremely friendly. Too bad the rooms are old and dingy. As my little one said the place looks old.

Check in easy. Location great. Lobby restaurant good food. Room clean and updated. Nice balcony with part ocean view. Good sound protection from noisy Waikiki area. Easy to walk anywhere. Would def stay here again. Nothing fancy but for the price it's tough to go anywhere and pay more.

Location was great, close to anything you might want to do. For the price, the hotel/room was just average, nothing speacial at all. All of the people were very friendly and helpfull. Ecspecially Marsha at the Tavel Desk. I was going to try and do Pearl Harbor and the Missouri on my own but found out that tickets were sold out due to governmental cut backs. I went to Marsha and she made numerous phone calls trying to get me on a tour group, because they had tickets reserved. I only had that day to go and she set it up for me. Very knowledgable and efficient.

Just checked in and, sad to say, the prior reviews are pretty accurate. While the bedding has been updated, our "upgraded" room with two double beds makes some NYC hotel rooms look downright spacious. While we have a nice balcony view, the furniture, walls, bathroom ALL need a facelift. Power is delivered through an old, over crowded, and tAngled power strip, on the floor. Ugh. hallway and elevators also pretty rough. It is clear that the property is trading on it's (prime) location, and the staff, while helpful and cheery, can only do what they can. (By contrast, my points stay at the Pink Palace six years back was upgraded to a junior suite with gobs of room. This upgrade got me a nice view and little else). Staying on points as SPG Platinum, I would say this was over rated (too many points per night) but then so are the others in Waikiki and I didn't have enough for the Royal or Surfrider.

Travelled to Hawaii for my partners birthday and stayed at the Sherton Princess Kaiulani.The location was perfect, right on the main strip and less than 5m away from a coffee shop. We stayed in a studio which was lovely and modern unlike alot of hotels in Waikiki. It is great value. Everyone was willing to help us out and suggest places to go and see. We were giving free calls back home each day and bottled water. The only way you could get any better would be if you stayed right on the beach.
user_name:
Chiara G
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is all about location. You are right smack in the heart of all the Waikiki action, steps away from the beach, restaurants, shopping, etc... The rooms are a bit dated and could use a good thorough renovation. The air conditioning is not as powerful as I would have liked and the curtains are kind of threadbare. But he bed was comfortable and I did not hear any noise coming from the streets of Waikiki. And everything was clean. The staff at the hotel was friendly and seemed eager to accommodate everyone's needs. There is plenty of seating at the pool, which was a nice area to take a break from the sand and crowds of the beach. I love the location of this hotel and would stay there again, sure the rooms could use some work but it's Honolulu, you are only in your room to sleep!

Wife and I stayed here for 8 nights in May 2013. True, PK is not such a modern facility as others in the area, but I have no major complaints about my stay. Our room was very clean and well maintained. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was a bit small but ok. Would have really liked some kind of counter by the sink to provide more room for my things.Street noise during the night was sometimes a bit noisy from vehicle and pedestrian traffic. But that has to be balanced against the convenient location of PK, in the center of Waikiki. AC unit was noisy sometimes and took getting used to. I did not have much problem sleeping, even with the noise. Easy strolling along Kaiulani Ave. Easy walk to Waikiki Beach across the street and either through the Moana Surfrider Hotel (no one there seemed to complain about our using it as a walkway to the beach), or through one of the street beach entrances a little further down.No complaint about the resort fee, like some other reviewers seem to have a problem with. It seemed to be reasonable and in line with other hotels. Not sure I understand the rationale for setting is as a separate fee; it didn't seem to be optional, so why not just incorporate it into the final room rate. As part of the resort fee, PK provided beach amenities: towels, folding beach chairs, and even one of those small plastic inflatable rafts to use on the beach.Staff was courteous and helpful. Especially one of the people at the tours table. He spent a lot of time arranging one-day tours to Maui and Big Island for 4 of us. He made a lot of phone calls to accommodate us. Shuttle bus picked us up at PK and brought us to the airport for travel to each island.Tried the breakfast buffet one morning; it was okay, nothing special. Although the woman working the omelet station that morning didn't seem to be in a particularly good mood. Guava juice was good; I now love that stuff!We rented a car. Using the PK parking deck was very easy and it is right next to the hotel. Parking was covered in the resort fee.I had no problems at all with the internet access. It worked fine all the time.We attended PK's "Creation" dinner show within the hotel itself. It was okay. The performers were very good and worked very hard.

True the hotel is aging, but it is a very good value. Comfortable beds, fast and efficient service. I found that many of the staff members are friendly and helpful.The parking is easy and a very close walk to the lobby and rooms. Two bottled water provided daily, coffee maker and refrigerator in the room. And, you are right in the middle of Waikiki. Not sure if they offered a breakfast to platinum members.

We stayed at this hotel in Hawaii for 6 nights post a cruise from Sydney. The staff were lovely the rooms were very clean and serviced daily. There was free wi, sorry only down fall if you are on the 28th floor as we were too high up for wi fi, friends on 14th floor received it. There was a consolation to this we could phone home for 1 hr every day on the room phone for free and not just by ringing one person, it was great.The pool area was old but nice and was on ground level, not roof top as many are in Hawaii. We would have drinks there every evening before going out to dinner. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and the price was very reasonable. There was no spa in our room or around the pool area.

After booking this hotel in november we were very tempted to cancel after all the negative reviews we read. So glad we didn't, don't know what some people want. The hotel location is great, right in the middle of everything, with Waikiki beach just over the road. When we arrived we were given a room overlooking the car park but asked next morning and the staff were very helpful and we moved to city/ocean/diamond head view, lovely. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for you. Yes the rooms are basic, but the beds are something else, so comfortable, and the maids do a wonderful job keeping them spotless, what more do you need. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

I was skeptical about this hotel because of some negative comments, but I got a decent rate (considering it was the Fourth of July holiday) and decided to give it a try. It's right on the main drag of Kalakaua Avenue, but this particular corner at Kaiulani Avenue is surprisingly less frenetic than other parts of central Waikiki -- perhaps because there's not such a high concentration of restaurants and retail on this particular stretch. This property is definitely showing signs of wear, and some amenities seem a little improvised, like the oddly placed gym that sort of floats between a large terrace and a big open public area where large groups sometimes convene. The standard rooms are on the small side, but the ones on the higher floors of the tallest tower offer great views of the beach and mountains. I was upgraded to Room 2762, one of the hotel's suite accommodations, which was a very spacious open-plan room with a wet bar area in the large entryway; a big seating area with sofa, desk, armchair, and large flat-screen television atop a chest of drawers; a two-poster king bed; a bathroom separated from the rest of the room by a glass wall, good for showering while enjoying the view; and a very long double balcony that really brought the outdoors in when both sliding doors were flung open. This is by no means a luxury hotel, but my room was simply fantastic and, with the great location, made up for all shortcomings. TIP: The self parking is really convenient, especially if you are staying in the tallest Ainahau Tower, for there is direct elevator access from the top two levels of the parking structure to the rooms in this wing of the hotel.
user_name:
travelerhnl
New York City, New York

review_body: Just arrived back after 6nights at the Sheraton princess.after reading all the negative reviews for months,was in too minds whether to change hotel!But we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.staff were very friendly couldn,t do enough for you.we did change rooms,and got a high floor city part ocean view.room. pool and bar area was clean.food at the hotel was pricey,but there are plenty of resturants near by.Enjoyed having the chairs for the beach and the water and fruit that they brought to you twice a day.would stay at this hotel again,don,t know what people want,.think they just go away to moanl!!!

Just came back from vacation - stayed here for 3 nights - for a Sheraton Brand Hotel, very disappointing. Air conditioner cannot be controlled, situated also on top of bed - could not wait to leave. Also, very noisy from the street level activity. Although very close to beach and shopping, not a great experience.

Enjoyed a second visit to Sheraton Princess Kaiulani while celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary. Every moment was wonderful from the young man checking us in (I think his name was John) to Bobby Kubota the restaurant manager who provided complimentary champagne to Lenora S. who kept our room clean and comfortable. The Celebration Luau show and dinner gave us lots of priceless memories. I love the location and atmosphere this hotel offers with the nightly native music and the wonderful tropical smell in the lobby and pool area. At check-in we received a free upgrade and enjoyed a very nice room with a pool view and partial ocean view. Sitting on the lanai while enjoying the cool breeze was the perfect way to end each day. The music ended at 9 pm so we were not disturbed while sleeping. Each day we walked one block to see the Duke statue and wave to the camera and to the folks back home. Altogether, the Sheraton Princess gave us a dream vacation.

I was so incredibly disappointed by my experience at this hotel. I am a Starwood member and expected this hotel to meet up with all of the other hotels. It doesn't. Think Howard Johnson's. I decided that most of the good reviews must have thought they were reviewing the good Sheraton down the street. The rooms are old, the pool is small and dated and it is across the street from the Beach. When I realized I had checked into this hotel I tried to switch. It would cost 400.00 more to switch to the Moana surf rider across the street. ( the package was listed as 150.00 more when I booked) I will take that but because of the extra expense I will book one night there -not stay here at all and stay with friends the other night. Apparently that wasn't good enough for them. I could only switch if I booked two nights. Really??? I stay at the st Regis all the time and have never been treated as rudely as this hotel. They would have got my room fee for two nights. I would have paid 200.00 extra for one night at their other hotel. No deal. DON'T STAY HERE. NOT REALLY A SHERATON.

Hotel rooms are older, need updating, lack electrical outlets, furniture is stained, bathrooms are small - very little to recommend here. Stayed at the Maririott Wakkiki last month - far superior experience and room.

We stayed here for a week at the end of a rail & coach tour of Canada and had no input to the choice of hotel. However, the location is great - a stone's throw from the beach and surrounded by shops, restaurants and take-aways. Our room was immaculately clean with fresh linen and towels every day. The complimentary toiletries were a generous size and also refreshed daily. We had a room on the 19th floor which was located on the corner of the building and gave us views over the ocean and Waikiki beach from our balcony. We chose not to eat here so I'm unable to comment on the food although it did seem to be a bit pricey i.e. $39 to $42 for buffet evening dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful and there is free Wifi. There is also free use of computers and printer in the lobby area, which was great for us to print off our boarding passes for the flight home. They supply towels for the pool or beach and also have chairs that can be taken to the beach. The decor, which has had some negative comments, was generally fine and I, personally, did not have a problem with it. Would happily stay here again,
user_name:
Beedubya
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: For the price, this hotel is a great deal. Though not on the beach, the beach is a very short stroll away. If you like Waikiki, all the major attractions are within walking distance. The hotel is a little aged and is slated for major renovations next Summer. The staff is extremely friendly and courteous. Caution, this hotel is not for the culturally or ethnic insensitive.
