The hotel has arrangements with several travel agencies in Asia so, while I was there, I would estimate that 60% of the guests were from Asia. For me, this was fantastic since I find Asian travelers more hospital that those of the 48 contiguous States. For those who have health issues, Straub Medical Clinic is located on premises which should relieve you of any medical concerns you may have while visiting Waikiki. The food and entertainment in the hotel is top notch. Live Hawaiian music permeates throughout the lobby and restaurant during dinner hours. Later, I would recommend the hotel's Splash Bar. On two consecutive nights, while a guitarist was playing tunes, hotel guests and vendors did impromptu hulas. It was fantastic! Bet you didn't know that there are more Hula Halaus (Hawaiian dance groups) in Japan that all of Hawaii and the other 49 States combined.

We stayed here for close on 2 weeks and really enjoyed the close location to Waikiki Beach and all the shopping and other Oahu experiences.The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating, and would go out of there way to help.The pool is excellent and the service of drinks and fruit brought out to you at Waikiki beach was much appreciated on a very warm day.Yes the rooms are a little updated, but how much time do you really spend there at such a wonderful location.We had amazing views, a desk , and plenty of wardrobe space for all our clothes and extra purchases.We woud certainly consider staying here again.

This hotel was disgusting, so outdated and dirty. I felt uncomfortable sleeping in the bed and the bathing was dirty and the toilet was broken. The staff was rude and not helpful with finding things to do. Overall, I would never stay here again and honestly would question staying at a Sheraton again. Terrible experience.
user_name:
Britt S
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is one of the older ones in Waikiki. Great location though, in the thick of things and walking distance to everything in Waikiki. The beach is across the road. The room wasn't huge, but had everything we needed, including air conditioning. The check in staff were friendly and helpful. We got a good deal on our room rate and thought it was great value for money, considering the location. Ok, it's not up to the standard you would expect at a Sheraton, but considering it's about half the price of the other Sheraton in Waikiki, we were happy overall.The pool area has loads of sun loungers and the pool itself isn't huge, but it's not that busy as the beach is across the road. The food and drinks at the pool bar are good. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant so I can't say what that was like.All staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating. We booked a Pearl Harbor tour through the tour desk, which was great.

We were pleased with the hotel. The staff were very helpful the room was great with a wonderful view over the beach. The cleaning staff were first class as they always left sour room spotless and with all amenities new. The staff in the restaurant suggested better ways of making our dollars go further - well done. All in all the hotel made our first stay in Hawaii very pleasant. For the money we paid this was excellent accommodation. Well done Sheraton PK. Greg and Deslie Broad, Australia

We were a little disappointed in this hotel, having stayed at several Sheraton hotels all over the world previously. The bathroom was super outdated. I walked in and said, "This looks like my grandma's bathroom." The pool was miniature, and there is no hot tub. It was right across the street from a good place to swim on Waikiki beach though. And in prime location for Waikiki shopping and dining.

The staff were very nice. The rooms were not great. It is a very old hotel. If you take the cost of the hotel into effect, it is not a bad deal. Don't go expecting the Ritz. It is very convenient location, close to everything.

Very disappointed with this place. The location is awesome, but the rooms are awful. I can deal with being outdated but the cracks in the tile, dirty caulk in the bathroom, the broken toilet seat, and the fact that you can RENT a microwave for $10.00/day when you're already spending $200+ per night is frickin ridiculous. No no no! I'd never stay here again. Ripoff!

I really wish we'd gone somewhere else, at first look the hotel was nice the reception, bar and pool very clean and welcoming check- in was a little bit of pain have just got of a flight and arriving at 2pm we where informed our room wasn't ready but we did get a complimentary drink with book in so we had something to do.We found our room really quickly but it was really small (there where 3 adults) it wasn't very clean and the balcony was really dirty we had hand prints all up the one wall, the paint was chipping and for the price we paid our view consisted of a multi-storey car park and bins (which are emptied daily in the early morning), the worst part of our room was the bathroom hair on the tills, the toilets leaked, the bath wouldn't run away and the lime scale on the shower head made having a shower feel like you came out dirty again.The restaurant is so overpriced that we ate out every night, the only meals we did have in the hotel where at the pool bar, the only good side where the staff who couldn't do enough for you they're always there to get you another drink and go the extra mile on the hotter days and get you water when your by the pool.The Sheraton is in need of updating and maids who can actually clean.

This property needs urgent makeover of rooms. The fact they have two double beds in a normal room leaves no lounge space. Balcony has great views but steel rails that obscure view instead of toughened glass. The carpet is frayed, vacuumed occasionally and has some odor. The common hallways in accommodation level have urgent need for paint and carpet.The staff to a certain extent save clients from exploding as most a very friendly and polite.We wont return unless they refurbished, shame as location and staff are fine.

We stayed here in May having read some of the reviews were a bit worried what we had let ourselves in for ... well we had a room overlooking the pool fantastic we could see the beach. Rooms were very spacious clean and well looked after. The location was excellent opposite the beach a right in the centre of town. .. overall lovely hotel dont know where the bad reviews come from ...we would definitely recommend this hotel & would visit again

Rooms are the size of cruise ship cabins, cannot open windows, air conditioning controls are either HI or LO, no in between. Ceiling was leaking onto my bed from room above on one stay. Other stays I had roaches in the room and hair in my bathtub. No counter space in bathroom, nowhere to put anything.Housekeepers are VERY noisy in hallways and rooms, constantly slamming doors and dropping toilet lids as they clean, also slamming vacuum cleaners into the walls.If I wasn't forced to stay here on business I wouldn't! The entire hotel is past due for an upgrade and remodel.Very noisy.
user_name:
Deborah K
San Martin, California, United States

review_body: Great older hotel in the center of Waikiki beach area. Easy walking distance all around. Beach across street and hotel towel card gets you a towel and beach chair to use on the beautiful white sand beach!

Newer hotels are cold show places, the Princess is friendly warm, welcoming, relaxing. Yes she is older, but has kept her style. Wonderful food and a great menu each night, if you choose to eat at the hotel. Loved the view of Diamond Head, didn't care that I didn't have an ocean view. At night I could see all the lights and the flags over Kings. The Princess is Hawaii, Aloha Janet & Ted

Right in the middle of kalakaua Ave. Rooms have fantastic views over Honolulu and the ocean.Service is fine but the hotel looks very old, needs some refurbishments. If you are in honolulu on a business trip, it will make you fill you are in holidays.breakfast by the pool is fantastic with a lot of fresh food, but a bit expensive.

There were 6 of us staying there. We were all very happy with the hotel and staff.Our rooms were very clean great view of the ocean. Staff was very helpful except prices for breakfast and luch were a bit to pricey. We went and had dinner to a nice restaurant down the street.

We travelled to Honolulu with our nine month old to break up our trip from Melbourne to New York. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with the SPK, so much so, we cancelled our booking on our return trip even though we had to pay a cancellation fee. The hotel staff were nonchalant, downright rude and lazy. The hotel decor was so old everything appeared to be dirty. We loved Honolulu.

We stayed here nearly 3 years ago and once again have enjoyed their hospitality. The location is central to Waikiki but because it is not beach front it represents better value while providing all you need to enjoy the beach.The rooms are clean and well appointed and we had great views which included the ocean.We ate at the hotel buffet one night but the food selection was not as wide ranging as I would have expected and there are other places nearby offering better value.The staff were both friendly and efficient in answering our queries and responding to our needs.

The appearance of this once-lovely hotel has faded like a wilted plumeria lei. This was our 4th stay here and definitely our last. At $400 per night for a high ocean view in the Princess Tower, we were expecting so much more...We opened the door to our room after a LONG day of traveling and felt a huge rush of disappointment. The room was--in a word--SHABBY. Old furnishings and stained carpet, cramped quarters, antiquated bath, and dirty lanai were our first impressions. After one night, I went to the front desk to inquire about an upgrade and was told there was nothing available. When I commented that we were surprised about the condition of the room, the staffer actually stated that I must remember this is a 50+ year old property and I should have booked a better room at the Sheraton Waikiki. My adult daughter, who was with me, could not believe the staff member would not even try to defend their own property. I did inquire at the Sheraton Waikiki if we could make a change there. The front desk clerk said he was hearing more of these types of complaints about the PK, but could not give us accommodations for our entire stay. So, we just decided to stay put and not have the conditions ruin an otherwise great vacation. The only recommendation I can make for this hotel is its location and lovely views of the Moana Hotel and ocean beyond.On the last day we were in Waikiki, we did spend a couple of hours checking out other properties and have found better accommodations at better prices elsewhere. If very basic lodging is all you require at a good location, try the Princess Kaiulani. If you expect a little bit more for your vacation dollar, try something else.

We were a family of 9 ( 6 Adults, 3 children) staying at the hotel for 5 days. The rooms were very good & serviced daily. The eating area was excellent. The pool was a big bonus, as was the location. I would definitely recommend this hotel & would stay again but have a longer holiday. Loved Hawaii!!!

We where celebrating my husbands 50th birthday over the Memorial Day week. I read the reviews about this hotel prior to our stay and I really didn't know what to expect. The staff was extremely helpful. Lee at the front desk got us checked in with a pool and partial ocean view on the 16th floor. We also received a bottle of champagne delivered to the room courtesy of the hotel. I must say that the beds are very comfortable and the rooms very clean. The rooms are a little dated true fact. We attended the Creation dinner show with a party of seven. The show was good but the buffet was a little bland. This was not your Vegas style buffet. Overall a good place for the price and great location. Added plus -you get the free towels and chairs for the beach, two bottles of water daily.

first time in honolulu- looking forward to a great hotel- paid so much at the accomodation. bathroom looks like a hospital loo. very very old and run down! from a long haul travel want to sleep- beeping noise downstairs (truck reversing?) so loud!!! rang guest services- they suggested to upgrade rooms instead? additional $60/night ++ taxes!! as hotel is part of sheraton groups thought it would be good room?

Extremely happy with this hotel. Staff go above and beyond their duties to help you out. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. The atmosphere of the hotel really is incredible. The location is PERFECT right across the road from Waikiki beach. Just down the road from many shops, international market place and many restaurants. It's truly a great place to stay :)

We made the mistake of booking our hotel quite late for the time of year we were staying in Waikiki (between Xmas and New Year) and so other hotels we could stay at with our SPG points were booked up. However, it didn't really matter that this one wasn't as luxurious as the other choices - it was good value for points and did the job as we didn't want to spend much time there but exploring Waikiki (and had spent a lot of money on other resort hotels for the trip!) This was more the sightseeing stop/bed for the night option and it suited us fine. The location was fantastic, overlooking the sea front in Waikiki, just off the main strip with hundreds of shops, hotels, restaurants etc.The room was clean but slightly dated. There was a mini bar, a balcony, no other real mod-cons. Breakfast filled us up for the day as we had the buffet option (there are two options, we took the one that didn't include hot breakfast - but still included lots of hot items! - and this was PLENTY). There's not really a lot else to say about the hotel. The pool is small and no chance of bagging a sun lounger but its dated and if you have any sense you'll spend your time on the beach anyway! Waikiki has a brilliant bus service taking you to other beaches and sights like Diamond Head. It even took us to the North Shore. Just thought that was worth mentioning as an extra! (thebus.org)

Just returned from holiday had stop over in Hawaii on way home. Good hotel and good location. Staff were very helpful only had slight problem with concierge booking our airport pickup she gave us back the slip of paper and said hope he turns up he repeated back the wrong details. I later got front desk t check for me and the gentleman there was terrific. Also tour desk was helpful. Clean rooms great location and spa across the road fantastic would definitely return although paying the full resort fee when you arrive at 10pm is a bit much

I am writing this review while sitting on our balcony overlooking the ocean. After dreading the review's we were a bit worried to what we would be getting. After our long journey from the uk we just wanted a nice clean and comfortable hotel and that what we have got. We had and high ocean view room on the 16 floor (1646)Yes the hotel is in need of updating but it is clean and comfortable and the location is great.Did not try the food as it was very expencive.The only bad thing is that we only booked 8 nights, should have booked longer

My friend was getting married in Waikiki so I booked this hotel (right across the street from where she was getting married). I was not disappointed... this hotel is a full on resort with welcome cocktails, a nice pool, poolside dining, down blankets and pillows, etc. Room was great --> very clean. Down sheets were an extra plus since most hotels I searched had the tacky flower bedding that looks like it came from the 1970s and reminds me of cheap motels. The clean white blankets made this feel more modern like you'd expect in normal hotels these days. Huge safe --> I put a laptop and an entire bag inside. Location was fabulous- again, right in the heart of Waikiki.Downsides --> you pay for the extras (ie, room service was very expensive... only did it because I got in from a long day of travel at 10 pm and did not feel like going out)... Resort fee is extra $23 per day but this includes the welcome drinks, towels for the pool/beach and parking (parking in the structure next to the hotel where you park is usually $25 per day otherwise). Overall, affordable for Waikiki.

My travel agent suggested staying at the PK for proximity and price as this was my first solo trip (I'm mid 50's & female). Having checked out traveler photos on tripadvisor after booking was made, I was apprehensive and really didn't know what to expect but what a surprise this hotel was! Central to great shopping, fantastic restaurants and almost across the road from the famous Waikiki beach. Yes, you can see that it's an older hotel but you can feel it has class! My room was clean, fresh and crisp, comfy bed, clean and adequate bathroom. There was only a coffee maker in the room, I rang lobby for a kettle & a member of the house staff was knocking on my door in less than 5 minutes! You can pay $100's more across the road but why? I usually call anything less than 5 star "camping" but the PK has won me - I will most certainly stay here again and have recommended to all that will listen!

This hotel is across the street from the beach, and is a sort of poor man's sibling to the Moana Surfrider. It has a lot of floors and rooms all built probably in the '70s or '80s. The place is very dated but I must compliment them on their recent renovation to their suites: you could hardly tell they are of that older vintage.Unlike the Surfrider, whose age is part of its beauty, the Kaiulani's birthdate is somewhat from a time when we made some of our ugliest and cheapest buildings. But the property is getting reinvestment and seems to have a cheery feel to it. Very tourista and just what a middle-class Hawaii vacationer should expect. It isn't five-star, nor does it pretend to be.The hotel has a cute little pool that is right off the lobby and feeds a steady flow of Mai Tais and other libations as the afternoons fade toward dusk. There is almost always some kind of Hawaiian-style entertainment going on at this point, and it all sort of blends together into buffet time as the sun sets.Buffets of a downtown Las Vegas level of quality are the standard here. Again: this is a great place for a budget vacation. Not on the beach, not fancy, but better than home for many.Because they turn over a lot of bodies the property's staff is as nice as can be expected under such conditions.

This hotel was in the perfect location! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little on the outdated side, but clean and work well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to stay in Waikiki.

Had to go to Honolulu because my daughter who lives there, had a sudden surgery. We stayed here after all was well just for a couple days. She went home, we came to the PK. One of the managers (David) knew our story and upgraded us to a tower room. We had a awesome view of the blue ocean and Waikiki beach. The room was comfortable as usual. The PK has always been the hotel we favor. Great location, comfy rooms and employees that seem to go the extra step. This trip proved that even more. It was a wonderful gesture that we will always remember.

We just came back from our 10 days stay here at sheraton princess kaiulani. This is our 4th time here in 4 years and ever year we always come back to princess kaiulani. We were celebrating our 4 year wedding anniversary and my husband 30th birthday. It was an amazing stay. Kathy at the front desk was very helpful .She was able to get us checked in very quickly. A week before our arrival i had called to to see if they had any pool view available becaused i wanted to upgrade our room and didnt mind paying extra. They said they would put in a request . At the time of cehck in kathy had informed us that they were able to upgrade our room to partial ocean view without a charge!!! WOW is what i said they went above and beyond to make sure I had a memorable stay. I love this hotel it is right across the street from the beach and right next door to international market. Sheraton is right in the middle of everything. Thats why i always choose this hotel to stay at. The room that we had was nice and spacious for us nothing fancy but it was perfect for 2 people. So if your looking for a clean and good price hotel Sheraton princess kaiulani is it. You wont be dissapointed. Thank you Sheraton for making our stay a pleasant one!

Check in was fast staff was nice. Room was a little dated and ac wasnt great. House keeper was great did great job. Its located a block from the beach quick walk across street. International market place is a easy 2 min walk. They offer beach towels and other services by the pool which is nice. Good location to alot of stores (abc,cocos). Buffet is kind of pricey but theres alot of options close by. All in all not a bad place to stay.

This hotel is across the street from to Ocean, next to an Alamo Rental Car Agency and a grocery store, and otherwise close to everything. It is a solid B to B+ hotel. Not much seemed to be happening at the hotel, but it is a good place to stay if you are not seeking activities to do at the hotel.

So I purchased a hotel voucher for 3 nights & 4 days high Ocean view room. It was a absolute B E A U T I FUL view! clean, comfortable room. The hotel's location is it the heart ( middle) of Waikiki. I enjoyed mt stay with my family. Staff was awesome & on top of things. we didn't dine in the hotel, its a bit pricey. we settle for early bird specials and couponed specials on the strip. hotel is also right next door to intl.market place and across the street from the beach...perfect location in my opinion.there's only one swimming pool which in the center of tyhe whole property , I personally didn't like its location! but hey the beach was 2 min walk across so no big deal.as for cons, no kitchenettes avaiable thru out the entire hotel. theres no microwave in rooms either ( I was suprised at that) we brought some in room snacks for kids hot pockets,cup of noodles etc, so microwave was needed, Oh but you can request one for a daily charge of $10.00 wasn't happy about their meaning of per day, its not per 24hrs ( a day) its just daily charge. and parking garage has no elevator service, so if your parked on the 5th flr garage you get a bit of a workout getting to & from your car.We enjoyed our stay and would rate this hotel a 8 out of 10...would come back for sure!p.S. please try PUKA DOG while in waikiki its in the intl market place entrance on Kuhio side , its a stuffed like hot dog with island flavor condiments ...DELISH, we ate there twice during our stay!

One of the best view of Sheraton of all. We got a room that is located up high (dont remember the floor #) but we could totally see both the ocean and city lights. No better location than this hotel, next to the market and shops. The room was a little old-looking but clean. Balcony on the room was great with 2 relaxing chairs. Snack in the afternoon + the view = happiness. The only thing that we weren't happy about was the continental a.k.a super cold breakfast. We were only allowed to eat cold stuff like fruits and pastries. We ended up paying few extra dollars for hot fresh breakfast. Otherwise, perfect stay!

For the price this hotel was great. Staff was friendly and rooms were clean. We chose this hotel based on a friend who frequently travels to Oahu and she said it was a nice hotel. We picked a room with a pool view and was greatly surprised with the pool view and a partial ocean view as well. Loved the balcony with this view! The housekeepers were friendly and rooms were always well cleaned and neat. Great hotel, defiantly would stay here again! Oh yea, self service parking is included with the resort fee, great bonus!! Enjoy!

The lobby was nice, check in was fast, staff very friendly.Room was in desperate need of updating. The air conditioning unit was from 1960. No setting other than on and off. And absolutely filthy, the rust had rust on it. The toilet was an industrial toilet, when you flushed, it was so loud. Tiles were very dated in the shower. Our balcony overlooked the parking lot, that was a bit disappointing. Rooms had a safe and fridge, that was nice.Pool was nice, lots of chairs and towels. Chairs to borrow for the day and take to the beach.I was there 2 years ago and they had a take out buffet breakfast for 10.00. They don't have that anymore, and want you to pay 25.00 for breakfast. Location was great, close to the beach, restaurants and night life.

This hotel seems a bit outdated however the lobby and rooms were very clean. The check-in line was a bit long when we arrived as they could have had more staff assisting with guest check in. There were had plenty of wifi stations for guest to use. Our room was close to the elevators which you could hear late at night.The parking garage had easy access. Don't spend extra money getting a room with a view as this hotel is not on the beach. The pool was small but you could check out towels and take them to the beach just located across the street which the hotel had a special section and did an afternoon drink and fruit service for the hotel guest.The concierge was helpfull when we needed travel arrangments on our wedding day. I recommend this hotel for the location and price!

check in was a nightmare, staff pleasant but had to fight for a decent roomeven though all that we were shown were small roomsBut what the heck, you wont be indoors much and the pool area is an oasis from the excitement going on right outside your front door.the hotels location is perfect and not expensive, but in desperate need of a makeover, this is definitely not Sheraton standard elsewhere in the world.Best view this place as only a spot to rest your head.

we stayed on the 20th floor and you could tell when you stepped out of the lift that this was an old hotel, walking down the wide corridoors the door jams had all been patched up after years of having bags knocked against them, so when we entered the room we were not surprised that it was probably 10 years past having a makeover. The balcony floor paint was worn and patchy, the balcony rails rusty. The batroom was old world with only 110v, no good for Australian or European travellers.For a cheap $18 daily charge the hotel offered free local and international calls for 1hr a day and free internet connection, however if you had an Ipad like me you could not use the internet in the room as it was not wifi, you had to go down to the ground floor and send emails from the lounge or put your name on a list to be loaned a temporary mobile wifi unit, and the waiting list was long.Yes the room was clean and the bed sheeting and towels were clean, the pillows were too soft and the carpet was worn and there was a noticeable 1cm hole in the middle of the bedroom/balcony curtain.

enjoyed our stay..would have loved to eat at the resteraunt..but too expensive..the atmosphere was beautiful...centrally located..lots of things to see on the street..the ocean is right across the street..the trolleys.were very.convenient for shopping..very friendly.staff..

This hotel is great for location. just walk across the road.Hotel is very tired - needs a great deal of upgradingIs used by a large number of tour companiesPool is smallBar is smallStaff is very friendly

The Hotel had many Hawaiian functions going on and encouraged guest participation. Lei making, Hula dancing, etc. Just across the street from Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to just about everything here. Big Celebration (much like food/art festivals in California) at the park by the Zoo. The room left much to be desired. Adequate.

My husband and I have stayed at many Sheraton hotels around the world and Australia and we can't believe that this prestige hotel chain would lend it's name to this totally run down, tired looking property! It truly is beyond shabby with peeling wall paper. cracked toilet cysterns and even though we paid extra for a high ocean view room with a balcony, the balcony didn't have any chairs on it, so I dragged out the big arm chair from our room.On the plus side, the location is great as it's right in the heart of Waikiki and it was quite clean. Some of the staff were lovely, but then some could be quite rude and uninterested.Since coming home I've now further researched and have found that there is a hotel just a half block down with fully renovated large rooms at a much cheaper rate so our next trip to Hawaii we'll be staying there.

I've stayed here twice now and I have to say, first time around I would have given it a 4.5 (18 months ago), we were treated well, and at no extra charge were upgraded to a room that overlooked the beach and pool (which is also the sunrise) so the views were beautiful! This time however, we paid for an 'ocean view' and we were upgraded to a 'premium ocean room' and i'm sorry but i can BARELY see any ocean! I have an extremely noisy view of the road and multiple carparks, but not an ocean! So I wouldnt recommend anyone asking for this room and im equally not sure where the 'upgrade' was! The other very frutrating thing is, I cant have a car as i am under 25, yet im paying for a carpark in the set $18 per day which also pays for two bottles of water and in room internet, one of our days we didnt even get water! I think if you dont have a car you shouldnt have to pay!!!All this aside, i dont have any issues with the room itself, its big enough for two people, wouldnt go anymore than that because the beds are tiny and you wont want to share! The location is also really handy, being in the middle of everything!

Nice hotel well located. Unfortunately it took three times before we got a decent room. We booked months in advance for my cousins wedding and asked for a two double bed room deluxe with ocean view. First room had a decent partial ocean view but one bed and my son didn't want to share. My cousin complained and within 30 min we were given keys to a new room which we found had a nice view...of a parking lot. We complained again and this time we were given a room much higher up with ocean view with two beds and could finally unpack. The room are nice, as were the bathrooms. They have a great breakfast buffet but we thought it was free and discovered it was quite pricey but still convenient and everything in Hawaii is pricey. So nice hotel and I would not complain if not for having to keep moving rooms when we were travel weary.

The Kaiulani Wing is an antiquated noisy section which would not rate 3 stars. The decor is shabby, the aircinditioning is noisy old fashioned type and our room was over the loading dock and garbage dump, with a 4 story car park opposite. Admittedly the room was clean and the bed comfortable.

while not on the beach, it's an easy walk to the beach. price was great. internet in the rooms are ethernet but wifi in the lobby along with 8 computers and a printer for public use. Parking is part of the "resort fee" which is hard to find in that part of Honolulu. Buffets looked bountiful but too many other good places to eat for a more reasonable price. Pool area and evening entertainment was great.
user_name:
gerrijellison
Santa Maria, California, United States

review_body: good location opposite the beach ,everything within walking distance.clean rooms that were a good size .as part of the resort fee international phone calls were free (mobile and land lines for an hour a day)! great coffee shop just outside the hotel complex.staff friendly and helpful those at the tour desk really informative .

I wasn't particularly impressed with this hotel, and having stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel at the beginning of our trip.The reception area is spacious but dated. The staff were friendly but didn't do anything to rave about. We put in our reservation that it was our 10th Anniversary. Not even a mention at check-in, nothing in the room or at any time during our stay. The room was not huge and the bathroom was compact. The room had an adjoining door, but we don't believe anyone was staying in there as we didn't hear anything.The balcony door was incredibly difficult to open. The bed was comfortable. We were located on the 27th floor and the view looking along the beach of Waikiki and toward Diamond Head was very nice.They had music at night which finished at 9:30pm, until then don't both trying to sleep.The biggest pain for me was NO WI-FI. You have to use the computers in the foyer, where Wi-Fi is also available. They charge you $18 a day for internet but it is only wired internet...if I had known this I wouldn't have bothered staying here.We found this hotel really catered for the mass market Japanese tourist, not couples or individuals. In comparison to the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel, yes it doesn't have a pool, it is smaller, it isn't a big hotel, but it was just so much better to me! (And they can manage Wi-Fi in every room.)

We stayed in this hotel for two weeks at the beginning of April. The location of this hotel is great as it is right across the street from the beach. The hotel room was adequate. It could be cleaned better. The top of the bed posts had a layer of dust. We had to move the dresser out as something fell behind it. There was a lot of dust and even a shirt behind the dresser. We upgraded to a pool side view because of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. I was really glad we did as it was a nice view and quieter. The street side would have been way too noisy. The staff were friendly and helpful. My son and his wife received a basket of goodies in their room which was really nice. However since I was paying for both rooms it would have been nice if both of us had received a basket. lol The beds were all right, certainly not the quality of beds that I have slept on at other Sheraton's. The pillows were perfect. The room had a fridge in it and there are ABC stores close by to buy food. We did not eat at the hotel as the buffets were too expensive - approximately $40.00 each. I'm not sure if there was a menu or not - no one said anything so I assumed there was only the buffet. I find out now that there was a menu. There is a Denny's and an IHOP around the corner and down the street so I wasn't too worried about where to eat breakfast. There are internet connections in the rooms but no WiFi. However there is a huge area to sit in the lobby and use the WiFi. There was also a T.V. there and newspapers to read. The pool closes at 6:00 p.m which seemed so early as there were several times we would have gone for a swim but it was closed. The parking was included in the resort fee of $18.00 a day for each room. This was great as we had a car. However, if you weren't renting a car then you would be paying for the WiFi and the two complimentary bottles of water. The room had a safe in it which is always nice to have. We did have difficulty several times getting into our safe. However, the staff were great about coming up and fixing it. I'm not sure what was wrong with it.

The Princess Tower and the Kaiulani Tower at the Sheraton P.K. are both scheduled to undergo a major renovation sometime in 2014. As a result, the general management of this property is being neglected. Glaring maintenance issues are regularly going unaddressed. The air conditioner in my room in the Kaiulani Tower was inundated with mold, mildew and rust and was probably unsafe to operate. I have honestly never seen an air conditioning unit look as bad as this one did. Completely disgusting! I would highly recommend staying elsewhere.

This is a wonderful location on Waikiki. It is across the street from the beach and near great restaurants and very upscale shopping. It is an older hotel, but then, older hotels sometimes have the best locations. Our room was on the third floor and overlooked the pool in the lower part of the hotel (not the tower). If we wanted, we could listen to the poolside entertainment from our balcony; however, when the door to balcony was closed, the noise was negligible. Housekeeping was excellent and unobtrusive. When you will be touring and going to the beach, a safe in the room makes sense and there was one. Check in was quick and easy. We were booked through a travel agency and after our stay, I would say that they knew what they were doing.

Hello to Raymond and staff, we would like to thank you all for all that you guys did for us.It was overwhelming to get all the gifts and it was great that you guys took such good care of us.We would like to thank you for the Diner at the Creations show it was amazing with great food and an awesome show.It was great of you guys to treat us to nice cold water and fruits at the beach, it sure added a nice touch to the day. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were well taken care of and we would definetly recommend your Hotel to our friends in the future and you never know maybe some day we could be back. The location is so convenient for the beach, shopping, eating, the bus line is close. Great food at all times.

Me and my husband booked the Sheraton princess for an 8 day stay for our honeymoon. The room was very clean. Good size for two and had a wonderful view from the lania. Very comfortable beds but they only cater to non smokers. So if you don't smoke this is a good choice. If you do well you won't by the time you leave. The bathroom was dated but nice. They charge you the hidden fee of 18 dollars a day. For parking wifi which you can't get and two bottles if water. So if you don't have a car to park basically you are buying two bottles of water for 18 dollars per day. Its a nice hotel but the food is outrageously priced and nothing really fancy. The pool closes way to early so we never got a chance to use it. I will probably seek another hotel for our next visit because of the price

Stayed here with my three children (two teens and one under 10). We had a wonderful time. The reception/check in process was non-eventful, and staff accomodating. We had a partial ocean view, clean, quiet room, and of course, this location is convenient to the beach and shopping, The bus line is close enough so the kids could hop on and off to go where they wanted. The restaurant, as mentioned by honeyre, is overpriced but the kids prefer to catch fast-food so they can go to attractions/the beach. Free breakfast was a blessing and area clean/food appealing. Didn't use the hotel pool. Wifi with no problem. We needed to stay a little extra due to our flight, and they were able to accomodate us (but always ask ahead in busy season). It is worth the extra $ to have a vacation worth remembering.

The first time i stayed at the PK was in May 1969 (i was 11 years old). But what awesome memories! It is literally steps to the beach, a 1 minute walk! and because of this I totally lived between the pool and the beach! The beautiful view from the room was nothing but ocean and Diamond Head, and the smells from the exciting Kalakaua restaurants are magnificant! I have been back many times since and it remains my favorite - and a true ALOHA for anyone wanting to "sleep" on the beach without getting arrested :)

Third time stayed here. This time with grandchildren. Only ones in line at check-in and everything went ok, except we had to ask for our free breakfast coupons. Thanks to Debbie for remembering our "three cups of tea", every morning. We stayed half way up Princess wing and had no problems with noise like we did last time. Cleaners efficient. Would recommend to anyone wanting a good resort without paying exhorbant fees to have beach frontage. We could see part ocean. Will definitely be returning.

We stayed here on our honeymoon, they upgraded us without us asking they sent a fruit basket to the room. We didn't have wifi so asked at the desk they gave us a portable wifi which worked all over the island at no extra cost. The restaurant is overpriced but the location is fab so their are plenty of dining options nearby. Would stay again, the staff are friendly and go out of their way to help. Had to pay an $18 resort fee but this gave us and hour phone call home daily to the UK, the Internet other things which didn't apply to us such as parking. We had tea and coffee facilities in our room and 2 bottles of water daily.Overall we had a lovely week xx

Rooms are small, cramped and old, the decor needs updating. Swimming pool is small and the restaurant is overpriced. None of the services of the sister hotels can be shared other then the restaurants. No wireless in one whole tower.

My family of 2 adults and 2 kids aged 16 and 14 stayed for 5 nights in March.We had a high ocean tower room and the view was amazing.Overlooked the pool and the beach.We did request this room so was very happy.We had 2 double beds that were very comfortable.For the people that are fussy with pillows,these were definately Sheraton quality.The room was made up everyday and was kept clean.The room was small but most of them are.As long as its clean and tidy we're happy.We were actually put next to the lifts and I was worried but there was no concern.While you may have heard it I like to have my verandah door open a little for a breeze and to actually listen to the outside noise.This may seem strange to some people as they say the main strip gets noisy.Really it stops around 10.30-11pm and starts around 7.30-8pm.We bought breakfast on the way to the beach everyday and lunch in the International Market Place next door.Sometimes we ordered from the restaraunt a burger and chips.The kids had drinks from the bar while sitting around the pool in the afternoon and we had a drink or two in the evening while listening to the music.Quite relaxing.The kids did enjoy the lobby and the free use of the computers and wi-fi.Which brings me to the resort fee.Its around $18 per day and includes cable internet in the room,bottled water twice a day bought to you at the beach or pool and fruit twice a day.You can have 60 mins per day local and international calls which was nice for us to call back to Australia.And the use of deck chairs to take to the beach.It includes other stuff like parking but we didnt need it.Every hotel now charges this.For this hotel and what you get I think its a fair deal.I never had a problem with staff.Infact I have stayed in 5 diferent hotels in Waikiki and cant find fault with any of them.Maybe I'm happy to be in Hawaii!!The location is perfect.Everything you need is so close.I would recommend this hotel.We travelled with my husbands parents and sister and her kids aged 10 and 8 and they enjoyed it also.

I had booked Hilton Hawaiian Village for our vacation for 4 nights but decided to get to Hawaii few days early. I found good rate for this hotel so I booked it. stayed here 4/3-4/5During check-in, they said I've been upgraded to partial ocean view, which the bigger tower (I forget what it's called). Here's what I thought of the hotelPros-Good price. It's a bit dated hotel but it wasnt dirty. Our Room and Bathroom was cleanGood location- Everything is close by. Beach is across the street. Ton of restaurants within walking distance. All the shopping you want to do... Small Markets to High end stuff.Cons- Not much to do at the hotel. Then again it's not a resortone pool and is on the smaller side. but it wasn't packed.. I think most people were either at the beach or out 'n aboutOverall I think it's a good value for the money..if you are looking to do stuff at the hotel and hang out by the pool and order drinks all day, this is Probably not the place to stay...if you want to do out thing outside the hotel, hit the beach, eat and shop then stay here, save some money and spend it on other things..

We arrived early on the day of the Honolulu Festival and were able to leave our bags with the concierge until our room was ready, and use the pool, restaurants etc. When it was, we were delighted to find we had a view of the sea and a top seat on the balcony for the fireworks display that night. Magic!!! The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and we were in the heart of Waikiki, and able to use facilities at the sister hotels without paying their much higher prices. Staff were helpful, especially Tommy on the travel desk. We would stay there again. We only found out after being there a few days that we could have rung home (international calls) for one hour every day, included in that resort fee.

This hotel is in a great location in Waikiki, but it is very dated and in need of upgrades everywhere. The rooms look as if the haven't been touched since the 80's and our balcony has a giant crack in the plaster. There is a $23/day resort charge - they were very upfront about this when we checked it. It was supposed to cover free Internet - but no wifi is available in the tower we are in. So the lobby is typically pretty jammed with a lot of people on their iPads. The staff have been very nice and service is good. Food at the restaurant is also good and not overly expensive (by Honolulu standards). The pool is simple (and not heated) - it doesn't have much of a shallow end for new swimmers. The only way I'd stay here again is if it said "newly renovated".

Everyone should be for warned before they book at this property that they have an $18.00 per day + Tax resort fee that is not an option. The rooms are clean but very dated and if you plan on using WIFI forget it! They have a small area in the lobby that has is it, the WIFI won't even reach the pool area only a few feet away. The buffet at the hotel smells terrible and is grossly overpriced @ $39.50 for diner and I believe $ 20 for breakfast, find another option as this food is not worth 1/2 what they charge. If your travelling with your family the stroll if you will for the local hookers is right outside the front doors, so after 8:00 PM it's open season! This was my family and I's 10th trip to Honolulu and our first at the PK and this will certainly be our last. We should have known on arrival nothing, is more frustrating after along day of travel than to show up at the front desk of your hotel and WAIT. And it wasn't because they were busy. There were four staff on the front desk and only one was busy with a guest, the other three it's anybodys guess what they were doing. Terrible service ! In closing please consider other options before booking here..

after arriving latenight to the hotel the staff was able to point us in the right direction to find something to eat. the hotel may not be the best in the at area of Wakkii... but the staff help help make up for that.

Very discourteous staff - made us wait 3 hrs before we could check in! Never had that sort of service in all the hotels I've stopped in and there has been many. Now the real kick in the pants! They tried to charge me $18 plus tax a day for car parking, free child meals, internet in the room, beach towels and hour phone calls for an hour. Considering I didn't need or use these, I was flaberghasted to find out it was mandatory! and not negotiable! AFter much argument they finally waived the charges. But I will never darken this chain of hotels ever again! Outrageous poor service! I have also written a formal complaint to my travel operator.

Sheraton should be ashamed of this once beautiful hotel. Run down doesn't even capture the condition of the rooms and public areas. I was told there was to be a renovation in the future, in my opinion it's a total scraper. Most Hostels are better than this hotel.

I had been a bit skeptical, as many of the reviews said this hotel was "dated." We stayed in a room with a pool view, and it was lovely! We had a nice little balcony with two chairs and a table, comfortable bed, and the room did not seem at all dated. We were only about a block from the beach. The "resort fee" of about $25/day included the use of beach chairs and towels and a bottle of water and piece of whole fruit (apple, orange) per day. The location was excellent- we could walk to restaurants and the International Market and other shopping, and took TheBus (only $2.50 round trip) to Diamond Head. My only question is why the resort fee was just as high for us (with no rental car to park in their garage) as it was for those with a car. I would suggest changing this to make it more equitable. Other than that, everything was fine!

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani March 20th - March 25th, 2013. The location was awesome. We have visited HI several times but this is the first time we stayed at this location. The staff was some of the best we have ever had in HI. All were extremely helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to make our stay nice. We normaly stay at beach front hotels, resorts, but this hotel is very centrally located in Waikiki. I had been told that the hotel was dated by others, but I didn't find that to be the case at all. We were upgraded to a tower room (free of charge) on the 21st floor. Great view, very clean room, and was very pleasant. Room was very nice and the bed was wonderful. The pool area is nice with entertainment at night. I thougth the meals were very expensive, but there are so many options in Waikiki within easy walking distance that it didn't bother me. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone. I will definately stay there again.

This hotel is well located across street from beach. Reception lobby, pool, restaurant area are all pleasant. Unfortunately the rooms are very, very tired, but nothing broken, everything worked.Linens and towels are OK Sheraton standard and bed comfortable. Rates reasonable considering location but we did pay extra for ocean view. Probably not a wise decision as we finished up on head dizzy 27th floor. Beach towels and chairs available to take to beach and there is water/fruit provided by hotel staff there. In all, if you can get past the sad decorating in room, it is clean and handy for beach, stores etc.

First time to Hawaii and we stayed at this hotel from feb 27th 2013 to March 3rd. Was not really impressed with the overall condition of the Hotel but the location was really good. One half block off main street in Honolulu and one block from the beach.The rooms could use some renovations as the one we were in was quite run down. Really close to all the shopping in downtown and lots of different places to eat within walking distance.

We stayed here while in Oahu for two nights. We had booked city view since we were getting in late, but when checking in without asking we were upgraded to pool view and also had view of ocean from our lani. Rooms and hotel was clean and is in a great location without paying extra. Staff was very friendly. Would definitely recommend to anyone that wants to stay on tighter budget.

Sheraton should be ashamed having their name on this hotel. From the outside it is beautiful. But it does lack in shops-compared to the other hotels in the area. When we got off the elevators and again when we stepped into our room---we could have been in any Motel 6. The carpeting was old. Their was nothing special to make it a Sheraton. It did not even feel like a 4 or 5 star hotel. There was a sliding door on the bathroom, which was very hard to close. The toilet seat broke on us-they did replace it quickly. We had to call for our room to be cleaned-after we had given them about 8 hours to clean it. I have been in Sheraton's in other cities and was amazed by the luxury of those hotels. This hotel-no way Sheraton quality. We got a free breakfast. Unfortunately someone had to stay at the table and make sure the birds did not take your food off your plate.Only one time were we given covers for our plates. The pool closed very early-6pm. There was still 2 more hours of daylight! The water was cold-not heated at all. The patio chairs were so close together that you couldn't walk between them. The employees didn't know their own hotel or area-we asked where the gift shop was-they didn't know. We asked whre we could get something to eat-fast food---well there was a burger king, KFC and subway about a block away. The staff told us about a bar about 3 blocks away. The towels in the room were very stiff and scratchy. You could hear everything in the next room. Fortunatly this hotel is located in the center of town and everything you need is in walking distance. The ice machine was located in a room with the service elevators and old newspapers. There is not any spa/jacuzzi.

We stayed here to be near the International Market where my wife wanted to shop. It met her needs. From our lanai we had a good views of harbor ship and boat traffic and watched the evening entertainment near the pool. It was a good experience and worth the price we paid. Parking was available with no shortage of open spots. However, beware. The four story parking garage lacks an elevator.

When we arrived at the hotel we had a few problems with our room. When we talked to the reception staff they immediately transferred us on to the manager who was fabulous, and incredibly helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to everything we needed and transportation. All staff were friendly and courteous. The rooms weren't huge, but were clean and functional. We liked that there were always pool chairs available and the pool wasn't overly crowded. We feel the hotel was definitely good value for money.

Nice location, right in the middle of Waikiki. The pool is lovely and inviting and the nightly live music is entertaining. Bar serves pretty average drinks poolside. The rooms themselves need a little updating, but the ambiance in the lobby, public washrooms and buffet restaurant is beautiful.The Koi pond by the front entrance makes a good photo opp.

As a resident of Hawaii, I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years. Recently, I spent two back-to-back weekends here with family visiting from the mainland. I think the best thing about the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, is its location relative to other things in Waikiki, without the much higher price point of hotels right around it. Granted, you are not directly on the beach, so if that is what you are looking for, pay the extra $100+ per night to stay at the Moana Surfrider across the street. The PK is perfectly comfortable for a stay in Waikiki, short or a week, and you will undoubtedly save money from other properties. The hotel is in desperate need of a style renovation and upgrade. I was always waiting for Rose, Dorothy, Blance and Sophia to be waiting on the lanai for drinks. If you can overlook the sad carpet, and awful 70s color scheme, you will enjoy yourself. We had a deluxe oceanview room, which provides great views of the city and the Pacific. Bathrooms are SMALL, which is the case with most older city hotels. NEWSFLASH: Sheraton...it would cost you very little to install curved shower rods in the bathrooms, to give the illusion of more space in the shower, without any major construction.A big mahalo to Gregg and Ping at the front desk. Both were very firendly, and accomodating when we needed to be moved to alternate rooms because the room we were in, though the hotel advertises wi-fi, and charges you in their resort fee, didn't have wi-fi. Overall, perfectly acceptable, and I will always stay here when price is a consideration in Waikiki.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani in early March and had a wonderful time. The hotel is one of the older hotels on Waikiki and the hallways and rooms are a little worn but the courteous staff and the location more than make up for this. The hotel is located across the street from Waikiki Beach. The hotel resort fee covers the beach service that provides chairs and towels for guest use on the beach. They even come over to the beach with cold water and fresh fruit in the late morning and early afternoon. The hotel location places you in walking distance of shopping, restaurants and other attractions. We found the hotel staff to be very courteous and helpful, especially with providing easy to follow directions to the many things to see on the island. The bar near the pool offers live entertainment each night and it was very enjoyable to sit and relax while listening to the music and enjoying a cocktail. WE would highly recommend this hotel to those looking for a good experience at a good value.

Booked this hotel knowing that it has mixed reviews on TA and we're aware that it would be old. We just needed a room to sleep for one night before heading to the other part of the island. The hotel is in a great location, right across from the beach, top hotels, restaurants and shopping and a convenience store across the street. Check in was a little slow but we were greeted warmly and they were very helpful. The hotel and room does need a major facelift but the bed was still nice and linens were thick and the sheets were white which was a nice surprise as I was expecting those old flowery bedspreads that rarely gets washed.The bathroom was also in need of renovation, it was small and old wallpaper, the floor was old and didn't look that clean. The bathtub didn't feel solid when you step in it. Nevertheless, it was still decent and it had clean towels and nice amenities. I was surprised that there was a newer single sofa bed and they had linens for it in the closet so the room could accommodate up to five people.The closet was also old with an old safe that I wouldn't feel comfortable leaving valuables there. The resort fee was a lot cheaper which includes free wifi is a lot cheaper than the other hotels. We had a buffet breakfast and they had a good selection and great fresh juices. It was a little pricey IMO.With all the great updated hotels in the area, I'm not sure I'll stay here again not until they're done with their major renovations which is in the works so I heard.

Currently staying here for my girlfriend's birthday and we couldn't be more happy! From the moment we walked in the bell staff and front desk have been nothing but helpful and friendly. You can tell they have been very well trained in the Sheraton values and truly go out of their way to connect with their guests! Shanna at the pool bar was particularly amazing sharing her wealth of knowledge about the area.The hotel is just steps away from amazing beaches, a huge shopping district, and countless great places to eat; which is great if you are like us and prefer not to drive everywhere. Overall, the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani really is a can't miss! We are already talking about coming back in the near future and with without a doubt be staying here next time!

The location is great across the street from Waikiki beach just to be clear it is clearly not on the beach. Also beside the International Market.The interior is old and dated like most hotels in Waikiki. Customer service is good and friendly and their computers with internet in the lobby for surfing and printing boarding passes etcI would stay there again

i stayed for 6 nites paid 18.50 tourist tax a .day for not more then 2bottles of water a day felted ripped off will not be back rather go to bali and get better value, rooms old, bar staff slack, the location is the best thing about this hotel

If you are looking for a centrally located and very convenient hotel in Waikiki, this hotel is pretty good. In terms of price, it compares very favourably to other Sheraton properties which are close by and a lot pricier We had a room in the Kaiulani Wing which had no view but it was very clean and had amazingly comfortable beds and very crisp white linen. The let down is the bathroom which needs an update and has poor water pressure in the shower. Although the hotel is located in the busier part of Waikiki, the rooms are surprisingly quiet and we had really undisturbed sleep. One thing to beware of... You get charged a "Resort Fee" on top of your room tariff of US $18.85 (incl tax) and this covers things like 60 minute daily free IDD calls, room WIFI, beach towels etc.. So make sure you make full use of the services included.The Hotel is one street back from the beach which is why it's well priced but its easy to get to, just walk across the Main Street to the beach on the other side (directly in front of the Moana Surfrider). Overall, good value for money hotel and well positioned.

We have just spent 2 nights at this hotel. Great location for shops and Waikiki beach, but if you want quiet and relaxing, this is not the place to go! We were on the 23rd floor and still had noise from the hotel evening entertainment at night at the bar and from the street outside all through the night, particularly delivery lorries. The view from our room was good. The hotel was a bit shabby, particularly the pool area. Room was clean but basic. We didn't eat at the hotel, choosing to eat at restaurants in nicer hotels instead and we had breakfast at I HOP which was a couple of blocks away. The staff were courteous but not particularly friendly. We were not expecting the $18 per day resort charge that we were told we had to pay but did take advantage of the international phone calls and car parking which this covered. The charge also covered internet access in our room but this was not wireless and we had to sit in the lobby to get a signal on my kindle fire. Overall, the hotel was ok, but next time we visit, we will spend more money and stay at one of the more plush hotels that share the same good location.

Do not stay at this Hotel only if your Rich stay here 42.00 dollars for supper and lunch and breakfast is to far off that mark 39.50 per person.thats also you have to include a 18.00 resort a day fee for what i dont know,do the math 12 nights 12 suppers for a couple that over 1000.00 dollars,do your self a favor dont stay here,we will never come back here again,ih did i tell you about the hookers right outside the hotel yeh well maybe 40 feet down from the hotel

I stay at both the S.W. & P.K. when I visit Waikiki. I cannot believe the review by jassdsu saying that the Sheraton Waikiki is much nicer with a friendlier staff. The S.W. is on the beach but it is too large which requires a lot of walking to get to anywhere. The S.W. lobby is like a very long 'wind-tunnel'. The P.K. has a more open feeling in the lobby and I think the staff is better than the S.W. It was easy for me to compare because I had stayed at the S.W. the last week of February and then at the P.K. two weeks later. I do think that the bathrooms at the P.K. needs some work - - our faucet leaked and we needed to put a towel behind the faucet to absorb the water. The P.K. is just across the street from the Beach and much closer to great restaurants. Food is too expensive at the S.W. Both hotels have a 'Resort-Fee' - - - much higher at the S.W. than the P.K. More JALPAK & JTB groups at the S.W. than at the P.K. which causes more congestion around elevators, restaurants and halls. The bell--staff is faaaaar better at the P.K. than at the S.W. Lastly - I cannot believe that the rate was higher at the P.K. than at the S.W. for 'jassdsu'. I stay a lot at both and find that the S.W. is usually $50 to $100 more a day than the P.K.

We stayed 2 weeks on March 8th reported to security our bags had been gone through and items missing, heard nothing so by March 12th contacted duty manager, she was aware of concerns on the 8th but had done nothing, we left on March 17 no word from hotel. on leaving discovered my daughters swaroski earrings were also gone. Pool shuts at 6pm even though its light for another 2 hours so if you have children and have been out all day then they can't swim. Staff are basically rude or indifferent, internet can only be accessed in your room by cable so no wi fi not any good for iPads or iPhones, internet in foyer keeps dropping out. Wallpaper in room lifting off and powerpoint cracked and broken. we were told staff were not questioned about items missing as they were on days off. Asked front desk for an email address for Sheraton and was told "I have no idea how you can email a complaint" Hopeless, Sheraton you should be embarrassed. Do yourself a favour just don't stay here.
user_name:
James M
Terrigal, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: No Wifi in your rooms, old hotel. We're a starwood member so we used points to book here. We shouldve paid cash for a room and saved our point. If you have an option stay at the Sheraton Waiki- much nicer. Much friendlier staff. Ironically it cost up us more to stay at the Sheraton Princess than the sheraton Waikiki. Unfortunately sheraton waikiki was sold out. If we go back were going to stay over by the Aulani- not at the Aulani but somewhere near it. Waikiki is a mess, traffic is so bad and beaches are crowded- its not a vacation if you have to stay down there. Sorry to be so negative, just got back from five days at the Sheraton Princess and everyday we went to the Aulani beaches to escape the Waikiki. Lastly i met a couple at the computer lab who had housekeeping enter their room at 8:30pm while they were sleeping- they thought someone was breaking in.

Our second time here & love it, across street from beach, walk to everything in Waikiki including great beach strolls, generally very good care of patrons but pool staff need to clean bird poop off of pool chairs themselves instead of handing a wet cloth to patrons to do it (yes, this happened, while they watched, but they did say "thank you," with a smile, but ... not my job), family friendly, really enjoy the pool area - lots of sun but can also find shade, rooms older but very nice, really enjoyed upgraded room, very nice pool side Hawaiian music 6:30 - 9:00 nightly, really appreciated the hospitality room and towels after we checked out in advance of a 1130 pm departure flight, will definitely stay again.

I stayed there on a girls trip where i took my mother, daughter and cousin for my mums 70th Birthday. We stayed there from 26 January 2013 for 7 nights. The hotel is in a great location central to everything. The reception area was spacious and the staff were very helpful and always polite.The pool area was good with plenty on lounge chairs and tables and chairs around so if you came back from shopping with takeaway you could sit around the pool area and eat and relax without having to go up to your room.The splash bar was great because you could get a snack or a main meal without having to wait an hour at some of the popular restaurants nearby.We had interconnecting rooms. The rooms lookec tired and were very clean and not very spacious as the furniture was bulky.The rooms definitely need to be refurbished. We stayed in level 27 in the tall tower that was beside the international market. When there was a band playing at a bar in the international market we could hear it and would be playing till very late at night.We had been to Waikiki 18 months previous and stayed at the Beachcomber Holiday Inn.Comparing the two. The Holiday in rooms were more spacious and modern compared to the Sheraton. However the Sheration had the nicer pool area, reception, guest lounge and you could even get buffet breakfast or dinner every night which the Holiday Inn doesn't have.We also hired a car on our stay and had free parking which a lot of the other hotels do not have.If we went back to Waikiki we would stay at the Sheraton over the Holiday Inn as It offered a lot more outside of your room.

Stayed for a week, loved it. We had a pool view which I would get again. Room is a little dated but very clean. Room did smell a little musty, but I had a small air freshener which I used the first day that took care of it. Close to everything.

This is a wonderful hotel. I highly recommend that you get a pool view room. It is a bit noisy, but if you bring an electric white noise "sound machine" it is not noisy at all. There is beautiful Hawaiian music from young men singing with guitars starting at 6:30 p.m. until 10:30 p.m. at night and you can sit on your balcony, your "lanai," and listen to the beautiful music. The musicians also have a "hula girl" with them performing the hula.The room is a bit basic, but it is nice and clean.The location is the best thing about the hotel. It is right in the middle of Waikiiki with many shopping areas and restaurants nearby. If you are on a tight budget, there is a Kentucky Fried Chicken across the street, and also an ABC Store across the street where you can purchase "lunchables" and sandwiches. There is also a Subway within walking distance.There IS an elevator to the parking garage, but only if you park on one of the top two floors.The breakfast buffet is wonderful.I highly recommend that you rent a car and drive to the North Shore of Oahu on your visit; the waves and the surfers are awesome! Also, rent a car and drive to the Pali Lookout-the view is terrific.I would give this hotel 5 out of 5 for everything. The staff are also wonderfully efficient and kind.From-Minnesota Girl
user_name:
Ann R
Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States

review_body: I stayed in this hotel 23 years ago when in Hawaii with my parents and have come back to stay at late notice with my husband. We booked online and flew out that afternoon. The price was great considering we were on a high floor with ocean views towards Diamond Head however did not include breakfast which wasn't a drama as each morning we went to the ABC store, bought a yogurt and banana then walked across to Kona coffee and bought our cappuccino which was alot cheaper not to mention healthier! I do however remember the same furniture in the room from the first visit all those years ago!! The room was sufficient though a little small and decorations a little tired however clean and tidy and in an awesome location just across the road from the sand! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in the heart of waikiki who enjoys evening entertainment around the pool and an amazing view!

Presently my particular career choice has me stuck with the Navy (although i didn't actually join the Navy but that's another story). After a few painful weeks of sailing we ported in Pearl Harbor and i could not wait to jump on my mountain bike and see Oahu! I found eventually found myself wanting a place to sleep in downtown Waikiki. I thought it would be a small matter to pick a hotel and get a room. After something like 20 hotels with no vacancy i was getting a bit discouraged! After standing, most conspicuously, in line with my mountain bike in tow at the Sheraton Waikiki I was assisted by the most gorgeous of asian goddesses. She seemed sincerely dismayed in informing me that there was no vacancy. But hold on! She jumped on her phone and began to call every friend she had that also worked in hotel reception. She found a room for me at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. I wish i could remember her name!About the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani... Absolutely worth the $150 room charge. The room was 4 star american standard. It was clean and functional with every modern amenity including free wifi. The rooms appear to have been last renovated in the early 90's however they have been kept spotless and functional. The bed was extremely comfortable but keep in mind that i just got off a bicycle seat and prior to that a navy bunk bed. The sheets where pure white and smelled sterilized clean. The shower was excellent with a modern shower head.The hotel offers a decent pool that is popular with the kids and those who want to chill out from the bustle of the beach.The famous Waikiki beach is merely across the main drag, Kalakaua Ave. So it is not right on the beach... fine! Those hotels start at 400/night so if adding 60 more steps to your journey is too taxing then by all means you need to be on the beach!!

We are staying here now. The hotel has a fantastic location very close to the beach. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodated us for an early check in when are son needed his nap. Our room is very clean and has a nice ocean view. The hotel is dated though but I imagine some would find it charming. The one major drawback is that some rooms don't have access to wifi though it is included in the resort fee. This was fairly annoying for us since we are in one of those rooms. I would suggest you are told this at check in to at least avoid the frustration of trying to log-in. All in all I would recommend this place as long as you don't absolutely need Internet access in your room.

Mr wife and I stayed in Honolulu Hawaii (my first time, her 3rd) and overall we had a great time! I will preface this review by saying that we stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki which was a different level of hotel...and we were spoiled by the accommodations there. We moved after one day to the Princess to save some money and because the Waikiki was sold out, and having seen some reviews, we were ready for the property to be a slight step down, and in some areas it was. The location is really great, blocks from a main tour pickup and drop off point, the beach is a short walk, and there are tons of restaurants and name brand and boutique stores. The lobby, while dated, was clean (and very busy with arrivals and departures). We did not use the restaurant or bar except for a welcome drink when we walked in, but both were also clean and appeared well staffed. The pool area was nice, and oddly enough there was never anyone swimming, just sun bathing. We checked in after 3 because the room was not ready when we first arrived in the morning, but I understood this as the hotel was full the night before and checkout is at 11 am, so I was unfazed by it. Our check in was made warm and friendly by Kathy, who was great and made up feel welcome. Getting to our room in the tower, it was again clean, but also dated. The view from the 26th floor, however, was amazing! The ups and downs were unfortunately a recurring theme with this hotel. A really nice touch was the fresh flower arrangement that was provided for us as a honeymoon gift. Then 10 minutes later, a complimentary bottle of champagne was sent up. Awesome! Up again! Then the downer came at 11 pm when we could hear a performing band from across the street. The sound echoed through the natural canyon formed by the tall buildings. Not the hotel's fault, but my wife simply couldn't sleep. In the morning we asked to move to a different room, and once again, Kathy came to the rescue! Luckily, she was able to find us a room in the much-newer feeling wing in the building by the pool. No noise, fresher room, and the views were actually just as nice! lastly, the housekeepers were very friendly, making eye contact and saying hello very day we saw them.We continued on with our week of beach, swimming, shopping and touring, and had no more problems. So while the Sheraton Princess could use a facelift, it was truly the face of the caring staff, and Kathy in particular, that made our stay great and just as importantly would entice us to return. Didn't love the resort fee, but we tried to get our money's worth out of it by getting beach chairs and towels, and using the internet which was wireless in the 2nd room we moved to. Also, become an SPG member if you have a moment. This gets you points, upgrades, and other bonuses like discounts at local restaurants applied at check out.

The hotel lobby was beautiful. The room was very worn and dated. The bed was like a rock. The 27th foor also led to some loud winds and furniture movement on the balcony. It was supposedly an upgrade room but I can't imagine what the next level down looked like. The dinner and breakfast buffets offered a wide variety but was not maintained and some of the food offerings ran out before being replensihed. The location was perfect for getting to the beach, international market, and day excursions.

Decided to stay at the Sheraton Princes Kaiulani from 26 Feb - 6 March 2013 due to the fact that my mother had stayed at this hotel for the last 2 years in a row and loved it. This trip I travelled with my mother (3rd visit to PK) and my 3 year old daughter. Upon arrival at 8am we were made to wait till 3pm for a room after flying from Sydney, Australia. The hotel was not full, but that was too bad. In the meantime we had lunch by the pool and was served a stale club sandwich with black avocado (not fresh). We returned the sandwich and gave lunch a miss. By the time 3pm, we were very tired and checked into our standard room which was tiny, original bathroom (very old) with a view of the carpark and down below dumpster bins. By this stage I was starting to feel like we were anywhere but Hawaii. My mother complained to the bell boy about the room. About an hour later the hotel sent up a fresh basket of fruit apologising for the room. Only to open the fresh basket of fruit and discover the fruit to be green and mouldy. I went downstairs to the reception to thanked them for the fresh fruit, but in Australia the Sheraton is of a high standard and when we give fresh fruit, it isn't covered in mould and that they were welcome to eat the fruit themselves. With that we were upgraded immediately to the Ocean Deluxe Room which was a nicer & bigger room with a lovely view of Waikiki Beach and I started to feel like I had in fact arrived in Hawaii - finally. The only further problem was that the room stunk of "MOULD". This hotel is old and is in need of renovations with all bathrooms. The service is a little slow. My mother was very disappointed with her 3rd visit to PK and won't be returning next year. Such a shame to have a regular visitor have such a disappointing experience. Other than the hotel, our trip to Hawaii was lovely. The Waikele Outlet is a shopping heaven. Travel with PJ Plover, they have coach's pick up and drop off from Dukes Statue on Waikee Beach for $10 return. Pearl Harbour was interesting. Alo Moana Shopping Centre was over rated. Once you have been to the outlets, further shopping isn't necessary. The outlet covers everything. The Ross Store has great/cheap clothing for children. Will definately return to Hawaii again for a shopping holiday, other than that, there isn't much to do in Hawaii. The beach is lovely, but it's a long way to travel for a beach when Australia's beaches are just as nice.
